review_content: Stayed at this hotel in a block of rooms for a wedding. They held arrival gift bag behind the counter and provided it to us when we checked in. This location is either unique or I have not been to a hotel like this before. The reception desk is directly in front of you as you walk in but it is slightly pushed back. This allows you to take in the lobby experience on the right and left. There is a restaurant area on the right with what looked like a bar. This makes it a very nice open set up for a location in suburban Ohio.The room was nice, we had a King bed as well as a couch that opened up into an additional sleeping spot. I'm not sure if the wifi was slow or if they cap upload speeds but I was not able to upload a video to YouTube here. There was also some confusion about my room being cleaned as I was still in the room when room service came. I told them they could come in while I was there but they never came back. Check in and check out is simple nowadays with the bill slipped under your door the morning of.Just stayed for one evening. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. Very clean both outside and inside. My room was spectacular with super comfy bed. I have stayed here in the past and it has been a great states have visit. The Hyde Park Chop house is close by, highly recommend. Also, you are close to downtown Dublin and a variety of other restaurants and taverns.Friendly staff, clean rooms. Workout facility is small with 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, Dumbbells that go up to 30 I believe; a bench and a stability ball. The pool looked nice though I didn't use it and the breakfast area stayed busy even though I did not eat there. Bed was very comfortable... I slept like a rock and the AC blew Ice cold which helped me sleep so soundly.We made reservations to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn for the week of Christmas.  I have to say that Justin (who works at the front desk) was so very nice and helpful from the time we made the reservation, answering questions when I called back twice and when we finally met him at the front desk.  He even called us on a day we kept the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door( and didn't get the room cleaned), to make sure we didn't run out of anything we may need.  He was even nice enough to bring a box of kleenex up since that was the only thing we ran out of. The hotel is super nice.  I understand that renovations were recently done and it shows.  The lobby is gorgeous.  We checked in with no problem whatsoever.  We stayed in a king room on the fourth floor and the room was really nice.  Very modern decor.  When we walked in, there was a cute towel display of two swans on the bed.  The room was clean and mostly comfortable.  The bed was a challenge for us since we are used to a memory foam mattress at home.  There is a mini fridge, microwave and mini Keurig in the room.  Pods, cups, creamer and sugar are provided.  Nice touch.We stayed seven nights and enjoyed our time there.  The staff is very responsive, friendly, approachable and caring.  The front desk personnel, the "restaurant" (more like a cafe) employees, housekeeping and maintenance were very helpful.  We stopped at the front desk to let them know our room was cold.  The maintenance person went to our room right away, we were having breakfast in the hotel and he was back to us before we even had a chance to sit down to eat.  The issue was ours with the heat, we had the settings incorrect.We used the hot tub and pool once during our stay.  It was very nice in there, very clean.The only criticism I have is the breakfast food/cost.  I liked the waffle I made for my boyfriend and I, the fruit they serve is fresh.  The coffee isn't very good and the cost for what you get seemed a little high.  Including tip, the breakfast was a little over $20 for 2 people.  That is regardless of whether you have a cooked breakfast, or cereal and fruit, or a muffin and a banana.  So if you are going to partake, make sure you are really hungry and get your money's worth.  Don't pay $20 for two people to have coffee, a muffin and share a banana.  There is a Kroger nearby, I suggest you pick up some food that you can keep in your room.Place is clean and rooms are nice.  The Wi-Fi is terrible.  Took forever to get the hot water to reach our room and it was hard to control the shower temperature.  The breakfast was NOT free and they did not make that clear.  There are too many other good Hilton properties in Dublin and we will not be staying here again.  Feel defrauded by the breakfast situation.My girlfriend and I decided to get away for the Christmas holiday and made a reservation for 8 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn.  We read a lot of reviews and looked at a map before we decided on this place and we chose a winner. The hotel is conveniently located near the freeway, plenty of restaurants near by as well as grocery and other shopping.The staff at this hotel are extremely nice and helpful.  Even with suggesting restaurants and such.The hotel itself is clean, updated and comfortable.  We even used the pool and hot tub one evening and it was enjoyable.  We liked the Dublin area, there are plenty of places to shop, eat and see.  Even though we didn't go, it is close to the zoo (in case you are looking for a place to stay near there).We will stay here again if we are in town again, and hopefully we will be!!Greeted warmly at the front desk. Easy check in. Free wi-fi and Keurig coffee. A pleasant stay.We stayed here for a friend's wedding at the beginning of April 2014.  Let me start by saying that the hotel was being renovated when we arrived and was clearly torn apart in many places.  They were busy and it sounded like they didn't have any rooms left available for walk-ins.  The woman in front of us was having one heck of a time with her check-in but luckily, ours went very quickly.We left the front desk and headed to the elevators.  There were two elevators and one of the doors opened, only to find out that the elevator would not move...Strike 1.  We waited forever for the second elevator to come down.  We finally got in it and went to our floor, the 4th floor, which was nicely renovated.  We walked to the room, inserted the key card, only to find a man occupying the room...Strike 2.  He looked just as shocked as us and we apologized and went back to the front desk after a long wait for the elevator.  Another family that was waiting to check in when we were there were back on the elevator.  They asked what was wrong with our room.  We told them someone was in there.  We then asked what was wrong with theirs and they told us it was torn apart and not acceptable to stay in.  We finally reach the front desk and explain the situation.  They were very apologetic and assigned us a new room and also gave us free breakfast for the next morning (we were just hoping the room was completed).  We once again waiting forever for the elevator and made it to the room (which was completed and not occupied).  This left us with 30 mins until we had to leave for the wedding as it took 30 mins before we could get to a good room.The rooms were decently quiet so that was good.  The parking was horrible as they had construction equipment blocking some of the spots and of course the hotel was busy...Strike 3.  Strike 4 actually happened the next day at breakfast.  The food, it just wasn't that great.  The eggs looked unappetizing and our "waitress" even said so.  They kept running out of stuff too.I stay at Hiltons a lot when I travel and this one just did not live up to the other ones I enjoy.Good hotel but first room smelt like cigarettes. Went to the front desk and instantly got a new room. This one was nice. Decent Hilton. Good for the areaService was top notch and price was good too  one thing I really liked was that the lamps beside the bed had phone charging options. There was TV channel guides available and my tv even had MLB Network on it. I was so happy to be able to watch the cardinals game. It's located in Dublin which is a nice and safe area. Definitely recommend this hotel. It's not often I give any place five stars.I stayed two nights in this hotel. The night before my wedding and the night of my wedding. It happened during the great Derecho of 2012 and the power was out for half of my stay. Still, given the circumstances the staff handled it well. Night one was in a 2-bed room on the second floor. It was fine but had lots of minor problems - peeling wallpaper, knicks all over the bathroom walls, tiny cramped bathroom with a door that wouldn't stay shut, etc.Night two was in a much nicer 1-bed room room on the 4th floor. It didn't have any of the problems described in the room from the first night and was pretty comfortable (aside from the fact that the room had no AC, not the hotel's fault though).It would seem that the quality of the rooms are not all the same after all.Stayed here for a week for business. The gym here is very small and no free weights. If you care about working out while travel, you prob should check out another hotel. The rate is good around $110 a night for corporate rate. It is next to a kroger for shopping groceries. There's also jasons deli and a dry cleaners near by. The air conditioning us very loud and can bother you if you're a light sleeper. They have happy hour from 6-8 daily.Cheers!It's just a run of the mill Hilton Garden Inn. The front desk operators were very nice. I was greeted nicely and received my room key with no hassle, even though I arrived before the check in time of 3:00pm. Unfortunately, the room was not ready even though I was told it was. When I walked in the sheets were off of the bed and there was trash everywhere. I went back to the front desk, they apologized and quickly gave me another room. This one was much better. After two nights of stay, I only wish that there was a bar at this hotel. I did not try any food at this hotel.As a recap, I would only stay at this hotel if there were no other options available. Next time I'll have to try the Embassy Suites next door. Also, the water temperature control was backwards in my shower. Very nasty surprise. I must congratulate the front desk staff however, they were very courteous and polite.Are you a fan of beige, nondescript, sterile hotels in suburban office parks? If so, look no further! All joking aside, this hotel is a very serviceable option in Dublin. Close to a lot of retail and shopping, but not downtown Dublin, so you'll have a hike to the city center. My room and bathroom were very clean, the beds were comfy, and the staff was gracious. My sole complaint is that the shower ran icy-cold on me a few times. That certainly kept me awake. I'll chalk it up to bathing during morning rush hour, but one would think they'd plan for the whole place to be showering at once, no? Breakfast is decent, with an omelet station, a waffle iron, and healthy options like oatmeal and fruit.Very nice hotel. I'd suggested it for the business traveler as it's away from the town (Dublin) center. I did see two wedding parties there and people with children though. The service is great. The rooms are very nice and so is the breakfast bar. They have a small pool and a business center (small, but it's functional). I would've definitely given the place 5 stars....but they decided to replace the mattresses in a few rooms. Not really a problem....unless you keep two slightly soiled mattresses outside in the hallway for two days! That was not a pretty view to enjoy. I checked the mattress in my room and it was super-clean. The entire room was sparkling, so I don't think soiled mattresses are a norm there. The hotel also has wireless Internet, a small fridge, a coffee maker and a microwave in every room. Did I also mention that they are about 40-50% less expensive than other hotels of this class? I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Yes, as other reviewers have mentioned, it's a bit dated. However, the service and attention to detail more than made up for that! We are Marriott Gold members and had access to the M Club Lounge. The woman working each morning was friendly, warm, funny, full of info about Columbus, and on her game with the breakfast foods. (I really regret not getting her name!) On one morning we inadvertently left our "privacy please" tag on our door. The next day, Jerri Lynn made it a point to speak to us and ask if we'd like the room cleaned. When we returned that evening we received a handwritten note from her to let us know she left extra towels and shampoo for us. (We joked with her earlier about our teenage daughter using all of the shampoo.)Very easy, quick access to downtown Columbus without the parking costs. We will stay here again when in the Columbus area.This place is dated so beware but is very clean and friendly staff. See pictures attached.Very nice place - close to the airportThese people are truly exceptional.If an Undercover Boss goes and check , they can see the true picture.. comes -true good nature would be seen.that's the case withGood work -by Patrick - front desk -he is so young, quick, sharp, willing to travel extra mile- very nice person..Willing to do what it takes..he is like my son's age...- Emma - Housekeeping-she is super conscious, highly ethical, professional etiquette-follows through if there is a door hanging-even though she is well experienced, she wanted to wait.-Kim - River City Grille - she is fantastic- highly customer service -she wants to travel extra mile. Very pleasing and really dedicated.Ick!!!! Do yourself a favor and stay in Easton and shuttle in. This place is a typical airport hotel. Looks like they are renovating so maybe improvements to come?????? I won't be back.I was bumped by Delta, and this was the hotel they booked me at.The check-in at the front desk was easy; the staff was very warm and welcoming; yes, the coming around the desk to give you your keys and walking you to the elevator was a nice touch.The shuttle service was easy for me coming and going.The most important part of the stay for me at this point was THE BED.  It was supremely comfortable, and on my travels quite recently, I've tried a few.  This one might have been the best, and I loved the (feather?) comforter and pillows.  Wake-up calls were on time, food was 'eh' in room service, but oh well, I wasn't there to eat.I don't know how much a room runs in this location, but the room was beautiful, and as mentioned, so was the bed.  I don't know if the plane noise is loud during the day, but it was a fairly quiet location after 7 PM.The rooms are a bit of a trek from the front desk (at first glance, anyway....), and from seeing the pool, it wasn't much to write home about.  For my stay, I enjoyed it.  The Wi-Fi also worked well.I have stayed here before and although a bit outdated, the convenient location and great service brought me back. The cockroach scurrying past my feet this morning will ensure I don't come back. Come one Marriott, disgusting! And if you see one you know there are any more.Awesome service awesome hotel!  So good to get away for a weekend with Ms. F!From check-in to check-out we had a fabulous weekend here. Everyone was so helpful with local directions and local restaurant recommendations. We were in town just for the weekend but I cannot tell you how helpful everyone was from breakfast server to General Manager!Note:  Platinum member review using free nightsPros:  Close to a number of highways and the airport (but not much noise from either).  Super dooper comfortable beds (soft but firm, nice bedding).  Good workout center and indoor pool, whirlpool and sauna.  Concierge Lounge open Sunday evening for snacks, drinks and desserts and Monday morning for decent breakfast.  Full service restaurant.Cons (and these are pretty snarky on my part, so I'm not downgrading my rating, just whining):  no upgrade available even though I'm Platinum.  Concierge Lounge closed all-day Saturday and Sunday morning.  Sprawling 1st floor layout, so it is a hike from the lobby to the elevators (recommend you park at the far side of the parking lot and go in the door to the right of the pool for a quicker way to the elevators).This hotel under-performs just a little bit from what you would expect on a number of fronts, nothing serious, but for this chain I expect more. Two of the main hot items in the buffet breakfast were cold two days in a row. The hotel is very spread out with the check-in and restaurant quite a hike from the elevators. The temperature in the conference room was too cold all three days I was there, even though we asked for it to be warmed up. Our room was cleaned very late in the day each day, and not at all one day. The bathrooms could really use an exhaust fan - they steam up from the shower and do not dry out for hours. Each of these issues was relatively minor but they added up to 3 stars for this hotel. On the positive side, the staff were uniformly friendly and courteous. Everything was clean and in good repair. When we asked to get a different room, away from the elevator, the staff obliged with no issues. The conference room was well stocked with coffee and snacks.This is a McMarriott standardized format hotel that's common in the Ohio area.  It looks the same as others including the one in Cincinnati.  If you like things to be the same everywhere you go then you'll love this place.  I tend to like to stay in a diversity of places that don't look alike, but hey... to each his own.  The other reason I don't like it, is that when you travel as much as I do, you wake up and totally forget what city you're in.  Not good for me.The staff is VERY nice and professional.  I like how they step around the check-in desk to hand you the key and direct you to the elevator.  Good pool and cardio area.  Has a sauna and this is very, very convenient to the airport.  But you'll have to have a car to go anyplace interesting to eat and/or hang out.Went to Ohio to watch a sporting event.  They overbooked.  Threw us into another hotel of lower quality.  Gave us the same rate.  Gave us nothing for our inconvenience.  We booked our rooms MONTHS in advance.  Guaranteed with a credit card.  What can you do for us?  I asked.  Nothing they said.Very nice hotel in my opinion. We were in town to watch North Carolina A&T play at the Shottenheim Arena against Ohio State and were very pleased with the room's cleanliness and amenities. My only complaint would be with the beds (way too soft), but this "pillowy" style in beds seems to be the trend wherever you stay these days. A bad back forced me to sleep on the floor, but at least I felt at ease that the floors were clean, too. (chuckle) A very friendly staff and convenient shuttles to and from the Easton shopping district all helped make our stay enjoyable...despite A&T's loss to Ohio State. Oh well, can't have it all I guess.One of the worst experiences I've had at a hotel.  The customer service is weak at best, and the condition of the rooms is run down and a little sad.  The atmosphere is unprofessional, and the lobby area is very loud, both with music blasting through the speakers and the people traffic.  Even the fountain in the lobby smells due to an overdue need to be maintained.  The mattresses are super soft, and the support staff seem to be understaffed, sullen, and unhelpful.I chose this location specifically because I needed proximity to the airport, as well as shuttle transportation from the airport.  Prior to my arrival I called twice to confirm the procedure for securing a shuttle.  When I landed at 8:30pm, I called.  The phone rang and rang, but no one picked up.  I had to call back a number of times to finally secure a shuttle.  Another gentlemen was waiting with me (and had also called).  When the shuttle finally arrived, 40 minutes after my original call, he didn't apologize.  Instead, the driver aggressively told me I should have called for the shuttle (!)  When we got in, the shuttle reeked of smoke,  and it was clear to me -and the other passengers- that we were left waiting so he could have his smoke break.When I got to the front desk, there was no one there.  We waited until a very green employee signed us up.  The room I was first assigned had a very soft, very old mattress.  They tried a different room, but all had equally old mattresses.  We finally settled on a room with a king that wasn't so bad, but I needed a new room key for my new room assignment.  It took them 30 minutes to get the keys to me.  When I was finally settling in, I discovered that the pillows in my room too were old, soft, and pilling with wear.  I called down to get pillows.  Again, 30 minutes to get them to me.  The woman who delivered them was downright rude about it.  By now it was 12:30am.  I hadn't had a moment's peace, and certainly wasn't getting my money's worth in any respect, so I chose to leave.I ended up going to the Embassy Suites next door.  At the same exact price point, the experience was like night and day.  Their accommodations, suites, and free breakfast (which the Marriott did not have) were excellent. I called a few days later to speak with the general manager at Marriott, and was dumped into her voicemail.  I was told by the front desk that the general manager doesn't carry a mobile.  Surprising for a general manager of a hotel this size, but not really when you consider all of the above.I have stayed at MANY hotels, for both business and vacation, and this is not representative of my previous experiences with Marriott.  However, in this case, buyer beware!

Update: Second time we've stayed here. Even better than before. For some reason we were able to get one of the rooms on the 7th floor for $5 more (maybe because it was a off day) and its huge! This would be perfect if you were traveling with kids. Again, very comfortable, clean and quiet. First time we've stayed at a Drury Inn, and regret that we had not given it a chance before, because it's been one of our better hotel experiences yet. After a disappointing stay the previous night in a different hotel, it became quickly apparent to my wife and I that Drury Inn really understands how to satisfy their guests. My wife loves how there are a variety of pillows in the room, as opposed to them all being the same. Some are super fluffy, some a little less for example. The bed is super comfortable. Everything worked, AC, fridge, hot water, lights (yeah, we've had experiences where that wasn't the case). Ice machines and soda machines on every floor, but there's a free soda fountain downstairs. There's a free evening meal (nothing to brag about, but it's free. Hot dogs, baked potato, Mac and Cheese, free drinks).  Free breakfast, but we opted to go to Bob Evans next door. There's also a Texas Roadhouse next door as well. Both within walking distance. Drury Inn topped off the experience with a 100% guarantee. That's right, you just read that. If you're not pleased, they'll make it right. We've stayed at places before where we had a bad experience, and complained to management that just blew us off. Staff here are friendly with a sense of humor. Place is very clean with one exception that's not worth mentioning. Shower has this ingenious body wash / shampoo / conditioner dispenser to save on all those little plastic bottles. We'll seek out Drury Inn in other towns we visit from now on.I like this place! Let's calculate: Free breakfast per person let's assume this benefits you at least 15 to 30 dollars; free evening kickback meal ( means you don't have to eat out forget taste think price) why this will benefit you 10 to 20 dollars; free drinks ( you get 3 plus pop tea coffee) now I'm not a drinker but this I know is a major benefit for drinkers...heck I wanted communion after I heard this... Because price can be a deterrent for the wise consumer and his dollars. So i will estimate the savings at 15.00. Never have I seen a hotel work so hard to get your money....Amenities that have aleady been named in other reviews indoor outdoor pool hot tub.I have one complaint change the washing solution the towels were gard...however I could exfoliate my skin with them... This is a consumer smart hotel especially if you have a lot of kids....or if you want a romantic weekend without losing all your savings.... And on top of that you still can get deals.  Best rate value and suchWhen I heard that I was booked at the Drury Inn & Suites for my recent stay in Ohio, I could not help but think of the Muffin Man. You know, from Drury Lane.  Let's get this out of the way now. I don't know the Muffin Man and I am not the Muffin Man. Just call me the Melman because I always deliver.  Hah!! My travel department booked me here for week and it's just your basic hotel.  This type of room would normally cost about $25 in Laughlin, $50 in Las Vegas, and $150 in Los Angeles. So, I figured that the price of about $100 is just about right for Drury Inn.Some amenities that this hotel has includes, a pool, small fitness room, a restaurant that for breakfast & Happy Hour, and room service. I think the food from room service is actually delivered from somewhere else, but I could be wrong. As for the employees, great staff here, I had an issue and forgot one of my work assignments at home. One of the employees went out of his way to help me print a new one.  The check in process is also easy here.One last thing to point out about the Drury Inn. It's conveniently located near a ton of restaurants and shopping.  Everything is walking distance from the hotel, which is also a huge plus.We have been dedicated Drury fans for at least 5 years now. We have stayed in at least a dozen. This Drury is mostly the same at first glance. I think the prices of all of them have gone up about $40 in the last year or two. This Drury has the most expensive price tag of any we've stayed at so far. I didn't blink at first, because I thought it would be the same experience. The bed sheets are a bit thin. And there is a dried blood stain on the sheer curtain. I always have trouble sleeping on a trip, and here I go again. 3am, and I can't sleep. I see a lot of reviews complaining of smoking smell. I was told that this hotel is now non smoking. And there is a clear sign in the room saying they will charge you $250 if you smoke in the room. So that's good! Our room has no smell of smoke. The dinner was the same it always is. It's ok to eat vegetarian. Not particularly great if you're vegan. What can we do though, it's "free" food. I expect the breakfast to be what it always is, too. The staff at the front desk upon check in was nice, friendly and efficient. They also brought us an extra blanket quite promptly. I wonder if this location will soon be renovated. We stay in 2 other Drurys the next 3 nights. Hopefully they will be what we remember and expect from all of our previous stays. PS - I would still pick this chain of hotels for this location. However, I think we will try a known location we have stayed at several years now - another Drury in a nearby area - on the way home instead of this location. It had the same price as this one, so we'll see if its quality has gone down at all yet too. PPS - Drury is very proud of those JD power awards - 9 years in a row now. I wonder if that will continue if the quality is starting to go downhill?Great room, clean and updated, our hallway smelled like and old mans dirty laundry hamper. I assume that was because of water damage. There were multiple large fans in the hall. Aside from that the facility was great. I was surprised that the tv programming didn't seem to be HD on a nice HD television. I also would love a guide button so I can look at a list of programs like I do at home. It's frustrating now to look through channels one at a time. I'm spoiled by technology. Your breakfast (for a complementary) was second to none. It had everything I wanted and it was always kept neat organized and full. My kids also loved the indoor/outdoor pool although in the back of my head I couldn't help but think it wasn't very energy efficient. The staff was courteous, helpful and always smiling. I also loved for 10.00 you could bring your dog. I would have given 5 stars had it not been for the water damage. I hate to not give them a 5 but my experiance was perfect except for that.My boyfriend and I just drove across the country and stayed in a lot of hotels. This is the best one yet! By that I mean friendly staff, great beds, HBO, very clean and they allow dogs! I hope to have the chance to stay here again.Been there.  Done that.  Will again.  Friendly service.  Free food and drinks in the evening.  Free hot breakfast in the morning.  Nice rooms.  Comfortable beds.  Great location without having to stay in Columbus.We stayed here on 9/15/2012 just for a night away from the baby and it was only ok. I wanted to it....but the room smelled like smoke...even though it was a non smoking room...and the bathroom was only moderately clean.... And the hot tub in the spa are had broken tiles and some green mold...... Not so attractive. We did enjoy the breakfast that was free....but there were not healthy options.... Some more fruit would have been nice...i don't think i would try it again...but i will say that the beds were very comfy and they had a nice flat screen tv in our suite.Leaving off a star because when we pulled up at 1AM the check-in person didn't want to leave his conversation with the security guard watching TV in the lobby to open the door.Has suites, takes dogs, has breakfast that generates a lot of individual serving style trash.First time staying at a Drury, will not be the last.   For the price it is a great deal.  Very clean, comfortable bed, courteous staff, nice pool and hot tub - did not use, breakfast was very nice and better than expected, evening kickback really nice - good food overall, free soft drink & popcorn in the lobby, what am I missing??   About ten to fifteen minutes from Columbus.  We would stay there again.Dear Drury Inn,I would like to love you, but I don't.  I am a Marriott fan, but I couldn't resist your billboard offering a room for $89.00.  In fact, I was almost giddy with excitement!   I had stayed at your Dayton location a couple of years ago and was quite pleased.  However, I am not so sure your Grove City location aids you in your quest for adding more J. D. Powers awards to fill your corporate trophy case.  Sure, billing me a room rate of $114.95 is an easy mistake.  But having to endure torture from Ms. Perky Pants to get my issue resolved was almost more than I could take!  Also, maybe you need a little bigger serving area for your free snack and free breakfast buffet.  Don't you realize that some people go crazy at the sight of free food and could hurt themselves?  I am totally forgiving you for the cheap and worn sheets and the stained hallway carpet, because I am sure it's tough to keep up on that stuff.  But aren't you in the business of providing a clean and safe room for me to stay in?  Just a little something for you to work on....Regards,Julie D.This hotel is a wonderful place to stay.  I travel for business and I find this hotel, clean, comfortable, welcoming, and the staff very friendly.  On my last visit, I left a jacket hanging in the closet.  I called the hotel and spoke to a friendly voice who took my name and number.  She called me back within 30 minutes, said she had found my coat, and if I give her an address, they would send it in the mail.  I received the package two days later.  It's nice to stay some place where the staff understand customer service.Great hotel! I had screwed up and booked the wrong Drury and they were able to accommodate me without a problem - they put me in the LAST possible room, a meeting room (i.e., a hotel room with a big meeting table). Everyone was super nice and helpful. I love that everything was free - internet, long distance, breakfast, a "kickback" happy hour (with 3 free drinks!), etc. It was a GREAT deal and very clean and nice. I loved it!

We stopped in after a day of driving around 2am just to get some sleep. I was so pleased with Chuck at the front desk and our room was so clean and nice. The bed was so comfortable we fell asleep right away! Very friendly staff during breakfast and the food was good. If we were driving back that way I would definitely stay again!New, clean, good location in Dublin. A little hidden until you're right up on it. Breakfast included. Free WiFI. I'd stay again.Located close to plenty of restaurants and just off I-270 which makes it a very practical place to stay. Add to it that the rooms are clean and the Internet runs at a reasonably good speed and you have a winner. This property also has loads of parking space available.This hotel was great and if you don't know it is there you would miss it - Quiet with awesome cookies out each night.The internet was sufficient and served as home base for 5 days on a business trip.The Fitness Center Treadmill is HORRENDOUS and probably dangerous as the belt catches and when incline is used it becomes wobbly.  Hotel would receive 4 stars if treadmill was replaced as it was the second worse treadmill I have had in the past 40 weeks on the road.Overall it was a pretty good experience. The room was clean. The bathroom was larger than I expected. The biggest downfall was that the two twin beds were very small. With my husband sleeping with one child on one bed and me sleeping with one child in the other bed we were all very crowded and very cramped. On the other hand, the continental breakfast was pretty good and had quite a variety. I would stay here again but would ask for two king beds or two queen beds were at least confirm it was a room without the tiny beds.clean, modern, friendly-staff, great hot breakfast buffet, free internet, nice location. The only reason we didn't give it 5 stars was because the work-out room didn't open til 5am (when you're jetlagged and wake up at 2am, this matters) - but they were kind and explained the reasons for it. Would absolutely stay here again.Happy surprise to arrive at this well kept hotel on a cold night in Ohio. Loved the small touches like yellow stickies on the headboard like my mom used to leave me: linens are fresh for your arrival. Also appreciated nice white bedding and thick towels. Dont really want to visit Ohio again (yikes its cold and grey!) but if I had to, I would happily stay here.First trip to Dublin, first time staying at a Hampton Inn.  I am impressed with this hotel so far.  The lobby and grounds are super clean.  My room is simple but seems superbly clean!  It has everything I need and again, extremely clean (and i'm very picky!).  What really makes me happy is that they offer free coffee/tea/hot cocoa any time you want it in the lobby.  One more thing, this is in a great location!!  So many things are right around the corner, shopping, a cinema, restaurants - and let me suggest giving the Mellow Mushroom Pizza a whirl!  Thank you Hampton for a great night's sleep!One of the best Hampton's that I have stayed in. Clean , neat , newly modelled, very pleasing staff and a great cook for a real hot and nice breakfast...On the top , my room had mini refrigerator and a microwave also. Last but not the least i love cookies in the evening at the front desk...I am a Hilton fan.. a Hampton fan.. and this Hampton fan..Great location. Clean rooms and nice property.How can I not give them five stars?  In addition to offering the usual consistent quality I have come to expect from Hampton, the friendly staff cheerfully offered terrific recommendations for local dinner and nightcap spots.  Cudos!They just finished a remodel, and it looks fantastic. Clean, spacious and looks upscale. Had a last minute reservation and was on the side of the hotel that faces 270. It was a little on the noisy side from trucks, etc. Breakfast options looked decent, but no one was hungry at the time to actually eat anything.Love the Hampton Inn's because you always know what to expect.  This one is no different.  Clean rooms, friendly staff, comfortable bed. Fairly recent remodel. This location is close to many restaurants and convenient to 275.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Columbus N - I-270 Worthington
review_content: Well, we got a smoking deal on this room and it had an indoor pool and fresh linings  and hot shower. Pro-Indoor pool, great staff, and comfy beds,walking distant to mallCon-Confusing lay out, several large meeting rooms (all in use on a Tuesdays night, limited parking) and the poor restaurant is in need of update and staff help Didn't like that the pool was in the main hallway with lots of windows that  'visitors' could stare in, made me uncomfortable for my kids to be leered at. Also the off ramp is under construction, and is very hard to navigate ( a guest told us it has been under construction for 2 years)Ok, so it's a big old Holiday inn. Rooms and all are large enough and in decent repair. Just not spiffy or new. What gripes is the $10 per person breakfast charge for a buffet.Ok, so this review only counts for the conference part of the Holiday Inn, but it's great! I've attended a conference here two years in a row and it's always a nice experience. Many rooms for break-out sessions, a nice big ballroom with good acoustics and viewing for keynote speakers, and tasty food!Recently stayed at this hotel. The staff is polite at first, but becomes less so when asked to solve a problem.  Most of the walks especially the doors away from the front lobby were left unshoveled and stairs were covered in ice.  Beware the 2 axle breaking holes in the back, they were partially obscured by snow so no opportunity to avoid them.  Staff solution for slippery floor due people tracking through the snow was to put down 1 mat and leave it even when it was soaked and slippery.  Hot water is spotty at best and shower adjustment is sooooo touchy you either par boil or freeze.  It also will vary temp all on it's own just cause.  The room is comfortable, clean and has free wifi.  There is an onsite restuarant and the food quality is very hit or miss.  Soups, which they claim are homemade are thin, salty and lacking in flavor. Fries are abundant with no grease, salads are a mix of fresh greens and ones that are wilted and brown.  When the wilted greens were pointed out to the server, the response was "Oh".The room I stayed in had BED BUGS!  My friend was eaten alive!  I couldn't avoid giving this place one star...REALLY!This HI need to be remodel, some of the rooms have that "old hotel" smell and look, some room will have microwave and fridge, and some will not. The only thing i like about this hotel is because it's next to a "mall" ( more like a ghost mall) and next to a Kroger, if you do not like to waste money at the hotel's restaurant, then the supermarket, and a couple of restaurants are across the street, just watch out for the cars though!As part of a large wedding party all our needs and wishes were accommodated by the excellent staff. The rooms were very comfortable and had all the hookups needed. Brunch was really good and is very kid friendly. The pool and exercise room were great. Highly recommended!I recently attended an overnight conference at this hotel, and so experienced the conference spaces, hotel rooms, and dining. Conference spaces: well set up, but AC was so loud in some conference rooms that attendees turned it off, leading to very warm rooms. I appreciated that there were pitchers of water available in each room, and plentiful pens. No problems with AV equipment. Hotel rooms: very very meh. Badly needs updating, some odd smells. Very bizarre layout, so not suited to large groups, and definitely do not recommend to guests with mobility issues. I would not choose to stay here again. Food: the breakfast buffet is $10, which is a huge ripoff. The warmers were not stocked, so I had no bacon; the sausage was almost too rubbery to slice, eggs did not look very appetizing. There is a waffle iron, and the potatoes were very good. Service was very slow (waitstaff seats all guests, and gets their beverages). The conference I attended provided the breakfast buffet for free, so I would think the restaurant would have expected a crowd. Instead, there was a wait for tables to be bussed, and even longer waits for coffee and OJ. I would not recommend the breakfast buffet unless it is included in your room/conference rate. There is a Panera across the street where you can get a much better breakfast. At the conference, we had two lunches, one dinner, and various snacks. The snacks were all great--plenty of variety of pastries. The lunches and dinner were all pretty mediocre banquet food--nothing spectacular, nothing too offensive.My very first impression of this hotel is the staff is very helpful and friendly. There is no doubt about. From the van driver to the front desk to the housekeeping. All wonderful.  Workout room , nice indoor pool. Free internet even.   There are a few restaurants around and a huge grocery store across the street,(Kroger) that has everything.The rooms are nice and clean with big soft beds. Very nice and reasonable price.  Even free hotel parking, you won't find that on the west coast.As far as Holiday Inn's go.. this is okay. Its clean.. updated and has a friendly, nice restaurant. Near nothing. The airport shuttle can be slow. Decent gym.. good beds.. works for me.This review is primarily for the food in the restaurant, the hotel was OK, in fact we thought the people working there were helpful. Husband and I arrived at the hotel late (after 9pm) from all day flying, we were hungry and didn't want to go out searching for dinner. We were the only table, manager was courteous, brought over our drinks promptly. Husband ordered the rib eye steak ($18) medium rare. The salad and onion rings were the high light, the steak was a total disaster. It was paper thin, very tough and well done..... I had the baby back ribs ($12 for a half rack) , they were decent and that's what we shared. The price was not bad if we could at least get a half decent piece of meat, it was so bad to the point we thought it was comical. DO NOT order the steak.The room and grounds are great. This hotel is located in a convenient and nice area. The breakfast however is horrible.I hosted a large reunion event at this hotel for about 90 guests. The staff was nice during planning and very helpful. Once the event date rolled around however, all of the overpriced extra's we paid for were nowhere to be found (like the 50 dollar audio hookup which was just a cable). So the entire event schedule was thrown off because we had to keep tracking the manager on duty to figure out where our services were. The wet bar was also a joke. Our bartender was great and was ontop of his game, however the back of the house kept choking him on supplies so we had to keep waiting for the manager to sign more alcohol out of lockup or track down more mix. Ridiculous. We were also shorted a comped roomThe worst part however is the fact they overbilled me $127, then took almost two months to refund the money. Finally after three emails the rep got back with us and said they had resolved the billing problem, and credited us for the inconvenience and phantom room.... for a total of 127. When i asked him what was the value they put on the sloppy service, since he only refunded us what they legally owed us they never replied.I'd rather host our next event out of a Chuck E Cheese.If I could give this place 0 stars I might very well have done it.  Where to start?  We had a group of 4, when arriving at the hotel dead tired and ready to pass out we find that instead of the 2 queens we reserved we have a room with just 1 king. Instead of any sort of apology, Ralph the front desk guy (who eerily resembled Lurch from Adams Family) merely offers a gruff "that's all we have available", he clearly seemed like he couldn't care less.  Since we only had one bed we requested a rollout bed as well as some pillows and blankets.  After waiting over 30 minutes we call the front desk to learn that the guy with the key is at the airport?  WTF, why would he not leave a key there, or why would a room with extra blankets need to be locked to start?  He was "5" minutes away though....  So about 30 minutes later our stuff finally arrives, yay!  Next morning, while about to take a much needed shower to my dismay I see that we are inexplicably in a handicapped room.  This means we get one of those god awful fake showers that has a portable shower head and stands about 4 feet tall at its peak.  So my choices are to use the shower head like a garden hose or bend down the entire team, fun choices!  To make things worse the shower was super sensitive with regards to temperature.  Moving the temperature gauge a millimeter meant changing the temp from scalding hot to cold, a good median temp was virtually impossible to find, halfway thru the shower when I had decided on scalding the temp decided to start fluctuating on its own, epic fail.  We were hoping to get some sort of basic foods or coffee for our trip ahead.  All that was available was a breakfast buffet for $10, no free continental breakfast, no thanks...  Oh yeah I forgot to mention that the setup of this place is an absolute clusterfck.  The only thing near the lobby are all the conference rooms, the rooms were a 10+ minute walk from the lobby, for a 1st room floor no less.  It really seemed like it was some sort of funeral home converted to a hotel.  The entire hotel stuff seemed grumpy or disinterested.  This whole place seemed like bizzaro world, the best part of this experience was getting the heck out of that nightmare.  They gave us a slight discount but quite frankly we absolutely should've got it comped after this experience.Comfortable hotel, attractive  well set up rooms, surprisingly upscale  upscale made for a pleasant stay. Nice bed. With a $10 buffet the only option for breakfast, we did not try the food. Pool is very nice, recommended overall.

A great place to stay. Affordable and in the heart of the brewery district , German Village and several other areas. The hotel is just south of downtown. The rooms are nicely furnished with a fridge/microwave   Their us an outdoor pool, funky lobby and clean. I will stay here my next visits to this areaIt feels like this place has had some renovations in the not-too distant past, and I generally like them. The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff, especially the owner/manager, are very friendly. Breakfast is pretty much what you'd expect from a Choice Hotel in terms of waffles, pastries, eggs and meat. The hotel is in a convenient location - it borders the western end of German Village, and it's only a few minute's drive to downtown Columbus and Short North.Parking is challenging here, as the hotel's primary parking lot is limited. But they have plenty of spillover space in an adjacent parking lot. The amount of space you have to drive through between the spaces on the left and the entrance is quite narrow and 1-way. They can and do have cars towed which park inappropriately (I approve).Wi-Fi here is good. They have several domains to which you can connect via password.This hotel is pet-friendly. I learned that when I discovered that other guests located about 3 rooms down left a small, neglected yappy-type dog alone in their room for many hours last night. I wish I could give those people 1 star.Get Ready People here comes the pros& cons of this Hotel......The Staff is Amazing!!! The Breakfast Was Pretty Good, The Closet Only had one Door so when my guests came to visite, they were able to see my belonging inside, Not!! cool, The Closest Mirror was horrible, looked like it was cleaned with pledge instead of windex, The pillows were amazing, bed also Comfy, but Sqeeked All night, The parking was horrible, free wifi was a plus, the elevator was slow, smelly& looked like it was painted by a homeless man, but it had a fridge& microwave in the room so we loved that....in conclusion If I came back to Town I would stay there again because of the affordable price.I don't recommend this hotel. The updates they have done are good, but the room was not clean at all. First our room smelled like a smoking room, and then the toilet was not clean. It was covered in what looked like men's hair that had been just been shaved and a bunch of yellow goop. I could add a picture, but I won't. It's just gross. This lead us to wonder if even our bed linens has been cleaned. The front desk lady never apologized just gave us a small discount for the problems. We even sent the pictures as requested by the front desk last to the owner and the SMALL discount was all he felt necessary. We were told by another worker the room would be free and this never happened. Spend the extra money and stay at the Hampton Inn.Very nice stay.... Hotel employees are very nice and helpful.... Great morning breakfast... VERY clean and comfortable bed!    Only thing bad I can say is that the elevator smells horribleMy boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel last weekend. We were in town from Chicago for the all-star game. I understand this is not a five star hotel but our experience at this hotel was horrible. We were fortunate enough to have pulled back the covers and take a quick look at the sheets before getting in and we were horrified to discover that our bed sheets were completely filthy and full of hair (short hairs and long hairs) all over; it was disgusting. We asked to have our room switched as well as to speak to a manager but the manager was not around and the front desk lady told us we need to speak to Renee or Nash. Anyway, we went into our new room and cautiously looked at our sheets once again and this time our sheets were fine but the comforter was gross. There was a huge yellow spot and spots of blood. We took the comforter off and just slept in the white sheets. The next morning as we checked out we asked for the manager, Nash, and he again was not around. Renee was at the front counter and we explained our dilemma and how unacceptable the uncleanliness of our room and bed was. She seemed uninterested and kept telling us that there was nothing she could do without Nash around (for a comp or a discount on our room). I showed her the pictures I took of the soiled sheets and she requested I sent them to her cellphone. I refused since I found that inappropriate. She wrote down a gmail address but again I was not sure if that was her personal email or not. We left our name and number with her for Nash to call us. I also emailed the email address on the Comfort Inn business card and never received a reply. We did not stay in that hotel another night but went to another hotel down the street. We called Nash the next day, he was not there and no call back, we called the hotel Monday, and then again yesterday, and we still have not heard back. The front desk girl, I believe her name was Brittany was no help and even said, "I'll pass along the message but can't promise he'll call you." It's Wednesday and no call back or reply via email. I will never stay at this hotel again or Comfort Inn. We are talking with the third party in which we booked our stay and they thankfully have been a major help and going to investigate the issue.I was VERY pleased with our recent stay. We were in town on vacation for a couple of days with the intention of exploring Columbus with our kids. I searched for weeks for the right hotel, but in the end, the Comfort Inn was over 50% less than other downtown hotels. I was preparing for a mediocre experience, but was really surprised. The location was great. Right in the middle of historic German Village, you could actually walk to a lot of the great parks downtown in just a few minutes. And everything you couldn't walk to, you could catch the free(until Dec 14) CBUS and it was a quick bus ride to all the great downtown locations, including Short North. The hotel room was great, clean and the staff was actually really excellent. We had a few issues trying to ask for early check-in so our kids could nap, but after that, everything was great. The breakfast was not great, but it was what I expected from a Comfort Inn breakfast so it didn't leave me super disappointed. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an incredible value.I've stayed at comparable places, not very clean, things old and broke down, but I  didn't have to pay $100.00 to stay at those other places. Every mirror in the room looked like they were cleaned with Vaseline, there was a giant greasy looking stain on the couch, the toilet seat was loose, there was masking tape holding up the trim around the corners, the down elevator button didn't work on the 3rd floor, there was no plate to sit things on in the microwave just the rack that holds the plate, the coffee pot was dirty, and both nightstands were greasy and sticky. I had to put hand towels on them so I could lay my phone and glasses down. If you don't mind these things and you are okay spending a hundred bucks then you will be happy here. I have to work 5 hours to make a hundred dollars so I wasn't happy with this place. On the up side, they didn't have a lot of guests so it was quiet.I accidentally booked a room via a third party website and on top of that, the wrong day (talk about needing a day off). However, Nash at the desk was so helpful even though they were fully booked and didn't have a room for me. He actually wanted to call me but he showed me the papers the third party sent and they dont even send contact info, just a name. So since the third party already took my money, he set me up with a discounted room nearby and set things up so that i didn't have to spend extra money to make up for my and the third party's mistake. I can't speak to the quality of rooms since I didn't stay, but from what I saw, everything else was very nice. The customer service was above and beyond, especially for someone who didn't even stay! Nash is someone who really wants you to be happy and help however he can.The rooms were clean and spacious with fairly comfortable beds and pillows. We stayed in this hotel on out way to and from Virginia this week and both times the deadbolt locks did not work and both nights were in different rooms.  I have to assume that most or none of the deadbolt locks work in this hotel. My sister and I were traveling alone so this was a big issue for us. We had to push a chair up against the door. Overall the experience was good but security should be a bigger concern for hotel management.This place is gross.  Completely gross.  My friends and had bug bites all over us the next morning.First of all, this place is now a Comfort Inn & Suites.Secondly, this place is great.Last year, we thought we hit the deal of a lifetime when we got two cheap four-star hotels from Priceline. However, the exorbitantly high parking fees at each hotel forced us to hunt for free or lower-priced parking, which turned into a big hassle, especially when we were dealing with the inherent stress involved with my wife taking the Ohio Bar Exam.We were going back to Columbus so that I could take the Ohio Bar Exam. We didn't want to deal with finding parking, so we looked for places that had free parking. We got a great deal from Hotwire on this place. I was a bit nervous about the fact that it was a bit farther from the bar exam site than the hotels in which we stayed last year, especially given that I have immense trouble getting *anywhere* on time!Fortunately, everything not only turned out well with getting to the bar exam, but also with this hotel. My experience here made the entire bar exam process go MUCH easier. If my exam results turn out like this hotel did, I'll be a very happy Yelper!To be honest, the ONLY quibble I have about this place is that they advertised that they had a circular bar and a fitness center and that neither one was in operation when we went. The bar is permanently closed but the liquor is still there, and this sorta reminded me of the bar from the hotel in The Shining. Also, the fitness center is temporarily closed, but I was told that they're getting new equipment.Everything else about this hotel was fantastic and was either as good as or better than the four-star hotels in which we stayed last year. The continental breakfast was free, wonderful, and had a full array of breads, meats, cereals, and eggs. If it hadn't been for the bar exam, I'm sure I would have loved it even more--hard to eat when one's stomach is in knots! The room was clean and spacious. The television had almost as many cable channels as we have at home and had some of the rarer channels like Bravo and Hallmark (Sheila F. loves The Golden Girls!) too. The outdoor pool was great. Best of all, there was plenty of free parking. The hotel's lot is small but they allow you to park in an adjacent lot that's quite close. Oh yeah, there's free WiFi too! I have no idea why this place isn't more popular....free parking, cheap rates, and an abundant continental breakfast make for a fantastic stay!This place was kind of blah.  The hallway had a persistent wet-dog aroma and the room smelled like a gym locker-room.  There were some beer cans in the stairwell that remained there for the entire three days I was there, also some dirty linens sitting on the air conditioner in the hall.  One of the towels in the bathroom had a long black hair hanging off it.  One morning there was no hot water.  On a positive note, the guy at the front desk was super nice, the parking is free, and the area around the hotel is really cool.  It's next to a neighborhood called "German Village" or something like that, and it is absolutely gorgeous, just walking around in that picturesque neighborhood was awesome.  There are also a few really good restaurants and bars in the area.  Definitely enjoy the walk from the hotel to Schmidt's Sausage Haus and get yourself some incredible schnitzel.  I really love this location, but personally I'd rather pop the extra money for a nicer hotel around there next time.This review is based upon my in-laws staying here while visiting us while we were living in German Village.This by far is you cheapest "name brand" hotel option in the downtown area. The price of what they paid is comparable to the room and service they received.The room was spacious, with a generous seating area. While the decor was done in country floral, I've seen worse hotels for the same price. The area around the hotel is full of tons of food and shopping options, being sandwiched between two historic districts (German Village and Brewery District). By the way, avoid the clarmont restaurant next door... it sucks..I stayed here for a week during November 2008.  The hotel is not very fancy, but the room was indeed clean and spacious.  Our room even had a sitting area, complete with sofa, chair and coffee-table. **Insider tip: forgo the coffee in the hallway; it's bitter.  Opt instead to use the tiny coffee pot in your room.  Run once with water, first, to clear out any  potential dust from not being used.  It works just fine.

This is a top notch place.  Very clean and quiet rooms with nice amenities. The 9th floor has a nice executive lounge (I was in room 918). Front desk staff was very friendly.  The front lobby is very modern and hip looking I would definitely stay here again.Probably the BEST Hilton I have stayed.Fresh look, very modern amenities, and the staff is above and beyond the competition.We did not try the restaurant and/or the bar, but the pool and hot tub were wonderful.The room is great, it has a fridge (which I am finding more and more uncommon in rooms), has a very  spacious bathroom and a great view.  The complimentary Wifi is great, and the complimentary 5 mile shuttle is a nice touch.  The biggest problem is the worlds worst shower.  It is the most low flow shower head I have ever seen.  It was really hard to take a shower, and I'm a guy, idk what a woman would think, but it would probably be twice as bad for them.  The spa is nice, I used it for a massage the last time I was here.  Rates are fair and the service was good.  If you want a cheap, quick massage just run up to the mall and get one up there.  The hotel is pretty far if you want to go downtown Columbus, but perfect if you are just visiting the area.  The mall is awesome and there is plenty to do in the immediate area, and great places to eat too!I can finally share the truth. So you would think this hotel would be lovely to get married yes, just the building itself is good but I'm not talking about the service here. I cannot recommend this place anymore for any bride or groom after my experience during my wedding.I went in for 2 taste testings and you would think the hotel would get it right on the wedding day. Nope, every guest came up to me and said how all the vegetables were barely cooked. You could barely cut up your brussel sprouts. The chicken was not flavorful. They only thing that was actually good at my wedding was the cake which didn't even come from the Hilton Hotel.Later on that evening we got the complimentary room. Although we did not need a phone call saying the champagne and strawberries are late do you still want them? My husband says sure and we only drink less than half the bottle and give it away. Let's just say, I was being nice and not telling them how I really thought of my overall experience at their location.The bar and restaurant food is wonderful. Great people, great food and great waiters. We stay here a lot but we also just come for the restaurant.Stayed at the Hilton Polaris July 24 -     July 26. The hotel is located in a great area and, the mall is right next door and there are its of restaurants nearby.  The lobby is very modern, Our room was very spacious and clean and the bed was comfortable.   I would definitely recommend.(I'm staying here right now as I write this...I have three young children with me.)You can tell the true character of a place by paying attention to what happens when something goes awry. Our room service delivery guy dropped a glass of lemonade, and the glass broke, sending tiny shards of glass all over the carpet of our suite.I asked if he was alright and immediately began helping him clean up. He graciously objected to my help, but I insisted.  As we patiently picked up the tiny shards together (he handled most of it), he asked why we were in town and where we were from.  (Cleveland.  A youth basketball tournament.)When he finished, he hurried downstairs to bring us a new lemonade. He also returned with some energy bars for the kids to put in their bags for the basketball tournament. And even though I repeatedly told him we were not inconvenienced, not bothered, and understood that accidents happened, he wouldn't let us pay for our breakfast.  Which, by the way, was served hot and delicious. He was one of the nicest, most courteous, thoughtful, and service-oriented people I ever met.  And he remained that way throughout what may have been a stressful situation for him.  We're here for a couple more days. I will never choose a different hotel in Columbus.I really enjoyed my stay here.  It was a pretty last minute reservation, and they were still able to accommodate my fragrance free room request. The price was very reasonable. The sheets did not smell, which is very important to me.  They still gave me toiletries, but I just removed those from the room.  The lobby has a beautiful fireplace, and great seating for just hanging out.  The rooms are updated, modern.  The water pressure was AMAZING. It felt like a waterfall. Seriously.  I'll definitely stay here again.Had a luncheon and they ran out of food. Gave me a small what looked to be half eaten vegetarian plate. When I explained that I had paid for a full meal they said sorry and walked way.. Never been treated so poorly by a staff in my travels. They're are better options close by.PROs:Really quite a lovely hotel. Lobby is fashionable and comfortable upscale decor.Services thus far have been good but we haven't asked for much.Check in was easy enough and staff has been quite friendly.Room is beautiful. Nicely appointed. The bathroom is quite nice as well. It has an amazing magnifying mirror.We are very pleased at the decor and ammenities.Location is fantastic. Mall and a million restaurants right next door.CONS:Disappointed that Hilton doesn't have any sort of welcome pack for the kids...no activity book, wiki stix , crayons, snack, tub toy...nothing.So many hotels are wonderful about having a little something for their smaller guests. Sad that Hilton hasnt thought this was important.The sensor light in the bathroom was a nice touch until you need to go to the bathroom in the middle if the night-blinding!The beds and pillows flat out suck. I have never had such a bad nights sleep at a hotel. If you can bring your own pillow, do so. They are a mushy lump that flattens over time leaving no support what so ever.The bed it self is flat and jiggles every time anyone moves. Every time my husband rolled over and moved in any way the whole bed shook and woke me from sleep.The bathroom door is heavy and solid to muffle noise but the main room door isn't. You can hear every conversation of passing people.The floors are not well insulated we heard footsteps above us like a herd of elephants. I spent most of the time telling my kids to walk softly as to not disturb people below us. Breakfast was ok. Clearly the dining room is a bit small for a hotel this size.The Buffett was fair. I've had better scrambled eggs and it seems like the mixed berries were frozen prior.I would love to stay here again based on its location and decor but the bed and pillows were so bad and I value a good nights sleep far more.Hotel bar maybe the most inviting place I've ever stayed. Beth the bar tender was gracious and quite entertaining. Loved my expierence!!!Nice clean and spacious . They have free internet in all the rooms and the staff ia really nice. Especially Kathy! Shes awesome. They have a shuttlw that will take you within a 5 mile radius of the hotel and give you a lift from the airport. The convention rooms are nice and large, but the rooms are freezing so be sure to bring a jacket!Hilton Polaris Hotel looks from the outside like any other Interstate hotel.This is a well-run, clean, modern and hip hotel with friendly and helpful staffModern workstation area (pics uploaded). Usual comfy Hilton Beds.Wi-Fi works reliablyExecutive Lounge offers a happy hour. Mix of beer, wine and booze at reduced prices compared with the bar area. Complimentary simple breakfast is offered with fresh fruit. During the day, the lounge is open for complimentary coffee, snacks, water and soda.Tip:  Check out the Polaris Grill for dinner, nearby at 1835 Polaris Pkwy, as recommended by the Exec Lounge Staff.If you think this review with photos is useful, funny or cool, I'd appreciate your feedback by clicking below.Very nice, clean rooms.  The standard rooms are a bit more spacious than you'd expect.  Lots of room to move around.  The beds and pillows are quite comfortable.  I found the staff to be a little less friendly than I'd expect.Stayed here with my husband for his birthday. The pool and hot tub are very clean and the exercise equipment is well maintaimed. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly. A very pleasant stay.Such a beautiful hotel and meeting facility!  Kind of sad that I was in meetings all day and couldn't really enjoy the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and the Polaris mall is right next door!Conveniently located less than a mile from the Interstate. And also next door to a huge mall. Front lobby is nicely decorated and a fireplace in the winter months makes it cozy.Like the reviews say, they have a very nice lobby.  I stayed here for a work trip.  Service was above par.  Although, the front desk agent didn't offer any assistance with my luggage even though it was noticeable my hands were full.  But that was no biggie.  My room was clean.I would stay here again.I booked a room for my husbands birthday so we could get away from the kids. The room was very nice and the bed was super comfy. The staff was very friendly as well! We also ordered room service and the food we ordered was excellent. They also brought has a wine opener since we had brought our own wine and forgot our wine opener at home. Overall the place and our stay was excellent!Great hotel. Great management. Without question this hotel is one of the best, if not best Hilton Garden Inns in the brand. Outstanding location. Highly recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Columbus/Polaris
review_content_20: The bar at Hilton even though has excellent drink choices and an excellent menu, the ambience is dull. The bright lights with no background music makes this great bar into a poor waiting area bar. I wish they could change it up to be more of an upscale lounge, I would frequent this bar.This hotel is excellent. It's across the street from the mall. The room was clean and everything in it worked. The indoor pool is cleaning and functional. The halls are quiet. The bar restaurant is amazing. Service at the front desk was fast and easy.I wanted to love this hotel. It was pretty on the surface but the lack of service and cleanliness was shocking. Here's a few things we noticed:-rolling papers stuck to the guest directory in our room-long dark hair in the sink-eye makeup on the towels-long hair baked into the cookies we ordered-nasty, funky smell in our roomMy favorite part was when we took the guest directory to the front desk with the rolling papers stuck on it. When we returned to the room, the book was back in the room, but they left the imprint of the papers on it....they didn't even clean it off...pretty nasty!When we (very nicely) spoke to the front desk for a second time about our issues, we recieved no apology, just a  "We can't move you, we are all booked". It was very dissapointing and I would not recommend this hotel for anyone.I spent last Saturday and Sunday night at the Hilton Polaris while in town for my sister's wedding. Here are my impressions.The hotel itself is very new and looks so both inside and out. My room was well furnished with a flat-screen TV, king side bed, and desk. It was clean and the AC worked great as well. The only drawback was the location of the room, which was right by the elevators (meaning that I could hear all of the conversation and running around in the hallways late at night). While I didn't dine in the restaurant(s) downstairs, I did order room service on three occasions -- twice for dinner and once for breakfast. Not only was the service lightning fast (my orders each arrived with 15 minutes) but the quality of the food was awesome. I enjoyed the club sandwich I had on Saturday night so much that I had the same on Sunday night! The bacon and egg breakfast on Monday morning was just great as well. I've stayed in tons of hotels over the years while traveling on business and this one had the best room service I'd ever had in terms of the quality of food and the speed and courtesy of the service.There is plenty of great shopping and dining in the area as well, although I didn't have the opportunity to sample any of the local eateries.I would highly recommend the Hilton Polaris in Columbus.The hotel has a great location. The rooms are very clean and new. The hotel has an excellent bar and restaurant inside, however many tastey places are located close by. I definitely recommend staying here.I have stayed in MANY Hilton Garden Inns, and this was by far the best one yet! The room was spotless, the bed comfortable, and the breakfast tasty, but the thing that really made the visit special was the staff. Every single person was unfailingly kind and friendly. We were stressed from car trouble on the road, and their sympathy was much appreciated. There were guests up late watching a bowl game, so the staff kept the bar open late, which have us a chance to get a much needed drink before bed. They arranged late checkout so I could relax in the room while my husband took the car for service. The restaurant staff handled my food allergies with aplomb, and even put my breakfast on a silver tray so I could take it up to my room. Altogether, this was an outstanding visit! I would unreservedly recommend this hotel to anyone, and if I'm ever back in Columbus, I know where I'll be staying.First my big complaint - lack of power outlets.  While the lamps on the work desk were stylish, I would have preferred ones with electric outlets.  My other complaint about this hotel, and many others, is there air conditioning preset - 67 degrees.  Haven't they heard about energy & climate problems?I got a pretty good sized suite, with a separate living room and a large bathroom, at the end of the hall.  This hotel is new and doesn't show any wear.  I ate dinner at the bar, and lunch in the restaurant, and both were decent.I also presented at a conference there, and the conference setup was pretty goodAs 2 stars indicate, I've done better.  For less money. The rooms are quite nice.  Clean. Cleaning crews at a civilized time and quiet. However a decent breakfast is important to me. In that respect, the Hilton Polaris fails miserably. Start with whoever laid out the restaurant should be fired. 4 walls, as one would expect, 3 with access points (doors), 2 on the far wall are the kitchen and those doors are lined up with the 2 main aisles. It's like sitting in Grand Central Station.  Acoustics are terrible, high ceiling, hard surfaces. The decor is a mess.  It can't be described, it's just a mess.When we travel to Ohio, we like to think of it as a trip to the country. You know, farms, fresh food, good stuff. In all honesty, our party had not had as bad food since we were all in college over 40 years ago. The eggs had pee like yellow spots for yolks.  Fortunately they tasted of nothing. Espresso made with powdered mix and terrible. The coffee it was replaced with was burned and acrid. Sausages were filled chemical derived favors and the meat itself was simply garbage.  Butter, what's that?  Though it was called butter. Dinner, we took a peek as we were curious. Same mess with noise and activity.  The food we saw brought back memories of college cafeteria food.  No compelling smells. How in the world a place surrounded by farms can't get decent food is beyond me.What's really weird is the Hilton Garden Inn across the street has a very good breakfast, good coffee, great staff and costs less per night. And I may as well join the AC chorus. Yes the rooms are freezing, turning the thermostat takes about a day to effect any temperature change.  It's also noisy and runs all the time.  Bring some needle nose pliers, you will understand why when you get there.I stayed at this Hilton for a work trip, and I thought it was great!  The hotel is modern and has very nice decor.  The lobby and bar were great for me and my co-workers to chat after our conference.  It is also conveniently located (as long as you don't mind jogging across some busy roads) next to a pretty nice mall with a lot of restaurants.I ordered room service for dinner the first night I was there.  The portions were larger than I expected and they brought it up very quickly.  The rooms were really quiet.  I was near the elevator and am a very light sleeper, so I was pretty nervous about that.  However, I didn't hear anything from either the hallway or other rooms.  The best part - the staff was super friendly and accommodating.  The shuttle driver to and from the airport was pleasant to chat with and literally ran around the shuttle to open and close doors for people.  The front desk made sure that I had a shuttle at the exact time I requested to make my flight to the airport, even though I could tell it wasn't very convenient for their staff.  Walking around the hotel, the staff always made eye contact and smiled, which I appreciate.    I really enjoyed my time at this hotel!Beautiful new Hilton. Close to everything: shopping and restaurants. Great service.

review_content: Stayed here three nights for business.The staff was friendly and helpful, check-in and check-out went with no issues.  The room was a king-bed suite, and it appeared to be clean and tidy.  The linens also appeared to be clean, with no issues there.  I didn't notice any off-putting smells in the room.  The room was also mostly quiet (I could hear the shower running a little bit from the room next door).  I admit that I like to keep the fan running in the room at all times if possible, because it adds a bit of "white noise" to help block other sounds, and I was pleased to find the HVAC controls in the room allowed for that.  In fact, I could choose from low, medium, or high speed, which was pretty nice.  Temps in the room stayed constant with no wild swings, and the water temp & pressure in the shower also stayed constant with no fluctuations there either.My room had a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker.  There were also complimentary bottles of water provided.  Free wi-fi was available, and it seemed to work just fine.The hotel is located in an area with lots of restaurants within walking distance (or a short drive).  There's no reason to go hungry in that area.  It's a very short drive to the interstate, despite the road construction that's been an ongoing project for quite a while.I did not sample the in-house restaurant/bar, fitness room, or pools.So a couple of points to make which lowered my rating down to three stars:While the room itself seemed to be overall clean, the carpet in the hallway needs to be cleaned. There were several fairly good sized stains in the carpet, and there's no reason not to address those.  Also, some of the trim around door openings (especially at the service elevator) is worn and in need of replacement.  Minor thing, but it's all about appearance.Also, the couch had some sort of white stuff on it.  Not really sure what it was, but it was ground in.  Again, like the carpet and the trim, not a huge deal - but it's a matter of appearance.Again, some might see this as a nit-picky thing, but those who are safety oriented will understand this comment.  There were quite a large number of padded chairs stored at the bottom of one of the exit stairwells.  The last place anything combustible should ever be stored is in an exit stairwell.  This has nothing to do with anyone's stay, unless you need that stairway in an emergency.  That's a life safety/fire safety issue.  Hotel management should seriously reconsider that practice, as it's also against fire code in many places.Overall I was pleased with the stay, and would not hesitate to stay here again.- Friendly staff- Decent rooms- The A/C works well- The breakfast buffet is below average- Only three treadmills in the gym and one was broken and another's tv didn't workNo issues with check in or check out (a couple of mess ups on their end but nothing that ruined my stay).  They made a few errors but fixed each one--annoying.  My key cards kept malfuctioning which was annoying and the elevators can be slow at peak times.  This place is in the middle of nowhere and a hour bus ride to downtown Columbus.  Food was fine.  Best part was they give you a five dollar voucher for use at the restaurant if you don't have the maid clean your room and that was awesome--the veggie wrap for lunch was really good--all other food was fine.  Friendly staff all around.This hotel was awful!! We stayed here one night and that was one night too many.
