The staff was rude and when we went to then to address our concerns they told us that we were only staying there one night so it wasn't there problem. I have never been treated so poorly at a hotel ever. We will never be staying at this hotel again.I booked a night at Sheraton Suites through Hotwire. The rate was ~ $75 per night after fees and taxes. I had a pleasant stay at Sheraton Suites and would definitely return given the low rates.The first thing you should know is that the hotel is located just outside the Outerbelt (I-270) in the Worthington suburb, which is about 15 minutes from downtown Columbus. With that said, it's a quick drive downtown and Sheraton Suites is conveniently located next to the freeway. With that said, there are plenty of chain restaurants and shops within driving and even walking distance. For example, there's a Chipotle, Bob Evans, a Japanese restaurant, a German restaurant, 2 steak houses and multiple bars within stumbling distance. The rooms are suite style with a single king bed, 2 TVs, a convertible sofa bed and a bathroom accessible by both the bedroom and living room. I would estimate the overall size of the room to be about 300 square feet. The suite can easily sleep 4 without any issues.I found the suite to be clean. I had no noise issues, even though the hotel seems to attract a steady stream of business and sports team travelers. There is plenty of free parking in their lot. My only gripes are the lack of free Wifi in the rooms and the lack of a complimentary breakfast. However at $60-70 per night, I shouldn't complain. I would definitely come back!What a nice surprise! Great location, spacious rooms, clean, and bright. Dogs allowed, as with many Sheraton / SPG properties. Club Lounge was fantastic, though we weren't up early enough to take advantage of breakfast. Coffee maker, microwave and fridge in room. Lots of places to eat around the hotel; most of them close by 11:00pm.We just stayed here again and as before, overall this place is a winner.  The suite setup is kind of posh-- a living room with sofa, mini-fridge, microwave, flat screen, dining table; open a pair of french doors and enter a bedroom with a king-size bed, another flat screen, nightstands.  It allows both the early riser and the night owl the appropriate options for peace and quiet.I cannot recommend the restaurant however; we had breakfast again there, and it was just mediocre to below average food for the buffet selection.  It was so unappetizing that I passed on the buffet, and we had a breakfast coupon that had the breakfast in the room rate.  My wife confirmed however, it was a poor attempt at a buffet.  Other than this item, we enjoyed our stay and will absolutely return.  I'll just have to find a nice breakfast joint nearby, which won't be difficult.My wife and I were traveling last minute and needed to find reservations on the road. Based on a few previous experiences with Sheraton Suites and the competitive price for the busy weekend we settled on this one. $125 for the room, but read on...Upon arrival the staff seemed friendly enough, but the parking was limited. Our room was spacious enough for a suite but the finishes seemed outdated. The bathroom looked clean but smelled dank and moldy.  The couch in the living area had a substantial food stain in one of the cushions and was worn--along with all of the other furniture in the area.The worst part of the overall experience was the cost. The staff were sure to explain the use of a debit card was not the best choice as a hold would be placed on funds to cover any extra costs incurred. We are not big on room service, so we assumed this wouldn't be an issue. The next morning we found the breakfast cost an additional $14 per person and it consisted of about what I would consider average for a holiday inn breakfast. In addition we used the coffee and tea provided in our room to the tune of $4 per person and a bottle of water in the fridge for another $4. We are regular travelers and this type of shady tactic is the opposite of what I expect from the "hospitality" industry. Needless to say, we won't be returning.Between the bartender, and the customers we encountered here... I'm not sure I've encountered a more rude atmosphere. Will never be back.I'm definitely not pleased with this place, this place is outdated and the price was 209.00 for a Saturday night with a AAA discount! I paid less at the beautiful Sheraton downtown Columbus just last week on the 4th of July!!!!!! And we had a view of the capital. Don't waste your money here,the customer service wasn't great either.Had a great stay.  We got a fantastic rate with a wedding group. There are a number of good bars and restaurants in easy walking distance.Traveling with children was no problem and the hotel was very accommodating. The hotel supplied a crib and it was both sturdy and nice. The sound insulation between rooms was excellent so we didn't have to worry about a fussy baby bothering our neighbors. We ended up leaving some clothes in our room after departure.  The staff found them quickly and got them Fedex'ed to us the next day.This place is horrendous. Constantly overbooking, very rude to people, and they do not communicate anything to their guests. Overbooked by ten this weekend and had very angry people. I would not stay here even if it were free. The only good thing about the hotel is Sammy the bartender. By far the best in town.We stayed here for 2 nights and would not recommend it to anyone. Upon walking in our room the smell was overwhelming. The bathroom stunk! We had to shut both doors connected to the bathroom (to the bedroom & to the living room) just to make the room smell somewhat okay. We requested air freshener but they never brought us any after they said they would. We avoided the bathroom at all costs it was seriously THAT bad. I think it was either a plumbing or mold issue. We chose this hotel because it was dog friendly but the grass area was limited and covered in poop. The pool is supposed to be heated & said it was 85 degrees but the water was freezing cold. We will not return. For how much we spent we could have stayed at a much nicer hotel.I like this hotel.  When we travel we don't spend a lot of time in rooms, the extend of our stays can be summed up as we close our eyes, wake up and leave. I can see if you had to actually spend some time here how the suite thing would work nice. The room has 2 tvs, a desk and a comfortable sofa. We travel a lot for work, but even then so we only stay in a hotel once, maybe twice a month. The problem for us with travel is that I have a finicky back and my husband has a sensitive neck, so comfort is a big thing for us. I love Sheraton beds, they are plush and super soft, while at the same time firm enough to not wreck my back. The hotel is clean, updated and modern,  and upon check in both clerks were friendly and helpful. Parking is free, and the hotel seems to be in a quiet location. A movie theater and some restaurants are in the surrounding area. I refuse to pay $14 for a Sysco hotel breakfast, but the restaurant and bar area looked nice.Nice, clean hotel in the greater Columbus area.  We booked this hotel through Hotwire for one night while relocating cross country to Arizona.  The price was great, rooms were clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable.  Everything that we could expect, and honestly, even a little above.  The suite included a fridge/freezer, as well as a microwave. A nice touch that was quite appreciated. The large living area with separate couch provided a nice little respite after a long drive from NYC. As another reviewer said, this hotel is definitely NOT near downtown, but no more than a 20 minute drive in no traffic.  Also, they really should offer free WiFi.  However, if we should ever be back in Columbus, we would definitely stay here again!I would never recommend this hotel. We too booked it on Hotwire as we were driving cross country. After 10 hrs of driving we just wanted a hot shower and a clean bed. We got neither. They put us in a handicapped room with one of those horrible plastic handheld shower things. My husband called the front desk and they offered us a room with two double beds. We should've taken it! The shower was ridiculous. It barely sprayed, kept falling down and I didn't feel much cleaner for having taken it. When I got out and grabbed a towel to dry off with, it was dirty. You could tell it had been washed but somewhere between the laundry and our room it had come in contact with something black. It was all over that one towel. Thankfully the other two towels were clean though.      The furnishings in the room were just as pictured online, except about 10 yrs older! The couch was so stained and worn out. We didn't even sit on it. The desk had no shine left on it and felt grimy. Both my husband and I stepped on a staple or nail coming up from the area that had once been carpeted in front of the bathroom. There was a big patch of carpet missing there. The linens on the bed were nice and clean on top but the sheets and comforter underneath were stained. The comforter was yellowed and also had what appeared to be blood from a small cut on it.       Just gross and disappointing. Stay away. There are so many hotels in Columbus.Nice suites. It's about 300 sq ft so it's not bad for 2 folks size wise. There's a separate living room area with TV and a small desk. They also provide a fridge, coffee maker, microwave and iPod dock. The bathroom has access to both living room and bedroom. The bedroom has its own TV. The area is pretty decent. It's right next to other hotels/motels and there are a lot of restaurants too. They have their own restaurant and a decent entree selection for room service.I have never stayed at this hotel, but from a customer service stand point, I have had a terrible time with Sheraton Suites, as well as their main chain Starwoods Hotel. I have never been spoken to with such a lack of empathy, lack of concern and harsh condescension in my life. When I tried booking a room through one of their sister hotels, there were several problems including; double booking, booking at the wrong hotel, as well charging my card immediately (for both rooms). I never even received a confirmation email. Due to the laundry list of problems that occurred, the only thing I can think happened was a computer error. I called frantically, and was completely disappointed in how I was treated. I was told the only explanation for all of the mistakes was that I did everything wrong. I was sent through the ringer with several employees, promised phone calls I never received, until finally speaking with the hotel cancellation manager who finally agreed to give me a complete refund, only after warning that I "need to be careful in the future". One week later and I still haven't received my money back. I am in the customer service industry and have never given a bad review in my life. The only thing that I can take away from this terrible experience is to always do as much as I can to accommodate my clients, so they never feel as inadequate and frustrated as I feel/felt. As well as I will never stay at this hotel chain.Good hotel in a pretty convenient area. We picked this hotel because we were bringing our dog and we also have a 4 month old. The suite layout is great for us when traveling with our son because when he goes to bed at 8 we aren't forced into bed. We can easily put him in the bedroom with the doors closed and watch tv in the other room and still access the bathroom without going into the bedroom. Total win! The rooms are also comfortable, I love the beds and pillows and sleep so good. The room comes with a mini fridge as well. Pool was nice as was the hot tub and when we were there was empty. My old reason for the lower rating is the front desk. It seemed as though we were really bothering them when we went to check in, like it was taking away from there fun time. They quickly checked us in and gave us our room keys all while saying MAYBE 2 sentences to us. Bad impression right away and definitely not a way to welcome guests.This hotel has a convenient location basically right off I-270 and US23 (although you have to snake your way back to it on the side streets).  There are movie theatre and lots of restaurants nearby. All of the rooms are Big (all suites, hence the name :). Free computer & Internet access in the lobby.  There is both an outdoor and indoor pool, although they are pretty small considering how many rooms there are.  The weekend we stayed there, there were multiple kids sports teams staying there, so it was pretty crowded.The lobby restaurant is just OK.  I would recommend the Bob Evans restaurant nearby for breakfast, or there are lots of dinner choices within walking distance.
review_content_20: I won this on Priceline for $45/night, and thought I got a steal of a deal.  The suite was well-appointed (two flat screen TV's, for instance) and modern, and the bed was very comfortable.  As expected, wifi wasn't free in the rooms, but it was in the lobby and this was sufficient for me.Customer service was great.  I had a random craving for milk in the middle of the night, and the guy at the front desk went into the kitchen to get me a small carton at no charge.Only a couple of quibbles: First, shower water pressure was lacking.  Second, the fitness center was unimpressive.  It's more of a cardio center (plus a few dumbbells), and the elliptical machines weren't set up to operate correctly.Check-in was okay. We were in on a Sunday afternoon and the front desk associate seemed generally uncaring but not rude - this didn't bother me terribly, but I know up-front service is a big deal to some so just an fyi. We requested a crib and it was brought up to us promptly.We stayed in a king room. The layout was lovely with nice french doors separating the living space from the bedroom, with a flat screen in both rooms. The outdoor pool space looked like it would be an awesome area with a grill and a bar, but it was closed the day we were there and we had a baby with us anyway. Cool environment, it seemed. The pool was a pool, area was kept clean, no complaints there.Our room smelled like cigarette smoke. I didn't request a room change because it didn't really bother me. The fact that a pet had recently been in that room did, however. I understand it's a pet-friendly hotel so I'm not docking points here. Dander is hard to get rid of. Apparently so is cigarette smoke. The other downer is that while the room looked to be recently updated, all the furniture seemed kind of shabby and beat up, as if that's where all the partiers stay. There are so many options at this exit to stay at, I may or may no stay here again. The reason we chose this property was because of the rate ($79) and it was close the zoo and we were only taking a mini-vacation with our daughter. If I were to stay here again, I smell-check the room first.WIth the limited Starwood properties in Cbus, I figured I'd give this a shot (after almost always staying at the Westin -- which sucks). Super cheap rate.  Hotel is in an area of town around, seriously---20 other hotels and at least 20 restaurants (all in one-ish square miles). Old property.  Really, really in need of lots of work (but I can't complain due to low rate). Spacious suite-style rooms.  Plenty of room for a family if you're on a budget.  I have to stay that staff were a tad rude and not that helpful.  Wireless was down for half of my stay and they didn't seem too concerned about getting it back up.  Overall, ok stay.I have stayed at this hotel nearly every week for the last 8 months, and I've simply had enough.  The staff at this hotel (with the except of maybe 1 guy) either do not try or do know how to be hospitable.  I am just so fed up with the staff, I have to call it quits.  Sure, I'll miss the SPG points and status, but it's just not worth it.Besides the staff, the facility itself also leaves much to be desired- poor internet quality, gross couches in the room, a poor excuse for a workout facility... but it all came down to the staff not being responsive to the needs of the guests and not being able to think outside of 'policy.'A couple of clowns run this hotel. They booked my reservation, took my money and then sold out the damn hotel. Crooks and bums. Stay far far away!! Zero interest in making things right for customers.This was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in, I've stayed in roach motels at the beach that were awesome compared to this. I was here for business over the past week and there are so many different things I can list. At first impression it looks like a great hotel: Corporate side - there's no free wifi, it says there is but there is not and it's $10 per day per device to get Internet in the rooms. There is no continental breakfast, the restaurant down in the lobby charges outrageous prices for a small glass of orange juice and bagel.Hotel Side - the rooms looked clean when we got there but everything steadily went down hill fast. The person I was rooming with and mine own keys kept locking us out of the room and would not work, by the end of it we only had 2 mix-matched keys that would work after 3 days of having them reset 4 or 5 times. The shuttle service was pretty much useless since nothing (including the airport) was within 3 miles, and they would not pick me up from the airport so I had to take a $40 taxi. Some of our groups rooms were not cleaned even when they asked them to be cleaned. Every time I went back to my room my bag and stuff had been moved to a different location and I don't mind my room being cleaned but don't move my stuff. My roommate and I got placed in a handicap room, needless to say there was no bathroom door because it was a small thin sliding partition; and when rooming with someone you have never met before that makes for a very awkward event showering or going to the bathroom. Our company had contracted for the hotel to make us lunch so we could all eat together, the food was a joke and was terrible; I had fast food across the street that was better. Some people who were supposed to stay the last night for flights out of the city the next day ended up having no room, they were clearly booked in the system and there were records of it being from monday to saturday but the rooms had been double booked out from under them on the last day, so they had to go to a different hotel the very last night. And probably the worst thing is after staying there for 4 nights I now have bites all over me where my skin touched the bed, I don't know if they are flea bites (they allowed pets in the rooms) or bed bugs but I am very disturbed by it.Conclusion, if I could give the score a half star or no star at all I would. I will never stay at a Sheraton again.I DID NOT STAY HERE BUT.....I have to give a review and five star awesomeness to the staff. I was having a horrible allergy attatck and my hotel, the Hyatt Place, did not have a gift shop or sell medicine. I called around to a few hotels in the area that were walking distance (Doubletree and one more I forgot) and the Sheraton was the oly hotel with a gift shop and Benadryl. But oh nom that is not even the best part. So i walk over there (like a 7 minute walk, I can see the hotel from the parking lot of the Hyatt) and when I get there, the manager working the front desk whom I spoke to on the phone had the medicine there waiting for me! I am only really happy about this because it was the last one and he saved it for me which I appreciate greatly. But wait, it gets better!The manager then tells the shuttle bus driver to give me a ride back to my hotel!!! I wasn't even staying at the Sheraton but he asks the driver to drive me to MY hotel! I thanked him and told him i did not mind walking since it was just around the corner, but he insisted, saying that my allergies could get worse and I should stay inside.OMG!!! How nice they are!! The driver was so sweet too, she was very friendly and would not even take a tip.So I had to give a review for their niceness :-)Good deal on Priceline for 50 bucks a night (not including internet access).  This is a great hotel for a business traveler, lots of restaurants within walking distance and a short drive to Polaris Mall.There is an indoor pool and restaurant in this hotel as well.  Bed was very comfy.I am normally nominally annoyed/aggravated by hotels and their staff.  this was completely different.   The young lady at the front desk was so nice- found my rewards number that I'd lost, even looked through a few addresses to see which one it was I'd registered with (and failed to update) and applied my stay.  I was particularly flustered after a day of house/apt hunting and in no mood to deal with a hotel check in, but she made me laugh and told me a story about a relative's hard time with a house too.  She even offered me a few amenities ( I chose the loofah thingy)  and wished me well on house hunting.  the room itself is nice.  bed comfy and after the last 3 hotels I've stayed in that have smelled oddly of urine and animals, this was a welcome respite.  I did not have to buy benadryl to sleep due to thin walls, heavy tollbooth traffic, etc.  Very nice for the area.  Only real con is that a 24 hr wifi block cost $9.95.  No free surfing. :-(  but didn't really matter since i could sleep and didn't need 24 hrs of Netflix to live.If I weren't the only one staying in the room, perhaps I'd have felt claustrophobic.  The bedrooms are separated from the main living area, and both are well-appointed.Staff is very helpful and cordial, and were shocked that I was there, driving during some level # snowstorm, something this visitor from Phoenix had no idea what the hell it meant.  Close to a bunch of stuff, but as Ben mentioned, it's more conducive to driving than walking, though during my stay there was no way in hell I was going to be out walking in sub-zero temperatures in the snow (something I hadn't seen for 4+ years).No free internet (boo) but there's a Panera close where you can surf the net to your heart's content.  Also has both an indoor and outdoor pool, but I obviously only used the indoor hottub to try and defrost my body.I was travelling to Columbus on business, to attend a training class and was quite pleased with the Suite that I had (being SPG Platinum boosted me up to the Executive floor)Rooms are very well insulated, floor was quiet, staff was friendly and efficient. They are about the size of the Homewood Suites ones I have stayed in, perhaps a tad smaller, but not noticeably so.The hotel has an ATT Wi-Fi network which you can use as part of a regular subscription to any of their roaming partners, so wi-fi was covered as well.The breakfast buffet was about average for a Sheraton. Not a lot of imagination, but had most of the basics. You can order omelets or take a look at their more extended breakfast menu if desired.This Sheraton does not have a club lounge, but has three private-access floors.We don't travel to Columbus to sightsee.   We're here for business or to visit extended family.  As such, it doesn't matter to us that this hotel isn't close to the Zoo, OSU, the Brewery District, Polaris, or Easton.It's quiet, there's plenty of kid-friendly dining options nearby, and there's a big movie theater close by, too.  The suites are nice- there's a tv in the bedroom and one in the living area, so my husband and I could shut the door after the kids were in bed and watch a movie without disturbing them.  There was plenty of space for them to move around.  They LOVED the indoor pool.  It's not huge, but it's conveniently close to the elevator and was very warm.  Towels were available poolside.I'm thinking the other reviewers are accustomed staying in cardboard boxes underneath an overpass.  About the only redeeming aspect of this place is that it is cheap.  Otherwise it is old, frayed and utterly incompetent.To begin, we arrived late in the evening with a confirmed reservation which, for unknown reasons, the hotel had canceled without notifying us.  The front desk clerk was utterly unhelpful, implying that it was somehow our fault that our reservation was not coming up on her computer -- perhaps the problem was that she didn't really speak English.  We finally got a manager to find us two rooms side by side (one for us; one for the kids).  But there were only rooms on the "Club Floor."  Initially, the manager wanted to charge for the upgrade.  Eventually we convinced him that canceling our reservation was his problem, not ours, and he relented, giving us the club rooms at our original rate.  I'm not sure what made this floor so special; the rooms didn't seem any different from others' in town for the wedding.As for hotel amenities, the HVAC in the rooms was pathetic (overheated in one room; freezing in the other), the WIFI was like molasses (and they charge for it), and the bathroom space was minuscule.  Finally, sometimes it is the little things that are really annoying.  The room had a small ice bucket with tongs, but the hotel's ice machine produced crushed ice.  You can't get crushed ice out of a bucket with tongs, and the bucket was too small to scoop ice up with the glass.  Really frustrating to be in a place with such pretension at luxury but which so utterly fails to meet the mark.Dysfunctional landscape: Exhibit A. You're in a car, or trudging across a dreary space that acknowledges nothing without an engine. There was one sidewalk in the area, about a half mile away, that was conceived and aborted within fifty yards. I would pay bodily limbs if we could go back to 1945 and re-develop out nation.This, of course, is not the fault of the Sheraton. People were nice. There was a suffocating presence of back-slappy commerce (JP Morgan conference). Two flat screens: one in the bedroom and one in the front room. I guess that's good for maximizing SportsCenter. But, of course, you pay for your internet. Thankfully, the Hilton nearby was not so greedy.All-in-all, good place to sleep, bad place for existential considerations.I stayed here over the weekend. Nice cozy suites with room service and a great restaurant. There is a cinema and some nice eating joints including Bob Evan's around this Hotel. Courteous front desk staff. My suite had 2 Flat Screen LG TVs.The bedrooms are separated from the main living area, and both are well-appointed. Only thing on flip side is charge on WIFI. In this digital age, WIFI is a free must have.Needs some major updating.  Carpets in the common areas were a disaster.  Suite was okay but again could use a little updating.  Bed was comfortable enough.  Hey it's Columbus!Very Disappointing. I have stayed at this hotel about a dozen times.  Twice I have been bumped because of over booking at this location.   The first time I assumed a fluke and it could happen but twice is a pattern of bad management.  These are not very good odds of actually getting a room when you book a room at this hotel.  When you get bumped you will be sent to a very low standard hotel in the area which is very frustrating experience for a customer.  The hotel I was sent to last night did not even come standard with shampoo or blow dryer in the room.   After last nights experience I will be staying someplace else in the future.   There were at least three of us last night with reservations that were all bumped at the same time.  I wonder how many more customers had the same frustrating experience.  I didn't even really hear an apology.  We were just told there was nothing they could do because it was over booked and they had no rooms available.  I would avoid this hotel if you really want a room when you arrive.  In my option the chances are not very good.  There are plenty of nice hotels in the area.  I will try another one in the future.  This is not the standard I would expect from a Sheraton.

review_content: I'm a man so I only judge hotels on 4 criteria.1) Are there beds? Yes, and it was comfy. There's a star.2) Is there a TV? Yep, a flat screen.3) Is there a fridge to keep my Scottweisers cold? Yep4) Is it in a solid location and easy to find after a night of clowning around with pals in the city? YepAdd that plus the cleanliness, how awesomely nice the man at the desk was when checking in, and throw in the fact that they had a pool, I am a very happy camper.Cons - The biggest problem was that they charged me $10 for parking and the parking gates didn't open and close. I could have lied and said I walked and could have avoided a $10 charge.Besides that, yeah, I'd stay here again and again and again!As a business traveler and expensed, this hotel isn't bad.I had a room that had the upgrades. Towel and linens quality is much better than average. They have a coffee maker and fridge.It located downtown away from the cluster of hotels that are near Nationwide arena - that is about a 25 minute walk.Not too many food options nearby, not as many as the hotel cluster.They have a FREE shuttle to take you to and from the AIRPORT. If your working downtown, there really isn't much of a reason to rent a car.They have a restaurant, bar and heated pool - never tried any.I recommend this hotel. But it seems overpriced - but this is downtown Columbus with very low hotel vacancy rates.The only fail is that they didn't have a suitcase stand in my room, and apparently not one available in the hotel.Also, they try to mess with you mind with the elevators - 1 elevator had the buttons on the left, the other on the right.This place had everything I'd want in a hotel stay. Convenient location to downtown. Free Wi-Fi in rooms though it was shotty at times. The rooms are big and included a desk. A big bonus is this place had a free shuttle within 3 miles until 11 p.m.Meh. Decent room with nice upgrades. However, there were a few "holes" in our flooring/carpeting and I could not find an ice machine to save my life. Also, no coffee available in the lobby. Definitely not worth the $110 I paid.We stayed here one Thursday night and got a great deal on the room. We noted that this was an older building but it's been done over so our room seemed newer. It had coffee maker, fridge and cable TV (everything on the small side, but we aren't complaining). A big surprise was a pool and work out room! Everything was more than adequate and the location is good for the Columbus Art Museum and Kelton House which we came to see and which were in walking distance. Room was quiet, water was hot and without exception, all the staff were friendly, helpful and conversational, without being intrusive. We had a great breakfast in the cafe/restaurant as well as a light supper in the bar area in the evening when we arrived. Everything quite tasty and good enough. We'd stay here again on our road trips to the midwest and of course the whole place is wheelchair accessible (since the rooms are small though, if you are wheelchair user be sure to get a larger room).Throw another log onto the fire. The place needs work. The lobby is nice, but the room was meh. The room I stayed in had a one inch gap between the faucet and the wall in the tub, like you could see the pipe and water was flowing backwards out of it. The ceiling had a cover that was painted over, but it was opened since and the paint was all cracked around the opening but was never repainted. And lastly, there was a long ass hair on my bed sheet. I was sleeping alone and I have short hair, yup it wasn't mine. Lol Overall, it kinda seemed like they didn't care to maintain the room. On the bright side, the comp breakfast in the morning was pretty decent. They cover for whatever you order on the menu, you just pay tax and tip. Not bad.This is a review for Holiday Inn Capitol Square (March 30th).So where to I begin. I'm hours away from check out & I thank The Lord I didn't go crazy in this building. My co-workers booked this hotel on Hotwire.com because it was the best price in the downtown area. This hotel has taught me sometime cheap isn't always good. Can I get an amen? From the peeling wall paper in the hallways to the broken toilets in your room this hotel is a constant reminder that what? SOMETIMES CHEAP ISNT ALWAYS GOOD. Don't get me wrong staff was very professional however I don't know they could give a room to a guest with a broken toilet? It's beyond me. The hotel is perfectly located near the Short North area and the Holiday Inn provides a free shuttle to any establishment in the 3 mile radius. Overall the hotel wasn't horrible but I feel like if we put a little more effort into our search we could of found a better place to rest our bums.Lobby is nice. Rooms need work. Located in kind of a lousy area if you want to walk around. No restaurants around to walk to, along with a lot of bums asking for money. Located close to highways though so I was able to quickly get on highway and find places to eat. Nice workout room and pool. Charge $12 to park every night, this brings price even with nicer hotelsI sure wish I could give zero stars. First, the hotel cost was $189 plus tax per night. This was because it was the weekend of "The Arnold." Unfortunately it was also the weekend I had an interview in Columbus. So, after overpaying and fighting the crowd to check in, I found that there was absolutely no hot water.After a lukewarm apology and assurance that the water would be restored, I decided to roll the dice and try again later. Ultimately, I came to find out that this happens "every time" the hotel is over carrying capacity. How unethical is it to abuse the laws of supply and demand, mark up the rooms, all along being FULLY aware that they cannot support all of the guests. I rarely get this furious with an establishment, but this is corporate greed at its worst. Please do humanity a favor and never stay here.We travel enough to know what to expect and Holiday Inn met that expectation and more. It is my understanding that they are remodeling. The room that we had - 2 Queen size with city view was very nice. Ultra clean. The desk clerks at check in were professional and friendly. They also answered any questions that we had. They also have a shuttle that will take guests anywhere within 3 miles of hotel and we used the service. The restaurant is nice - portions are big. Kevin friendly but flighty. The down side is that they do not offer continental breakfast so need to buy in the cafe. Small fitness room and decent pool. Small business center. Location great within walking distance of German Village and downtown area. I'll definitely stay againI agree with Ryan, definitely a low rating. I would rate them between 3.5 to 4. There were some issues with check in where they assigned my room to another person but that was smoothed over in 5 minutes. They don't include a fridge or microwave, and they didn't have a closet so that was a bummer. They offer free Wifi--I always recommend bringing a wireless card just in case. They have restaurant included inside the hotel--it's pretty much comfort food. It's right in down town, minutes from CVS on High Street, many Subway restaurants near by, and the Columbus Commons. They are pretty cheap compared to other downtown hotels. Just a warning, if you do bring a car they charge $10 a day for parking, and if you smoke in the room they will charge a $250 fee. There are many parking areas that may be cheaper if you are staying there long--check the one off Town Street and Grant Avenue. It will be a walk but may be cheaper if you're staying more than 5 or 6 days.The last time I checked, Holiday Inns are supposed to be great options for the traveling professional... sadly this place made me feel like a misplaced gnome. First I was curious as to why Sarah lied to my face by saying "your room does not have a refridgerator because another room in your party requested an extra one" (which she did, for medical reasons... but that should have no effect on my stay) which seasoned rep Heather later apologized for, and promptly (sorta) switched our rooms half-way through our stay, only so that we could enjoy granite counters and a broken toilet, eww.com. P.S. If your menus in the room say dinner is until 11pm, why was there no food options at 6pm... questions to ponder I suppose.Dated but undergoing renovations. Ice machine didn't wok and I had to go to a different floor to get ice.Very friendly staff.Plenty of space in the room but I was expecting something a little bit nicer.I stay at this hotel regularly, and have a number of issues with them.First and foremost, if you're arriving after 10:45 PM, you can forget the complimentary airport shuttle. Occasionally you'll get a driver who is nice enough to come get you after 11 PM, but generally they won't. This is really frustrating because if they stayed on an extra 30 minutes, they could service the last flight into Columbus.Secondly, as I come in late frequently, the fact that the hotel only serves food until 10 PM leaves me in a bit of a limbo when it comes time to find something to eat. Fortunately there is a decent bar down the street that serves food until 1 PM so that helps.The lobby has a strange odor to it. Not necessarily bad but unique and off-putting. The front desk staff is generally friendly, depending on who you get. The elevators are hopelessly slow, and if you hit the call button sometimes only the service elevator will open, while the two main cars never reach the ground floor. In this case just take the service elevator as it is appointed the same way as the guest elevators.Regarding the restaurant, I've had much better. I ordered a Caesar salad, however the plate was piping hot, thus wilting the lettuce. It was also served without croutons (they were out) and had a mess of mozzarella cheese on it (which doesn't belong on a Caesar). Service was acceptable but the food wasn't.There is also a lot of noise in this hotel, likely due to the fact that is is undergoing renovations, but I can't hold this against them. The hotel is in dire need of renovations as it looks quite tired and dated.One thing they do have going for them is FREE WiFi in all of their rooms, though it will kick you off the system if you are idle for a short time, which is only a slight annoyance. Parking in the on-site lot costs $10 a day, when it should really be free. The complimentary shuttle service is nice during the day and they will take you anywhere within 3 miles for free.Basically, I would not stay here if I were booking the hotel. But because my organization pays for my rooms, I stay where they tell me.Update: The hotel has removed their complimentary business center for things like checking in for your flight and printing boarding passes. Also, I finally got to stay in one of their renovated rooms, and it is clear that they tried to cover up a tired hotel with a thin veneer of high end finishes, but it was not well executed.We stayed in this hotel for 28 nights last month. Jan 25-Feb 22, 2015. My husband was working and I stayed in the hotel 24/7 with our dogs. The staff were amazing!! We travel almost 1/2 our lives and this was one of the BEST staffs I have ever encountered. They treated me and my dogs as family. The restaurant and room service were OUTSTANDING!. My only complaint was the structure. About half the days there, there were issues with the elevators. Usually just one, but one particular Monday, BOTH customer elevators AND the service elevator. The stairs had to be use. One Tuesday, myself, my 2 dogs and another guest were in one when it would not move. For 20 minutes. The last 2 weeks, there were signs 'out of order" and men working on them all the time. The Thursday before we checked out, a man worked on it all day, he left, and 5 minutes later I had to tell the front desk it was stuck again. After checking out and responding to Holiday Inn's Guest survey, I was told someone from the hotel would be contacting me about this within 24 hours. They have not yet. I called today and told my review was rejected because I mentioned said elevator troubles and this was considered a safety issue they did not want published. I am offering this to other guests so that they may avoid this potential issue. Also to ask if other guests at the time can confirm these problems. I am very disheartened by Holiday Inn's response to my issue.I wish negative stars were an option.Charged a smoking fee to our room when clearly no smoking could have possibly occurred. The windows are sealed shut to prevent suicides, if someone smoked a cigarette in that room, THE WHOLE FLOOR WOULD REEEEEK. Also video surveillance would show me and my friends going outside multiple times throughout the day/night. I'm disputing it now, but what an irritating hassle. From my research it seems that it's common practice for hotels to do this to people because the likelihood of someone wanting to take this to court is slim.Don't be a patron to this fraudulent, thieving enterprise.NOT friendly staff!As a business traveler, my time is money. While the hotel itself is middle of the pack as far as amenities, time is something that they might need some help on. Figured I would try their in house restaurant so I came down from my room right at 5 pm hoping to get a quick meal in. Needless to say I walked back up to my room at 5:15 with their closed sign still up even though they were supposed open at 5. This is frustrating. This is the second issue I have had with this hotel in 2 visits. The first involved an early morning hotel shuttle. I needed a 5:00 am shuttle to the airport. I called down the night before and was told that it would be unavailable to me even though our corporate contract with the hotel states it should be. I ended up booking a taxi instead.When I arrived at the front desk, I noticed a shuttle and a driver hanging out chatting with someone. As I waited for my now late cab, the driver asked if I needed a ride to the airport...... I said yes and off we went. Frustrating! Another hour taken out of my time off to relax to get a cab scheduled all because one person gave me bad information.Clean rooms and a great location.We had an excellent stay at this Holiday Inn. My fiance and I reserved a king size room a few weeks in advance. When we arrived, there were plenty of parking places and the employee who checked us was very helpful. We were in town to attend an Andrea Bocelli concert, and we accidentally left our tickets back home. After checking in, we conveniently printed our tickets using the business center's printer. The hotel room was very clean. The bed, the pillows, everything was very comfortable and both my fiance and I slept wonderfully. During check out, the employee at the desk was very helpful and he checked us out quickly. The next time I'm traveling in or through Columbus, I will be staying here again. I highly recommend this hotel.
review_content_20: We were torn between this hotel and another hotel down the street but what sold us on this hotel was that during the time of our stay they were offering a promotion where if you stay two consecutive weekend nights you would receive a 75 dollar rebate.I am so glad that we ended up choosing this hotel. The location was perfect, it was in downtown but it was kind of in a secluded location from the "nightlife" downtown scene but walking distance from all the night life. The rooms were very clean and the lobby was very nice, it was obvious that the hotel had been renovated because the feel of the hotel was like a "today" feeling, not like some hotels that are still stuck in their 70-80's ways. The front desk staff was very friendly,nice and accommodating. However, parking was not free, it cost $10 to park each night, but they did offer free WiFi to their guests. If I am ever up in Columbus, I know where I will be staying!I've gotta buck the trend here and post a positive review. A two-star average is just too low for this hotel.I stayed here for three nights at a Priceline rate of $46 + tax. Sure, the rooms aren't spacious suites, but they get the job done. They are clean, and housekeeping does a fine job of keeping them that way.The room I stayed in was certainly lightly furnished. You've got a bed, a cushioned chair, a desk, a desk chair, and an entertainment center with an old CRT TV. There's a coat rack with a few hangers, but no luggage rack. The bathroom was especially small, but also passable. The biggest plus was free wifi. Others have complained about the speed, and I too experienced some variability. It ranged from broadband speed (first night) to about half broadband speed (third night). Never did it approach "dial up speeds" mentioned in another review...I suspect that's an exaggeration. Considering I had friends staying at the Doubletree who paid $12/day for slower Internet, I'd say things aren't so bad at the Holiday Inn in this department.Neither is the $10 parking fee. You're downtown - you're going to pay to park. $10/day was the lowest rate I found anywhere nearby - Hyatt and Doubletree were both $20+ as a point of comparison.The lobby was recently renovated and the public restrooms are of very high quality. The restaurant downstairs is a couple dollars more expensive than I'd like, but turns out to be a good value because of their huge portions. My chicken sandwich was so big I had trouble finishing it. Overall, this is not the perfect hotel, but it's very underrated on this site. I would probably give it three stars, but the two-star average is ridiculously low, so I'm bumping them up to four...which should serve to make this a 2.5-star property on Yelp.The   ***loading***Slowest    ***loading***Internet    ***loading***Ever!!!!    ***loading***Other than the dial up speed internet, the hotel is...meh...ok.  rooms are clean(ish). beds are fine. laundry on siterestaurant on sitewalking distance to downtown, although a bit of a walkthe one huge plus is it is located one block from DIRTY FRANK'S hotdog place.  Great dogs and bar!We make an annual trip to Columbus every Labor Day weekend. This is the 2nd year we've stayed at this hotel. Last year the stay was great; our only complaint was a long wait to be seated for breakfast in the restaurant & a long wait to receive our breakfast. They were short staffed. This year, the complaints were many: It took 30-40 minutes for us to receive a crib to our room (TWICE). It took us 20 minutes before someone answered the phone for room service so that we could place our order. Our receipt was not received under our door on the morning of checkout & we had to call the front desk twice to receive it. And the same issues in the restaurant for breakfast as last year. Redeeming factors: We expressed our complaints to the manager on duty. She was very nice & apologetic. She comp'd our room. She got us seated in the restaurant for breakfast immediately, had our order put at the top of the cook's list so that we could eat and make our flight, and also comp'd our meal. Overall, we'd give this hotel ONE more chance before staying somewhere else.Despite the location, I had high hopes - based on the newly-renovated interior - that their service would be similarly spiffy.  I was disappointed.Although pleasant and friendly, the staff and service were extremely slow.  I tried to grab a quick breakfast but was told it would take 10 minutes to get so much as a bowl of instant oatmeal.  Later that day when the wi-fi was crawling and I suggested a reboot, I was told that "sometimes it just be slow."  Clearly. If you don't need anything from the staff, the property itself is fine - not in the best area but not too terribly far from some fun restaurants for dinner.This is probably the worst cleaned Holiday Inn I've stayed at. I almost didn't shower this morning because I didn't want to use the towels and have my body touch the curtain.I'm pretty sure my room didn't use to be a room. It's large and empty and the bathroom looks like it recently had construction done. I can tell from the shoddy work and loose fixtures. I'm typing this now so I don't forget, but I have to go to check out of this dump.This hotel really sucks. There is essentially nothing to walk to and frankly you probably wouldn't want to in the evening regardless. The rooms are OK, but are essentially standard older holiday inn rooms. No more, no less.  The whole place could really use an overhaul.  Furthermore, the restaurant in the hotel is a trainwreck. I was sitting at the bar and couldn't even see a menu for over an hour because the bartender couldn't find one.  Any time anyone so much as ordered a drink, we all had to hear about how overworked she is. Truthfully, I think the average bartender could handle the job in their sleep.  On the plus side, the front desk staff were very pleasant, but that's about all I can really say positive about the place. I ended up leaving after 1 night and finished my trip at the Blackwell on the OSU campus.This place sucks. New, fresh Holiday Inn logo. Same turd hotel.It goes without saying that this location isn't the best.  Not to mention the place is ancient.  But in my opinion, it has a nice quirkiness about it.... 'time warp' comes to mind.  I found the rooms to be very clean, neat and nicely put together.  I think they were renovated not too long ago.  The lobby itself wasn't and that shows but don't let that scare you off.  The food was quite good- glorified pub food with a few really nice dishes.  I was not disappointed.If you want to stay downtown, you can get a good rate here as it is sort of the underdog hotel.  But I typically root for underdogs so that is just fine for me.$10 parking, weak, most everything else was passable. no flatscreen tv's. the remote control was weird, i had to manually turn on the tv. what sucked the most was that the shower was cold-cold-warm-scalding-cold-warm-cold-fucking freezing.  fix that shit.Kind of funny - I feel the opposite of the other reviewer here.  I was pretty impressed with the lobby.  Perhaps they have renovated since then.  However, the elevators didn't get updated and the rooms are clean and comfortable. It is an average Holiday Inn and just fine for a good location at a good price in downtown Columbus.  They treat their Priority Club members very well there as well and my check-in process was great - the guy at the desk was friendly, funny and very helpful.

review_content: Our experience on 1/23/2016 was beyond our expectations.....  Easy check-in, reservations made at a great restaurant (during restaurant week), free shuttle to the restaurant and back, complimentary breakfast and valet parking.  The hotel is modern industrial and my husband loved it!  Go for the Bed and Breakfast Package that includes the parking.  Definitely worth the bang for your buck.  Will revisit!Stayed here for 2 nights for work.  This has more of an apartment feel than a hotel.  The decor is modern industrial.   Has brick walls, open ceiling, wood beams, etc.   was cool because it had a separate living room with TV, and huge bedroom.   Bathroom was also roomy, clean, and modernly decorated.  Overall was nice and would stay here again.Having stayed here for three nights, I will say that there is some truth to the reviews about the walls being "thin".  However, I can't say with any certainty that I have stayed in ANY hotel that is perfectly quiet and doesn't have noise coming from an elevator, ice machine, or kids running.  I can say I had none of that noise here - I could hear my neighbors walking above my room once in a while, and I could hear some city sounds.  However, I am staying downtown - hello...The facility is a very unique hotel and provides a very neat atmosphere that you won't get at a lot of places.  There are exposed wood beams throughout the rooms on the walls and ceilings, providing a very neat viewpoint.  The rooms are huge - I literally had a hallway leading into my room.I found the rooms to be clean and well kept, the bathroom was very clean and had nice amenities provided.  I had an excellent view from the room of downtown and it made the experience very nice.  I did read in a couple of reviews about the fact that the room uses wooden blinds and not curtains - I didn't think the usage of blinds caused any more light to enter the room than curtains would, but then again I have these at home.Overall a very pleasant experience from check-in onwards.  If you are looking for a unique hotel experience while staying in downtown, I would highly recommend you stay here.  You will be right in the center of everything, and within walking distance of a lot of great dining experiences.Stayed here for a night last weekend when we cam into town for some live music.  It was my first trip Columbus so I wasn't sure what to expect.  This hotel, although a little pricey, was a really cool unique place to stay.  It was walking distance from all the downtown entertainment venues, and some very nice restaurants.I see a lot of reviews claiming it was dirty, but we did not experience this.Nice, clean, roomy rooms with a great shower = 4 stars.I have stayed here a couple times and have funded family member visits.  In all of my stays the hotel has been in good order and the rooms have an industrial / warehouse feel, like others have commented.  But the front desk service staff have never impressed me, I have overlooked it in past encounters but after a very recent experience I am to the point where I will no longer be staying there or recommending anyone I know stay there.  The front desk staff is not helpful and bill incorrect credit cards, take liberties with room service and have no power or willingness to correct mistakes, it goes to their accounting department.  Its a hassle to deal with and there are better managed hotels in the 1/2 mile radius.I can imagine people complain about the noise. It is noisy. You can hear your upsairs neigbours walk around the room and you can hear the traffic. But living in the center of a big European city next to a trainstation I think I'm numb. Don't hear it, doesn't bother me.Stayed here last May and this week. Both the same room, or at least the same lay-out. Big spacious room with a big bed. No curtains but wooden blinds. So if you prefer a very dark room: don't go here. A nice bathroom with only one real complaint: the water pressure is not so high and if the neigbours take water or flush the toilet you're out of water.And both time we had to wait a long time for the valet. In May to leave the car, this week to get our car.And excuse any grammar and spelling mistakes. English is not my first language. And if that's not bad enough, Apple keeps changing the English words into 'proper Dutch'. Yes, you guess right, my first language.""Artsy-Artsy hotel with a great location"" "Expensive, but a great place to stay" "Unique Warehouse design !"  I would definitely return. The reasons are the following: 1-Great service 2-Beautiful Hotel &  the room was sort of artsy 3-Best Location (downtown Columbus right across from the Convention Center) 4-Very nice staff & very helpful. 5-Very courteous valet parking & service The best I liked from the hotel was the comfort of the room and views. I think is a great hotel for adults especially and if there are kids around you won t notice them. I hope this answers all your questions.This hotel is 2 stars. No professional staffs, not maintained well. I will not recommend to anyone or I will not come back for sure.Total disappointment. First we paid WAY too much for a room that would have equated to something much nicer up near Polaris and should have just done that. The room smelled like urine and cigarettes so if you're into that this is your spot! You can't rent movies on the tiny TV mounted from the ceiling that is so high you can hardly see it. Then they trick you by advertising a pool and fitness center but it's actually located in the neighboring hotel and both are a complete dump! Funny because I think this is considered one of Columbus' premier hotels and if that's the reputation the city is going for, well I'm damn glad I moved. Smell ya later Lofts!I wish I can choose no stars. I just checked out this overrated overpriced hotel. My room was made up and no complaints. But I opened my "closed luggage" and found one of house keeping's damp rags inside. A few of my worn clothes were wet and stank. It was HELLA NASTY!!!God only knows where that rag has been used. Upon check out, I gave the rag to the front desk in front of customers checking in. I let them know upfront I don't need any complimentary things because I don't plan on staying here ever. Word of mouth news spreads the fastest so count on me on spreading the word. The floors and walls were very thin. You can hear above tenants walk wherever. For the most part, I did have a good stay at the over priced hotel, but never again.Tiny little boutique hotel, certainly as the pics show; however dirty beyond belief. The carpets in the room were stained beyond belief, the tray table meant for patrons was dingy and most certainly had never been cleaned. I didn't care for the gloomy rooms, as the lighting in a room with such high ceilings is hard to illuminate if not done right. The wooden ceiling joist, although giving a stylish feel, made for a noisy nights sleep. I was on the 2nd floor and unfortunately could hear every step taken from the room above! The lobby is literally 20x10ft. if that.. Don't expect much. Certainly a level of disappointment.To start I would like to say what a nice room I had at the lofts. Large, well appointed, modern and a good bed. I'm afraid my experience there did not go well however. With all of the money that was spent on this building, nobody thought to insulate the walls or ceilings. My upstairs neighbor walked around until midnight. My neighbor had their tv on at a reasonable volume until I moved rooms at 3am. It was as if their tv was in my room. The blinds were insufficient, which would normally not be a problem except that the hotel faces the convention center which is lit up like a Christmas tree all night. I think I slept for a total of 4 hours and I was in bed for 9. It was brutal. DONT STAY HERE IF NOISE OR LIGHT BOTHER YOU AT ALL!!!!!Also the breakfast place looked terrible. I walked over to the hilton downtown where they have great food. I would recommend staying over there when ever your in town. It's much better.We loved our stay here. Very cool place. The room was fantastic. Valet parking couldn't have made it any easier. Thank you for a great nightI wanted to add a couple of things. Day 1: I found very late at night that i was allergic to something in my room on the 5th floor. Maybe the big plant in there or the wood or brick, not sure, but i could not breath, so if you get allergies don't stay on the 5th floor. However, when i called to tell them, they asked if i wanted to move and i said no... the man actually brought me up Alkezelter Cold medicine and Unisom to my door so that I could get some rest...  Day 2: the second night it was even worse with the allergies, so i had them move me to a room on the 3rd floor and they did it right away, as soon as i asked, they had a bell man come help me take my things to the new room and the next day made sure I had complimentary breakfast and free internet for my trouble..  Day 3: I needed to wear jeans for a charity day on Thursday (that part was ok) but I sent the only pair of jeans I had to the laundry on Wednesday and was told I could get them back the same day, not the case. After calling several times, they were able to call the laundry service and have them make a special trip back to bring me my jeans in the morning which was a good solution. So that is a good thing.Day 4: I needed to get to a party around the corner, but it was freezing out, so they had the shuttle take me around the block and the guy brought me right to the door.Day 5: In the morning I called and had them take my bags to be checked, so that i could head to the office and pick them up later. Then they drove me in the shuttle to work. When i got back, getting my luggage was a pain because a giant bus filled with rude people pulled up and they all wanted to check luggage. I tried to tell people i was trying to catch a plane, but they were not interested.. finally i caught a valet and told him, he called a airport shuttle 20.00 flat fee plus tip (not bad) and got me my bags so i could go change into my travel clothes.. they got me to the airport and i am writing this review from the airplane via wireless by gogo inflight..  COOL HUH :PVery nice business hotel rooms.  The problem is with the service.I walk up to the check in desk. The girl at the front desk is on the phone and looks down as i approach.  I wait patiently for about 3 or 4 minutes and she doesn't acknowledge me.  SMH.  I sit down in a chair because she does not plan on acknowledging a guest  until she has completed her call.   Several minutes later she gets off the phone and asks if she can help.   She didn't even pretend to care that it took her almost ten minutes to acknowledge or assist me.  She gave me my room key and I was off. I think she said maybe ten words to me the entire time.  I was only there one night but the next morning when I was leaving at 7am, there wasn't anyone at the front  desk.I had to call and get an emailed receipt.  The room was almost 200 for one night after tax including valet parking.  Although the room was spacious and clean I will not return for that type of attitude.There are a couple of things that are definite positives about The Lofts: the rooms are HUGE. And fairly inexpensive. And it's in a lovely historic building. The brick walls and high industrial looking ceilings are lovely. The service was friendly and helpful.There are also some definite negatives: the grout and caulking in the shower was black. And not intentional black. Mold/mildew black. In fact, the bathroom was one of my biggest issues with the hotel. The tile was in bad shape and there was just a feeling of creeping uncleanliness.Basically, this hotel, as far as loft-style boutique hotels, is a swing and a miss. The decor seemed haphazardly placed, and cords were visible everywhere. Neighbor-noise was distracting and forced you to wake up whenever the person walking down the hallway or walking around above you decided to get up. Street noise is noticeable. It isn't a terrible place to stay, but I'd probably choose something else next time I'm in Columbus.Although I had a really great stay here, I'm only giving it four stars because we didn't take advantage of all of the amenities, so I can't say whether or not the full experience would change my rating.We booked a room here for our wedding night because we were putting the honeymoon off until we had cash to take a really nice trip.  The check-in person was friendly and helpful, and the room itself was gorgeous.  The bedding was nice, there were a really good amount of pillows (not the two little flimsy ones you usually get in a hotel), the sofa was nice, the bed was *huge*, there were two good-sized televisions.    Even the bathroom was nice, with Aveda products rather than the generic hotel stuff you'd usually get.  It's a definite step up from generic chain hotels.We did order room service from Max and Erma's.  The food was okay, but I'm wishing now we would have saved ourselves the money because I wouldn't ordinarily eat at Max and Erma's.  If you like chain restaurants like that, you'll probably be very happy with the food; places like M&E, Friday's, Applebees, etc, I tend to avoid like the plague.  But hey, it was our wedding night--gotta order room service on your wedding night, yes?Parking was a little on the expensive side; we self-parked in the garage and I believe it was about ten dollars for the overnight.  With it being so close to High Street and within walking distance of a lot of eating and entertainment options, if you're visiting and you don't need to drive, you can save this expense either by not renting a car or by finding cheaper parking options and taking a cab or the bus until you need to retrieve your car.All in all, it was a great stay, and we plan to return sometime when we're not so exhausted and can enjoy ourselves more leisurely.Ok, I suppose. Artsy, cute, decent location near to short north. Regardless, the parking was a shambles. Vale parking shared with the hotel next door, cars going in the out and vice versa, bottleneck an delay was unacceptable. We did score a free bottle of bubbly on account of it being our anniversary but he parking thing was a major pain.The check in was smooth.  The staff was friendly.  My issue was with the decor.  Maybe I'm just used to the Vegas posh decor, the luxuries of NYC, or the bungalows in Beverly; but I was highly unimpressed with my room.  I'm just not a fan of the exposed brick.  I was okay though.  I walked through the room to the bedroom and loved that I didn't feel cramped.  My pillow cases were not clean... Lipstick or blood stains, which made me wonder if my sheets were clean.  I decided ignorance is bliss, so I slept on the couch with a coat and hiked up the heater.The bathroom seemed small to me.  They did have Aveda bath products.  I just didn't like the black and white tile.  When I hear luxury, I just think of something more.  After talking to others, I realized that I'm just a west coast girl.Overall, I would have given this place 4 stars, but visibly dirty sheets are inexcusable.Best. Hotel. Of. Our. Stay! Free wifi. It is a connection to the Crown Plaza, which is great. We had a HUGE, GINORMOUS bed. Big flat screen TV. Tons of space. We had a hallway with a sitting area. Floor to ceiling windows. Aveda bath products. Stay here when you are in town.
review_content_20: My girlfriend booked us a stay here on a Friday night for my birthday, even though we are locals. I've always heard about this little hotel and wanted to check it out. I read some so-so reviews, so I wasn't sure what to expect. We used the valet because it was part of our room rate(breakfast & parking package). The valet was quick and friendly and offered to help with our bags. The guy checking us in could not have been nicer or more friendly. He offered us ideas of places to go and things to do, until of course we told him we lived here. But a nice gesture. Also, even though we booked the cheapest room type, he upgraded us to a superior king room with no hesitation.The room was awesome. Very contemporary and what you would expect for an industrial/loft theme. There was a sitting room with wetbar, sizable bathroom and tons of room in the bedroom, with more seating and a decent desk. We were right next to the elevators, but we never heard them. These are rectangular-shaped lofts with the beds being farthest from the door, so it's not like it's right next to you. The bathroom amenities were all Aveda, the soap, shampoo, cond and lotion, not just the soap like someone else reviewed. The bed was really comfortable, as were the pillows. You can also connect your iPod to the clock radio. Since the breakfast was included we ordered it room service style, and yes it is from Max & Erma's. I too typically avoid those types of chain restaurants like the plague, but the breakfast was actually pretty solid. Ok eggs, great potatoes, ok toast and Minute Maid OJ. We definitely plan to stay here again, it was an overall great experience. Good job Lofts!The rooms are pretty.  That was the only positive with my stay here.  I'm appalled at the service.  Yesterday I had 6 different people for various reasons knock on my door  (picking up old trays - there were none; rose petals turn down - Wong room.. etc)  Room service was bad and I don't just mean the food...  They forgot things every time.  Sometimes I had two peppers no salt, I had to eat a float with a fork, they forgot my drinks... the list goes on and on.  My advice, go out.  The front desk was to arrange a massage for me and ended up just not calling me back to let me know they were booked.  I found out many hours later when I called them to see what was up.  They also were to have the restaurant manager call me about the horrible service and that didn't happen either.  I better call back to make sure my cab will be here so I can leave this wretched place.I would never stay here again.  I thought this was an upscale hotel.  I was misinformed.I'm seriously disappointed in the lack of detail and thought in... everything.A very nice boutique property in a great location - walkable to Arena District nightlife, prompt and attentive housekeeping service, and an exceptionally unique room in a historic property.  Exposed brick walls and luxury accents including Aveda bath products made my stay a pleasure.  The towels were thick, plush, and I daresay DELICIOUS.  Room downside:  Thin walls!  Normal conversations from the neighbors, as well as TVs, alarm clocks, music, etc were all audible.A *tremendously huge* problem with this hotel was the valet service, which is shared with The Lofts' sister property, Crowne Plaza.  Valet staff were difficult to locate, seemed generally lackadaisical about their duties, and seemed generally understaffed.  (For appearances alone, how about you boys try RUNNING at least until you're out of eyesight instead of sauntering off to get vehicles offsite?  And with not one but 2 wedding parties plus an entertainer and his entrourage as guests, how about adding a few extra staff to the night?)  At check-out, valets simply refused call-down service - instead requiring all guests to queue at the valet desk while cars were very slowly brought up.Attention seemed to focus on inbound guests and luggage assistance than with expediting retreival of vehicles.  For $21 a day, a guest needn't wait over 20 minutes for a car to be retrieved.  Not even at a large convention hotel in LA do you wait this long.Should I stay again, I'll go with the much cheaper self-park option.My poor valet experiences were not isolated - Over 3 days I retrieved my car 9 times - and each retreival was met with similar delays.The Lofts has the potential to provide a very attentive, 4-star experience.  They just need to tighten up the service aspects a bit.My husband and I stayed here for our wedding night. We chose the Lofts because our wedding guests could stay in a block of rooms at the Crowne Plaza. It was so convenient to have our people close by for a night on the town with our friends but far enough away we could enjoy our wedding night! The rooms are beautiful. Our room had exposed brick, a view of the city and a HUGE soaking tub as well as a living room in addition to the bedroom. Aveda products, plush towels, and fluffy robes were the icing on the cake.My only complaint was our neighbors left their room service outside their door to be picked up and it was left in the hall during our entire stay- 6 pm to noon the next day. Pretty gross no matter where you're staying, but especially in the environment the Lofts seems like it is trying to create. Oh, and don't even think of putting your room key next to your cell phone when you put yourself together to go out. You will deactivate your room key :(All that aside though, this was a really great hotel. I've done a bit of traveling and I was impressed with our choice. We even plan to stay here to celebrate our anniversary. It's a wonderful place to stay even when you're not leaving town!I was initially excited to stay at this place because I love boutique hotels and had read about this place. Unfortunately, whoever wrote that article probably didn't stay here. What they have is halfway to boutique - if you count exposed brick, loft-style rooms, etc. But unfortunately whoever did their interior decoration made off with 80% of the money or just had very little discernment when it comes to quality. The robes, bedding, towels, etc. were really substandard. Anyone with a bit of taste should be able to pick this up. I prefer not to wear cardboard after my shower. The bed was so uncomfortable (again, did they pick this up at a yard sale?) and the HVAC system so loud and so ineffective, that I can say, of the 45 or so odd nights I've had on the road this year so far and it's only April, I definitely got the WORST sleep here. Oh, and thank you for the wakeup call both days at 6:30 AM that I didn't order. After the first day of staying here, I told them that I got a wakeup call at 6:30 and to please take it off. I was hitting 3 cities in four days and was exhausted. But no, thank you for waking up again the next day. This made their neutral, nonexistant service go to terrible in my mind.Honestly, anyone here on business should avoid this place because you're just going to end up tired at all your meetings. This is my first 1 star on yelp and I wish I could give zero. Next time, it's back to the Hilton by the airport - at least there I was comfortable.The Lofts hotel is located inside a building that used to hold the old waterworks. I'm not really sure what the waterworks was, but my Grandpa was really impressed with the conversion.The Lofts is in prime time downtown. On the corner of Nationwide and High its less snooty than the Crowne Plaza, not cookie cutter like the Hyatt, and classier than the Red Roof Inn. Its unique and hip. The lobby is tiny but decorated in art deco and staffed by a person who is cheerful and not too enthusiastic.The rooms are marked by the mile high ceilings and artsy decor. Each room has its own theme. Staying in the econo version I was impressed by the Aveda products for the bathroom, and the million thread count towels. The Lofts also offers free ( for the night) terry cloth bathrobes. The bed is impressive with so many pillows and covers you could get lost inside of them. There are a few downsides to the Lofts. The walls are paper thin. We heard the neighbors coming home from their night out and celebrating. Our other neighbors were caught enjoying the hotel's room service porn. (I hope) You can hear the elevators opening and closing seemingly all night long. The hotel itself is also very small. Realizing we had forgot toothbrushes forced us t go next door to the Crowne's concierge.These little flaws were minor and overshadowed by the staff's service. Finding out we were newly engaged the hotel bought our breakfast and champagne. They even provided us with a free cab the next day to take us a few minutes down the street to our home. Bring earplugs, but be prepared to have a really nice hotel to stumble home to after a night out downtown. Just don't forget your toothbrush.This place is great.  Nicely laid out - the rooms are all unique - and they have free WiFi and wired internet access.  It's close to the Convention Center and you get free breakfast at the Max and Ermas downstairs.  My place to stay for the Arnold Classic every year...

review_content: I stayed there for more than 6 weeks between 2014 and 2015 and would stay here again if I get a chance. Excellent service, they remembered me by my name. High points include:- About 20 items in the lavish complimentary breakfast. - Provided me with laundry supplies (free). shaving Kit (free)- Really quick and friendly valet service - Free light dinner served 2-3 days a week- Every room is a suite and has a FULL kitchen- Great location, right in the middle of downtown- Friendliest staffBeat that?I love the historical aspect of this hotel. It use to be a bank and was converted in 2008 into a hotel. There are pieces of the bank history all over the downstairs lobby area. The breakfast here was good and I like many others liked that you had to go threw the vault door to reach it. Our room was nice even though when you pulled out the sofa bed you could barley get back threw to the kitchen or the bedroom. What really bring the rating down for me is the bed. The point of a hotel is to sleep... Well I spent most of the 2 nights I stayed here tossing and turning trying to get comfortable on a bed that was anything but comfortable. It was squeaky and hard and just felt like an old rickety bed. It would have been a much nicer weekend had the bed not been stif as a board.We stayed here for three nights as part of Cosmos Tours. The hotel is going through a refurb in the lobby although they limit their working hours so that there is no work going on at night. Our room was very spacious, clean and equipped with towels, iron, coffee machine, toiletries etc. Actually the coffee machine was really good! We were on the 5th floor over looking the freeway. It wasn't too noisy and I actually quite liked looking at all the traffic at night time.Make sure you don't park on the street overnight.  Your car will get towed. And the staff will fail to warn you of this, even though they watched you park.  Thanks, staff!  Next time, we will fork out the extra money we spent on getting our car back on a nicer hotel.What an awesome hotel in Downtown Columbus!  We got so lucky to land this place using Priceline!  Located right in the heart of Downtown, we were so close to everything to walk to!  The hotel has $20 Valet parking with in-and-out privileges, a big plus.  Rather than do the hassle of paying for the different lots and meters, we just did that.  It seemed pretty reasonable, and it was one less thing to worry about.The staff was extremely friendly, and the hotel, being inside an old bank, was STUNNING.  The lobby and first floor had all the old charm of the old bank, with high ceilings, old signs, and other little things here and there including the vault door which I loved.  We ended up getting a studio suite for our room, with a full kitchen including a dishwasher.  We didn't need that much space, but no complaints here!  The room itself was modern and very nice.There was free Wifi, complimentary breakfast, all that good stuff.  This was seriously a great 3 star hotel in Columbus.  It is very well managed and well maintained!Had a wonderful stay at this cool old bank turned hotel. The desk staff were very helpful -- we asked about stuff going on around town and when we came back to our room a few hours later we found a note and print outs of their favorite restaurants and events. Comfortable room and bed. Breakfast was free and offered much more than the average continental hotel breakfast. Conveniently located for us. We were able to walk to COSI and out to dinner. We had a car to explore some of the sights that were a bit further away.  Would definitely stay again when in Columbus!The room is pretty amazing. But the walls are thin. And the house keeping is loud. Tried to sleep to the sound of vacuuming.Okay, this hotel is hands-down the coolest hotel I've been in years.So I'll start off with the obvious, that I love the decore, ambience and style of this hotel. The building has been repurposed from its original use of a bank to A very unique hotel. This tickles a little part of my heart for businesses that repurpose old buildings instead of tearing them down and building new ones. From what I was told the city put them on a slightly restrictive leash regarding what they can do with these spaces for a three-year period. So when you come through the main entrance and come into the lobby the room opens up into this grand hall and the further back you go the cooler the place is. They use lighting that really shows the beauty of the original architecture.They have brilliantly used old parts of the bank for instance the bank vault door is the entry way to the food area for breakfast. The place is kept immaculately clean, and when there are periods of slow traffic there is someone always cleaning or making sure everything looks perfect. My experience with the staff here was absolutely amazing.
