There was no big event that sold me just the consistency between all the employees, their concern that I was happy in all areas of my stay, A smile on everyone's face and thank you, my pleasure at the end of every conversation. I was only staying for a night so I chose the smallest room available. It was actually about the size of my first apartment. The room smelled clean, all the appliances were very clean, no dust no stains....Breakfast on the other hand was fine but just like every other hotel eggs sausage biscuits waffles the usual. Which is fine because that's what all of the residents inn's serve.The exercise room was smaller than most but still had two treadmills and elliptical trainer and a seeded bike. They did however have a great lounge area. a TV to watch movies on, a large couch and a full bar with a great bartender.The only downside I found with the hotel was parking. The only reason why I did not take away from the rating was because all of the hotels downtown have the same problem. You either have to find a parking garage or park somewhere nearby yourself or pay for valet parking. The valet parking here was $20 but your car is being stored under ground in a private secure a lot. What sold me on making this not a negative was that the valet team here gave you the ability to send a text message or scan in a QR code or call the front desk at any time you wanted your car and if it was through text they'll even update you when your car is ready or is it about to be ready, Technology baby!!Overall of all of the Residence Inn hotel chains, courtyards or any other Marriott chain that I've stayed in this one is the best!#Marriott #Hotels #ResidenceInnThis Residence Inn has set the standard for all other Residence Inns that I'll likely ever stay at. So, I guess, sorry to all other Residence Inns. I was a bit in shambles when walked up to this stunning building to check in. I just stepped off a flight and basically wanted to crawl into a hole because I felt so sick. Sinus infection + turbulent flight = horror. The very nice staff member behind the desk, Ashley, was sweet enough to get me into a room right away (at 10am) and even walked up a print out of two local family practices within walking distance. As for the room, I actually checked into a handicap accessible room, which may or may not be larger than the typical guest room. Regardless, I was impressed by the large sitting area, generous kitchenette, desk, comfy bed and large bathroom/vanity. The comfy bed and flatscreen LG were a welcome respite at the end of the day when I still felt like death warmed up. A couple of other notes to keep in mind...1) The location is fantastic. Right on Gay street with great access to plenty of restaurants and coffee shops. 2) I wasn't well enough to check out the workout area, but it is open 24 hours. 3) Typical buffet breakfast is served off the lobby each morning, so that's always a plus. 4) My room had a pass through door to an adjacent room, which was surely locked on the other side (just like mine). The gentleman next door must have been under the weather as well, as I heard the poor guy coughing about every 10 minutes. Clear as day. When I find myself in Cbus again, the Residence Inn is high on my list!Great hotel with great staff and a good honest breakfast! Built in an old bank that is really cool!Little to do and hotel is old and dated. Rooms are noisy and staff is not helpful. Grandview heights or short north areas are much nicer!Quite pleased with the service of the hotel staff. The hotel is in a great location of downtown Columbus. And if you plan to visit COSI the hotel is less than a mile away. The east view from the 12th floor gives you a nice picture of the tall buildings in the city. My family and I will definitely be staying here the next time we are in the Columbus area. Also, if you have children the history behind the hotel is neat. Each morning breakfast is served from within the old bank fault. The kids will love it. Vaulted ceilings and portions of the old bank still present give visitors a sense of the good ole days in Columbus!Excellent location and the rooms were very spacious.  The kitchen was well stocked, and even the breakfast was great.The 5th floor was great.  I wish the view of the city was better.Walking distance to a Starbucks, and across the street is a nail place and restaurants.  The only reason for the 4 stars was the "Happy Hour" was a little misleading. I thought we'd get free muchies, like trail mix, pretzels, or something to go with our drinks.  Many hotels offer free soft drinks, but I had to pay for my pepsi, and it was a "used" opened bottle (so it was flat).Valet is $20 per day, and some people posted their cars got broken into.  Mine didn't but it still made me worried.Resident Inn was class all the way. This hotel is actually built in an old bank, and it keeps the giant splendor of it. Monstrously high ceilings, gold leaf everywhere, the iron bars still on the window (in a really nice old-school way). It's an impressive sight from the first moment in.Even the elevators have old school buttons. That's so cool.You do get this classic feeling in the lobby, which is why I was semi-disappointed when I got up to the hallway and that all disappeared. It looked like your normal hotel hallway and then my room was a normal hotel room. I wish they could have kept up with the 1940 bank theme throughout, but I'm sure this was cheaper and easier. Ah well.My room was nice though. I actually had to walk up two stairs to get to the door (making it feel like more of a home than just a room) and inside was spacious and classy. Bed was comfortable, view was nice. All around solid.Parking here is an issue. There's valet for $20 a day or you can park down the lost for $9 for 12 hours (so if you're staying for a full day and have nowhere to drive to, I'd suggest the valet). Complimentary breakfast is served in the morning and there's even a little mart in the hotel if you need to buy anything. Rooms are about $150 a night and worth it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.As a couple of the other reviewers already stated, I've never quite seen such a unique Residence Inn location anywhere in the U.S. The old bank location which now houses this beautiful and modern hotel was a SUPERB idea and made me think a little better of Marriott these days because they saved such an historic building.The rooms were amazing! I opted for a one bedroom suite. I couldn't believe how clean it was and I didn't find one thing out of order. I'm a world traveler so hotels are very important to me because I tend to get use out of the accommodations. This location really satisfied me and I'll definitely be staying here again when we return to Columbus.The layout of the rooms, kitchen amenities, linens, bedding, towels, etc. all above average and usable. One evening my coffee pot stopped working and someone immediately brought me a new one out of the box. Another evening I didn't have a corkscrew for some wine (I was told there was one in the kitchen drawer). Immediately someone came up with a new one. Awesome service! Wifi is free in the rooms and unlike many hotels, the wireless connection was powerful and quick. I worked in the room several of the days during my stay and downloaded everything I needed without a problem.The breakfast buffet in the morning was one of the best buffets I've seen. The food actually tasted great! And they served some really delicious biscuits and gravy that I never get! It was a real treat!In summary, this is definitely my Columbus hotel location for future trips. The value, space, modern amenities, breakfast, service, all add up to a very, very nice stay in a superb location in downtown!Great hotel.  Great staff.  Awesome ambiance in this historic property.  Would return in a heartbeat.Nice hotel for a business stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was really really really quiet when I stayed, almost like a ghost town.  Valet was super convenient.  Wish they had a restaurant and room service.  Would stay again.Beautiful historic hotel in an old bank building. Rooms nicely appointed with kitchenette/living room and separate bedroom/bath room. Hot breakfast- nicer than most hotels (cereal, oatmeal, waffles, eggs, meat, etc) was served from the old bank vault. We stayed for our anniversary and used Marriott points, so not sure on the value for money. We loved the old style and found it a lovely hotel. Would and will plan to stay again!5 stars is hard to come by for me. I love Marriott and whenever i travel i try my hardest to stay at one, so when I went to Columbus Oh for a convention I was thrilled to know I had my choice of three different brands of Marriott. I picked this one even though the other was closer and didnt even have a restaurant or pool (which are key for me). The decor of this hotel was something I needed to see and I deff wasnt disappointed. I was surprised by the fully stocked kitchen and loved how the place was set up; it felt really homey. Being 8hrs from home, feeling at ease made things so much better and I was able to enjoy my week stay that much more. We had a few mishaps but like Marriott always does, our problems were solved with ease. Location was key for us and I loved my stay so much I made another special trip to Columbus just to re visit the area. My husband and I fell in love with the city, and I sit here now writing this review to say Ive now moved here to Columbus and part of the reason was the homey-nes I felt from the very first stay I had with Marriott Residence a year ago.The rooms are wonderful and so are the staff. The breakfast is a decent breakfast as far as complimentary hotel breakfasts go. This is a nice hotel if you are looking for a little bit more room but not trying to pay too much for that extra space. The kitchenette and closed off bedroom are a bonus. The location is close to downtown and a short walk from the convention center and Short North. Loved it !
review_content_20: As a true business traveler, it's pretty rare for me to rate a hotel 5 stars, but I truly enjoyed my stay here while in town for the weekend.We chose this place because we were traveling with our two dogs, and Residence Inn accepts pets with a non-refundable fee.  The building is gorgeous inside and completely unlike any other Residence Inn I've ever seen.  The room was a little on the small side (queen bed, no king), but still comfortable.  New bathrooms, new kitchen, tasteful granite, nice cabinets.  The breakfast is pretty good (yogurt parfaits were my favorite!), and the internet is free.  It's a good location to explore most of Columbus.Just about the only thing I can complain about is the expensive valet-only parking.  You can park in the garage next door, but if you stay over on a Sunday, try for a meter out front and park for free!This is, by far, one of the best Marriott properties I've ever stayed in.  As other folks have mentioned, the breakfast is great, the old building is beautiful, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the staff is delightful.PROTIP:  Parking behind the hotel!  Take the immediate right turn after the hotel (if you're on Gay St) go through the little alley, and turn on your next major one way.  The garage you'll park in is on the right.  It's $10 overnight, but since there is no attendant, it's only $5 if you leave first thing in the morning.  PROTIP PROTIP:  Be cautious of street cleaning.  The hotel side of the street is cleaned Monday Morning (if you're parking overnight on Sunday) from Midnight to 6am and the side opposite is done on Tuesday Morning (if you're parking overnight Monday) from Midnight to 6am. Failure to move your car will get you a $25 ticket.  Also! Parking is now metered until after 10pm.  It should be criminal!PROTIP PROTIP PROTIP:  Pay your ticket.PROTIP:  There's "Cafe Brioso" next door -- they make some of the best effing coffee I've ever had.  Seriously.  It should be criminal to stay at this hotel and not go for coffee next door.This is a great place to stay if you are going to be here for a little while. Clean rooms, great kitchen space and supplies. My only issue is that there is not a lot of late night eats in the area. Other than that., this is a great place for the business traveler.This is one of the coolest hotels I've ever stayed in.  Anywhere. The building used to be the Buckeye State Building and Loan, and they converted it into a hotel!   I love staying at hotels that have been converted from a previous use(an old river paddle boat and a grain silo being the most notable).  I mean, who wants to stay at a boring cookie cutter hotel that is the same exact layout in every other city? Lame!   Pushing my way through the revolving door I had no idea the cavernous lobby space that awaited me... I could only stare in awe, mouth agape at the beautiful mason-work of the massive ceiling and walls, every detail borne out with the flood of natural light from huge windows.   To the back of this giant lobby is a sort of loft area holding the hotel bar and lounge(happy hour during the weekdays!), the workout room, and a meeting room which they will furnish with food and beverage at your request.   The kitchen is on the main level in the freaking vault! And yes the vault door is still there(that thing is seriously beefy). Complimentary breakfast everyday consisting of eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, biscuit/tortilla/croissant, cold and hot cereals, make your own waffle station, make your own yogurt parfait station, bagel, toast, english muffin, fresh fruit, coffee, and juice. Plus they have complimentary dinner nights a couple times a week with such themes chili dog or fiesta(tacos, nachos, etc.).  Basically they give you the hookup on food...  While the building itself may be old school, all the amenities are definitely modern and definitely chic. The decor of the rooms are as nice as any Vegas hotel, plus you've got a full kitchen with range-top, dishwasher, sink, fridge, etc.! Plus every room has a flat panel HDtv and HBO.   Bottom Line: Great experience in a an awesome old building! Aside from two separate run-ins with a rude kitchen staff member, my stay could not have been any better. I can't think of any reason to stay elsewhere in Columbus!OK so I've stayed here the last two times I've been in Columbus OH and it's a really solid spot.  The staff is super friendly and helpful and the breakfast is awesome since they change it up just enough each morning.The building is pretty beautiful as well, especially the main lobby interior although the only thing that was a little funky was that our room had a vague hint of armpit smell.  Not sure what that was about but it was just faint enough not to be bothersome and we kept forgetting to ask them about it.  Obviously it wasn't enough to make that much of an impact on us as we'll definitely be coming back!Decent place not 5 star but practical and adequate for a business traveler who needs a kitchen for three or more days. Good points: full sized fridge microwave dishwasher and pots pans etc. lots if surface area to spread out your papers: desk sofa coffee table dining table ottoman etc. cramped but I am here for work so these are all useful as work space.  Bad points are crummy scratchy old towels and so so bedding but like I said it is not supposed to be 5 star. Ditto others who have praised staff for friendliness and genuine warmth and competence.  Especially Paul i think his name was. Parking mandatory valet at $20 a day seems pricey but all the downtown hotels charge this and while there are cheaper lots nearby they do not allow repeat entry during the day and the area is creepy to walk at night so i believe it is a good value. Gay Street is the most walkable street in all of downtown by far. There are coffee and tea shops three great restaurants. Other parts of downtown are run down deserted and scary even in the day.The good:  The staff are super nice and the rooms are great (flat panel tv; couch; free wifi; kitchen; frig).The so-so:  Breakfast is free, but kinda gross; There is a gym, but it is too small to really use (fortunately you can go across the street to metro fitness, which is another story); The bad:  There is no hotel kitchen, so room service comes from the way overpriced Due Amici from across the street and there is few delivery options otherwise; the hallways typically have a strange odor; no pool; and the bar is always empty.Great hotel with a central downtown location. I was skeptical when the host hotel was sold out for a convention and I typically stay at Marriott's but this is a very cool re-do of a older Columbus property. Staff was more then courteous to solve a problem with a gym associated with the property and room was very large and clean. $20 valet fee not fun but typical for downtown property. Would stay here again no problem.The hotel is in a beautiful building, and the rooms are spacious, having the exact same decoration as every other Residence Inn.  I stayed on the 15th floor, and my only complaint was that there was a constant banging noise and rumbling feeling either from the ventilation system or the elevator shaft.  When I checked out, I mentioned this to the staff at the desk, who (disingenuously) acted surprised.I'm staying in this hotel again in two weeks, and I hope they've fixed the problem.I stayed at this hotel for work-related business.  Supposedly, the hotel opened 9 weeks ago after being vacant for 10 years..bc it's haunted (maybe).  Who knows?  Anyway, the building is beautiful!  The inside of the building is very detailed and the builders did a great job transforming the bank into a hotel.  They even left little detail like the original elevator buttons and the vault.  They serve free breakfast in the morning and it's actually inside the old vault.  The hotel staff are super friendly and respectful.  The rooms were perfect...not sure if this is bc it's a new hotel, but I honestly found nothing wrong.  You have a frig, dishwasher, kitchen, living room area, separate bedroom area, nice vanity area, and decent bathroom space.  In the rooms, they left the old bank windows, as well.  After work, I usually try to find things to do in new surroundings, but hey...I was in OH and just came back from NYC...there really was nothing to do or go see.  Thanks to my hotel...I had an enjoyable time relaxing!The staff is really good. Everyone is very helpful and friendly and offer excellent service. The rooms are awesome and spacious with a flatscreen TV and free WiFi! They also have free breakfast with a variety of food. There is no restaurant inside the hotel though and there are hardly any people in the bar. The fitness center is pretty small but you could work out at the gym nearby. No pool.

review_content: I haven't really encountered any staff, but I am very pleased with the cleanliness I /did/ encounter. I also appreciate all of the accommodations in the room such as the microwave and mini fridge. And I was pleased to find a bible in the night stand drawer.First thing I'd like to say is. Our room was clean. Now for the rest of the hotel. From the minute we walked to our room we smelled a very strong marijuana smell and the hallways stayed that way during the two night stay. The bar area was dirty and we waited a very long time to make an order. After ordering our drinks we were ignored and didn't receive a drink until we saw another employee who had no idea how to pour a vodka and cranberry on the rocks. There were also people yelling in the hallway most of the time. It seemed more like a crack house then a hotel.This was literally the worst hotel I have ever stayed in period. For starters the where roaches so we told the manager who said he would move out check out to 1pm and switch our rooms (we did not want to unless we saw another one) which we where grateful for. Later that night my friend put some towels on the towel rack (4 to be exact) and the towel rack fell off the wall I wish this was the last problem but sadly I was not that lucky. The room service worker could not speak English (I don't have a problem with this) she then kept trying to get into the room (which she did) and we kept saying not to then she tried to force her way into the bathroom while my friend was in the shower and you can hear it running when you are in the room. The next morning when we woke up the room was so hot and we couldn't figure out why so we go look at the heater and when we got close we found out why. It was freezing by the heater because it was literally falling out of the wall so it would turn on every 30 seconds. So we stay one more night and began packing at 11Am at 1:10 pm we get a call saying they called the police because our check out was noon. They never called at noon informing us about this and we told the woman that the manager gave us till 1Pm she wouldn't listen to us. My advice don't stay here you will surely regret that decision.NO FREE BREAKFAST !!Only reason I go to best western is for their free food not to mention you have to pay 6 bucks for the same food you get anywhere else.The food at the bar was Chinese which sucked I paid 13 bucks for a plate that didn't even get me full my drinks where over price the rooms need more of a facelift the Bruce Jenner.All in all this best western sucks and I only stay at best westernsThis was a minimally serviceable hotel at a very low rate, with a reasonably good location.  I really don't need to elaborate much more than that, but I will add a few more details. Its close to 71 off 161 so there is good access to most of northern columbus from this location.  Its not an awful part of town, but its not the best either.  The staff was ok, pretty unmemorable.  I had to get two rooms for my group - my room was clean and generally fine, but the other room smelled like an old man rubbed his face all over everything.  The price was very, very low.  So the value was pretty good all things considered.  If you need a cheap room and good access to the highway, this will do.Our stay was a horror show. The inmates were running the asylum. We saw hookers in lobby while checking in. I was afraid to go anywhere near the bed for fear of bed bugs. The mattress had a huge crater as if a truck or bus parked on it. I could go on, but what's the point?I was so afraid our car wouldn't be there when we woke up...be afraid, be very afraid!Don't waste your time staying at this hotel. The staff is extremely rude and not helpful. I felt they were doin everything in their power to make our stay miserable. The hotel smells like old dirty mops and cigarette buds. I book a room for Friday thru Tuesday. When I get there Friday my room was book for someone else and I had to wait several hours to get a room! I would have been better off sleeping in my car! Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!!!You get what you pay for... I found a good deal from Priceline but didn't know all Best Western's are not the same.- No breakfast- Rude Staff- Someone on the top floor making noise late night- Another room had loud music - creepy people- Late checkout should have given me 30 minutes but the key stopped working at 12. The front desk warned me that I will be charged extra even if I stay a minute over 30 minutes after 12.- Ok, for a one-nighter but I would not recommend long term stay here.Going to start throwing clothes in the garbage if people can't respect that other people need the washer and dryerNot very good.  Hallways had offensive skunk smell.  Bathroom not very clean and out of date.  Bedding was clean and television was nice.  No free breakfast.  Was cheap and on sale with priceline.  Wouldn't go back.The positives: clean room, modestly appointed, decent for the price. Quick check in and friendly staff. The negatives: Although the rooms on the floor were all non smoking the hallways smelled heavily of smoke. The layout was industrial feeling and the doors had an unnerving " break ins are all too frequent " feel to them. Window pane was broken and window was wide open on entering room.Bed bugs and fleas. Awful hotel. Never again.My wife got the room and I didn't realize she booked it here. The place is not a 5 star hotel to begin with, so my expectations were that of a 3 star hotel. The neighborhood the hotel was in didn't look bad to me, the fence that separated the hood from the hotel looked adequate. My car wasn't broken into here, but parking was at a premium because some "jack wagons" were parking their car and taking up 4 spaces in the process. The tree clearing business that was apparently staying there did the same thing, so about 30 spots were occupied by 6 vehicles. Nice people. The rooms were a good size. The bathroom was small, but I wasn't thinking I was going to be throwing a party in there. The door to get in and out DOES slam often, announcing your arrival every time. Also, every time I left the room, the hallway wreaked of cigarette smoke, but all the rooms were clearly marked NO SMOKING. I'm not sure what was going on there. I think the biggest complaint is that there is free continental breakfast advertised and it is also in the rooms guest book stating a free continental breakfast. It's not free, it's associated with the adjoining Spain restaurant and it's discounted for hotel guest. That's not free. My wife did not like the beds. More specifically, the plastic sheets, which are presumably to combat both bed bugs and bed wetters. The business center was small, but I was able to use it when I needed to after hours without issue. The room was cleaned daily otherwise. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I think next time I'll opt for another location. However, I can see some of the other Yelpers points. It was very convenient to the highway, restaurants, and even a bowling alley.I'm reviewing just the fitness center. I'm a local and I go here in the winter months to run on thier indoor track.  The fitness center is a 10 ft walk out the front door from the hotel and is free for hotel guests.  I get just a 3 month membership since I'm a runner and this is one of few fitness centers that have a track and don't require a long term contract.  The place is ok, looks a little worn, but everything seems to be functional. The place is frequented by a bunch of local boxers so you have to dodge people lifting weights while on the track or kids who sneak up from the pool below.  But it beats running on icy streets.After running I hit the pool. Its a nice 25 meter pool with about 6 lanes. In the winter many evenings it is rented by a local youth swim team so everyone else is crowded into one lane. This is  a pain if you want to swim laps.  The steam room works well and their is a hot tub and its ok, but I have my own so I don't use this one. All if all its worth the $75 I pay for 3 months.   Again, free for hotel guests.From the pics I saw on line of the place, I thought it would be cleaner than what it was. When I pulled up, w/ my daughter and niece, there were men hanging out in the parking lot. The lobby was dirty, there were people hanging out on the stairs, barefoot kids running around like it was a playground. The only good thing was a clean room. The bed was hard and uncomfortable, hallways were like a maze. Thank God we didnt have bed bugs, because from looking at the lobby, you would think there would be.This place is VERY dirty.  Nasty.  Breakfast stops at 9:00 am.  Crap joint.  Should be kicked out of best western franchise.DON'T. DON'T.DON'T.In case my comments above MIGHT not be clear DON'T stay there. Rooms are OK, but our car (despite being parked under their security cameras) was broken into. Everything was gone through and stuff was stolen. It was reported to the hotel staff and they could not have cared less. NEVER heard a word from them as follow up. As if that wasn't bad enough the Cop that showed up to fill in the "report" told us he could handle three breakins a shift every day from strip of hotels near the Best Western. So:A/ It' not safe.B/ The staff couldn't give a shit.Stay at your peril. Be prepared for a door glass repair bill to be added to your invoice when you check out and you won't be too surprised or disappointed.The images of the Olympic sized pool online had me assume the rooms would be equally as awesome. Not so. My first floor double non-smoking room smelled strongly that the last tenant (or housekeeping) was smoking in the room. The bathroom was small, but clean and only 1 person could operate effectively. I was also a bit concerned with the rough neighborhood the hotel was located in. The only employee we saw there was the front desk guy who while effective, was visibly hating his job. On the good side, the Pizza Hut next door was excellent and the pool/sauna met my expectations although the hot-tub was on the fritz when we were there. Overall, the stay was decent for the rate we paid.The beds and bed linens are perfect and clean. No bad smells. No dust. No elevator and we were on the second floor--not cool. The hallway is on two different levels so more up and down with my suit case. There is a large lap pool. The breakfast is $5 and it is a full breakfast. So what makes this stay a 4 star? The price and the quality beds, the 40in plasma tv, ironing board and iron, hair blower, microwave, large fridge all for $59, that 's how. I've heard that Best Westerns were quality. This one was. On your way south from the windy city and are gonna be in Columbus around check-in time, check into this Best Western but get a room on the first floor.Was in town for a wedding and meant to book Port Columbus and got this hotel instead. The was definitely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. There were drug dealers, hookers and homeless people hanging around; empty condom boxes outside and a dog pooped in the hall and it was not cleaned until at least 24 hours later and only after we called to complain. The electricity went out Friday morning, I was woken up to the microwave beeping and I could not move the entertainment center to unplug it. I called the lobby and they said they would send someone up to unplug it but never did. There were gnats in the room and even though I kept killing them, they somehow continued to reappear...I would not stay here for free!
review_content_20: Two-story hotel in suburban Columbus, probably a 15 minute drive from downtown. Bed was sagging a lot, but surprisingly did not cause me any backaches. Free continental breakfast was not very good, the only hot food was weak scrambled eggs, little fresh fruit, no yogurt. Some parts of the hallways smelled very strongly of smoke and my room also smelled mildly of smoke and cleaning fluids. The hotel does have some smoking rooms but it was impossible to breathe in some hallways. No DVD player for the TV. The ground floor room I had was convenient because the sliding glass door opened in front of my parking space. The hotel and neighborhood seemed safe. A previous reviewer mentioned homeless people but I did not encounter any during my stay in June 2009. There are no sidewalks in the area so there is almost no pedestrian traffic. On weekend nights the restaurant turns into a very loud dance club so you might want to ask for rooms away from the restaurant. One of the side entrance doors did not latch and was constantly open throughout my stay. The room was clean and the hotel was relatively cute and quiet. I believe they also allow pets in some rooms. There is a large grassy field behind the hotel which is a good place to take your pet for a stroll if it is of the strolling variety. There is an indoor pool big enough to do laps in and an outdoor pool which is smaller. Free wireless internet was spotty at times but generally decent.Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were thin but not sagging. Free wi-fi with a strong in-room signal. Good value (quality for the price). Uncool: 1) homeless asking for money in the middle of the night; 2) Receptionist with no sense of direction for those who get lost on Dublin versus Dublin-Granville Rd; and 3) The entry/exit door that slams each time someone comes or goes from the back of the hotel.I seriously LOVED it here.  First off all, I have stayed in MANY hotels in the area and this is the best, for sure.  I got a non-smoking room, and my room didn't smell at all-although some of the hallways did.  My room had a mini fridge and a microwave in it so that was a plus also.  For the neighborhood it is in it is very quiet. The outdoor pool is small but the indoor pool is HUGE and I loved that they had diving blocks! (: When I got in my room it was very clean, something I've had issues with in other hotels. It also looked really, really nice.  I got this hotel for 30 DOLLARS on priceline and I was AMAZED at how awesome it was.  My only complaint was that some of the surrounding rooms were NOISY, but, I could only hear them from the hallway.  In my room it was quiet, peaceful, and clean, like a hotel room should be! Next time I am in this area I will definitely stay here again, and I would definitely advise you to stay here, if you are staying in this part of columbus, or any part really, BEST VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY. oh also, that bed was more comfortable than the one at my home, seriously, favorite part!!

review_content: I had an absolutely excellent stay at the Hampton Inn and Suites in Downtown Columbus! The staff was an absolute pleasure to deal with. They each greeted me with a smile and continuously offered any help they could. They even gave me a complimentary razor and shaving cream, since I had forgotten mine. The location of the hotel is second to none. You are placed right in the heart of downtown within walking distance of several bars and restaurants, as well as the Columbus Convention Center! The hotel also provides valet parking, at a small cost. When you wish to leave, you can call down and have your car waiting at the curb for you. Then there is the room. FABULOUS!! Flat screen tv, great wifi signal, beautiful view of Columbus, great stand up shower, and one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on in the country! I am not sure when the Hampton Inn and Suites was renovated last but everything in my room still appeared to be brand new. The housekeeping staff provided additional towels upon request. There was a convenient vending area right outside of my room. If you want more snacks or supplies there is even a great little sundries shop right next to the front desk! I really enjoyed my stay and the Hampton Inn and Suites in Downtown Columbus and cannot wait to return!As others have mentioned, the rooms are exceptionally well kept, the breakfast doesn't disappoint, and the location couldn't be better. However, for this review, I have to give major kudos to the staff for really looking out for me, the customer. After a grueling three-day business trip, I left this Hampton Inn for what was destined to be a nearly 9-hour wait for my departing flight (long story...). While waiting in Port Columbus Airport purgatory, I received an email from Roxane (one of the front-desk staff) notifying me that Housekeeping found my house and car keys while cleaning out my former room. Needless to say, I panicked a little. However, she managed to connect me with a taxi service that they would reimburse directly to take me to the hotel and back so I could claim my keys before I left town. All I have to say is that I could not have been more fortunate in finding a hotel staff that went above and beyond the call of duty to help an absentminded soul like me.If I'm ever in Columbus again, this would be my number one pick as a place to stay. Thanks for being awesome, Hampton Inn!!Overall, my stay at the Hampton Inn was very good. The rooms were very clean, fitness center was nice, and continental breakfast was good. Only bad thing about the Hampton Inn was there are no microwaves and Refrigerators in the rooms. The impeccable staff is what stood out the most. From the moment my colleagues and I walked through the doors we were very much impressed with Troy's hospitality and promptness at the front desk. He really want above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. This was our first time in Columbus so we weren't familiar with the area. He recommended a place nearby for us to shop and eat. In addition he arranged the shuttle for us to get picked up and dropped off. As flight attendants, we stay at several hotels on a regular basis and so we really appreciate the enormity of attentiveness given to us.A few blocks from the heart of Short North (Columbus's trendy restaurant/bar strip), this Hampton Inn is an amazing place to stay for business (especially if you need to be downtown or at the convention center). The property is impeccably well kept, the staff is tremendous, the rooms are super clean and everything works, gym is great, breakfast is pretty good. The have coffee and tea available at all hours. They have free printing in their business center. The strength of their wifi could use improvement. I had some issues with it during my stay. Will definitely stay here when work brings me back to Columbus.I'm not sure where to start on this place, honestly. I guess I'll use the Sandwich Method here. I'm not hoity toity, fancy, or pretentious. Here's the thing though. when you're paying a pretty big chunk of change for a hotel, you should get what you pay for. It's gorgeous, clean, and the wifi was fast. Nice beds as always too. Here's the bad parts... I literally waited 5 minutes for anyone to get to my car at Valet I'm just standing around like where the hell are these people? ( 24.00 ) btw. which isn't a big deal ... Just drove 4 hours, kind of wanted to just check the fuck in and take a nap already. So, we finally get checked in, yadda yadda. Walked into a clean room, thought everything was kosher. THEN, about 20-30 minutes later, no knocks, no " house keeping, you want me to fluff pillow ?" or anything... 2 people just barge in while, well, how do I put this... You know when a man and a woman love each other and things happen. YEP. Right then. Fucking unbelievable. Seriously? It's THREE PM, I'm checked in, fucking KNOCK. Terribly embarrassing. We were LIVID. Of course, I went down and said my piece about what I thought about the situation... 6 hours later, I get a call... " We comped your room and we are SOOO so sorry " Sure. I get it. Mistakes happen. I let that go... I then check my bank statement, I get charged TWICE, instead of getting a refund. Lovely... I had just spent a shitload of money in The Short North district, and then 200 more dollars get pulled on top of the ORIGINAL 200 they charged?! 3-5 business days to get ALL of that back now. Perfect. BUT, Everyone was very nice. They tried to accommodate, yet didn't do a very good job... The coffee was very good. I'm just trying to not want to hate this place right now. I'll give them one more shot... Hopefully they can get their shit together. Cheers.Awesome hotel at an awesome location. Reasonably priced for downtown Columbus, and if you're in town for a convention at the convention center, this Hampton Inn is it. It's located right across the street from the convention center, literally takes less than 2 minutes to get there, extremely convenient. It's also right next to the North Market, lots of eatery options. This Hampton is also bigger than others. Nice big lobby, and the entire hotel is very new, clean and modern. There's freshly brewed coffee all day and complimentary breakfast in the morning. The front desk and the staff were very friendly. There's a presidential suite on every floor, and they were so nice they even bumped me to the presidential suite (definitely coming back and staying here next time I'm in town lol). Valet parking or you can self-park at the garage across from the North Market.We stayed back in January for a convention, and while it was not connected to the convention center it was just a quick walk across the street. The room was nice and well cleaned, but the walls were absolutely paper thin. If people are outside your door, be prepared to hear them as if they were in the room themselves. Staff was very nice, especially someone named Jeremy, I think. The poor girl at the check in desk still got us a room last minute after a problem with our last hotel, even though the lobby was filled with people trying to get a room. She was a doll. We did have a little problem with the GM after my fiance mistakenly thought the items in their suite shop were complementary. He didn't see any prices and noticed that there wasn't a cash register like any traditional shop would have had, only an unmanned window to the check in desk. He said it was an odd and confusing layout, and I must admit he shouldn't have assumed that it was complementary but I took a look down myself and I did think it was a strange and confusing layout as well The poor guy was distraught after he was yelled at by the GM and threatened to have the cops called on him over a bag of chex mix. I felt like the situation could have been handled better as the GM was a little boorish over the incident, and I was appalled by his tone and manner. If they haven't already, as this was months ago, they need better signage down in their shoppe to alleviate any problems like my fiance had or at least mark their window with a "pay here" sign. Again, the GM was a little crude about the chex mix incident, and brutishly gave us 30 min to pack up our stuff and leave while reminding us that we weren't getting money returned for the night we wouldn't stay. I still stand by my opinion that the situation was handled very poorly, even though I understand that theft is not tolerated, but a little empathy about the confusing suite shoppe would have been nice. I do believe Jeremy gave us a refund for our un-stayed night; I think he felt bad for us.You can find a photo of their suite shoppe on their slideshow right on the homepage and judge for yourselves.hamptoninn3.hilton.com/e...Stayed here this past weekend for a Bachelorette party and we had a BLAST!!! The staff at the hotel are amazing - Clifford was literally so very kind and happy! We all absolutely loved him - the other people at the front desk were also helpful! We were a rowdy bunch & they took great care of us. I was especially impressed with their continental breakfast - it was delicious & much much better than most. So many options!Overall, we had an amazing stay here & I would highly recommend!Excellent stay. Rooms are very clean. They have onsite gym, Pool and whirlpool. Great breakfast and delicious coffee. The staff is very pleasant and everyone greets you with a smile and make you feel welcome. Will definitely return for another stay when I'm back in town.First impression - right across from the Convention Center, so that was a huge plus for us. Very convenient access.The room was nice - as Hilton Hhonors members, we were able to request a higher floor. We got the room right next to the Presidential Suite. Great pool and hottub, but no poolside towels. That was a bummer. Free breakfast is always a plus! Not quite what Embassy Suites offers, but still decent, with omelettes, sausages, and potatoes, and waffle makers, and usual pastries and bagels. Front desk service was exceptional. Christine (Kristine?) ended up taking care of a lot of things for us, and made the stay very pleasant. Oh, the complimentary toiletries were a godsend when our luggage was misplaced by Southwest Airlines. Thank you, Hampton!After driving for hours we arrived at the hotel to find out that the room we thought we had been given as a wedding gift had not actually been paid for, only reserved. The desk clerk we went to first was polite but cold, and I thought we should just go to another hotel. But the supervisor, Ms. Sura, took over at the front desk and helped us problem-solve in a kind and efficient manner. We are grateful for her help and ultimately had a comfortable stay.Me and some co-workers stayed here for the Arnold Classic at the convention center. This place was pretty nice, but it truly was the people that worked there that made it such a wonderful place to stay. Clifford is a ray of sunshine here - he is always ready and eager to help anyone with anything- whether it's putting away your luggage or getting you coffee! He is very high spirited and is a staple to this hotel running smoothly and keeping guests feeling very welcome! Another great employee here is Jeremy. He anticipates customer needs like no other and is very accommodating. Best tip about this place: There is coffee and tea in the front lobby right by the elevators for on your way in or out!The property is gorgeous - everything re-done with new high-end finishes, and just a really pleasant place to stay. The wifi is easy and fast, and my favorite thing - SOOOOOO many outlets and usb plugs in the room. Wonderfully modern and convinient. And there is a very happy man named Clifton that you should hope is working when you check in. He is hilariously enthusiastic. Only thing I'd advise is that on a weekend, the club music from nearby can get pretty loud - I don't know why the city of Columbus lets that happen.Stayed here recently for work and it was terrific. Great staff, Clifford is a one-of-a-kind character and he made everyone there feel like a guest in the truest sense of the word. Rooms are very clean and comfortable and you can't ask more for location, I was able to walk everywhere all weekend.Very nice hotel! The front desk workers were friendly, and the rooms were clean and stylish. The pillows were awesome.. And the breakfast buffet was delicious. I'd definitely come back.I never thought I would give a Hampton Inn 5 stars....For a Hampton inn this is the best you get. I got a suite, which was huge! Nice fixtures and furniture then any full service Hilton I have stayed in! Extreme clean, no smells, no stains on linen. Valet Parking only, I missed it first, Valet is located on the side of the building.Door greeter is nice and friendly, although I think unnecessary for a Hampton Inn. Location is excellent for walk-ability to any kind of restaurant/style. Personally I checked a few out and they were all too loud for me to work and have dinner. I drove 1 mile down High st and found even more restaurants!I've stay in my fair share of hotels around the world (once logging in 221 days in one year) and I have to say that I was really impressed with this Hampton Inn and Suites. First of all, this was the nicest Hampton property I have ever seen. It looks newly remodeled and done in contempory style. I could have mistaked it for the Hyatt Andaz property easily. The hotel staff was extremely friendly & helpful and the suite I was upgraded to was very spacious like I've seen at the Embassy Suites.I'll be honest, I don't get too excited when I have to visit Ohio but this really does make the difference for me when coming out to Columbus. And its proximity to some nice restaurants and bars is an added plus.I didn't not stay over the weekend or during an event but I would think it can get a little crazy outside with college bars around the corner.All in all, an unexpected nice find.The hotel was recommended by the wedding couple for its convenient location. Everything around in The arena district is walkable and easy to navigate. Rooms are very nice, recently updated with very nice bathrooms-best hotel bathroom mirrors I've ever seen. Pool and gym facility were better than I've seen, breakfast was fine. Our only issue was getting in and out of The garage during two festivals.A great hotel for the price. Reasonably priced and conveniently located to OSU, downtown, Arena district and Short North. Clean with updated, contemporary styling. Not a super fancy hotel, but definitely nice enough for me. Very good breakfast buffet that is free, and free WiFi. Was shocked when I was upgraded to a suite for free! A very happy surprise. All employees I encountered were super positive, helpful and friendly. Clifford abounds with outgoing enthusiasm and welcome.Toiletries provided were pretty basic. There were not any full length mirrors anywhere in the room. The toilets flushed extremely loudly like a jet engine.Overall I had a great stay and would definitely return.One of better Hamptons I have stayed at in awhile. Location is great - across from the Convention Center and the North Market. They are in the middle of a renovation and I did stay in one of the updated rooms so all good there. The staff was great - super helpful and friendly. They offer the standard amenties: breakfast, free wi-fi, cookies in the lobby. The only con was the valet only parking. But the valet did make it easy by letting you text a number to get your car instead of calling. Overall, great value for a downtown hotel - I would recommend to other co-workers and stay here again.
review_content_20: Came to Columbus for a job interview and they put me up here. Really good service and good location. Front desk people were nice and helpful. They gave me a bottle of water upon my arrival and the valet service was pretty snappy, even at 5 in the morning. The manager greets guests when they walk past the front desk and asks if there is anything they need, which honestly is a great thing to do and a pretty rare event in hotels these days. The Arena district is rowdy at night, but the hotel feels very safe. It's not an overly luxurious hotel, but the service and accommodations they provide are solid and good value. Best thing: Free wifi and free breakfast! Tea and coffee always available. Great hotel if you're in Columbus for a few days.Worst Hampton Inn we've ever been to, and we are frequent Hampton stayers. The staff was overwhelmed and unfriendly, valet is under staffed and very slow, and the only place that had air conditioning was our room (thank gosh). The breakfast area was so hot that it made the food disgusting, and the juice was all room temp. Save yourself $$ and stay 15 minutes away at the Polaris or Easton Hampton Inn.am a fan of of Hampton Inns in general. Hilton provides a consistent brand across the country. They are really good for families with the free breakfast. This hampton is in a great location in be short north and near the market--and close to 2 Jeni's ice cream shops! There are lots of restaurants and bars within walking distances. Like most Hampton Inns this one has a boutique-y feel. Rooms were clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I found the business center to be comfortable and the equipment in good working order. Would stay here again!Amazing stay at the Hampton! Very clean rooms, nice staff and most importantly the coffee is wonderful. Not only was this hotel really nice and enjoyable, but it was in the best location. Walking distance to everything I would need. Definitely a place I would return to as a car rental is not needed. Thank you Hampton!Take me to High Street!(After a particularly blah stay at the Westin DT, I was smarter this trip and stayed in the Short North...much better!)LOCATION: First off, you cannot beat the location of this Hampton. A stone's throw from North Market...where any food item you might need (including Jeni's Ice cream!) lives. Right on High Street...where a bevy of shops, restaurants, bars and galleries perch themselves sweetly. Many entertainment options, and right across the street from the Convention Center. Location is exceptional, and made my stay absolutely lovely. BREKKIE: Hampton's are known for their complimentary hot breakfast, and it was standard, per usual. Hot coffee, tea and other morning beverages plus some hot egg and meat items, cereal, pastries, fruit and yogurt. Quite substantial, and a nice eat-in dining room to watch the news or skim USA Today. To-go cups for coffee, nice touch. Despite the Christian Bible Pre-teen conference that overwhelmed (assaulted!) my pre-9am senses...this was still quite enjoyable. STAFF: Very friendly, though I would've appreciated one thing upon checkout. I had asked them to look up my HH number so I could earn points for my stay...and she told me to call an 800#. Um, no. How about you help me with it and we get it sorted out right here and I leave feeling like you actually care about where I spend my money and sleep my head at night, mmmmk!?ROOM: Besides the frigid, old AC that blasted 24 hours a day and gave me a sore throat...the room was A-OK. 2 nicely sized rooms (a suite!), clean bathroom, etc. The comforter was decidedly....lumpy? Yes, lumpy. Weird, like they washed it and weren't supposed to and it got all weird. (Can you tell I've done this personally? Well, I have...oops). GYM: Very adequate! About 10 cardio machines, full weights, full range of medicine balls, mats and bench. Water cooler, included...and headphones. Very clean, and had a good workout after drinking 4 cups of coffee at breakfast. Price: $159/night (summer/midweek) for a 2-room suite. Valet: $21 (seems a bit absurd, but I didn't have a car, so eh)Overall, great for the location and price is reasonable...it's a standard hotel chain, and no real complaints. Just wish the service (checkout) and the room were a bit less chilly!Pleasantly surprised. Friendly staff, clean rooms, nice decor, good breakfast and warm cookies to boot. We rented out a meeting room and it was very nice. Didn't expect the parking fee but other than that all was well.Believe it or not, this may have been my first stay at a Hampton Inn... and while it was A-OK (with the location being it's biggest perk), it didn't exceed my expectations. The positive:*a very adequate fitness room*a complimentary full breakfast buffet each morning (available from 6am - 10am)*free internet*pleasant front desk staff*awesome location in Short North! *the price (approximately $130 a night)The *not so positive*:-the odor in the room - not bad, but not great-the thin walls-the bed not amazingly comfortable and didn't necessarily feel like the cleanest bed I've slept in-housekeeping - they never came! Bottom line: if you're heading to Columbus and want to stay in the Short North area and you don't plan on spending a ton of time in your hotel room, this is a fabulous, affordable choice. If you prefer a hotel with nicer amenities and really want a good night's sleep, perhaps look elsewhere.I'm usually a Marriott guy, with over 200 nights a year (consolidate those points) - but decided to stay at this Hampton due to it's great location, walking distance to lots of good bars/restaurants. Hampton's are known for their consistency, but this one stands out due to recent remodel. Super comfortable beds, great bathrooms. 2nd level "great room" is a good spot for eating/working. Great indoor pool and jacuzzi. Super friendly staff. I think most of the bad reviews on here were pre-remodel. As a frequent traveller, I can endorse this as a solid choice.Nice place but no self parking (even for guests) big negative (valet only at a Hampton?) In the middle of the action.It might sound insane for a local to spend a weekend in a hotel in their home city, but I stayed in this Hampton during Ohayocon 2010 with my girlfriend and some friends and we were all very thoroughly impressed. It wasn't the convention hotel, but it was right across the street and cheaper than the Hyatt and the Drury.The fitness facilities and pool were in excellent shape and very clean. My partner, best friend and I really enjoyed the sauna. Our room was clean, well-made, and everything was in order. Complimentary breakfast? I'm not a morning person, and it was worth it. Show up early, though, if you want choice picks and a chance at getting a waffle.I don't think there's anything negative to say about the hotel staff. The doorman was so welcoming and called for someone to help us with our bags, and the folks behind the check-in counter got us in and out very quickly.The only downside was the thin walls (we weren't the only con-goers staying there). We didn't hear any adult activities going on, nor did any of us engage in such activities, so I'm just chalking it up to con-goers having a good time.Super-friendly staff, great location, and a bed comfier and more nicely furnished than my own (I miss you, puffy down comforter). The pool is weird in that instead of tile or plaster it's metal, and the hot tub is really small, but both served their purpose. A little on the pricey side, but we found a deal online and split the room and parking ($20/day, oof) four ways, so for two nights it ended up being $85 per person. Not too shabby considering it's a nicer place within walking distance to restaurants, clubs, a park, and, most importantly, our friends' apartment.Room was clean and well-appointed. Nice city view. Beds are in good shape, and no complaints about the bath. The location is terrific; across from the convention center. Many sites within walking distance in the Arena District, and Short North neighborhood. For a newer hotel. this Hampton can feel dated. The exterior is fab, but the interior decor seems a little dark and outdated. I hope the hotel plans to do some redecorating in the near-future. Staff was helpful. Parking is difficult around this area, so plan to spend about $20 per night whether you use the hotel's valet or one of the adjacent garages. Luckily, most places are short walks, so moving the car will not be necessary much. Heading to Columbus, I would stay here againGreat hotel for a 'downtown' Hampton. I have been to many Hampton Inns so I know what to expect.LOCATION: Short North. Directly across from the convention center. Walkable neighborhood - shops, bars, dining, parks. PARKING:Valet entrance on Spruce Street. Overnight valet parking $23/night (weekend). CHECK IN/ CHECK OUT:Bellman/Doorman was very friendly. Front Desk Associate was nice - checked us in quickly. Nice lobby, with a faux-dome ceiling, and a staircase. GUEST ROOM: Upon walk in the air was off and there was a tiny 'staleness' to the room, but once the air kicked in it was fine. The rooms are decent, spacious to share. The wallpaper was peeling in multiple parts of the room, though. The bathroom was a good size and had your standard amenities. Free WI-FI which had decent speed. ON THE HOUSE BREAKFAST: Free. 6a-10a. Breakfast hostess did a good job at keeping up with all of the traffic. Food is Hampton standard, hot items (omelettes, waffles), boxed cereal, yogurt, bagels, fruit), juice machine. I like that the breakfast lounge is on the 2nd floor and not on the same floor as the front desk.POOL & HOT TUB: Decently sized. Great thing is that if you do go for a swim there is guest laundry right outside the fitness center. Who wants to pack wet clothes?SOMETHING COOL: the cool part about this hotel is that when it went up, they wanted to preserve the 'historic' feel of the old building. so they took down the old facade brick by brick, built the hotel, and then reconstructed the facade to its original form again. All in all, our weekend stay was pleasant and if I ever had to come back to Columbus I would strongly consider (and recommend) the hotel.Is it possible for me to just defer to Colleen C.'s review? Yep, I'd really like to do that please. Not only does she capture the essence of this locale perfectly, but her review is far more informative and detailed than this one will certainly be. If you care to be educated on all things Short North Hampton Inn & Suites, seek out my gal down there. Want to know exactly what I thought of my weekend stay here? Well, then, read on... Here's the skinny: it was OK. That's it. Just OK. I can't gush because there is positively nothing glamorous, sexy, indulgent or luxurious about this hotel locale. Nope, not a thing. They won my stay by default as (literally) the only hotel in the bustling Short North's fabulous High Street area and maintains a reputation - at least in my book - as one of the most utilitarian hospitality locales around. Think disposable cups in plastic wrap at your bedside, super lackluster paisley decor covering every surface able to be swathed in fabric, deafeningly loud wall unit A/C and then, of course, there's the bed. Oy vey, that bed. Take a table top hard king size bed with four insufficiently small standard size pillows and throw in the world's lumpiest bedspread for good measure, and there you have it. CC already made mention of the bed comforter in her review yes, but I'm sorry, it warrants repeating. I have no idea what they did to make those duvets look as if several oompa loompas are scattered and hiding underneath them, but it's ridiculous and uncomfortable to sleep with despite the hilarity. Expect standard accommodation bathrooms with shower/tub combos and the customary practical small-ish towels that accompany them. Make do and press on to the fun and fabulousness that awaits outside in this amazing neighborhood! To be noted: Continental Breakfast is free to guests (WIN!) though ends abruptly at 10am (FAIL!). Time your evening's festivities wisely if you know you need your a.m. java fix.I stayed at the Hampton Inn for three nights during a conference last week. Overall, I was greatly satisfied with my stay and definitely would return if I was back in the area. I'm not going to get super detailed since there are some great reviews already that say what I want to say better than I would say it, but here are my quick pros and cons.Pros:- Location: right in Shorth North, directly across the street from the convention center- Staff: Courteous and helpful at all times, gave me toiletries that I had forgotten at home- Free breakfast: Good selection, have free bagged breakfasts if you're on the run- Rooms: Clean and adequately sized, nice large lcd tv'sCons:- Parking is relatively brutal at $21 a night- No microwave or fridge in room (I know, nit-picky)This Hampton Inn was a far better experience than the night I spent at The Columbus downtown earlier in the week.Loved this place -- even while it is undergoing renovation. The staff was friendly and eager to make my stay a pleasure. Maybe it's becuase I spend most of my time in the Northeast, but it was nice to get some Midwest charm. Don't delay, go ahead and book!I live in Columbus so staying in a hotel around town is a treat. A stay-cation, if you will.We went out downtown and decided last minute to stay here without any reservations. The rate they quoted us was $105. I've traveled extensively over my lifetime and stayed in countless 3 to 5 star hotels over the years, and despite the generic decor, I was impressed with the location and rate. The lobby is inviting, clean, and open.Upon walking in the room, you felt comfortable immediately. The room was incredibly spacious with a higher than normal ceiling (at least it felt that way), and the bed was well-equipped with lots of soft pillows, plush down comforter, crisp quality sheets, and more than enough lighting. There was a 50 inch plasma on the sideboard and typical hotel but tasteful furniture. The air quality and heating/AC unit was effective and I appreciated how I didn't freeze my buns off or the fact that I didn't wake up with a cotton mouth. It wasn't a suite and since our room was on the 6th floor, the sound from below or from the street wasn't a factor. We had a nice view of the convention center too.I'd stay here again because the location is perfect. To roll out of bed and walk over to the North Market is a bonus. If I had company in town who wanted to experience that part of the Short North, I'd highly recommend it. I'm not normally a fan of the Hilton brand of hotels, but this Hampton Inn is a great one.Ditto what everyone else said in terms of the 4-star reviews. Just wanted to note for swimmers: the indoor pool is nice but it's kind of square-shaped and smallish. I managed to do circular laps because I had the place to myself.Also: touchscreen computers in the business center with printer, free of charge. However, they blocked Tumblr.com because it's a personal blog site. Boo. Yet they allow access to sites like Yelp, Facebook and Gmail. Hm, time for someone in Columbus to get with the times.Anyway, staff were really nice and friendly, and gosh it felt so good to have some peace of mind after a long drive.I have stayed here several times and the last time I stayed there I got bed bugs. I called and spoke to the manager the next day and he implied I was not telling the truth- WHY would I lie about something like that? Having worked in the hotel industry for years I take that stuff seriously and was merely trying to give him a heads up. It does cost an arm and a leg for a hotel to rectify this problem so maybe he just didn't want to hear it. Whatever the case, it left a bad taste in my mouth (and quite a few bites on my legs). It was awful. The room was fine I guess. I remember nothing other than itching like crazy. Suites are available here as well. They are nice but prepare to hear EVERYTHING around you as the walls are paper thin.What a great, clean hotel in a great location. I wish I could've stayed here longer but had to stay at Renaissance Downtown because of it's proximity to where I was working. So many great amenities like coin laundry, pool, hot tub and fitness center. The best part about it was it's location, which is right in the Short North- a great area full of restaurants, bars, boutiques and galleries. Service was good, too. An excelent value for the money.
review_content_40: Perfect location, near everything.  Staff was very helpful, kind, and friendly. Great continental breakfast, very clean facilities, pool and jacuzzi were well stocked with towels and it was clean.  Workout room also well stocked at all times with water, towels, headphones.  Valet was fast and friendly.  Reasonable prices. Not one complaint.  I would definitely stay here again.Great hotel very clean rooms, VERY comfy beds as well! Staff was fast and very friendly. Hotel was right across the street from the convention center, plus in walking distance to all the bars Gay or straight. Very busy. Only down fall was the 189 room but it was a saturday. We did talk them down to 133 though so that was a plus. All in all Very great location and very good hotel . I would recommendTook a trip to C-Bus to see Roller Derby and stayed here because many of the other hotels were booked.  I'm glad we ended up here - we had a great stay in the Presidential Suite (sure we had to pay a little more and only got placed here because nearly everything else was booked but I still seemed special).  Great room, great location (North Market is around the corner - grab breakfast, lunch or dinner; Barley's Brewery is next door; lots of fun shops in the Short North), and great staff.

review_content: Great stay here. Looks to have been recently renovated. The room was clean and staff were friendly. The a/c unit in my room was louder than I would have liked -- it woke me up multiple times throughout the night -- but I assume it's an older building with some older fixtures.Breakfast in the morning was good -- nothing super fancy, but a good quick breakfast before heading out to meetings for the day.Overall, I found Springhill Suites to be a pleasant stay. Clean and quiet room, no fuss no muss.Would I stay here again? No. Just little things, I guess.Hotel bar did not have any food, they were out of everything. Although a small issue, when you have travelled all day, the last thing you want to do is head out in single digits in search of food. There is nothing nearby as in walking distance, that I would eat. Maybe I am picky. The vacant inn next door was also a little off putting. I obliged to the front desk staff solution and ordered out. I never ever do this. I don't because I do not enjoy eating in my room. Nor do I enjoy delivery food. Don't order from Wings.I was chilly last night and went for the extra blanket in the closet. (Hey, where is the extra pillow? No, I'm not calling the front desk because it is late and I have my nightclothes on.) The extra blanket was rough and pilled. Not the fluffy velour blanket that you get at other places. Gross.Breakfast was ok. The eggs were reconstituted and you could tell.Business traveller here. Will look to stay at a Courtyard Marriott next time.I dug this hotel. It has a newly remodeled look to it and the service was friendly and quick. I liked the amenities too. The work out room was clean and complete with some treadmills and ellipticals along with a set of free weights and a TV to pass the time. Their lap pool is small but a nice feature to have. Mornings offer a complimentary hot breakfast.My room was off the first floor and it was mostly clean. That said there were some fruit flies in my room that were a nuisance but I'll chalk that up to a fluke. The shower could've been cleaner and the handle to the glass shower door was falling off but all in all a nice place to stay. My room had a desk behind a glass partition with a fold out couch with a couple tables that you could pull up to the bed for laptop use...so for the business traveler I think this place is worth coming back to for what it is.Big fat zero..... The staff are very hit and miss.  The day shift staff have it way more together.  Afternoon shift is another story.  If you are staying for a convention plan on using your own transportation despite the shuttle.  Going out on the schuttle is scheduled, coming back is a try at your own risk depending on volume at a location so you could be waiting, bring a book. Good luck.  We stayed her once before a year ago because it was great but now it needs some polish.  As a frequent customer of Marriott,  there needs to be some front end training taking place here in a major way very soon or the ratings will start to fall without question. Rooms were your newer springhill format.  Tub/shower not walk in shower... Thats a negative.  Plus is bathroom and toilet are separate.  Location is good close enough to convention center but far enough away to avoid the traffic.  The building gets a 3.5 stars and staff get 2. I place great importance on management, attention to detail and customer service so thats why its a 2 star in my book.I have stayed here many times over the last four years while visiting my daughter and her fiance who were both attending OSU Medical School. Great service, clean rooms and a good breakfast.Great motel. Great location (minus getting out of parking lot during busy traffic times).  Nice decor. Price was right via Priceline. Nice free breakfast. Good free wifi. Would definitely choose this motel again if in the area.Great location near campus as well as a Target and multiple restaurants. Same Springhill Suites quality. The sink didn't work in one of our bathrooms, but other than that everything was perfect. Parking was a key aspect of this hotel...lots of other hotels in the area you need to valet. You don't here."Use your GPS" is not an appropriate answer for a front-desk person to offer when you ask for directions to an important local destination. (In our case: the building where OSU does admissions interviews.) It's also not professional for the person to get visibly annoyed when you ask why there is no map.GPS's don't work 100% of the time - so because the desk clerk's unhelpfulness, it took us 45 minutes to find the destination, which in theory is only a 5 minute drive. Beyond that: our room was fine - very modern and clean. However, the breakfast buffet seemed to include a lot of old food - the bananas were almost entirely brown, and the oatmeal congealed and icky. (I wouldn't be surprised if it was left over from the day before.)Notice how no one is responding to these reviews - the management clearly doesn't care. Search for "hotels Olentangy" and you'll find plenty of other options, often cheaper.Stayed here for a couple nights, and was pretty happy with the experience. The hotel seems to be brand new and nearly everything in the lobby, hallways and my room was pretty much spotless. Free lollipops on check-in. Free wifi. Friendly service. Free breakfast (not bad... cereal, oatmeal, eggs, breads, pastries, juices, coffee, etc.). Bar in the lobby. The room had a small seating area with a desk and sofa-bed. There's a microwave and small coffeemaker. The walls are pretty thin so you can hear the neighbors but it's not that bad unless you get a room full of 10 year olds next to you (like we did). The bathroom is pretty tiny but not too bad - the shower was fine. I thought the towels and soap seemed like motel-quality and felt out of place, but it wasn't a huge deal. Considering the convenient location (near OSU) and free perks (parking, wifi, breakfast, lollipops), this is a place I would definitely use again. Recommended.Stayed in room 308:Upgraded from previous 3 star review. Located walking distance to the Grandview area which has awesome restaurants!My room was clean and very nice.  The young lady at the front desk was very sweet and Friendly.  Xaiu I think that's  how to her spell it.  I had no problem checking in or with my room.  Another plus for Marroitt.Great location in Columbus OSU area.  The customer service was on point, very clean, newer design and the experience was condusive to the avid business traveler.  I will continue to stay at this location.  If you are like me, as a business traveler, I need to be within close proximity to a Target or grocery store to stock up on water, some food, snacks and maybe OTC drugs for the occassional cold.  Both Target and a Kroger were near by.Loved the look of everything- very modern and bright!  Loved the room and the separate bathroom.  Made getting ready in the morning easy.  Only downside was the ridiculously loud flushing toilet!  We have night time bathroom goers and it woke me up.  Also, breakfast was good- but are they powdered eggs?  Weird texture.  I'd stay again for sure.This hotel was brand new and everything was perfectly clean.  We had a room with two queen beds.  Love the queens instead of doubles!  There were two bathroom areas, one with a toilet and sink, and another with a bathtub/shower and sink.  The mini fridge was actually....wait for it....cold!!  Been a long time since a mini fridge in a hotel room actually did it's job well.  The location was very close to OSU (hence the name) but was also within 5-10 minutes of downtown which was really nice.The lobby was nice and there was always water available.  There was supposed to be a bar open nightly but I never once saw it open and we came through there all through the afternoon and evening.The service leaves something to be desired.  Both mornings when I went down to breakfast there was practically nothing available.  The eggs and sausage were almost empty with just bits that look like everyone had their hands on them left over.  The oatmeal was empty and cleaned out with 45 minutes left to spare during breakfast.  The batter was removed from the waffle machine...again with 45 minutes to spare.  Our room was barely made up.  The bed would have the sheets and comforter put back to the top of the bed but not smoothed out and the decorative blanket was never put back.  The bathroom would have new towels but nothing got wiped down.  The plastic cups were never replaced.  Simply put....it was subpar at best.Finally, no receipt under our door the morning of check out so I went to the desk to get the receipt and was handed a blank one.  They said they didn't know how to print another one so I never got a detailed bill.The hotel could be great if they could get the service items figured out.WARNING! This place is not for you if you have small children. Free breakfast, parking, free internet drew me to this place.Normally, we have our small child sleep in a crib placed in the bathroom. In most hotels the doors are normally so thick that a child can sleep soundly without being bothered. This allows us to watch TV or a movie and have a light on. In this place, they have sliding glass doors that let in both light and noise. Let's just say, none of us got any sleep.The other problem was the bed. It creaked really loud getting in and out of bed. REALLY, REALLY loud. Our girl heard us get up every time.If you don't have kids with you, you'll probably love this place. Clean too.Poorly designed for young children. It was hard to pay $159 a night plus junk state taxes to get a bad night sleep every night.I stayed here while interviewing at OSU, and it was very conveniently located close to OSU and the airport. The room was quiet, clean and spacious, with a nice set-up including desk, sitting area, fridge and microwave. The furnishings were quite modern and the bed was comfy. The fitness center is sparse but sufficient if you only need it for a couple days. Breakfast is served early enough (starts at 6:30), with waffles, eggs, sausages, yogurt, fresh fruit, and other regular continental stuff. There is also a Wendy's about a block away.The only issue I had was that my room was close to the parking lot, which had very bright floodlights that came through and around the drapes. I used some eyemasks that I brought along for my flight which made it bearable, so I would recommend bringing some along if you're like me and need your room to be dark when you sleep.Stayed here at Springhill Suites for New Years with my family. The continental breakfast was below average with very stale food. My bagel was hard as rock, bananas were almost brown, and the apple was soft and old. My shower was warm, at best. The exercise room was closed even though it was advertised to be open 24 hours. I exercise every day and, in cold months, I count on the gym for exercising. I book hotels with exercise rooms when I am away to fulfill my routine. The television channels barely worked. They skipped and cut in and out or simply said, "no signal" after stuttering so often. I would have to say not the worst hotel stay I have ever had but most certainly not even close to the best. Below average at best.Pretty much everything you want in a hotel at an affordable price. This is a cute, modern hotel, with friendly staff, probably a lot of whom are either students or recent grads from near by OSU. We stayed here for one night on our way over to Indiana, and had one of the best nights of sleep in a long time. Crazy comfortable beds and pillows!  Plus, free hot breakfast is always awesome.Room was big, great if you or your travel partner need to get work done, with a divider set up between the desk area and the bed area. Only thing keeping me from 5 stars was the thin bathroom doors (hopefully you're comfortable with the person your traveling with!) and almost 50% of the TV stations being dedicated to ESPN stations. I know it's a college town, hell I'm on my way to a Purdue game right now, but I don't need to see last night's score on 10 different channels.Location is convenient to campus and downtown area. Lots of restaurants, shopping and movies in close proximity. Rooms are updated and nicely appointed. Staff was professional, courteous and competent. Decent breakfast included or you can go next door to the Bob Evans. Light sleepers may have difficulty with train tracks behind and a busy road in front of hotel. I would stay here again.The hotel *just* opened. Everything is brand new and super modern. I've found there are two types of SpringHill Suites -- 1) the old boring kind with stale decor from the late 80s/early 90s or 2) the new chic-styled hotels. This one falls in the latter. I had a king-sized room. The toilet is split from the bathroom so it has another sink. Flat screen TVs and a L-shaped couch making it pretty nice. There's an open desk area between the couch and bed area.
