The only downside was that 1) though it offers a ton of TV stations, it doesn't carry Bravo and 2) there was no tub (only shower) for a king-sized bedroom. This might not be the case for all room types, but ... The exercise room is pretty good, especially for a "budget" hotel. There are free weights and a coupe elliptical machines with their own entertainment systems, though they don't offer the same amount of TV stations as that in the room. There is a "dip pool," but I didn't try it.The hotel offers an open seating plan for breakfast and there is a bar area. Nice sitting area/lobby, too.Its location is great for OSU, but it's also pretty convenient to downtown.
review_content_20: First time in Columbus, OH and found this hotel to be a lovely surprise!Easy distance to walk to campus/tailgates/football stadium! Free parking which is always nice.The room is spacious and has a separate sitting/living room space (has a couch, coffee tables) from the bed. The bathroom is also separated - one part toilet and sink, next area shower and vanity area - very nice as two people can get ready at the same time and in different areas :) Great comfy bed, clean - very clean.After the OSU game, their bar area stayed open then woke up the next morning to a free breakfast inclusive of eggs, sausage, juices, breakfast pastries, etc...For what we paid, we were very pleased with our accommodations and how friendly the staff was!Older springhill suites. Carpet in first room had red stains all, second room they were brown. Beds were tired. Time for a remodel or at least a new head of housekeeping.This is a very well decorated hotel. Very modern clean lines and beautiful warm colors. The rooms are nice, with every room to my knowledge having beautiful glass showers, separation for the bedroom area, and flat screen TVs. I also like there's a fridge and microwave makes late night snacks easy.I agree with a previous review the tv placement isn't convenient for watching in the sitting area.The bathroom split in my opinion is strange. I want everything in one place, especially when sharing a room with a friend. The indoor pool is nice but freezing, both in the warm and cold months. And I mean cold. The room is warm though which almost makes it worse.Their outside patio is also nice.

review_content: About 5 years ago, I used to stay at this hotel 4 nights a week for at least 6 months for work. I've been back about a dozen times since my regular stays here.They've renovated the lobby and it looks nice.They also redid the gym area from what I hear.Not that I actually ever work out.Odd thing about this hotel is that it is across the street from Bud Weiser factory and you can smell the hops brewing sometimes from the parking lot.And the area that the hotel is in has gone a little downhill. Hotel is huge and it's quick to get to other areas but the direct section is a bit sketchy.The rooms are fine but they aren't special.Some have refrigerators and microwaves.The 8th and 9th floor is club level access so the rooms are slightly larger with desk and seating area.There was rain damage in the ceiling in our room.We always stay on 9th floor and the club room is great. They have breakfast with coffee, teas, salmon, bagels, cereals etc. They have a appetizer evening spread and a big TV in the room. The customer service here is nice and they always go out of their way to assist and make you feel welcome.I was worried about this stay because of the reviews. Generally I like to base me Yelp reviews on "what it is", as in I'm not going to expect Ritz service from a basic hotel.Anyhow. Rooms were clean, beds were comfy, breakfast was delicious. I ordered room service. A Salmon Egg White Frittata, only for somewhere around 10-15 bucks, now that I was impressed by. Service was friendly. I had an issue with the cafe and it was taken care of promptly. I'm not sure what people are talking about with decor being outdated. The hotel isn't a contemporary style, but the hotel doesn't seem outdated or smelly. Overall I enjoyed my stay as a mini getaway on my day off.It's hard to accurately rate our stay. The hotel was nice enough and clean but we were both shocked to be awakened in the night at 2am by the sounds coming from the neighboring room (302). This is not a joke. I was legitimately scared that someone was being attacked due to the cries from the other room and the sounds of someone being struck. In hindsight, I should have called the front desk or the police. That said, it might be a good idea to upgrade the walls to make them a little more soundproof.Stayed here 2/8/16. I was attacked by bed bugs. A day later and the bites have become painful in addition to the itching. Notified the hotel and they blew me off. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!Stayed 3 nights at Crowne Plaza North recently. We were very pleased with our experience. The check in process was quick and painless and friendly. We received excellent and prompt housekeeping service as we needed additional towels and a rollaway.We did not eat at the onsite restaurant but did use the pool (which is an indoor/outdoor) and it was clean and fun.We also found the location to be centrally located to our other destinations. We visited the zoo, OSU, and Easton Towne Center.We have become so numb and just accepted the fact that we are going to get no smiles, no thank yous, no appreciations for staying at specific chain hotels, flying specific airlines, eating at specific restaurants or even drink our coffee from specific chains.This specific hotel (not the entire chain but this very specific location) blew me away and brought back to life what customer service really SHOULD be.I was part of a large wedding group so we had probably over 30 rooms booked. Prior to arriving here, I didn't expect much cause I've never had a good experience with Crowne Plaza ANYWHERE in North America.From the moment I checked in, to the special requests I made to the check out process to the request for a late check out (which the hotel is in NO WAY bound to accommodate without charging a fee); I mean EVERYBODY was so pleasant, had a smile, were respectful and just happy.For those of you in the service industry reading this review, there's PLENTY to learn from these guys at this location.Giving this hotel 2 stars is generous and only because the public areas are attractive and the fitness center is acceptable. However, I'm not sure if this is a trend in hotels, but this one has become over security conscience and made access to everything cumbersome. For example, you need your key card to use the elevator and the stairs. Upon entering our room it had an unmistakeable mildew smell and I narrowed it down to the shower curtain. The walls are also not that well insulated and could hear everything from the room next door. Then there was the breakfast (not included). You do have the choice of ordering off the menu or the buffet which cost almost $13.00. You could get made to order omelets but other than that it was a typical buffet breakfast bar. The only reason we stayed there was we were attending a conference being held at the hotel. If we choose to attend the conference in the future and it remains at this hotel, I will be more inclined to book a different hotel to stay at.My family stayed here for a wedding. I came from out of town and it was my first time staying here. The parking lot is spacious and it is not hard finding a spot close to the building. The lobby was nice. There was a restaurant and bar as well as several ballrooms and a courtyard area. This hotel also had a gym and pool which from my understanding were both free. There is also a little store where you can buy snacks. In theory you need a room key for the elevators , but one didn't work so you could use it without, and the other you had to put your card in a certain way or it wouldn't work. The room was nice and of average size. The beds were comfortable but seemed more on the full side rather than queen. The tv was nice as well. The bathroom was a nice size as was the shower. The room was also very clean. The staff at the hotel were polite during the day, but I did note that late at night some of them were making distasteful comments while at the bar with guests. Another issue I had was that quite a few drunk people were stumbling around the bar and lobby late at night. I'm guessing they don't really have a cut off at the bar. Someone did vomit outside and it stayed there all night. Ew. They were very accommodating at this hotel however. My brothers wedding ceremony and reception was beautiful and the hotel staff were flawless during this time. They were so nice and attentive. With all that being said I personally wouldn't make this hotel my first choice unless you are holding some sort of event. Events are where they really shine. I stayed here for 3 days and 3 nights.From my experience at other Crowne Plazas, I thought that this location would be able to provide a good experience. I only stayed one night and I've had better experiences at motels than this place. The hallway outside my room wreaked of cigarette smoke. My room seemed relatively clean but there were dark stains on some of the white furniture. At night, the heater was so loud that it woke me up a couple of times. At 8:05am when I was about to head out the door to check out, housekeeping is knocking on the door non-stop. I open the door and tell her I'm about to check out so, she can go ahead and clean the room but instead of coming in to clean she repeatedly apologizes and leaves. Their breakfast buffet was pretty pathetic. For $12, I expected a bit higher quality - not so much bland artificial eggs in pans. Also, I've never experienced so much chaos when trying to get my room tax free. I had to email our form twice. They weren't able to take care of the paperwork before I went to my 9am meeting so, I decided to go ahead and go and I thought that surely, they'll sort it out by the time I come back at noon. When I got back, they hadn't even filled out the forms. They had me fill out their spots on the form like the name and address of the hotel and I waited for at least an hour while two poorly trained front desk clerks ran back and forth to the accounting office to ask questions and crawl through the computer forms. How can their front desk clerks be so poorly trained? One of them could hardly type and slowly poked out the words on the keyboard with her two index fingers. It just seems like the whole place is poorly managed with no sense of order.Just no. Don't do it. I went on priceline and bought the "mystery hotel", 3.5 stars, in the area I needed. I thought 3.5 stars had to be a good hotel.Not sure in whose world this is a 3.5 star hotel. But if it is, its out of 10 stars.Room near highway is like sitting in the middle of the highway. You hear everything. Heater is so loud that it sounds like there is an engine in the room. You can't hear the tv over the noise of the heater. So, I turn of the heater and freeze, and hear everything next door because the walls are paper thin.The bathroom was nasty. Black thick mold under the soap dish in the shower, rust marks under the faucet, slow draining tub so who knows what you are standing in.Housekeeping banging on the door at 8 a.m. I would never, ever stay here again.Stayed here overnight after booking a Name-Your-Price room on Priceline. I was really worried after reading most of the reviews here on Yelp - what kind of roach motel had I bid on? But I had to remember that most hotel reviews I read tend to be overly picky and critical, for whatever reason.I found the front desk staff to be very pleasant during check-in. When we arrived, the hotel was super-crowded with a couple of conventions, so the lobby was hectic and full of people, and the elevators were also filled with people coming back from a dip in the pool, but I didn't find those things to be particularly intrusive.The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the fan on the AC unit blocked out any noise we might have encountered from other rooms during the night (although our floor seemed relatively quiet late on a Friday night). Since there were two of us, more than one set of toiletries in the restroom would have been nice, but the hotel does offer concierge service including free extra basic toiletries upon request, so we could have requested those if we really wanted or needed them.Overall, I found this to be a more than decent hotel room for the price.Given past experiences with this same chain of hotels I figured I'd be getting the same as with other stays, boy was I wrong! First of all I was in a makeshift king room with a pullout couch blocking the sliding glass door. My "wall ac unit" functioned at half capacity and there were bugs on the wall in the middle of the night that scattered when I put on the lights. I can only guess they were roaches or worse bed bugs..... My thought is this room was originally a two room suite that they made into one room as it had multiple doors for adjoining rooms but they were nothing more then wooden cheap doors that had patchwork over where a door knob must have originally been. There were also large amounts of dust throughout the room. I voiced my concerns with the night staff about the quality of the room but was told there was a convention and no others available. It wasn't until I was woken up several times by my neighbors crying baby and found the bugs that I was truly truly mad. When I brought up everything to the morning desk staff and asked to speak with management, of course he was the manager, that it was taken with a grain of salt and not as seriously as i would have liked. I wasn't looking for a free night just for someone to act like they cared. It's frustrating that all I got was a well we will have someone look into that. I offered pictures of things I saw wrong and everything and he wanted nothing to do with it.I come here strictly for work conferences amd this hotel and their staff are very nice and helpful with any issues. The hotel is always clean and in a convenient location. The restaurant and bar area is somewhat small, but the food is good and the drink selection is sufficient.My son and I stayed for a function that was being held in the hotel. The hotel seem to be more business friendly than a place to stay while on vacation or on a trip such as ours. The rooms were clean and everything worked as it should. I was a little disappointed that the wifi only allows you to login on one device, effectively making us share one. I figure I should be able to login with two since there were two of us in the room. Also, I would have thought for the price, a continental breakfast would have been available. I find it hard to believe you don't offer that with competition being what it is. If we were faced with a situation with an event that was booked there, I might consider staying there again. If I were to just stay in the area, I'd most likely look somewhere else. You can do better in this price range a few miles away. I would have given it a four or five star if the wifi was set up for both of us and the continental breakfast were available.I was there less than 10 hours so I can't tell you a whole lot.We arrived late on a Friday and check in was fast. ~$80 for a room through HotWire.com and I feel like that was a bit much for this place. Anyway, check in was quick. I then stopped at their little snack store and paid $4.50 for a pack of pop tarts and a water.. I mean, you've got to be kidding me.Elevators require you to use your room key and they don't function the best. In fact, the elevators scared me a little bit. This hotel at first appears to be updated but on further inspection it's not really. When I got off and on to my floor, I was really intimidated by the looooonnnnnng hallway.Also, someone's left over take out sat in the hallway all night. Gross that trash was just left there.Room was nice and clean. Lots of towels in the bathroom. Bed wasn't very comfortable but for one night it was okay. That heater though. Ugh. Worst thing ever. Kicks on and it's so loud! You're sleeping and it wakes you, you fall back asleep and it kicks in e again... That was my sleep cycle.So thankful that I was out of there by 7a on Saturday.When you search for this place on a map, it looks like a great location - right off the highway, perfect! Not so much. It's true that the building is physically located directly next to the highway, but there is not a convenient on/off ramp nearby. I'd say the journey to the hotel from the highway is closer to 10 minutes than 5. Maybe not a big deal for most people - me included - but having to search for the place turned me off right away.The restaurant/bar in this Crowne Plaza is nice, as is the lobby and that whole set-up. The room was average. I was comfortable but not impressed. It WAS nice having access to the "executive lounge" on the top floor, where they had better breakfast in the morning and snacks/drinks set up in the afternoon/early evening. The attendants there were friendly.One big gripe - I received a cetificate for a free cup of coffee from their little store (in thanks for being a rewards club member). When I went to redeem it the first morning, there was no regular coffee. They use the K-cups (little single serving thingamajigs) and they only had "fancy" flavors. I asked the front desk for regular, you know, coffee flavored coffee. She checked and they didn't have any. Ok, I'll try something else. It was then that I realized they didn't have any cups out, either. No cups! I asked for these as well. She called someone on the walkie-talkie and asked for them. About 10 minutes later, no one had come, so she left - asking me to watch the desk - while she went to get them herself. Ugh. All that for a cup of french mocha latte some crap, I don't know - weird coffee.Better luck next time.After a long drive, we were happy to book an inexpensive room in a convenient location. The check-in was easy, and our room was clean and comfortable. What went wrong?We stayed here on a Friday night, and on Monday, I noticed a second charge on our account. I called Monday, and was told that only the correct charge was showing up. I said the second charge was not listed as pending, and shared the amount. I was told that management could not do anything to help, but to leave a message with accounting. I did that, and waited until Thursday, but never received a call (or saw the charge removed), so I called again, and was told the same. I left another message Thursday, then received a call on Friday that the charge was an accident and was removed. It was credited to our account today. Not a big deal, but one which was frustrating - I had to call twice, and both times was told there wasn't a problem, but to leave a message for accounting which took a week to respond. Not how you do business if you want someone to stay again. We won't be staying here again.I hope you will avoid using the property. Ranks right up there with the worst customer service I've ever experienced!OK so granted, I bought my room on HOTELS.COM at a pretty good rate. Not a GREAT rate...but not bad. It was just before Christmas last year. (I know, a little late posting this, but I haven't forgotten.) I was passing through Columbus midweek and decided to plan ahead (not something I normally do). During my journey to Erie, PA I learned that the Columbus / Northeastern Ohio region was expecting a very substantial winter storm late that night and early the next morning and that the highways would likely be difficult if not impassible. I thought it was probably best to push through and drive the extra 4 hours to get to my destination that evening.I called and explained the situation. Because of the impending storm, I would not be needing my room that night. Dispite the extenuating circumstances my request for a transfer of nights fell on deaf ears. There were no refunds, no transfers, no credit for future use, no nothing. My initial action was to try to convince the front desk to reconsider. Then to ask for a supervisor, which was fruitless as well. I finally asked to speak to the General Manager and was put into his voicemail. I called back the next day and was again put into his voicemail. He never returned my call but his assistant did. She was not in the Christmas mood evidently and was not even going to consider my request. I can be pretty convincing sometimes but this woman was not budging. In the spirit of good customer service, there was absolutely no reason at all that I should not have received a credit to use on a future date. I have been in some type of customer/sales related position most of my career. There isn't a reason in the world to be so stringent with policy. Shame on the Crowne Plaze in Columbus OH.LOOK! I know that those websites, (hotels.com, expedia, etc) are designed to help put heads in beds at a discount. What I don't understand is why a credit can not be issued for future use. They got my money, I got nothing. However, they will never get any again. I feel better now. I hope you will avoid using the property. Columbus has plenty of great places to choose from, it should be easy to avoid the bad ones.I was forced to stay at this hotel for two weeks for work, and currently have 3 more days left. This hotel is so terrible I leave angry every morning. I have a quick list of what, so far has made me so mad, so often. 1) the AC unit/heater is one of those with two knobs and 4 push buttons that were real popular in the 70's. The left knob, when turned all the way to the right makes the room noisy, and blows lukewarm wet air around the room. If turned to the left, it is quieter, but makes a fart smell and kicks out warm wet air. I have no doubt the universal remote cost more than that unit.2) the universal remote Cannot select inputs on the TV. So if you didn't want to cycle through the channels at 1channel every 3.4 seconds (max speed for changing channels), you can't switch to an HDMI input. And good luck finding something on TV. They don't have a channel list. 3)Because I had to stay here every day and their lunch average cost is around $22 for food that is prepared poorly, I wanted to get my own from the grocery. Well I had a choice of either putting it in the freezer and having it freeze in 45 min, or in the fridge and it freeze in an hour. The knob to control the fridge was broken off, turning this machine into a strawberry killer.4) This is the worst. I came to my room after work, around 4 to find the housekeeping cleaning. They ran over one of my shoes, sucked up the lace and burnt up the vacuum, and the lace of my shoe. The very illegal woman just smiled real big saying "sorrysorrysorry" and left. My room smells like smoke and my shoes are screwed up.This hotel is a mistake in every way. My room is uncomfortable, cleaning staff is worthless, equipment is outdated or defunct. I have been homeless before, this hotel is unacceptable.I've stayed here twice. The wifi is $9 per day, which is just amazing to me. The AC unit is really poor quality so I'm either freezing or burning up. The bathroom is strangeBut here's what took this hotel from 3 stars to 2: My mom and I went to eat breakfast and the waiter gave us a really hard time about ordering off the menu even though breakfast was still supposed to be served for another half hour. He took our orders and literally walked by and threw a bottle of ketchup on our table. He had also seated us next to tables away from everyone else with piles of dirty dishes on them. After he threw the ketchup, we were done. We left. We went to the front desk to tell them what happened and was met with, "No, we don't have anyone like that here". This hotel is mediocre on a good day. And I hope you don't have a problem here because the staff isn't going to give a damn.
review_content_20: One of the worst hotel stays i've ever had, and one of the worst hotel chains i've ever had the displeasure of dealing with.  Wish I could give it negative stars.After a long 7 hour drive from St. Louis we arrived tired and ready to relax, but the staff here made sure relaxing was the last thing I did.A 16 day road-trip, at which I booked all my hotels through priceline, this being the top star level i stayed at (3.5 stars), and was the only hotel that gave me an hassle when I requested a double room.I walked into the room and it had to be at least 90 degrees, i turned on the a/c and watched it struggle for 20 minutes.  I contacted the front desk and they sent up an "engineer" that fumbled with the buttons for 5 minutes and then told me the a/c was "overheated" and i should "wait it out".Well f**k that, I decided to grab my kids and head to the pool for relief.  After my kids jumped in, I immediately told them to get out.  The pool was so grimy that the names people had inscribed in the muck on the side of the pool tiles were still legible, ew.So it's time for dinner and I call a local delivery place.  40 minutes later, while on a very important business call, my wife picks up the room phone.  It's the front desk telling me I have to hike down from the 6th floor to the lobby to get my food.  WTF did i order DELIVERY for?  Yes, on the surface it seems lazy, but it's incredibly inconvenient when you're on a business call to have to tell your client you'll call them back so your family's food doesn't go cold.Mr. Delivery Driver forgot our drinks (but that's another review), anyways, i head to the end of the hallway to the vending machine to get a drink and it's broken.  So is the one on the 5th floor.  So I head all the way down to the lobby, again, to get a drink from the sundry.  I wait 7-10 minutes for someone to ring me up before leaving disappointed.  At this point I give up, decide to go take a shower and go to bed, but before settling into my sagging "u" shaped mattress, I had to play a lovely game of "stomp the ant" in my bathtub.  I contacted the manager, along with customer care the following day, and the hardly gave a s**t.  What a completely f****d business model these people run.  I will never stay at a Crowne Plaza again.Ok hotel for the price, but it is not a pretty place.  Our room was dirty and it looked as though someone used the curtains to wipe themselves.  I agree with another reviewer who said she felt bad for the staff.  The people who stay here are a sketchy group - at best.  There was a high school tournament of some sort going on in the area.  That led to countless unsupervised teens roaming the halls, shouting, and playing loud music until early dawn.  I politely asked then to quiet down, and they replied with middle fingers and swearing.  I called the front desk, and they sent security to shut the kids up.  That worked... for about a half hour.  You get what you pay for, and we will be spending more to stay at a more reputable establishment during our next trip to Columbus.nicest crowne plaza that I have stayed at in usa in a very long timegot upgrade to top floor - this room must have been updated already (sign in lobby said under renovation)  tv and furniture all looked newfront desk, lounge and housekeeping staff all very nice and helpfulonly complaint is exec lounge is dark/drearynot luxurious  so cant give 5 , but inexpensive ($80) so highly recomendedOne of the WORST hotel experiences I've had.Our first room had a ceiling leak.  Parts of the ceiling actually fell onto the carpet and onto many of my belongings.  The water luckily only fell into my cooler.  When I called to report the problem, the front desk didn't seem alarmed or concerned.  When they finally sent an "engineer" up to look, they acted like it wasn't that big a deal. He finally asked if we would like a new room.  They were not apologetic nor accommodating. I was stunned to receive this kind of service at a hotel.The hotel is not nice at all - outdated decor, dirty (from lack of employees cleaning the hallways), cheap accessories in the room (i.e. the coffee maker).Sure, the decor is somewhat dated, but the place is kept clean and in good shape, so I'm not complaining.  Add to that the fact that a room can usually had for cheap (~$50) via clever Priceline bidding, and the fact that the wifi is free and the gym is surprisingly decent, and this place gets an easy 4* overall.We stayed here for our friend's wedding, the same weekend as the Ohio state high school basketball tournament, so the hotel was full of high school kids.  Our room was recently rehabbed, which was nice,  but the room still looked worn out- dirty carpets, dirt on our curtains, etc Walls are paper thin- did not enjoy being woken up late at night by a bunch of high school kids. Location is conveniently located near Polaris mall and Easton, so that is nice, but it's off Cleveland Ave. If. you know C-bus, you know to be careful near Cleveland ave. For our purposes, it was fine and the price was okay, about $95/night total. Front desk staff were nice, and workout facilities are pretty decent (but small). Overall I think it's just okay, but if you can stay in a better location, I would recommend it.This hotel is very underrated, in my opinion. It's not the nicest hotel I've stayed in but for he price, it's great!! It's updated and the rooms are very nice. It's a little bit of a drive to the freeway, not as close as it looks on a map, but not a big deal to me.Large, clean, nice hotel. Not sure what people were talking about with the dirtiness. Sweet pool and hot tub area and new gym machines in great shape. I would definitely stay here again.Did you ever stay in a hotel where you actually felt sort of bad for the people that worked there? That is the feeling I have for this place. The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because of the staff. It's cheap and assume it would be a good place to have a hotel party if you were in college.Here are a few observations I made while staying here:This place is filthy, I feel like I need to disinfect.A bottle opener for soda bottles in the bathroom? You are about 20 years overdue for a renovation.The furniture was so worn and nasty I didn't even want to sit on it, more of less breast-fed my daughter.Smells stale and nasty.I can smell smoke.The carpet is sooo dirty.Wallpaper with boarders peeling off. Really?You couldn't pay me to touch the phone. It hasn't been wiped down in years.Outdated design leaves you wondering when they are going to get around to fixing the place up. Even the toilet paper is hidden far underneath the sink.  None of the vending machines seem to work, but there is a kiosk in the lobby where you can get some soft drinks, snacks 24/7. Cops on all the surrounding streets making you run the gauntlet to get back to your hotel. No, i didn't get a ticket. I was one of the lucky ones. Management should talk to the local PD and ask them to stop using their guests for the PD financial bailout. The staff I encountered at the hotel was all very pleasant, hardworking and helpful. But management and ownership need to do something to get the place fixed up.My husband and I decided to stay here while visiting Columbus for CommFest.  We got a great price on PriceLine.  There were three other couples that booked with us.  The nightmare began right when we got to the hotel.  My brother-in-law went  to check in and was informed that he did not have a room waiting for him.  He was told that his reservation was for two days prior and that they recorded it as a no show!  After that eventually got worked out, we all got situated into our rooms and then headed to the indoor/outdoor pool.  This was a redeeming quality of the hotel.  Another of the couples with us had no air conditioning and of course the window didn't open.  This same couple also found that the bath tub did not drain and had to call maintenance.  The next morning at approx. 12am, another one of the couples with us received a knock on the door from a member of the security staff of the hotel.  He was extremely rude and demanded to know who our friend was and why was he in that room because "he wasn't supposed to be there!"  He demanded to know our friends name and loudly called the front desk on his walkie-talkie finding that, of course, our friend was registered to that room. The manager (not the security person) apologized and offered a complimentary night on their next visit. Next was our turn!  It was raining while we were there and one evening when we returned to our room, we found that there was a large leak in the ceiling/roof and our carpet was WET!  I informed the person at the front desk and the person there just told me that a few other guests complained of the same issue and that it was because of the rain.  But he assured me that someone would be out in a few days to fix it.  Not only did the leak in our room need to be fixed but the wall paper needs to be patched, the bath tub drain in our room also needs to be fixed (very slow!!!) To be fair, there were a couple redeeming qualities (in addition to the pool).  The bed was comfy (bring your own pillows...); the fridge in our room was great; Polaris Mall and Easton Mall are within 5 minutes; the bartender was friendly.  Overall, I would not stay in this hotel again if it were at all avoidable.This place is pretty nice.  The rooms are good and so are the beds.  Very clean.  Book your room on priceline and save money.I recently held an event here and was pleasantly surprised. While the decor feels a bit outdated, the staff is exceptional. Every single staff member from the managers to the cleaning staff stopped to say hello and check on us. Consistently impressive service for three days is rare and will have me considering this hotel as a venue for future events.Wow a Crowne Plaza that is not nice! We checked in for just one night, and the place looked very nice. The place is very clean in the lobby and the front door.  After parking and going to the room (that we asked to make sure it had a fridge for medicine) we were VERY disappointed. The room was very old and worn looking, there was a burn the size of my foot in the carpet made from a hot iron, and no fridge. We called down to get one, and about an hour later they got us one, we had to keep out medicine on ice till then.  While we were at this hotel there was a group there (All Nations Baptist group) in the hotel for the night also.  This group consisted of about 200 of the most rude and obnoxious people I have ever met.  When we came back from dinner, there was a homeless man asleep by one of the side doors on a picnic table. We informed the manager that he was there and didn't feel comfortable with him there, we were informed "Its OK, we decided to just let him sleep there. We didn't want to call the police on him."  We also went to the front desk to get some menus for ordering pizza, when we were told "Well I think everyone stops delivering at midnight, no there is no reason for me to give you any of the menus. sorry."  What?! You think they stop, so we cant try?  Wow, I didn't know I was 5 and had to have my mommy tell me what to do and not do.  I would never recommend this hotel even to someone I hated. Its not safe, or even nice. AVOID if you can!!

review_content: This is a splendid hotel with great proximity to food options. Especially good if you're doing business travel, as I just so happened to be! The service is flawless. They gladly changed my room to a location where I could use an ethernet cable to access the net during my trip. This because my computer doesn't VPN so well on WiFi. With the amount of Japanese business in the area, and the fact that many of them use this hotel for conferences, there is a Japanese and English bilingual concierge and front desk. Made for a great chance to chat casually in Japanese before having to go around and impress big-wigs.The room itself was immaculate and huge. Of course being on a business trip I stayed in a suite. The bedroom was completely separated from the living room and bathroom portions. I could easily have lived in this room quite comfortably. They had two LCD TVs available in case I actually managed the time to watch them, and practically a full kitchen with fridge, microwave and deep stainless sink. All-in-all a superb hotel for any traveler, but especially for business travelers!Let's preface this review by saying we stay here while visiting family because it's really close and convenient to them and it's the only hotel that has smoking rooms and in the winter that's a great thing for my husband! The hotel itself is old, beaten and warn.We arrived, unpacked, loaded the refrigerator with drinks, left to visit family only to come back to our room about 2 am to find the heat in our room didn't work but the air conditioning did. It was something like 30 degrees outside and a cool 60 inside. Called the front desk and she offered us blankets or another room, of course there is no maintenance available in a hotel opened 24 hours a day, that could actually be a normal thing and nothing is "normal" in 2016. We accepted a new room and found one of the lamps next to the bed didn't work and the only lamp with outlets, the kind with outlets on it to charge phones, laptops etc was in the living area. You can't get to the other outlets in the room because they're all behind beds and dressers. It's forbidden to dry my hair anywhere in the room except the "kitchen" while my husband takes a shower because there is no accessible outlet anywhere else!Hilton needs to update this hotel to make its rooms guest friendly and and more appealing. Rooms are outdated and tired looking. The pool tables in the lobby are nice and a great gathering spot when friends or family stop in but once again the furniture could use an update, saggy and old!Front desk staff is always friendly and helpful!This hotel is awful! The service is terrible!! The property is dingy, the rooms are old, the furniture is dated, the restaurant is lousy and apparently the staff does not talk to one another!! Don't expect your room to get cleaned properly, nor your DRY CLEANING to get done! If you stay at this dump be sure to ask various employees the same question, because they all have different answers! One star. Poor.This place seriously is the most poorly managed hotel I have ever been to. They ruined my wedding weekend and I honestly would never stay at a Hilton Property ever again. Disrespectful staff and management. Poor policies and dirty rooms. Seriously do not stay here and find somewhere else to stay.I was offended by their disrespectful management and staff.Shame on you Embassy Suites and Hilton Hotel group.Using my points to stay here a week for vacation I know this area which is great, safe, etc., that was all good,front desk staff was nice, room was clean although I did find a Q-Tip and Kleenex shoved in the bed/wall area... And the room phones DO NOT WORK.. I had to use my cell to call room service. The air flow in the rooms is ok... I have it at 65 and it's still warm in the room. I appreciate the parade/traffic notice however when I got back around 6pm I could not find a place to park...called hotel and was told there was a Nigerian wedding and more guests arrived than expected so, I was directed to the overflow lot ... Umm I 'am the guest, why not make the "wedding visitors" park in the overflow lot and walk??Bad move on hotels part poor poor customer service! Three stars for reasons mentioned.My review can only be for the meeting spaces they have for rent. I was involved in a conference that was held in Saloon 2 and it's was a lovely venue. They had coffee and soda available to is on our way in and water pitchers in the center of the tables. They also had notepads, pens and mints. It was a clean and nice presentation. The hotel had a beautiful lobby and the staff was very friendly.Very nice hotel and great rooms however I was bummed to have to pay for wifi!! Why would you pay for wifi after dropping that much on a room?? They have ports for Ethernet wires but the front desk has like 6" cables and they didn't work...Breakfast was great and was the managers reception!Book it, book it now! Very clean rooms. Absolutely loved the complimentary breakfast buffet with made-to-order omelets. The staff was very friendly and helpful-we went downstairs to get a coke and even tho the machine was broken, the girl gave us two so we wouldn't have to wait. The pool and hot tub were perfect for our 3 year old and it was nice that the pool closed to children at 10. Another awesome amenity was FREE drinks from 5:30-7:30, which even included non-alcoholic drinks for our little one and snacks. I was very impressed with this hotel and will definitely come back if I am around Dublin again!I get cranky when wi-fi isn't included.  I'm not sure if that makes me cheap or just reasonable, but either way, it impacts my experience.  I was at this property for a state-wide conference.  The accommodations were as you would expect in an Embassy, things seemed up to date, I had no issues with my room.  And, I was able to snag a pretty great room rate ($99/night).  The staff were all very pleasant.  Parking was plentiful and free.  A hearty breakfast bar (made-to-order omelettes) and evening drinks were offered with our room.  We opted for the breakfast bar instead of the breakfast with our event that was all sugar and carbs.  I've stayed here more than once, and what I don't love is the interior corridor opening to the space below-it allows sound to travel, and I could imagine if you weren't with our group on the first night, you were annoyed by the volume coming from our happy hour.  But with the suite set-up, maybe you'd be just far enough away.  Otherwise, the event space was equally fine.  There is free wi-fi in the common spaces and, we had it in the conference spaces, just not in the rooms.  That just annoys me, sure I can expense it, but come on.  I'm only going to spend about two hours in my room when I can/would use wi-fi, just include it.We were there on a busy weekend which I think was probably the norm.  Multiple sports teams, a family reunion and a gamer convention.  It was extremely loud with doors slamming all night.  It's probably much nicer during the week.  Breakfast was very good.  The happy hour was ok.  All in all we wished we would have stayed somewhere else.Very nice hotel.  The rooms are clean and very large.  Love that they have a separate living room area with a refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker.  The views are nice and loved being on the 8th floor.  Very quiet, could not hear any street noise, doors slamming, loud talk in the hallway as in so many hotels.  The breakfast has so many hot options with a cook making omelets.  Food is fresh and good.  So much seating options.  Nice reception in the evening with free drinks.  Hotel close to highway and attractions.  Really nice staff, easy checkout, lots of parking.  Highly recommend for the overall comfort, price & great amenities!In my first room, the toilet wasn't attached to the floor.  So, housekeeping somehow didn't notice, the housekeeping mgr who signed off on the room didn't notice (the nuts & caps were laid out next to the toilet) and maintenance didn't sign off on the room.  Different managers thanked me for "bringing it to our attention".  Why would you thank me for something that is ridiculously obvious & at least 3 different people are paid to notice.  They also apologize.  I had to move rooms.  Annoying.  But, they were very nice & they sent up a drink & an appetizer.  Unfortunately, things kept getting worse.  Lost my package for 4 days, asked multiple times, I paid extra for 2 day shipping, finally when I said X signed at this time they magically found it.  The wifi is useless & constantly dropping-maddening!! when you're trying to do work!! The speed, when connected, is pathetic.  The extra fee "premium" is slower than most business hotel's free speed.  I didn't even bother to mention the chewing gum plainly on the bedroom door.  I just started cleaning it myself.  I could say the people are very nice but, that this a bare minimum expectation-not something to grade up for.  I  just want to get this trip over & get out of here.We stayed here and went to a wedding here this past weekend and it was pretty great! The room was nice and clean, and they even brought us some toothpaste since we forgot ours.The breakfast was amaaaaazing.  Free and delicious - doesn't get any better than that!! Overall it was great, we would definitely stay there again if we ever found ourselves in Dublin, ohOur stay was over the July 4th holiday. So lots of people in the hotel. The first night I did not sleep at all because of being too hot and not way to cool the room down as you cant get the temp control to move. My husband was hot as well as he was uncovered the entire night. The second day started off with need to be out of the hotel by 10 am or being stuck at the hotel until noon because of the parade. On the norm that would be ok but when you have not had any sleep. Breakfast was great. When we came back to the hotel July 4th evening went down for the free snacks and drinks only to find a huge amount of people for a wedding reception had taken over the entire hotel, children of all ages playing on the elevators, cramming the halls, screaming, laughing, pushing shoving, you could not get thru, could not get to the snacks or the tables, ,my family reunion had gotten a conference room and the guests for the wedding kept opening the door to our room and trying to get in, again the screaming, elevator joy riding and blocking the halls. No sleep this night either due to the hose of the wedding guests In the halls. I have asked for a refund of this night. But I also want to say my room was dirty chips on the floor from past guests. Took housekeeping until 3 to make up the room. I wanted to take a nap but had to wait for them to clean the room. I will never stay in this hotel again. My entire family was upset but we tried to make the best of it.Convenient location to the Columbus Zoo.   Kroger nearby for grocery shopping.   Rooms are what you expect from an embassy suites.   Breakfast and evening reception are nice like you would expect from embassy suites.  For some reason they still feel the need to change you $10 a day for wifi, that you get for free from hotels that cost 75% less.   Would stay here again if in town.I wish I could give this hotel a better rating because it was a very clean hotel, nicely appointed, and the customer service was very up-to-par. The problem is that every suite in the hotel opens up to the same courtyard (inside, the center of the hotel) where the pool, games, and bar are located AND this hotel caters to large groups. The noise is awful! During our two night stay, the first night, over half the hotel was taken up with a gymnastics meet in town and the second night of our stay, the same problem except with a basketball tourney. Think teenagers. Think loud, excited, copious amounts of teenagers. And, since they had easily reserved over 20 suites, you can imagine who the hotel was more concerned about; certainly not my party who had reserved only one suite. Bottom line: Traveling with a larger party? This is the hotel for you. Reserving for a girls weekend full of Moms who want to relax? Think elsewhere.Oh yes, one more side note: this hotel charges for WiFi! Who does that anymore? $10 per night PER device.I booked a room here for a "staycation" with 2 kids.  I'll admit, I booked here because I found a REALLY good deal ($70/night).  I've stayed a many Embassy Suites previously and knew about the manager's reception, breakfast, etc. So I thought it was a great deal for entertaining 2 kids for the weekend (including the pool!).  All went well on Friday night, breakfast was nice on Saturday, with the exception of the crispy/hard pancakes and the use of butter with the omelets (every other Embassy Suites I've been to, uses water when cooking the omelets).  Swimming was fabulous - the pool seemed very clean (an odd shape, but it's a pool), the hot tub was nice and hot, and we were the only people using the pool.After an outing on Saturday we came back to our toilet flooding... I turned the toilet water off and called the front desk.  They had someone come up quickly to fix the toilet and then housekeeping to clean the bathroom.  This was unexpected and pretty gross.  The manager's reception was nice; the hotel also had kid games you could use (i.e., chutes and ladders, checkers, etc.) and 2 pool tables in the lobby.  Again, we went back up to our room to our toilet flooding!  Another phone call to the front desk ensued and the "fixing" of the toilet happened.  We made sure from there on out that we rarely used that toilet!In addition to the toilet, the remote for the living area TV didn't work.  They replaced it, but when I asked for someone to fix the "movie" function, no one did.  Every time we turned the TV on, it was an ad for adult entertainment movies... not the best thing for children.  Therefore, I couldn't "order" a movie for the kids to watch in the evening, which was a little frustrating.Another positive for the hotel... they had a sheet of paper when you checked in that included local events for the weekend, specials for the hotel (i.e., large pizza for $9.99 via room service), hours of the pool, reception, breakfast, etc.  This was helpful throughout the weekend to know what was available.The kids woke up early to go to the pool on the last day and the hot tub was cold (2 hours after the pool was opened).Breakfast was good... we stayed away from the pancakes since we experienced them as hard/crispy the previous morning.All-in-all, I would go to a different Embassy Suites because of my past experiences, but I wouldn't go to this one again.  The rooms were loud, but not at night; the breakfast is a great addition, although it was different from the other hotels; the pool is a great addition, even though the hot tub was cold one of the mornings; and the manager's reception was nice.  The employees were courteous and helpful, but the biggest reason we will not be returning is the toilet issue and the issues with the TV.Lastly, wi-fi was not free... you had to pay extra for this if you wanted it!We visited the Embassy on 4/1/12 - 4/3/12 and had a great time.  The suite was roomy and clean. Managers reception went well and the morning breakfast was really good.  The pool was clean as well as the fitness facility - lot of  towels for the patronsI am taking away 1 Star due to the following reason - kids (probably within the ages of 2 - 9) ran amuck both at night and during the breakfast with no parental supervision.  Therefore, messes were made and pool sticks were swinging upon the guests. (yes, I have children and no I won't allow them to act that way). Would I go back?  Most definitely.  Just hoping that the parents/guardians or staff puts a stop to the ones that run wild.I'm pretty sure all Embassy Suites hotels were designed to prevent guests from sleeping. The open, echo-filled courtyard fails to block noise from downstairs while simultaneously encouraging guests to hang out in front of their rooms, making noise while hanging over the railing. Also, charging $15 a day for wi-fi after I just spent $140 a night for the room is ridiculous.I do appreciate the manager's open bar every night from 5:30-7 p.m., and the free breakfast is helpful when you can't sleep in.Finally give you a code for free Wi-Fi which helped with business.  Super clean room, luxury feel.  Fantastic breakfast and Managers reception.  Great food and service for event.  Friendly staff.
review_content_20: My husband and I had our wedding reception in October at the Embassy Suites in Dublin. Given that it is a gorgeous venue and the staff was nothing but friendly and helpful to us in the entire time we were planning our reception.  The food was great and we, along with our guests had a good time as well. The only snag was that they were too anxious to put out the 'cookie table' items WAY before the cake was even cut.  Not good. Not when we spent several hundreds of dollars for a cake. As for the beds at this location, I didnt sleep that night given that the pillows seemed to be VERY thin and not comfortable at all. The bathroom was gorgeous and everything else was too. But I was a little upset that I didnt get a good night's rest. We took advantage of the breakfast the next morning, but was a little disappointed in the huge crowd and little place to sit to eat. We didnt get a chance to have an omelet given that the line was too long.  Overall it was a great experience and a beautiful venue!The suites are always nice. A main bedroom and a separate study with two tvs. You also have a mini fridge and microwave. Free breakfast and happy hour daily. Pretty good deal Eh!!  Clink!!After our fifth stay on a New Years Eve & for all of the noise others on this site have complained about, I slept like a baby. So did my daughter & the guests in the front.room of the suite. The cocktail hour was fun. It was nice to meet friends from previous years and everyone was in the sharing holiday spirit. From babies in carriers to more mature.... grandparents(?) . There is something for everyone. On this night, the hotel was full & there were two wedding receptions going on. That made it more special & more fun. The breakfast buffet with made to order omelets was superb! We will go back, again & again!Hotel was nicely appointed.  Rooms were comfortable.  Food was not bad at all.  The menu is very limited with only a handful of items.I was booked here for a job interview between Christmas & New Years during horrible weather.  I'm a Southern California boy so it was quite a change to be in 12 degrees and snow!The hotel staff was outstanding!  Polite, professional, caring and accommodating.  The room was also wonderful.  Had a corner suite and it was outstanding!Morning breakfast was wonderful as well as the evening hospitality.Would definitely recommend this hotel.We were at Embassy Suites for pre and post wedding shin digs. I have always liked Embassy suites, they are ranked on my top hotels because of service, cleanliness, and budget. This embassy suites was very busy this particular wedding....so I understand no early check-ins etc. But the staff was not friendly about it. We had a shuttle set up to the venue and called to see if we could leave a few minutes early. Instead of apologizing for the inconvenience we got a very shot, brisk "shuttle times can't be changed, ok? bye." I get it, they can't be changed that's completely acceptable but maybe be a little nicer about it? Also, my #1 pet peeve when it comes to customer service...when I walk in and say hi to you and you just look at me behind the desk and not say anything back, that really gets my goat. It's not hard to say hi. The shuttle bus driver was great! He sang for us so kudos on that :) On the room: Everything was clean and in order, housekeeping was plentiful if we needed anything. I love the room size it left enough for our hairdresser and make up artist as well as the videographer to all work comfortably at the same time. I will continue to stay with Embassy Suites but this one needs some front desk customer service training.So far so good. Staying here for a work conference. Checked thoroughly for bedbugs and it seems clear (knock on wood). Weird layout. Pretty good food, but as usual for hotels, outrageous prices. Found period blood under toilet seat though - gross. Free wi-fi, which means I will be playing scrabble on my iPhone instead of paying attention, muwahaha.Very nice. Clean and modern. Good bar and good food. Starbucks in hotel!!This Hotel is somewhat older. I was in town on business and this hotel catered to all our companies employees. There is a bar inside the hotel, but beware the close fairly early. The Rooms were spacious and the beds were warm and comfy.

review_content: Ended up staying here while traveling from New Jersey to St. Louis. Exhausted and desperate for a place to spend the night, this was one of the cheapest hotels in town so we booked a room and arrived about a half hour later.  It was around midnight when we arrived, and despite how late it was and how little time had past since we booked our room, everything was ready for us and the staff was friendly as could be.  Check in was quick, and the room was clean and even better than I expected for the price.  Breakfast was minimal, but all we really needed was coffee to fuel us for the rest of the drive so we were more than satisfied.  This hotel went so above our expectations that we ended up booking a room here on the way back as well, and were greeted with the same quick and friendly service.  Oh, and one more thing!  This Red Roof Inn has the fastest elevator in the world.As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the lovely and helpful staff. It was snowing and super cold out so they showed us where we could make hot chocolate while our friend set up the room. The elevators were fast and we got into our room quickly. The view was spectacular and the bathroom was very nice. The beds were a little small and kind of firm, but we managed. Another con was that the parking was $10 and across the street with no cross walks to get you safely across the roads. A pro was the room service. It was super inexpensive and came to our room within 45 minutes. I enjoyed that we had a free breakfast but it wasn't very big. They had no scrambled eggs, bacon, or a waffle maker, which kind of sucked but you take what you can get! Overall not a bad stay considering the price! Would stay there again!You get what you pay for right? Knowing we were going to be in Columbus for one night only and going out with friends all day and night we decided to (for one time in our life, not splurge on the hotel room) humpf. Not sure if this was the right choice. I have to admit, I am a little spoiled. I like my fancy hotels, with modern lines and great amenities, but I can rough it once in a while if the place is at least clean right? Upon arriving we checked into our room and I could not help but notice there were dirty items all around our room. There were what I can only assume were chicken skewers? sticking out of our trash can with bits of meat left on them (EW). And the whole room just seemed like it needed a good vacuum. Another completely mind blowing occurrence - there was no comforter on our bed! There were only sheets and a gross bedspread used for decoration. I do not want to roll up in that. It was so late we just put on some sweatshirts and covered up with the sheets but it was not a comfortable nights sleep to say the least. The positives - The service was friendly. It was dirt cheap. There was a complimentary breakfast (really just coffee, juice & pastries - we didn't end up eating) and most of all they allow pets. One of the only hotels that allow pets in Cbus and we were thankful for that. Overall would I stay here again? No. But it is a good value for some one just looking to lay there head down for the night.I never stayed at a Red Roof inn before and so I was forced to stay here for work. I had called the hotel prior to my arrival and was told to make sure I park in front of the hotel first - check in and then I would be given a card for parking across the street. I am so glad they did - big help!  Also I was impressed the parking is only $10 per day.  I went to check in and they asked for driver license and took down my number which I have NEVER had done in the past 15 years of staying at hotel ever.  I have to also say that I HATE the keys for the room see attached - they are not like a credit card at all - annoying as hell.  I went up to the room - super fast elevator and the room was very nice and very affordable - $79 for King room and they have free wifi.  The only other negative thing for me after a a shower that the towels had stained on them and grossed me out.  I called the front desk and new towels were brought right away.Have to add - the breakfast wasn't that great at allNot really impressed. Granted, we often stay in nicer hotels, but opted to save some money since we've been doing a lot of traveling lately. So here's the run down...Pros:-The hotel was clean. Our room was clean. It had a more modern appearance than I expected, which was nice. -The location was super convenient. Cons:-Customer service. Prior to getting there I called regarding parking. The woman was very short and stated "You have to check in before you can park."  Then she hung up. Rude. -Our room was essentially in the lobby. I'm not kidding. And next to an ATM. It was very loud the entire time we were there. -The room and walls shook whenever we shut the door. That isn't all that comforting. -The "breakfast" consisted of muffins, moldy bagels (yes, moldy), and seriously weak coffee. It wasn't the worst experience, but we definitely won't go back.Well what you're paying for here is the location not the quality of stay.  The hotel rooms are an afterthought to the entire operation.  I will say that the staff was amazing.   Overall definitely overpriced.Our experience. Upon arriving we were told parking is a block away. We arrived after eleven at night. Parking is very limited so we had to park in the convention center parking. Not a big deal except the ticket machine wasn't working right and it took three trips to the front desk to get parking straightened out. Our first night we were in a suite. It was okay. Very large. The overhead lights didn't work and it smelled odd. At the front desk, they just said sorry. The lobby smells horrible. The next night we were in a king room. I liked it better than the suite. Appeared cleaner. If you're looking for a very basic room this is an okay hotel. Personally it didn't suit us.Overall it has been a good experience, the room has the usual amenities (fridge, microwave, TV, lousy coffee, lousy continental breakfast).  On the upside there are a ton of power outlets, on the downside the TV, while having HBO and a decent cable selection, is a wide screen tv showing a widescreen signal but it still shows it letter-boxed. It is also not HD, and this room at least has no guide.The wifi is about as expected, generally decent (as far as hotels and public wifi goes), but it craps out on occasion if you're streaming Netflix or related.There is no restaurant or bar attached, though there is a room service menu, curious where that food comes from.Beware of the surprise safe fee of 1.61 per day. They will remove it if you ask-but only at the end of the stay. otherwise a perfect stay. Great rooms. Handy to downtown. Free use of nearby health club. Parking just ten dollars per day. Walk to convention center or the uber trendy Short North neighborhood. Great microbrewery around the corner. Dive bar pizza joint and bar acreoss the street. cute restaurant next door. Rates are a bargain compared with nearby hotels. Don't miss the North Market. steps to the Capitol. A steal.  Not your typical Red Roof Inn although this is a Red Roof  Plus.Very hard for me to find a hotel in which I walk away saying to myself, whenever I'm in this city, I want to stay here.  Red Roof Inn is one of those hotels.  I stayed here a few months back for a conference being held in the convention center (which is right across the street; you can't get any closer) and again this past weekend to take one of my best friends out in the city two weeks before his wedding.  Both times, I was impressed with the customer service, cleanliness, and accommodations of this hotel.  First off, the staff couldn't be friendlier, made me feel right at home!!  They were constantly asking how my stay was, if I was enjoying the city, or giving me recommendations as of where to go out (bars, restaurants, shopping, etc.).  If you are a people person and enjoy that attention, you will like your stay here.  Next, the rooms and facilities were quite tidy!!!  It's definitely a good thing walking into a fresh and well laid out hotel room. Also, if you forgot any necessities, toothbrush/paste, shaving cream, razor, floss, etc. they have all of that available.  The parking is a ten dollar fee, but I have found that is common for hotels in the area.  Also, for those of you who are big on breakfast, their complimentary breakfast (from 6:30-10am I think) is pretty good!! Both times I've been they've had fresh fruit (apples, bananas, pineapple, mango, grapes), yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, pastries, oatmeal, and more.  Also, if you like to hit the gym, guest get free entry into the gym down the street which is pretty nice with a good mixture of free weights, machines, and cardio.  Long story short here, I'll be back next time I'm in town.The walls are as thin as the pillows. We could hear the people next door as clearly as if they were in the same room. Heard when they zip/unzip their luggage. Heard every text notification they got. Heard conversations they thought were private, but now we know their dirty secrets. Bed was hard and uncomfortable. Mini fridge didn't work. Parking was across the street and an extra $10 a day.Great stay! Convenient location and very friendly staff. Our room smelled like smoke. They promptly, without hesitation, changed our room. They let us do a late check out and gave us details/logistics for the area.I'd recommend this hotel. Looks like they've had a renovation. Stay here! Not the Sheraton at Capital Square.My two cents...Great roomsGood service Parking 10 overnight or at metered which is free on weekends.  Friendly and downtown really downtownClean air conditioned noisy near downtown park across the street 10 dollars per nightNot great really but not terrible. Had to park across the street and walk back across a four lane busy street to get to hotel. TV was funky, each channel change takes like 5 seconds which makes it hard to lay in undies and flip channels for hours, which is number one on my list of hotel qualities of faults. The 1970s Infra Red chicken basting machine type lights above the entrance made me think of Hell more than of the red roof inn, just weird. If you're staying to visit places in the Short North, it's a bit of a hike.I travel often.  I got a room here last minute, well, because it was the least expensive place next to the convention center.  I have to say; not only were we greeted by the most courteous front desk, JJ, the front desk host called our room to make sure we had everything we needed, as well. Not too many amenities, but A+ serviceFriendly, clean, right across from convention center. Parking lot was full when I got there very late. They allowed me to stay parked in there 10 min parking outside the door for 16 hrs ( even after I checked out!)This hotel is much cheaper than the surrounding options, and only slightly less posh, if at all. I have friends that stay here for the Hell City Tattoo Festival. Of course, I live in Columbus, so I've only visited them in their room, never stayed myself. You'd have to ask them about the beds.But the staff was friendly and courteous, the common areas were clean, etc. Those things I can attest to, and I know that rooms are only $90ish in season. A good alternative to the Hyatt if you're attending an event at the convention center.NO! NO! NO! I will not be heading back here! The place looked like it had been recently "updated", but everything in the rooms seemed dirty and dusty. Some people found bugs in their rooms (ceiling lights). There was no lotion provided. The free breakfast included packaged muffins/danishes. There are PLENTY of other hotels to stay at in the area.They did have free Wi-Fi...Nice hotel, with good rates for the area. We paid 46$ and were content with the value for the money spent.
review_content_20: The people are friendly, and informative and the place is clean and inexpensive!  The room was spacious, there was parking directly across the street (for $10/night) is was within walking distance of Goddard Park and all the yummy places in Short North.  There was a mini fridge, hair dryer, free wifi and an above average continental breakfast.  My dog was given an enthusiastic welcome by the front desk manager and there was NO pet fee!  Next time I come to Columbus this is definitely where I am staying!place is nice and clean, spacious rooms and friendly service.  the only bad is that parking is across the streetclean, spacious, surprisingly well-appointed rooms for the price.  unfortunately, somewhat thin walls and floor plates contribute to a noisy experience.  but the low room rates more than make up for the noise.

review_content: My family and I booked a room on Expedia at 6pm on a Friday night and drove 3.5 hours that night to get to Columbus. First of all we had an AMAZING rate. The room we had was quite larger than "higher rated" hotels: big bathroom, large vanity, queen bed, sofa couch for the little CrossFitter, big fridge, big kitchen. It also helped we were right beside the office. Secondly, and more important to us, the staff was great. Immediately we felt welcome. The office staff was awesome, superbly friendly, and the full breakfast was delicious. The kitchen staff made sure the food was hot and plentiful. My family was in town for the CrossFit Cert class at Rogue so we are used to eating a lot! The staff accommodated excellently. When we return to Columbus. We WILL stay here again. Some reviews say the rooms were "outdated." I call it a feel of home away from home. Well done, Hawthorn, well done. #Merica!Where do I begin? This was literally the RUDEST and least professional I have EVER been treated. I reserved this hotel on Hotels.com for 3 nights. Upon arriving at the hotel, I informed them that my friend from Cincinnati was driving up later and I would like to add his name to the room so that he would have no trouble getting a key when. I also asked that I have extra towels sent up and fresh towels daily. (I shower at least 3 times a day. Sorry, I'm just weird like that.) I was informed that it was against hotel policy to have more than two sets of towels in the room at a time, and if I wanted fresh ones that I would need to bring them to the front desk and swap them out. WHAT!!!! Okay. I'm not going to let that ruin my trip. I go to my room and begin unpacking.My friend arrives and he is told by the front desk that his name is not on the room. I'm a bit upset, but I throw on some clothes and walk over to the front. To my shock, it is the EXACT SAME YOUNG LADY THAT CHECKED ME IN that was still behind the desk. I said to her, (Her name is Sabrina by the way.) "You don't recall me adding his name to my room earlier?" "I was busy and forgot. I am the only one working right now." (Which by the way, "I am the only one working right now." and "I am only one woman." were sentiments that she repeated to several hotel patrons throughout my stay.) Again, a little upset, but this will not ruin my trip. We got my friend a key and went on about our business.The following day, I woke up and went and spent some time with family. I returned late afternoon and to my dismay, my room had not been touched. The bed wasn't made, the towels weren't refreshed. I called the front desk and voiced my displeasure, and I was told that "you must have had the Do Not Disturb sign on your door." No apology. No acceptation of blame. Just immediately put the blame on me. I did NOT have any Do Not Disturb sign on my door by the way. I asked if fresh towels could be brought to me, and she informed me that Housekeeping had left for the day and I would need to come bring my dirty towels down and get new ones. How ridiculous is this! I don't want to carry dirty towels around. But what else am I to do. Sabrina has informed me that she is only one woman and could not bring them to me. Imagine my surprise when I got to the front desk and there were in fact TWO women working. So I exchanged my towels, and returned to my room to freshen up.On my last day of my stay, I return to my room from a family brunch, and my keycard will not work. I was with a friend of mine whom was giving me a ride and dropping off a couple of birthday presents to me. I went to the front desk and told them of my issue. Sabrina immediately questioned my friend, "Are you going to the room. I need your ID." My friend obliged, despite the fact that she was merely visiting for a few minutes and not staying in the room. Sabrina saw her ID and told me that one of us would need to pay a $200 deposit or else face immediate eviction. At this point, I have had enough. I asked what the reason was and I was told that if anyone local sets foot in the room, it is a mandatory $200 deposit. If she sets one foot in the room without the deposit paid, it will be an immediate eviction and $250 cancellation fee charged to my card. I then explained all of my frustrations in my two days of being there and Sabrina immediately said that was not her fault. "You chose to book through a third party, that has nothing to do with us. I can't affect them giving you the wrong information." At this point her supervisor, Tammy chimed in and confirmed everything Sabrina was saying. My friend said that she wouldn't go to the room and would wait outside. Sabrina told her, VERY RUDELY, "You need to sit right here where we can see you so that we know you didn't go into the room and wait for him to come back." At this point... I was BEYOND regretting my decision to stay here. The amount of disrespect was APPALLING. After this, they told her that she was now trespassing and either needed to leave or the police would be called. (As Sabrina reached for her phone to call the police.) Tammy began explaining the $200 rule, yet again, and I told her that we understood the rule. Sabrina interrupted me to say, "She is just doing her job and telling you the rules." So I retorted, "So can you please do your job and give me my key?" This infuriated Sabrina and she looked at me with this evil death stare, turned back to Tammy and asked, "Does he have to stay? Because if I have to continue dealing with this attitude..." and pointed to something on the monitor. Tammy came from behind her counter and walked over to Sabrina's monitor to look and said, "Check him out." I have no idea what was on the monitor, nor do I have any idea why I was kicked out of my room. Sabrina then proceeded to check me out of my already paid for room, refused to give me a key AND refused to give me a receipt. The absolute WORST experience.Stayed NYE 2015 . 1)Hotel is very dated .. 2)Couch is old with stains as well as the chairs . 3)Toilet had black water and a ring around the inside . (Disgusting ) 4)Chipped paint off toilet seat. 5)Wood is chipping from bathroom sink . 6)rail to climb the stairs the screw is hanging all the way our so the rail is very loose and not safe for use (the rail outside to climb the stairs was the same ) 7) there was slick ice on multiple stairs to walk up to the room. 8) legit took 25 minutes to check in and there was only two people ahead of me . Very dated and some parts very gross .. Good thing is the noise control is great didn't hear anyone through the night next door . The hotel staff takes a copy of your drivers license and credit card for check in ( they take this from each adult staying in the room ) My friend reserved a room for her brother and her and her brothers credit cards were both booked for the entire amount of the room. She is currently disputing the charges now.I I only stayed here to be closer to a friend . The next time I will make the 20 minute drive to stay at the residence inn. Will not stay at this hotel again .Horrible. Came in 6.22.15 can't do it. I asked for a full refund and I am leaving early. Dirty rooms, not handicap accessible no whirlpool pool out, no elevator to reach food area, no bottle drinking water since 6.22.15. Time to go.I took a break from writing this review to see if time would change my mind, however the experience here has ruined the company in my mind forever!With that being said, IF you value customer service DO NOT stay here. We booked two rooms for my nephews graduation one studio and one penthouse, over a month in advance. Flying in from Nevada with a group of people, one being an infant, and one being a child with autism; we needed the extra space. The penthouse is great as it is two floors with separate spaces and two bathrooms, perfect for people to not be on top of each other. One week before arrival we called to make sure that we had the penthouse and to cancel the studio as a few in our party were not going to be able to make the trip. We arrive and given our room, we enter and immediately know this is not our room, we leave the room upon arrival! No bags even left the car, and we go drive back to the reservation desk.My sister tells the reception agent that this was not our room and the guy immediately got defensive and said that they well fully booked and she would have to deal with it. Proceeds to argue with her and tell her she must have screwed up the reservation. Took no responsibility for the issue and told her that no supervisor was available. She wanted a manager as we had a long travel day and just wanted to speak to a manager but was told no one could help her for the evening. For a reservation person to be so aggressive and verbally attacking a customer, not to mention we had stayed there multiple times, was despicable! There was a large hold deposit on the rooms, we couldn't get that credited back till after the holiday weekend. It was midnight and we had to now drive to multiple places to find vacancy for a large suite or two adjoining rooms. What a nightmare!The effort it took to get the card refunded was outrageous. How hard was it for 1) for anyone to apologize for the miscommunication regardless if they felt that they made a mistake and 2) to not blame the customer and yell at themThis location needs some serious customer service training.BEWARE!! This place is horrible, the rooms were filthy and I itched the whole time, our feet were black from the carpet. The curtains were torn. The people that are permanent residents were scary, I was scared to leave. The staff was rude. I should have listened to the negative reviews. Told us we would have to pay $20.00 for extra towels, this place is by far the worse place I have ever stayed. Residents sit outside on shared balcony with doors opened and music playing. I felt very unsafe.The rooms were well maintained and looked very nice. Everything seemed a little old and out of date so I didn't like that part and it is situated in a somewhat ghetto (or what felt ghetto) part of town. There is a Waffle House right around the corner which was convenient. The staff was nice but nothing special. I didn't wake up early enough for the breakfast so I cannot comment on that.My actual review would be less than 1 star. Stayed here recently. Outside looks much nicer than the inside. Inside is very old, and run down. I considered biting the bullet and paying for a different hotel. The bed linens were disgusting. The shower had a hole in the ceiling covered by a piece of clear plastic secured with safety pins. The sofa bed mattress was also completely disgusting. There were occasional faintly audible smoke detectors going off at around midnight and there was a lot of outside noise as well. Do not stay here!!Do not stay here. We got stuck staying here for exactly 15 hours while driving back to Chicago from DC in late June.
