Our original plan to stay in downtown Columbus wasn't possible due to a huge convention in town that had every hotel room there booked, so we figured we'd look elsewhere outside of town, to get a better jump on the 6 hour drive home.Found this place on Hotels.com, looked at the reviews which were just 'meh' but figured it couldn't be that bad to just stop for the night. Well, it was. We got one of the rooms free (book 10 nights, get one free) so that's the only reason why I didn't demand a refund. One of our rooms smelled of cigarette smoke and the furninture was very old, very ratty. I too would be leery of the clientele here - lots of people loitering, and we were told not to leave any valuables in the car. However, many people there seemed to be staying due to its proximity to Ohio State (15 mins south), so the jury's kind of out on that, I suppose.The wifi worked well, and the breakfast was good as well. There are many restaurant options nearby (Cheesecake Factory was 10 minutes or so) so that's a plus, too, I suppose. But if you're in doubt to the kind of place this is, I will let my pictures speak for themselves... we left the 'calling card' and 'welcome' beers untouched for the next guest....I am currently writing this review from my hotel room. Mom booked the room while she and my dad are moving stuff from our old house to a new one, and I gotta say, this is damn nice. I am really, really enjoying this place and I think I'll be staying here when I am in town to visit if there isn't any room at my folks' place.The room I'm in is a suite with an upstairs loft, a fold-out bed, master bedroom, two bathrooms, and a full kitchen and sitting room. It feels more like an apartment than a hotel. And with as nice as this place is, you'd think it would be around $200 a night. Nope. $80 per night for this suite (Mom booked through one of those discount sites). Their cheapest rooms are $40 a night. In addition to all the awesome perks inside the room itself, there's free wi-fi, a market inside the office (they sell chips, bottled water, cans of soda, ramen, etc.), on-site laundry ($1.25 per load for the washer and dryer), an outdoor swimming pool (currently closed because it's winter time), a tennis court, and a basketball court. Talk about nice!Another thing that makes me happy: they're pet-friendly. My dog and two cats are here with me right now. It's an additional $125 onto your bill when you check out, but it's worth it since the majority of hotels, even the really dingy ones, don't allow guests to bring their pets. They have a designated puppy-potty station so your pup can do his/her business, and they even provide poop bags! There's a trashcan at the potty station so you can immediately dispose of your pup's poo rather than carry it around with you.The area the hotel is in isn't the best. I lived not too far from here (Eden of Easton on Chesford Rd.) and my best friend lived in the Reflections on the Lake apartments on the other side of 161 until this summer. Another friend lived in the Continent apartments with her husband, and those apartments are literally right behind this hotel (they're not too bad, though). The Giant Eagle just around Zumstein Drive has been robbed several times. Obviously, it's not the best location. Still, it's really nice. I don't think its sister hotel, the Baymont, would be here if this area was truly horrible (like, say, Northland and Easton). The area around my old apartment at Eden of Easton was significantly worse than this.As for what's in the area, there's plenty. The Pizza House, Grandpa's, Pizza Hut (ew), Bob Evans, Tim Horton's, McDonald's, Wendy's, and Waffle House are really close by. There's Giant Eagle. On Boardwalk Ave., there's a convenience store/smoke shop, an internet cafe, tanning salons, a GetGo, and a Speedway little ways west on 161. Capri Lanes is also pretty close if you fancy a trip to a bowling alley. Oh, and Auto Zone if you need something for your car.The internet tends to cut out if you're idle for too long, but as long as you're zooming around the web or playing World of Warcraft, it's strong, reliable, and works really well.If - IF - you're a pet parent, bring a pet bed, a crate, some Stink Finder or Nature's Miracle, pet food, and dishes. Bottled water as well. I picked that habit up while my mom and I showed our Birmans. Pets get used to the taste of tap water from home, and tap water tastes different no matter where you go. This difference in taste might cause your pet to avoid drinking and become severely dehydrated. That being the case, get your pet used to bottled water before you travel and then only give them bottled water until you return home. Stink Finder and Nature's Miracle are must-haves anyway, but it's still a good idea to have some with you when you travel. It makes the housekeeping staff's job easier and might reduce the possibility of having to pay for damages to the room if there's an accident.As previously stated, I would happily stay here again. This place is really, really nice, and you get your money's worth.stayed there for 2 days while at the Equine Affair.. not a bad place to stay.. easy off easy on to rt 71.. i would stay there again.. free breakfast... fireplace didn't work but it was a hot weekend so we really didn't need it..First and foremost, I will always look for a Hawthorn Suites whenever I travel. Absolutely more bang for your buck! The loft style suite - full kitchen two bedrooms and bathrooms for $109, the best rate ever! Fireplace, wifi, two tvs, pool, grill area, $109 -heck yeah!Here's the problem, this particular little gem is going down hill fast. Unfortunately this hotel is surrounded by very low budget hotels with poor curb appeal. Unfortunately the whole area is or has changed. The hotel is very difficult to find, even with a navigation system.Here is what was bad: No fully equipped kitchen, not a pot or pan, no glasses, barely any utensils. Completely picked over! Check in was problematic, the credit card machine wasn't scanning properly and a guest made three room transfers during my check in. Not a good sign. Cleanliness, the rooms and bathrooms were good, the kitchen-not. Oven/stove greasy. After the mushroom cloud from the oven was released I just knew the smoke alarm would go off! Lets see, what else - the locks on the entry door were inoperable, maintenance came and replaced the entire system. Oh pets are allowed, I'm sure the policy is at most two dogs. Well the pack below howled and whined continuously. Wifi connection not good at all.So for the good: staff bent over backwards to correct every issue there was. I'm not sure if the problems are due to understaffing, mismanagement or financial reasons. Even with the issues you still get more for your money, spacious floor plan with a loft and separate entry, all for $109+tax, come on now!Overall this hotel chain is excellent in my book (Wyndham), I will continue to use them, unfortunately this location is having some difficulty.So when out of town guest come, this is still the hotel of choice, maybe a different location.My family stayed here at Hawthorn in the pent house suite. Awesome. We had a King suite and a living room and full kitchen along with a loft suite upstairs queen bed. Although it is not a four star motel it was quite clean and management great. We had some plumbing issues but were taken care of immediately. We stayed for 5 nights and were able to spend the holidays with my son in a comfy atmosphere!! After searching on internet we received an awesome rate which made the stay even better!!! I will definately stay here again!!!On December 4th, I arrived at the Columbus North location to begin a four-day stay that I had purchased in advance from a 3rd party website. I was presented with a room that not only appeared to have not been cleaned in several days, but also showed signs of a serious "bed bug" infestation as well. When I attempted to pull back the bed spread on the upper left-hand side of the bed, I noticed a small brown-coloured insect on the pillow itself. After completing a quick search online, I was able to identify this insect as a traditional adult "bed bug." I'm confident that you are well aware of the serious health complications that can accompany a person's interaction with such an insect. Secondly, I also noticed numerous used Kleenex tissues that had been discarded in back of the nightstand and subsequently left for the next guest to discover. Although both of these issues are quite substantial in and of themselves, I would argue that the third item that was discovered could in fact be considered in direct violation of state and federal law: a half-bent tablespoon that was sitting idle on top of the living room couch. The spoon was quickly placed in the trash can, as well as an urgent call to the hotel front desk. The young lady at the front desk was extremely apologetic and horrified when informed of these issues. She agreed to immediately move me to a second room that was located closer to the front of the hotel complex. She also suggested that I speak with her manager, Bethany, the next morning to address some of my concerns. The second room initially appeared to be satisfactory with the exception of white-coloured stains on the living room couch itself. Admittedly, I did not fully inspect the second room until the next morning as it was considerably late in the evening at that point. Several issues were addressed with Bethany the following afternoon: the bug infestation, discovery of used Kleenex tissues, large white-coloured stains on the couch, as well as the serious discovery of drug paraphernalia. Bethany was visibly troubled by these issues, however she was clearly not interested in addressing our health and safety concerns. She offered to send someone up to the room to clean the white-coloured stain off the surface of the cushion itself, however she was unwilling to accommodate us any further than a 15-minute session with a portable carpet cleaner. Although I did not agree with her assessment of the situation, I was willing to give her the opportunity to address the known issue within the second room. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed to discover numerous cleaning and plumbing issues within the kitchen later that evening (December 5th). I also discovered that the dark-coloured carpet had amassed a significant amount of dirt/dust that was only clearly visibly from the bottom of a naked foot. Subsequently, I became unwilling to stay at this location beyond the few minutes it took me to remove my belongings from the hotel room. Although the young lady at the front desk was concerned about the additional discoveries, she was unable to reimburse me for my entire stay. I have already been in contact with American Express to dispute these charges based on the fact that the service provided was not only inadequate, but also hazardous to the guest's health. I am deeply offended by both the presentation of these two rooms, as well as the lack of legitimate concern or response from hotel management. The entire ordeal forced me to make alternative last-minute reservations at an alternative hotel based on the nightly rates that were offered at that time.This place is THE BOMB.The queen suite is nice, larger than your average hotel room, with a sitting area and kitchenette. If you're a Wyndham Rewards member and are looking for a place in the area to spend your points on, GO HERE. You can get a king suite for 5,000 points (the lowest tier), and it's INSANE--a two-level suite with two bedrooms and two full baths as well as the sitting area and the kitchenette. We lived in a house that was smaller than that once!Maybe even better than the room, though, is the breakfast--not your standard Continental breakfast foolishness, it's a real, hot breakfast, with scrambled eggs, sausage, fried potatoes, make-your-own waffles, yogurt, fruit, and things to toast. The rooms are a little more than, say, the Days Inn, but the free breakfast makes up the difference. We love this place and try to stay here whenever we're in Columbus.Dissappointing. Does not look like the pictures. Very old buildings. Granted you can't beat the price and its the best bang for your buck. Can't beat $50 for a room with a kitchenette. So I would stay here again but only because of the price. Don't stay here if you're looking for an uppity getaway.Take it from a retired criminal attorney and police academy instructor, you DP not want to stay at this property or the others near it. The I-71/Rt 161 area is not safe. The drug dealers use these properties for dealing and parties. They rip out the smoke detectors so that they can smoke and party. Blood stains on mattress, mold covered shower, broken door locks, and only one scared clerk on duty for the entire complex. If you had a good stay there, you were either partying with the druggies or oblivious to your surroundings. Cops say it is a hotbed of activity. I'm serious when I tell you that you are putting yourself in danger staying in this area near the I-71.Hotel reviews on other travel websites were very misleading. Rooms need updating/proper service and cleaning. Location's pretty rundown and guests seem to loiter quite a bit. Breakfast was pretty good though. Service was also hit or miss. One female guest rep (daytime) was great while another male gentlemen (afternoon) seemed to care less. Item was left room and called to follow up and retrieve but they didn't seem to care. Asked how he would handle and the situation and response was, "don't leave anything behind." Fair enough. Or avoid staying altogether.YUCK!!! Our room smells musty and is dirty. The sofa bed is stained and sags. It's so bad that we have decided to go home tonight after the event we're attending so we don't have to sleep here. Worse place ever! The only bright spot was the lady who checked us in. She was very nice. She deserves the one star.Very nice and front desk staff. Although we were not able to get breakfast on our first day because they ran out of food, the second day we got our breakfast.
review_content_20: Apparently this used to be  a Residence Inn. Needing a hotel on short notice, I tried Hotwired and got this room for 50 bucks plus taxes. The room itself was OK, clean enough and it seemed safe, but there were a few issues: - There was a sticky spot on the rug. - The sink was leaking and left a wet spot on the rug under it. - The toilet also dripped as it was filling up leaving a wet spot on the floor. - The hot water ran out in the middle of a shower. - The internet connection was spotty at best. The bed was soft and comfortable, and the room sizable with a big kitchen . So all in all not bad for 50 bucks, but If I'd paid the normal rate, I'd be more irritated.PS - if you do stay there, it's a little tricky to find. It's way behind the Giant Eagle in the road paralleling 71. The Google map on Yelp is not showing the correct position.

review_content: Great location; friendly staff; clean, modern facility; and great price for the room (I got a queen room for $129).You're within walking distance of tons of restaurants and several of the big corporations, too, so it's an ideal place to stay on business travel to Columbus.  There's a bar and a little coffee shop inside, and a Max & Erma's right across the way.  I would definitely stay here again.My husband and I stayed here on a Saturday night in February. First impressions were all good: The lobby and hotel bar areas are nice and spacious. A young man checked us in and gave us valet parking for $15 for signing up for IHG rewards, which was nice. The hotel bartender was very friendly and we enjoyed a drink before heading out with some friends. Now the bad: First, the hotel is in desperate need of remodeling. The hallways smelled and the carpeting, wallpaper, and lighting are old and outdated. Rooms are average but also could use a facelift. The ceiling light in our room flickered. The walls are paper thin and we could hear loud conversation clearly in the room next to us all night. I was woken up at 4am and had to call the front desk to send security. Valet attendant didn't offer to help with luggage and instead of saying have a nice day, we got  a "keys are in the car" before he left. My husband had a tip ready in his hand that he didn't even get a chance to give. For the price you pay, this hotel is definitely not worth the expense.  We would not recommend this hotel to our friends or family.My friends and I stayed at this hotel during the ohayocon convention. We experienced difficulty's from the start. In the description of the room we were promised a couch and a microwave which were not present. Almost immediately the toilet clogged and we had to call someone. (We had to call them several more times throughout our stay because it kept clogging) also the mini fridge stopped working in our room as well. I will give it stars because the beds were nice and big. Also with the price of the hotel I was expecting to get a free breakfast but apparently you have to pay for that too. I will say that the employees were very kind and apologetic. But I think next year we will stay somewhere else.Not sure why everyone is complaining about 23/night safe valet parking...Maybe it's Ohio or something because any city I visit with my car, especially downtown, I know there is going to be a 20-something$ for overnight valet parking. Get over it, you're not entitled to have free parking, it's a city. Try DC where the parking for one night is double that then complain. End rant Hotel staff is prompt and friendly. I stayed here for business will most likely be back since my company chooses my hotels for me. There is food at the bar area which was actually amazing! Got a flatbread pizza and it was one of the best I've had. Our waitress was very friendly and fast even though she was serving what seemed like the whole bar! You go girl! The room was clean, big, and nice. I was, unfortunately, right by the elevators and even so it was still pretty quiet. The only complaint I have is that ALL my pillows were firm, no soft pillows. I like to see 2 soft 2 hard pillows in rooms...like tacos ya know. HahaI've stayed at this location about one a month for the last year so I can give you this review on its consistency. The front desk staff is some of the most professional and friendly folks you will run into at a hotel. The bar staff has actually remembered me month to month. Maybe that's a hint and half to become friends with Bill W. or perhaps it's just a hotel used to business travelers who enjoy a nightcap after a long day of meetings followed by business dinners.  Sure the Hilton on the opposite corner is newly redecorated but the staff makes this place. They are all very friendly and kind - everyone you run into - parking valets, reception, housekeeping....after all this time the girl at the coffee kiosk remembers my order. That's amazing. How many people must she see every month that she remembers mine for a few days very month?  It's the staff that makes this place.  Sure, the beds are comfortable. The rooms are quiet. No matter who is in town or how many conferences, your room is nice and quiet. Pay a little extra for the executive level and get a free breakfast and an economical happy hour. As I said,move been here about once a month for 9-10 months and consistently the service all around is very good. I think that makes for a pretty safe bet when choosing a place in downtown Columbus. It's a hop, skip and a jump to the Short North or the Nationwide Arena as well a some really nice restaurants.One star for location and one star for the clean, comfortable room. Everything else was massively disappointing. The pool is a joke. Cold, all one depth (deep!), dirty, and hidden in a musty basement that's only accessible by one elevator which you can't specifically call! You have to keep pressing the elevator button in the lobby and hope the right one comes. That is if the elevators are even working. When we were there they broke and were left to go down 10 flights of stairs if we wanted to leave. Such a disappointing place to stay, especially for the high price.This place is the definition of mediocrity.I stayed here for a conference at the convention center. Location is the best thing this hotel has going for it. It's close to the convention center but also to the Short North, so you're not stuck in the urban wasteland that is other parts of Columbus's downtown.The hotel itself is nothing special. The rooms feel old a tired. The hallways feel dark. The carpeting is in desperate need of a refresh. This isn't hotel I'd pick if I were traveling for pleasure, but for business, it got the job done.We had our wedding reception at this venue in July of 2015. The early planning stages went well and were actually quite fun. Unfortunately, our wedding coordinator left the company just two weeks prior to our wedding. This definitely freaked me and my wife out. The new sales person did the best she could. She was very professional and down to earth; however, if we knew this would happen, we obviously would have went somewhere else. The new sales person did not seem to have much experience with weddings and being creative with decorations, signage, etc. I would at least wait until they hire a dedicated wedding and large event coordinator before going to this place. We had other issues as well: The hotel rooms were completely booked several months before the event, and we weren't told by the staff. This meant that a portion of our reserved block went to guests that were there for a different event. The main reason we chose the place was for its value and convenience, being that our guests could stay there. This was a huge let down. By the time we figured the hotel was booked, nearly all other hotels downtown were also booked. There was a 31 gifts convention going on that weekend, which is why everything was booked. Our 2nd issue was the traffic of all the non-wedding guests on our event floor, likely from the other event in town. We were told the floor would be dedicated to us and our guests. We even had items stolen from our toiletry baskets in the restrooms. Given it was a fairly intimate wedding, I doubt it was one of our guests who stole the items. They should have had a sign easily viewable stating "private event" or something of that nature at the bottom of the steps to our event. Our 3rd problem is that we were supposed to receive a gift card for signing up with the hotel. After repeated attempts, we have not received this card. Our 4th problem was the lack of communication between the staff. Many of our guests calling in for reservations were given conflicting information regarding room rates, valet parking, etc.There are lots of nice places downtown to have a wedding reception. At least at this point, don't limit your options to this venue.Solid Crowne.Great staff.Decent bar food and drinks.Love the outdoor seating area with fire pit!Beds are good. The rooms are very comfortable.Typical setup. Great office/ desk space. Fridge in room (always a bonus).I ordered room service (breakfast) and the prices were very reasonable! The food has been consistent each time I have been here.Very convenient location downtown.Great location downtown, directly across from the convention center and down the street from a great running trail.Comfortable beds, fridge, desk, working toilet and shower/bath.  What more do you need for a great night's sleep on business?We have stayed at a variety of hotels both budget priced and nicer. I'm honestly not sure why we paid the extra $$ for this place.  We booked because of the pool and game room for the kiddos.  This was a spring break mini- vaca for them.  No game room and probably one of the weirdest isolated pools I've seen down in a basement.  The room itself is fine, but not any nicer than a budget room elsewhere.  Also, no breakfast(which we knew) and paying for parking every night leaves me wishing we would have stayed somewhere else.  Certainly not worth the money spent.Stayed here over the weekend for the 'Last Chance for Boston Marathon'.  Overall, I thought the hotel was very clean, the staff was welcoming and enthusiastic, and the hotel was a great host to all of us runners.  Overall, I am struggling to find anything negative about my stay beside the fact that the hotel wanted to tack on an extra charge of 5 dollars a night for an in-room microwave and 10 dollars a night for an in-room refrigerator.  Maybe I'm just a small town man and not use to the way things are run in the big city, but I can't remember the last time I paid 100 dollars a night for a hotel room and was told that such luxuries as a microwave and refrigerator would cost me an extra 15 dollars when I would probably use a whole 10 cents in electricity with these appliances in a 24 hour span.  In the end, I didn't need the refrigerator and forked over the 5 dollars for the microwave but I'm not complaining because I ran a 2:53:32 marathon, qualifying for the Boston marathon while I had a very nice and comfortable sleep and a hotel in a convenient location.  I will see you next year for the next marathon!!!Highlights: Room service is prompt and reasonable, shuttle service, clean.Lowlights: Extremely noisy, lots of children running around for a tournament, making noise my first two nights.  My second two nights included large groups of intoxicated people yelling in the hallway, jumping in the elevator until it broke. There was also the hotel bar directly below my room, where there was also lots of commotion.  You can hear everything through the closed windows.  I had to call the operator for security twice and when I checked out, I notified the management about the noise level when I checked out and I was told that was "normal" for Friday and Saturday nights.  I would not recommend this hotel for business travel.I have stayed here many times for business. It is just ok, nothing special. It's clean and they have room service and a lobby bar as well as a shuttle to take you around town.There is also quite a lot with in walking distance, so the location is good.If you are looking for this location but want something with a litle more style, stay at the lofts - they are connected to this hotel, but are more boutique style and you can walk across to the Crowne to use the amenities there as well as the shuttle etc.There are some bars and cafe's that you can walk to, depending on the weather.Not entirely sure how this place is a 4 star hotel. I think that system is completely defunct. Ended up here because of "name your price" on priceline, and we picked 4+ hotels. The base price itself wasn't bad, but then remember that you have to pay around $20 for parking unless you want to risk parking your car on the street. Since we were only stopping here for the night and didn't want to leave our car with everything inside on the street we chose to go for valet. The lobby is nice, but once that you go up in the hotel you see what I mean about BS 4 star rating. The halls are not well kept, looking pretty beat up. The room itself was nice, but when I looked behind the bed for plugs it was just a mess of dust and dirt. I think the positive was the concierge service. They were really nice and brought up toothbrushes and toothpaste for us at like 3 am in the morning when we realized we had forgotten them. It's also connected to some local chain restaurant and they will bring you anything from the restaurant up to your room.Accomodations are decent but it's an old hotel charging new hotel prices. This was way too expensive for what I got.No central air. Tacky carpeting. Lack of available power outlets. The furniture is decent but it was kind of like lipstick on a pig.  It's about a 10-minute walk to Short North. Unless you're hanging out exclusively in the downtown area, the location isn't close to Short North.Customer service: They aren't going to go out of their way to greet you or ask if you need luggage assistance but they took care of two problems I had.The Crown of Holiday Inn. The top shelf ! Well I do not think so. Nice lobby and lounge, but the place was not very clean. We stepped out of the elevator on our floor and you would think they would vacuum the floor. It was down right dirty. We walked to our room with the Bell Hop. The room smelled musty, it smelled like they have not had any clients in it for a long time. That old smell you get in homes, that is the smell. Other than the dirt and smell the Crown Plaza was OK. Great location and they do pour a strong drink in the bar. But they can not make Mojito's ! Be prepared to valet park and tip here. The service was great with valet parking and Bell Hops.Great place to stay when you want to be within walking distance in the Arena District.  Lots of room to move about, great on site gym (albeit on the small side), beds were comfortable.What I didn't like was the connectivity to the Internet, valet/garage parking, or the confusing hallways.But I still enjoyed the stay while here.  The surrounding area is great if you wanted to be within walking distance of some great eating establishments and some awesome local owned shops for shopping.  Columbus is a huge city, and this location of the hotel was very close to the downtown area and government buildings.These places are such hit and miss spots... This one I have neither a plus or minus to make me lean either way, which is neither a good or bad thing.It was a business trip, so it was one, two, three, check in, change for dinner and out.I hated that they had a queen double for me, after reserving a king... oh well, my suitcase gets its own bed.I did NOT like that there was not a coffee spot in the morning.  Had to wait for the bistro to open and order a cup of coffee.  For food/breakfast/dinner - you had to cross over the valet area and eat at Max and Ermas.So when a hotel doesnt supply food, aint that grand.  We are travelers and part of our living arrangements for the day/week etc should have easy access to food...I came back one day from a full meeting day and the lobby, bar, restaurant, was loaded with people- so loud and noisy, there was a convention going on at the center across the street and you know what that's like... the amazing thing was it smelled of bacon, but there was no way I was going to eat there so I crossed the street and had tilapia with a side of broccolli for $12 at Max and Erma's...Other than that, it was ok.  I travel for work, so all I want is a good bed, with decent air conditioning (no, not freezing or broiling) clean bedding and a loud alarm clock.  So it met it needs.I am not understanding the negative reviews of this place.  Our stay couldn't have been nicer, nor the staff friendlier .  Room clean.  Attention paid to detail.  Our bed was turned down for us when we returned from our evenings out.  There were fancy expensive chocolates on the bed, the robes were on the bed waiting for us, and soft classical music playing in the room, and a soft light turned on for us.  VERY nice touches.  Four pillows per double bed, which was another nice feature.  Modern bathrooms but with the typical shower/tub.  Very nice freebie lotions and shampoos. The staff was amazing.  My sister had made the reservations for three rooms but the staff was most accommodating when it came to payment since we all wanted to pay for our own rooms.  Jeremy the valet attendant was helpful, attentive, quick, and knowledgeable.  If you don't know where to dine, just ask him.  There is a shuttle too.  We chose valet parking at $23/day. We are used to this though, and I know it sounds steep but we didn't want any hassle with our car getting broken into, or walking a good distance with luggage in hand.  Valet Parking is worth it in my opinion. Ryan the Operations Supervisor did me a great favor.  My sisters and I were in a quandary, my elderly mother needed some flat shoes to wear to a wedding reception - her feet were swelling and her own heels were getting uncomfortable.  We shopped across the street for something but could only find flip flops.   I asked Ryan with a strange request that if there is a pair of women's shoes, size 8 in the lost and found that have been there forever and it is obvious that no one is coming back for them, can we have them?  He went down and found something we could use.  We offered to return them but he told us we could have them.  Thankfully they weren't dirty and disgusting.  He listened to my request and had a great attitude about the whole thing.  We were so grateful for him and he was a perfect example of how someone in the service industry should behave, as was the rest of the staff at Crown Plaza.  The free breakfast (don't forget your coupons!) at Max and Irma's was very good. Nice fresh omelettes, good fruit and good coffee.  Thank you Crown  Plaza!!!
review_content_20: I really want to give this place 2.5 stars.  Upon arrival, you are given a "choice" of $23 a night valet, or, $11 a day somewhere around the corner, down the street over there....The lobby is great and they actually keep the bar open late.  So far, the lobby is straight out of 2012.; nice.  When the rickety elevator arrives, be prepared to be hoisted (very slowly) into 1975.  When I got off of the elevator, I half expected Joe Namath and Bad, Bad, Leroy Brown to be walking around.  Carpet and walls simply DATED!  Alas, arrive in your room and you are time-traveled back to 2013.  Room is updated and clean.  Sub-par toiletries, but the room was comfortable and modern.  They want to charge $9.95 for Internet...when will hotels get over this charge, or, at least make it reasonable.So, if you wonder why 2 stars, it is because for the price, it should be a bit better.  It make be closer to a 3 if you get a discounted rate, but really, you get better amenities and a lesser charge at the Drury Suites across the streetNice hotel in downtown Columbus and close to the convention center and the Nationwide arena.  The King Corner Suite had plenty of space for four with pull out bed in the sofa.  Downside was only one TV for a suite.  Overall nice hotel for the price.Expect to pay valet $24/day or $17 if you're a priority member with in and out priviledges.  If you go public parking overnight, it's the same price so go with valet. The entrance has automatic doors, the lobby is spacious, an check-in was a breeze. There were 3 elevators but they really took too long.  We tried to take the stairs from our floor but only lead to the outside which would trigger the emergency alarm.  As to the room, we got a king suite with a sofa bed. Sitting area was roomy. And the bed was huge. The bedding was fantastic, the pillows were fluffy and the sheets were soft and luxurious.  I definitely got a good night's rest!I was able to find everything without too much effort.  What I mean is I could access the sometimes had to find light switches, lamps, outlets, and thermostat.  I called the front desk a few times and I received excellent customer service: friendly, professional, and helpful.  I didn't spend too much time using the facilities (gym, pool) but I'm sure they were nice.This place gets four stars for location and friendly service! It was conveniently located near short north and made running around town a breeze. Valet,  front desk staff and cleaning staff were exceptionally nice - probably the nicest I've ever encountered at a hotel ever. The rooms - meh - but I didn't really care about a fancy room. Just needed somewhere to lay my head and shower. Reasonably priced, great location and super friendly staff! Will use this hotel again next time I'm in town!i stayed there last month for 3 days.(I got a steal on priceline) I have Nothing bad to say.. The area was nice. Im a sucker for good service, and they SOOOOO have that. The shuttle driver/valet was the star of the show! His name was Chad. man he was great! i had to use the (free shuttle) 3 times.. I got to all 3 appointments in a timely manner, dude was chill, and he picked me back up on time! And my phone actually worked in that hotel so Big plus there.. The house keepers have this aroma therapy stuff thats Awesome!Thank you guys for a chill trip!Stayed here while interviewing at the medical center just a short distance away.  Very convenient location and nice clean rooms.  The front desk and shuttle drivers were very helpful in accommodating my schedule and helping me get around.  I'd stay here again if i came back to the area.Nice Hotel, very cleanA horrible place.  Stayed here Bout six times and almost always ran into issues.  The last one was explosive feces in the bathtub that wasn't cleaned by the staff.  Loud and rowdy, not what I expect from a hotel.  I would only recommend this place to my enemies.F__K this place. Snotty staff, reluctant service, and old carpet, smelly rooms. This sums up my experience: First thing I asked the creep of a front desk dude (after he had finished fawning all over a wealthy-looking guest) was if they had some sort of continental breakfast. His response? "Um, we're not a Holiday Inn Express, sir".  Well excuse the hell out of me. Instead of letting him know about the other places I've stayed that are better - cheaper ones and high dollar - I'll just stay at one of those next time.Really, I would prefer to give this place 3.5 stars - I appreciated the location and the rooms were certainly nice, with comfortable beds and appropriately layered blankets and a variety of pillows. Unfortunately, there were issues: the internet access was spotty and unreliable, often dropping out for up to twenty minutes at a time. The climate control in the room seemed to have only two settings, despite a digital thermostat on the wall - either it was the tundra or the desert, and the windows were non-openable, plus also unpleasantly small (much smaller than a classic hotel window, giving the room a gloomy cast at all hours). The pool, located in the basement, is very strange - constructed like a lap pool, at 5 feet deep all the way across (no shallow end) but far too short for actual lap swimming.The staff, however, were overall /wonderful/. Frank at the front desk addressed the internet issues as best he could, calling for tech support and refunding our internet charges. Nicole produced change, envelopes, directions and restaurant recommendations, and when we called down to ask about a nearby movie theater Katie had a printout of the movie times sent up with discount coupons attached. We were generally welcomed every time we came in and greeted warmly by the front-of-house staff, who really were working hard to make things right.I'd certainly stay again, though I would be sure to ask for a room near a router, and on a higher (and, I assume, sunnier) floor. Also, because I got this room on Hotwire, it was $72 per night including taxes, which seemed quite good for this property, and made the room feel more like a value than it would have if I had paid the advertised price, at nearly double.I stayed here last weekend for a friend's fraternity's formal. Overall, good experience. Positives: I didn't have to pay anything (woot!) but I know the guys got a great deal. Our dinner was delish. The bed was comfy. Negative: Room service came at 9 am. Really?I can't say much more because I was only there for one night but it's a good location and I'd recommend staying there if you're in the area.I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Terrible customer service. Expectation to leave your keys with the valet just to checkin.  The Valet while pushing their service did not tell us the correct price of the parking garage next door.  I was pleasantly surprised at the low cost of the garage.   I've traveled extensively for work and expect better service and cleaner rooms!Stayed here for a family wedding. My only complaint was the room desperately needed dusting. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great and beds very comfortable. Convenient to the skywalk and many good restaurantsThis hotel is in a good location.  You can easily walk to the Arena district which has plenty of bars and restaurants in it.  The rooms were decent sized, and the hotel was clean.  The staff is friendly. Nothing to wow you with , but simple and easy.This was one of the best experiences ever!  First, the hotel is up-to-date!  Clean everything!  The rooms are very nice and there is a lot of small detail they focused on - to include making a nice box to cover the ugly air conditioners typically seen in hotel rooms.  The staff was super nice!The best was that my husband and I went there for our first ever Ohio State Football game.  We didn't know anyone and we're going to be tailgating or anything.  That is - until we were offered a deal from the hotel.  For $25 a person it was all you could eat and drink tailgating in a great corner in the stadium parking lot.  They had a very nice set up with great food and 3 TVs.  They began 2 hours before game time and were there until 1 hour after the game ended.  They were the nicest people. When we showed up we were greeted with two very nice people (one lady was the General Manager of the Crowne Plaza) and we were offered drinks, and somewhat catered to.  We got food and our drinks and sat down in those awesome comfty folding chairs.  These people were so awesome - they would come and throw away your plates and they would get you refils and they were just so very wonderful.  It was clear there were "regulars" that attended this tailgaiting.The only reason for not giving the 5th star was because their pool was terrible - even though its listed as a lap pool - it was dirty and gross.  Also, their cafe has weird hours and there was no good breakfast place without going to Max and Ermas.  When the cafe was open - the breakfast choices were poor at best!All in all a great time and next time we go to an Ohio State Football game we will certainly be staying there.I don't think the first review counts cause he hasn't been there yet.  So, here is a more appropriate review.1 star for the location.  It's in a nice area only 5 minute walk to the very trendy, gay friendly strip on High St.2 stars - cleanliness and manicured landscaping3 stars - customer service.Downers: No free parking.  The closest structure to the hotel offers $12 a day parking.The hotel itself offers $26 valet.Bed could have been more comfortableI think only one elevator was working at the time.Save your money and find another hotel.  Old rooms, not the cleanest.  Turned my lights on when I entered the room and closed the door behind me and the lights went off from the door closing.  Room service is awful and the customer service was non existent.  I travel a lot for work and this is one of the worst hotels I've stayed at.  I would never stay here again and wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy.Cannot really complain too much about this place since my law firm client was paying BUT...  there is a Hyatt across the street which I'm sure is 100% better..  Anyway the rooms were clean although mine was strategically placed right above all the HVAC units for the lower parts of the building and across from the parking garage..  Gotta love that!!!  Carpet looks like it is right out of that 70's show..  Ashton Kutcher are you punking me???  Room was clean but let's not kid ourselves this is not a four star hotel maybe not even three...At one point there were about 15 people waiting for the elevator in the evening.. umm.. and the bar staff downstairs while accomodating one bartender started talking about filling bags with his own feces (insert a word that starts with 'S') and throwing them onto the field if the NFL brings in non union players... that's what I want to hear about for sure after a long day some bartenders s*** in a bag - wait aren't we in Columbus is there an NFL team here...Decent enough, but had some basic flaws that made it difficult to give more than the "Meh, I've experienced better" two star rating.It's a good location, and service was prompt and friendly.  I found it to be clean, no problems on my usual checklist of stuff.  Shower was nice.  I'd stay here again, except for one big problem which removes them from my list:1) The noise.  I had some serious suspicions when I got to my room and found a nicely wrapped package of earplugs.  Saturday night, I found out why - there is apparently a venue nearby (outdoors, no idea where) that was featuring a rap venue until around 1:30 AM.  The windows are poorly sealed, so I got full benefit of the music.  The room door had a HUGE gap underneath (probably 3/4") and the additional noise in the hallway was like it was right in the room.   Clearly, management does not stay in their own rooms enough.(the other three problems below were minor, but warrant mentioning)2) The elevators.  I was fortunate enough not to be with the people who were trapped in the elevators a few minutes before I got to the elevator lobby one evening.  The elevators smelled bad.3) This is a minor gripe, but the chair at the desk is like a spandex sock wrapped around a metal frame.  Possibly one of the worst chairs I've ever sat in.  4) If it's the football season, and you're not into football, you might keep a close eye on the schedule.  The place was overrun with Miami fans, who were loud and drunken until late at night on both nights.  I assume pretty much any "game night" will see similar activity.Price was not cheap.  Two nights: $509.  For the mid-west, that's pretty steep.  Not worth it, given the noise issues.I had a good experience here, mostly because I got a killer corporate rate and $5/day valet parking.  Can't go wrong with the arena district.  Renovation and rooms are nice.  Front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Only complaint are the elevators, very slow... sometimes extremely slow (1 floor every 30 seconds).
review_content_40: I wish I could give 3.5 stars....It was better than 3 but just not quite a 4.  After reading some of the reviews, I'd have to agree with many of the recurring issues mentioned.  I stayed here for a family wedding, and while it wasn't a bad experience, it wasn't outstanding for the price we paid.  The room was clean and the staff was mostly friendly.  The maid service was a little slow and one day was non-existent.  The shower is a little short for people over 5'8" or so.  The temperature in the room was difficult to regulate -- even though there was a digital thermostat on the wall.  We did figure out the last day that the window opened but it was a humid June day so it didn't really help.  The elevators were slow and sometimes didn't stop right in line with the floor/door.  I truly expected to get stuck on there at some point or another.  I asked for a late checkout, and while everyone else that was part of the wedding group was given 2 pm, I was told they couldn't accommodate me past 1 pm.  The required valet parking is expensive at $23/day.  They charged me for two cars when I only had one.  However, the girl at the front desk did promptly take it off when I brought it to her attention.  The actual valet staff were very nice...so they have that going for them. It would be nice if they offered an airport shuttle. There isn't a brand-name coffee shop around, but the cafe in the lobby isn't bad.  The girl working there was talkative and helpful.  I liked the bar area and outside seating with the fire pit.  I had hoped to try the pool and fitness center but didn't get a chance.  I was pleasantly surprised to find out the internet was free!  The bed was comfortable, and I liked having a refrigerator in the room.  I loved the location and would stay here again if I was able find a reasonable discount when booking.This review is based solely on their intelligent customer focused policy on internet access.  I haven't had a chance to stay here yet, but I will on my next trip to Columbus, based solely on the fact that they get it.  In fact they should just change their wireless SSID to something like:"Checkout of the Hyatt and Check-in here for real customer service"I stayed here for Columbus Pride. It was perfect because of the location!!! You are in the Arena district and just walking district to Short North. The hotel was clean. The room was great and the staff were very friendly.I didn't test out any of the hotel amenities because I did everything outside since it was Pride weekend. I did have trouble with the soda machine because it wasn't dispensing so I took the stairs down to another level to get drinks. I wished they had a snack vending machine. Especially at 3 am when I was roaming the halls for one. You dont get 24 hour room service so bring snacks. I like the mini fridge that was empty for your use.My only complaint and it's a big one was the doors!!!! The doors are heavy and when they close they slam hard! So in the morning all I could hear is dozens of doors being slammed shut over and over as people were checking out for noon deadline. Then the following day I heard the same thing over and over again. I peep through the peep hole to discover it was a supervisor checking each room to see it was cleared out. I was partying all night  I needed my sleep!!! They needed to install retractable arms so it would pull the door close quietly. I made sure to write that down on the comment cards. I doubt they would do it since it's a privately own Crowne Plaza. Every penny counts there. They don't even offer airport to hotel shuttles like the other Crowne Plaza locations.I didnt get to eat there but I LOVE the BIG wooden tables with high chairs you see in the lobby near the bar area as you walk in. Make sure to sit there and hang out for whatever reason. I finally got my chance as I waited for my shuttle to arrive. I want it for my house now!Great location if you are working downtown and not far from great bars and restaurants. 1 star for location 2nd star for nice rooms (excluding the AC unit)  The customer service was not very good, in a half empty hotel they initially put me in a room by the elevator, then put me into a room with a defective AC unit, everytime the wind blew against the hotel it would blow cold air into my room. Oh and yes it is bloody windy in Columbus in the winter!Double Tree suites down the street next time, Mmmmm choccy cookies :)Its a pretty good location if you're on a vacation. Not for business travellers. It is kinda far to walk to work. The room sucks. I had a nice view of their parking garage from my room. The lighting is not very good either. The best part of the room was the flatscreen TV for me. The wireless internet is not free but its a very nominal fee. They have a nice bar downstairs and Max & Erma next door though I didn't eat there. The pool in the basement sucks big time. It's kinda creepy to be swimming there alone. There is a skywalk to the Convention Center and the building next door which is pretty cool.

review_content: Go Yelp.  Let me start by saying I found this gem because of Yelp.  Now. It isn't a luxury hotel.  No room service. No frills but.....totally great place at a totally awesome price.  Room was perfectly clean. Beds were comfortable and linens were nice.  Not a complaint about the place. The service was awesome and the free breakfast and happy hour were great. My kids loved the pool, which was indoor/outdoor. Do yourself a favor.  Save yourself some money and stay here. You won't be sorry!!!!I cannot give this place anything less than five stars.  Everything is always above par here.From the point we arrived until the moment we departed the service was excellent.  I love how nice the employees are here.  To me, they genuinely enjoy their jobs and seem to go out of their way to make your stay an extraordinary one.  I have to suggest becoming a member of their rewards program called Gold Key Club.  You get some amazing perks with it.  The one time I used it to my advantage was to ask for a roll-away bed.  Due to the program, I got this with no charge to me.  As always, free breakfast and dinner, or as they call it, Kickback.  The menu changes depending on the night.  I noticed this time around that if you do not stay at the restaurant you can still partake in these meals for a fee.  Indoor/outdoor pool, hot tub, small gym area, small business center, connection to the Convention Center where there is a food court/small shopping center, grand piano in the lobby, gated parking garage.  If I kept listing the advantages of this place I am sure I would run out of space for this review.This will always be the first place I look for a room when I come to Columbus.  The proximity to Downtown, Arena District, Short North and surrounding area is very convenient.Wow!  What a find.  Was in town for a concert, looked at hotels downtown and this one was the least expensive.  What put it over the tops were the "perks".  Free happy hour complete with food, and real food at that.  Free hot breakfast with a ton of options.  The room was nice and is outfitted with a microwave and mini fridge.  The staff was super friendly, going out of the  way to make sure we felt welcome. I'd stay here again in a second!Even though could not hear the staff due to noise level of ComicCon, they were very friendly and courteous as well. Had to call Front desk at night due to loud guests in the next room. Within a few minutes the staff answered the call and was able to finally sleep. Really enjoyed the fact there was on-site garage so that my brother and I did not have to find other parking for the hockey game. The free hot breakfast buffet was a real plus as well.This place far exceeded my expectations. The room had some great design considerations with HBO on demand as well as a 37" LCD TV. If this wasn't enough they serve dinner from 5:30-7:00pm. For dinner I had. A salad, macaroni and cheese, chicken tenders and nachos with cheese. They also give you three complimentary drinks so o had a bourbon neat, a dry martini (with olive) and a glass of wine! ..just to see if it was real. I left full and satisfied. After dinner I worked out in the onsite gym and them swam in the pool until it closes at 10pm. When I woke up the hotel provided breakfast! And not those cheap continental ones. This one was a spread. They had fruits, oatmeal with raisins, brown sugar or granola, yogurt, bagels with a toaster, donuts, muffins, orange and apple juice, milk, 4 cereals (rice Chex, Cheerios, raisin bran, lucky charms). The also served breakfast potatoes, scrambled and boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy and sausage. They had a begin waffle station as well as the toppings. I didn't know Drury provided all of this for such a good price. If definitely stay here again!I'd never stayed in a Drury chain property before and wasn't sure what to expect.  I have to admit, I was absolutely stunned- pleasantly so.  I actually ended up bummed that their geographic coverage is relatively limited (looks like south, Midwest only).Though I got here too late for the evening free food and drinks (check out other reviews, though- sounds like quite the spread), I did enjoy a decent free breakfast. I got there early and everything was just being set up. There was a nice variety of fresh and decent food.Staff was friendly and efficient. My room, the lobby, common areas, even the parking garage for gods sake- were immaculate. (Okay, maybe the parking garage wasn't immaculate, but it was reasonably litter-free, brightly lit and felt safe, which is all you can really expect.)I'd stay at another Drury property in a heartbeat based on this stay.A great resource if you are staying at the convention center. Reasonably priced. Clean modern rooms. The daily breakfast and cocktail hour food bars were invaluable (especially on a family weekend stay). Very convenient to High St., so there's lots to do.We stayed across the street at the red roof inn plus+ for a few nights; we're here on business. Honestly we were just trying to save some money. Long story short, we were supposed to go to Kent but decided to spend an extra day in Columbus and we wanted somewhere new because the beds and parking at the red roof suck. We didn't have a reservation,  but Yodit took great care of us. All we asked for was a single queen or king and nothing fancy. The first availability that popped up was for two double beds and we were ok with that, but Yodit found us a suite for the same price! The room was beautiful, had a decent view, and Drury offered us free drink vouchers and a hot breakfast bar. We were blown away by the quality of service. We'll definitely be back next time we need a place in Columbus.In town on business, and stayed at the Drury.  The room was spacious and clean, a great value for the money.  Complimentary breakfast and dinner, with free drinks in the evening.  It was attached to the convention center, which was perfect for me.  I wish the hotel had a restaurant, but there are restaurants within walking distance.  Very secure.  Your key is needed to use the elevator, and to get into and out of the parking garage.  Very pleased.Came here with the family to attend the National Volleyball tournament.Hotel is VERY convenient being connected by a short covered walkway to the Convention Center. Not "cheap" but reasonable for what you get:1. Free breakfast 2. Free dinner3. Free alcoholic drinks (limited to one or two I think)4. Free soft drinks5. Free wifi6. Free parkingI haven't been to too many hotels that offer that much for free.Granted you probably wouldn't want to eat the breakfast and dinner everyday (food is pretty much the same) but it's an option and will save you money.Staff are helpful and friendly.Rooms are spacious and nice with flat screen tv's.The showerhead (Hansgrohe rain head) is VERY relaxing and I'm planning on getting one for my shower at home.The only cons are:1. Rooms aren't insulated well and you can hear noisy kids running around or playing in the rooms.2. Towels are like sandpaper.  I know good cotton towels are expensive but would be nicer.All in all I'd definitely stay here again!I spent the night at the Drury downtown. There were some things I liked and some things I didn't like.The room was great. I had a nice view. Free wifi. The bed was very comfortable. Lots of mirrors, lots of light. No issues at all. I liked the happy hour and breakfast. This added a lot of value to my stay. Free food and drinks are not a problem for me. Check in was easy. The staff was delightful. Parking was a breeze. The garage is nice and feels secure.The location can't be beat. It's connected to the convention center and all of downtown is right out the front door.The pool was just ok. It was overrun with kids most of the time and the hot tub was not warm enough. Not the end of the world, but it could have been nicer. There is no bar, no restaurant, no room service. If you want food in this hotel show up when they're serving or you'll have to fend for yourself. I don't know if it was because it was a holiday weekend, but I swear, some of the guests I encountered did not seem to know how to hotel properly. First of all, you need to wear a shirt to the buffet, hi. This dude had his shirt off every time I saw him. Come on buddy.Second, it's best to allow people to exit an elevator instead of putting your head down, charging forward and hoping for the best. The guests are not the hotel's fault of course, but the high degree nonsense I experienced was a drag. All told I had a pretty good visit and the price was right. The Drury doesn't nickel and dime you like most hotels with hallways. I would gladly stay again on a weeknight. For a weekend I would probably pay a little more and stay somewhere else.Will never stay anywhere else in Columbus!!! This place is awesome. Super helpful friendly staff. Great breakfast and Happy Hour - fantastic!I have stayed at literally hundreds of hotels and motels across North America.  We visited Columbus, Ohio recently and found Drury Inn & Suites through an internet search.  This hotel far exceeded our expectations.  We stayed in a two-room suite that was very clean and in excellent condition.  The staff was very friendly and helpful without exception.  The hotel offers a free hot buffet breakfast and a free dinner each day as well as 3 free alcoholic drinks each evening.  The pool and hot tub were well maintained.  We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.Not my favorite Drury but still good. The parking garage stinks. You have to check in before you are allowed into the garage. Plus theres no signage showing you where the garage is. Can be easily confused with convention center parking garage. The parking spaces are very tight and garage layout is atrocious. Plus you have to pay to park in this awful garage. Outside of the parking garage...the hotel is great.Stayed here on a week night for work and could tell a lot of other people stay here for business too. So it isn't the fanciest place on earth, BUT, when a hotel goes beyond free continental breakfast, and offers guests free dinner and three alcoholic beverages per night, and has an indoor/outdoor pool and free wifi, I'm not sure there's anything more a guest could ask for?The rooms are very clean. We were located right next to a major off ramp and couldn't hear a single car. Very quiet. Staff was courteous and helpful. The only blip is that the shampoo and conditioner (installed in shower) were really bad. I had to use twice as much shampoo as normal and the conditioner had an awful smell that was chemically and it was almost baby lotion like. It was also useless. The hotel was great, but bring your own shampoo and conditioner.I've stayed in a few different hotels in downtown Columbus during the Ohio Star Ball (a national dance comp). This year, I stayed at the Drury Inn as part of a group reservation, and by the end of my visit, I was wondering why I hadn't chosen to stay there sooner. The hotel was clean, the bed was large and comfortable, the staff was hospitable, and the value was great! There was free wifi and complimentary breakfasts and happy hours. The only drawback was the absence of room service, but there are restaurants within walking distance, including a favorite breakfast spot, Max & Erma's. The Inn is connected to the Convention Center, so you can walk to your destinations without stepping outdoors. This is usually a preferred alternative to battling the freezing temps of Ohio in November.I can't say enough about this hotel -- the people that work there are truly amazing and they really make sure you feel happy about your stay. From the breakfast on weekends to the afternoon kick back it is the little things that make a difference there.If you are in town for something at the convention center you can't beat the location as well. It is so close to everything and right in the middle of it. The only thing that they really could use some help on is the exercise room. During my last stay it was all out of operation and the equipment they have there is really minimal -- a few treadmills but that is about it.The rooms are nice -- staff is helpful and that is really all you ask for to.I'll keep coming back as far as I know.Drury Hotel is one of the best around - also has the best breakfast free - Hyatt is over $200 - you have to tip everyone - $25 valet parking or $12 if you go to a certain lot - restaurant only for meals . . .  Drurys rooms are wonderful - also everyone extremely friendly! Drury reduced their price to $149 for us too. You can't go wrong with them! **We are here w the "Women of Faith" Which is awesome @ Convention Center so we are split between both Hotels.The venue was surrounded by orange barrels and a ripped up street but I persisted. I was met with prompt check in and friendly service. Good explanation of how parking garage works, availability of evening snacks and breakfast hours. I liked the ease of the parking deck and found it a simple matter to get from car to room and room to car schlepping all my stuff since both were accessible via the same elevator. The breakfast selection was fine. The 7th floor was extremely quiet, and the room was very nicely appointed and clean. I got a great night's sleep.
review_content_20: I'm one that walks in a hotel room and rips all the sheets off the beds and the cushions off of the couches/chairs to check to for anything... Gross.  I also lift the mattress off the box springs to make sure there's nothing hiding out under there.  This hotel was SO CLEAN!  And very nice too.  Friendly staff, they were very accommodating at my request for a later check out time.  The pool is indoor/outdoor and there is also a hot tub. The fitness area is small, but very nice and clean.  We stayed in a suite which was awesome because there was a solid door separating the bedroom from the rest of the suite- which worked well for us as my husband who had to get up much earlier than me. I would definitely stay there again if I were in downtown Columbus and this will also make me think of checking out Drury Inn's when staying else where also.Found this place online when I was headed down to Cbus for a weekend shopping/drinkfest.  After I called and spoke to the girl at the desk I actually got a cheaper rate than the quoted online one!  This place is GREAT.  Perfect downtown location and right off High street.  The free breakfast, evening snacks and 3 drinks per person are totally worth it.  They also have a great pool that goes outside even in the winter months.  Its pretty cool to be outside when its snowing but be in a nice warm pool.  I had to pay for parking but its a secure lot and easy to get into and out of.  Ever trip I plan from now on will be including a stay at a Drury fo sho..I usually stay at the the Troy MI property. Overall a good Hotel comfy beds and a decent continental breakfast. They are always super clean and offer great services. The bathrooms in the rooms are a bit smaller than other Druery properties I have been to but I relate that to being in the city center. I like the Druery and have never had a problem prior to this visit. I was in town on buisenss and we got a meeting room in the hotel it was perfect for our group the issue was we had the room for one day and they charged us for two and advised us that we would need to talk to the manger to get it resolved. The 2nd issue I had was at the "Relax Time" they give you 3 free cocktails per night (which is awesome) I had 2 and couldn't find my card so another member of my group who didnt drink gave me their card and the server was really rude! She told me that this was my last drink and took the card away!! It would have been ok if whe wasnt so rude! When I stay at a property that offer ammenties I dont expect to be treated poorly when using the amenites.I was there for a week while training and enjoyed my stay here. Friendly, engaging staff-members combined with the free breakfast and happy hour made nice bookends of busy days. The indoor/outdoor pool was enjoyable (even in December). The room was comfortable, spacious and had a nice mix of amenities. Great location!I travel around the country to conventions and have never encountered a hotel that's as accommodating and pampering as the Drury! The Rooms are incredibly spacious, we stayed in a suite for two nights, that came with a living room, The last night we stayed at a double bed single room, and both stays were incredible.Every room came with a microwave, a mini fridge, a flatscreen (two in a suite) and free breakfast, dinner and drinks, and for a crowded convention night, effective Wifi.The staff is incredibly efficient and polite, they greet everyone and ask any questions i needed.It's also an incredibly affordable hotel compared to any of the others and the location is right next to the convention center as well as many restaurants and bars.Will stay again next year for sure.I'm really, really hoping that was a kettle cooked potato chip I found on my comforter. Granted, I never ate in the room and I have not had kettle cooked chips in sometime, so if it really was a kettle cooked chip, it surely did not belong to me. I just happened to have plopped on the bed for a second to send out an email when I felt something sharp pressing into my leg. Surely a chip would crumble, right? As soon as I saw it, I freaked out for a second and brushed it off the bed. It was late, I was disturbed and I reacted to it the same way I would a bug in the hair.  I pray, pray, pray it was not someone's dry foot skin.I'm really surprised that the ratings for Drury Inn & Suites are so high! I feel like I stayed at a different hotel from everyone else or something, because I was not at all impressed. As soon as my cab pulled up to the hotel, my expectations dropped. It was definitely a very humble driveway and lobby, so it gave me a better sense of what the rest of the experience would be like. At the time I checked in, the hotel was in the midst of changing up their access card system. This caused for a bit of chaos and disorganization at the front desk. Totally not a problem, since these kind of things happen. But I was disappointed by the lack of professionalism through the wait and through my check-in. I wasn't even told what direction to walk in, or anything about the facilities. I definitely was aware there was an indoor pool however. You could smell it in the lobby. The suite itself was spacious, but incredibly dated. Everything about this place felt old and slightly motel-ish. The coffee maker looked dirty (pass) there was only one piece of soap in the bathroom, the towels were rough and they had pre-filled conditioner and shampoo pumps in the bathroom. (Like a public locker room!)I even gave the complimentary breakfast a try in the morning (it's free for guests but $5.99 for non-guests. Why someone would pay that much for what they had to offer, I have no idea.) Pretty basic continental, with a few hot items (sausage, scrambled eggs, waffle maker) which was displayed pretty central, just aside from the lobby. I took a gamble on the scramble, ate a piece of toast and threw the deuces up. The only redeeming qualities that I found were:1)Location - It's next door to the Convention Center and you can walk to a bunch of places2)Staff  - they were pretty friendly and meant well. I think because they were in the midst of some changes things were running a little less smoothly.I have no plans on staying here again, nor would I recommend it unless it's a toss up between here and a motel chain. Between the two, it would be a tough call.Stayed at the Drury Inn columbus this past weekend.  We were in town for our daughters graduation from OSU. It was the perfect location, not far from campus and quick drive to the short north for dinner. The hotel staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean. We reserved a suite and it was very comfortable for 6 of us! The happy hour and the free breakfast was definitely an added bonus!!! Would definitely return!My husband, daughter and two dogs stayed here for one night. The room was VERY clean, the staff was polite and check-in and check-out were a snap. The only issue I had was the card I used to reserve the room getting charged as well the card I used at check in. Other than that, it was an excellent stay. The free breakfast is also a plus. Hot oatmeal, scrambled eggs, waffles, biscuits and gravy. I would definitely stay here again.This hotel represents Columbus! Clean rooms, perfect location, and great breakfast! Thank you guys for a great night!I stayed here on Nov. 17, 2014 in room 559. I rate the front desk staff and room cleanliness 5 stars. The reason for the overall 3 star rating is this - after checking out and going to work, I realized that I forgot my Kindle Fire in the room. After double checking my overnight bag, I went back to the hotel as soon as I could - 5 hours later. I explained to the young lady at the front desk that I had left my Kindle Fire in my room and exactly where I left it. No one else had yet checked into the room but it had been cleaned. The young lady checked with housekeeping and the housekeeper who cleaned the room claimed nothing was left in the room. They took my information in case it turn up and I left. I once again checked my overnight bag - nothing!!!!  I'm not going to accuse anyone of anything but isn't it interesting that no one was in the room but the housekeeper and the Device is no where to be found?A friend of mine was staying in this hotel because she was relocating for work.  I came into town to visit her and stayed in her hotel for a couple of nights.  I was very impressed with the hotel staff and service.  Everyone was SO friendly and helpful.  They rooms/hotel was very clean. They had breakfast, dinner, snacks, and drinks daily!!  ...and free internet! :)I will definitely stay at this hotel when I come into town to visit!  Thanks for making my stay pleasant! =)Extremely nice and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, 3 free alcoholic drinks per night, hot breakfast and hot evening snacks, adjacent to Convention Center (you don't even need to go outside!), electronic room card-key system that WORKS! What more do you need? If I'm ever back in Columbus, I'll stay here!Nice hotel. Big rooms. Had a nice message from teh front desk upon turning to my room asking me if there's anything else I need to make my stay better (nice surprise). Spotty Internet, but its free.The first stop on our road trip across America was Columbus, Ohio. We got into the city fairly late and the only pet friendly hotels we found on Yelp were Red Roof Inn and the Residents Inn. The Residents Inn was expensive ($179 i think) and they were charging a $79 pet fee plus $20 for parking. Red Roof Inn do not have a pet fee, but there's no private parking lot. With my whole life in the car, i did not feel comfortable leaving my car in an open lot across the street. We pulled the car over, and saw Drury Inn. I called, and they had vacany, no pet fee and a private lot - I'm sold. The rate was $126 with AAA discount, $12 for parking.Upon arrival, the clerk at the front desk was really friendly. She gave my dog some treats and checked us in quickly. She also informed us the hotel offers free hot breakfast and free wifi. The hot breakfast includes eggs, sausage, french toast, muffins, toast, bagels, waffles, cereals and coffee/juice. It was great!The room was clean and roomy. The private lot was awesome. You need a hotel key to get in the lot, and key entry to the elevator bank thru the lot.Drury Inn quickly became our hotel of choice across America...I was very pleased with the service (Scott in concierge was especially nice and helpful), ambiance, comfort of the room and the free happy hour with food (didn't have to buy dinner!). My only gripe was that housekeeping didn't come by to clean the room til 4pm - which meant I'd already returned from my event and didn't want to vacate while the room was cleaned. Most hotels I've ever stayed in, the rooms are cleaned by 2 or 2:30pm so that was disappointing.Always have a great experience at Drury no matter which one it is!  This was no exception!  We love Drury!We stayed this past weekend for my sister's bachelorette party. I cannot say enough about how impressed I am with everything about this hotel. I know a group of rowdy girls is not easy to handle and every single staff member made us feel welcome. We especially appreciated Josh, Scott, and Rosalia for their patience with us! Josh at the front desk even gave us free admission passes for The Big Bang Piano Bar since he found out that is where were going. The free appetizers and drinks were amazing and a great thing to offer. The location is perfect for easy access to the Arena District. We had a suite and 2 basic rooms which worked perfectly for the party. The suite was very spacious and perfect to hold all of us.I would recommend this Drury Inn to anyone staying in the area!I'd like to give the Drury a 4.5, but as you all know, there are no half-stars on Yelp. Anyway, if you're ever in town for a couple days, I highly recommend the Drury. It's only a short walk away from the strip where all of the bars are, but far enough away that it's actually quiet. There are a couple bars across the street (Max & Erma's, Charley O'Toole's) and it's attached to the Convention Center, where there is a mini-food court with several different choices of food and several stores. The staff is very courteous and friendly, and very attentive. We had a problem with our lock and the room # plate kept falling off mysteriously, but both were fixed within a half hour of us reporting the problems. It's very easy to get around in the hotel.The best part of the hotel is the free breakfast and nightly gathering they have.  If you're a guest at the hotel, you get a card that is good for 3 free drinks (anything) and free food.Again, if you're in the area for work or fun, I'd highly recommend the Drury!!Nice rooms, spic and span bathroom.  Walking distance to Arena district and North Market.  Free Wi-fi.  They give drink vouchers for happy hour.  The only qualm I had with this hotel was the hotel key card used to enter the parking garage was temperamental.  Another thing was I called to check if could do late checkout and they said 1pm was fine.  My friend called the next day to make sure and they said we had to leave by noon.  So my friend had to drag all of our luggage and hang out in the lobby until I got back.  And I had to change from my suit into my casuals in the lobby bathroom.I stayed at the Drury Inn two weekends ago on Saturday night for a bachelorette party. The set up of the room was perfect...there was a large living room area with a pullout couch, a nice size bathroom, an area between the living room and bedroom that had a microwave, counter and mini-fridge, and then the bedroom which we got with two double beds. I slept on the pullout couch which was actually pretty comfortable...either that or I was really drunk. Hmmmm...I'll go with a combo of the two.The location of the hotel is nice because you can walk to the Arena District or Short North very easily. Plus if you drink too much and decide to cab it back, it's only about $5 from the Arena District (not that I am speaking from experience of course...). There is plenty of parking at and around the hotel - you can park at the meters on Nationwide for free Saturday night and on Sunday; there is a garage attached to the hotel, although you do need a room key for it; and then there is another garage next to the hotel which will cost you about $20 if you park overnight. Also be warned that you will need a room key for the hotel elevators.Overall, a great hotel and one that I would definitely stay at again next time I am in town.
review_content_40: We were in Columbus for a convention and the staff at the Drury were unbelievably helpful and kind. The staff helped me bring things over to the exhibit hall and dealt with UPS for me after I checked out, shipping my items for me. The evening drinks and food (complimentary) were a great opportunity to network and speak with other guts, and the complimentary breakfast was great. This was my first experience at a Drury, and I will look out for them in future. There is nothing that could have been done to make our stay more enjoyable. Five stars!It seems the Drury isn't so dreary. In the shadows of the larger marquees in town such as the eye-catching Hyatt next door the Drury still makes quite an impression. To start off I would like to compliment the concierge at the other Drury in town. I initially printed the wrong directions that led me to a separate Drury.
