The front desk there was so helpful they not only informed me of my location but printed out directions to my hotel. As I navigated Columbus and drove to the front entrance of the hotel it seems modest but yet once one enters the lobby you immediately feel welcomed and surrounded in a comfortable clean environment. At the front desk we were checked in by a lovely young associate who explained about the area and when you will you will need your keys.As for security the entire time I was there I felt entirely safe. From the parking garage where you need a key to enter thru the doors and elevator requiring two key validations. Once you unlock your room you are instantly greeted by a marble floor from the bathroom. The bathroom contains a comfortable vanity area and a private but compact restroom area. There is also a great tv area with a microwave and mini-fridge even in standard rooms. There are comfortable and clean beds beckoning for you to lay down and rest. Speaking of resting from 3-10 pm there are free drinks and popcorn available in the lobby.There is also a hot tub/pool area which looked nice for a relaxing swim. In addition to all of the amenities mentioned above there is a great complimentary breakfast featuring great waffle you can make yourself. Overall the Drury turned out to be a hotel worthy of mention and has overall won my business in any area one is.After all of this great service there was one issue after I had left the hotel I found out that I had left my iPad charger in the room. I immediately called the hotel and they were so nice and offered to check the room for my charger. I later received a call that said that they would happily send me my charger. After all of this I truly was impressed with the level of service at the Drury inn led by their friendly manager Scott.In a time when everyone is cutting corners, Drury offers a lot of extras. 3 complimentary drinks for each night. Free breakfast. Free food in the evening. The staff was awesome. The rooms were clean. The location was ideal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying downtown Columbus. Was way better than the Red Roof across the street I once stayed in.Stayed at this gem of a chain when interviewing for Residency last year and can definitely say it was the best place I spent a night during the entirety of my search.Clean and large rooms, great free coffee, a central location downtown, offstreet parking with easy come/go access, and absolutely free wifi.Better than other more expensive options downtown and more convenient and cleaner than cheaper options outside the city.  Would be an excellent place to stay during NHL Season, the Arnold, or for a Convention.I have put on two meetings in this hotel and the staff has bent over backwards for everything we ask.  The value is more then i can ever ask for which make me look AWESOME to my clients.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting or needing to conduct a meeting.Quite, clean, friendly staff... Most importantly, free internet in rooms and wireless in the lobby to yelp...

review_content: It was not a terrible stay  but I would think twice about coming back again. I didn't feel comfortable / clean in the room from looking at the sheets.  Also, the conditioner bottles in my room looked worn which makes me think that if guests leave the bottles lying around, they just fill up the bottles with stock conditioner.  But worth of all, and this is why I chose to write a review, the walls and doors are PAPER THIN!!! I can hear people walking around the halls, talking, slamming doors - AND the rooms next to me... I can hear them watching television and talking!!!!!!!!This is your average Hilton Garden Inn. There's a fridge, microwave, and your basic amenities. I do wish for Hilton Garden Inns, Hilton Honors diamond members didn't have to forgo points in order to receive the free breakfast buffet. Even at the diamond level (takes 30 stays), members have to choose between free breakfast or 750 points. Oh well. At least this location offers my favorite breakfast food in the buffet - corned beef hash. I don't know any other HGI with this option.My main pet peeve that this hotel might be a little too close to the airport for me. I realize you may state, "Well it IS an airport hotel," but there are MANY airport hotels that are not EXACTLY right on top of the airport - aloft San Antonio airport, Renaissance Newark airport, Hilton Garden Inn San Francisco airport, etc (I could go on and on!). This airport hotel is SO close to the airport that you will hear the planes land, and depending on your room, can see them right outside the window on the runway! Given there are not soundproof windows, I give two stars!It's very close to the airport, but the walls are so thin, I thought my room was being broken into whenever my neighbors moved around..Stayed here because my daughter had a softball tournament nearby. It's near the airport, so goes without saying, it was very loud. ( read one review that said it was quiet???)   Upon check in the staff asked me if we were with any group, for discount purposes I suppose. I told him no, just here for a softball tournament. He then actually told us that there was no game playing or running and yelling in the hallways! I told him I thought we could hold off until we got to the field the next day. Pretty rude.   Lastly, the bed was like a board with a blanket thrown over it. Definitely done with this Hilton.Honestly, I don't understand why everyone is complaining about the decor. It's a chain hotel right next to the airport. It does what it needs: a nice comfy bed and free wifi for business travelers.I usually stay here or the Hampton Inn by Easton when I come up for business trips, and this hotel suffices. I receive a large room & working wifi. Yes in the morning you hear planes; you're right next to the airport, what do you expect? It smells just fine to me as well. If you're expecting luxury service, remember this is a Hilton GARDEN Inn next to the airport. Remember what you're here for, and you'll receive it.The hotel itself was fine.  It was a room with a bed, clean, and the staff was friendly.  However, their payment processing leaves something to be desired.  When I went to check in, they told me I had to put the entire amount of my stay PLUS $150 in "incidentals" on a hold on my card.  Once we checked out, the "real" amount would finalize, and the hold would drop off...but not until 5-7 business days after we checked out!  I said I was not comfortable putting $650 on my credit card for that long, so they did not let me check in until my roommates got there.  So after driving 8 hours, I had to sit in the lobby for 2 more to wait for them.  Then, when they showed up, THEY were told that was only for debit cards.  For credit cards they just held one night's stay, about $140.  Nobody said this to me, and I was not using a debit card.  So I sat there for 2 hours for no reason.  Then, fast forward to check out.  We split the room up between us, the total is about $125 each.  I give my card, everything is fine, then I get home and look at my statement.  There is a "hold" for $250!  Remember, my card was not used in the check-IN process, so no hold and no incidentals were placed on it.  There is no reason in the WORLD that this should have happened.  When I called they basically told me they had no idea why it did that, and the "final" charge would just be the $125 as it should be.  And when I said, "Well that's great, but what if this unauthorized hold had put me over my limit?  What if I NEEDED that extra $250 to live my life?"  And the girl had no answer.  Basically said, "Sorry, nothing I can do."  Meanwhile NONE of this was made clear at the time of reservation.  I am extremely disappointed in the way this all was handled.  I travel fairly often, and have never had an issue like this before.Horrible!  The entire place smells like an ashtray.  The non smoking rooms smell like smoke!  So gross Hilton!!  Charge 140 for this Crap is a Joke.  I am sure management will not Respond as every other review on here is negative. Diamond member officially moving over to Marriott as of today due to this trailer park Columbus Hilton you suck!My fortune 50 company decided to book a room here to better train their employee's.  Here is a run down of why you shouldn't book the Hilton for your next stay.A.  It needs updated.  They use 4 x 3 screens it it is 2011.  If you want business, you have to update your facilities.  Get a high def screen for the conference rooms.  While you are at it update the tv's in the lobby.  My grandmas Zenith console is more up to date than what is in the lobby.B.  Fix the HAVAC unit in the conference rooms.  When it would turn on, you couldn't hear a thing.  Plus it would turn on and off so much I felt like I was my mom going through menopause.  C.  Update the decor in the conference rooms.  If you are too young or too old and haven't been to a wedding in the 80's come here.  The minute I walked in I could have sworn I heard the Vapors singing "Turning Japanese", but then again maybe it was the HAVAC unit.D.  While we were having our meeting someone at the hotel brought in two men and showed them the room to see if they wanted to rent it out.  Are you kidding me?!   Again, are you kidding me?  I do not care who is renting out the room already, whether it is for a Bar Mitzvah or a business meeting but come on you just had to show those individuals the room and interrupt a business meeting that was already going on?E.  Thanks for running the vac during our meeting outside the doors of our room.  You knew we couldn't already hear because of the air unit, but this was the icing on the cake.F.  The bathrooms downstairs are cold enough to be a meat locker.Yeah...so I haven't slept here yet. I've checked in, gotten settled and wish that I hadn't decided to stay here already.Why you ask? Few reasons: First off, there aren't sidewalks that take you around the building. It was suggested that I park over closer to my room and by doing so I had to walk about 50 feet in cold water with my nice shoes. Second: The shower. I have *never* in all my stayings at hotels had such AWFUL water pressure. I almost had to touch the wall for water to hit me. So sad!The comforter is lumpy...really? yep! It is.The wireless uses some system that for some reason disables my ability to use my VPN. Thankfully there is a wall plug and it works through there, but otherwise I'd be hosed.Oh wow...so I had to edit this review after checking the gym out. I have not ever seen that bad a gym at a hotel before. Jeebus. I forgot how rundown and bad the places near airports are.Only positive such far is the fact that the AC will blow cold air, cause I can't stand having the heater on regardless of how cold it is outside.This is the nicest hotel ever!  The staff was very welcoming and helped me find a tasty delivery place at 1 am.  The next morning I came to breakfast and was worried my debit card wouldn't work (bc I am from out of town and thought it would freeze) and I was comped my breakfast.  The rooms were very nice and comfortable.  I would stay here again when I come back to Columbus.Stayed here on a business trip. OK experience here. Hotel room was fine, although I had issues connecting to the internet at times (not sure if it was my computer or the wireless network). Stayed right across from their small fitness center. Other than their in-house restaurant and the McDonald's across the street, you don't have many food options.Do you like hilton miles?  Do you like old fashioned Tv's and the sound of the runway outside your window?This is the place for you.I doubt Paris would stay in this namesake hotel.I decided to head to airport a day early due to bad weather and made a reservation with them -was a little concerned when they said that they were undergoing renovations but I didn't have a problem at all - they were very nice and helpful - was worried the airport shuttle may be to small as there were quite a few of us going there but was able to fit in 15 people and more pieces of luggage than that - all in all I was very happy staying there.I didn't hear the airport noise during my stay, which was nice.  The rooms are spacious and the free wi-fi was a great benefit.  I don't think I used the TV (I prefer to watch movies on my laptop).  The breakfast was good, although it was probably cheaper at the McDonald's across the street.  McDonald's is the only eatery close by, if I remember correctly.  But for an overnight trip, this hotel was a good pickDefinitely not bad as far as budget hotels go. The rate was pretty cheap ($119.00), and it was a pretty large room with a good internet connection, and a nice TV. The food at their restaurant in the front wasn't bad either.If you're looking for an airport that's pretty conveniently located to industrial parks, stay here unless you're going to a particular event in at a particular hotel.Oh, when I came it, it was the last day of the Arnold Classic Fitness Convention, which apparently is one of the biggest things that happens in Columbus. I didn't go, but I did keep getting asked if I was going or had gone, which sorta made me snicker. I do, however, wish I had gone out one day earlier, because the night before I was there, the UFC 68: The Uprising actually occured as part of this event.If you need to stay by the airport and whatever is out this way in Columbus, the Hilton Garden Inn is the way to go. Rates were wonderful, only $84 + tax = $101.Dining options are a bit weak, just the hotel restaurant and McDonald's across the street, but if you're only staying a night or two that's fine.Rooms are spacious, wireless is free, my floor (the 2nd) seems to smell like hair perm chemicals in the hallway, but otherwise the place seems clean and nice.Initial greeting by front desk & housekeeper supervisor excellent - but assigned room way out of date and badly in need of renovation. Very spartan room decor, luke warm water with little pressure in shower, ancient tube tv, squeaky bathroom door a big annoyance & on a spring to keep shut (broken trash can in the bathroom obviously constantly used to keep door open when desired), coffee service not cleaned. We've stayed at other extremely good Hilton Garden Inns but this one is not good.amazing customer service. nice rooms. quiet despite airport.

Stayed here for a night when visiting town.  Staff was friendly, room was updated and clean, free wifi and breakfast.  My only "complaint" is that the breakfast could have included more hot foods and the juice dispenser was more like flavored water.  I would stay here again.The room was large, with two queen size beds, couch, sitting chairs, desk, fridge, microwave, you name it.  Everything was very clean and smelled fresh.  The beds were a little firm but not uncomfortable.  The air was a little dry with the AC going all night.  I enjoyed it; wish I could have tried the pool.Pros:  it's nice, it's clean, the beds are comfortable, and it's easily accessible to the highway.Cons: the hallway floors feel like you are walking in a fun house... Ups and downs, lots of soft spots along the way.  For a hotel that is only 5 years old, this is crazy.All in all I would stay here again, I just hope they do something about the hallway floors before someone falls and gets hurt.Nice room with 2 queens and a sofa bed. Pool is really small - half the size of normal hotel pool. Only goes to something like 4 ft and freezing in the morning. Still fun for the kids. Breakfast is convenient and gets put away at 9 am. Front desk was quick and efficient but not the friendliest. No pets allowed. Convenient location.For whatever reason, the airport hotels right next to the Columbus airport are wickedly expensive compared to what you pay only a few miles out. This Comfort Suites is a mere six miles away (by interstate; it's less if you take the back roads like the cabbies do), and much cheaper.For $100/night I had a massive suite with a chair, foldout couch, flat-screen TV, comfy bed stuffed with pillows, a sizeable desk, a microwave and a good-sized hotel refrigerator. All for just me....This Comfort Suites has very friendly staff; on my check-in I received a little welcome bag for being a Choice Privileges member (I've never gotten one before!), and the woman at check-out remembered me from the day before. Little things, but welcome ones.A free airport shuttle is advertised, but as far as I could tell it's sporadic. I arrived around midnight and simply took a cab from the airport to get to the hotel, and when I needed to go back to the airport the hotel paid for a cab, instead of taking me in the shuttle that was parked outside. I don't know if they'd comp your trip from the airport, were the shuttle not running, but that may be worth checking into. Given that the cab ride was around $25, and rental cars at the economy level are around $15/day, you might be better off just renting a car to begin with, if you can't get a shuttle to the hotel.I didn't use the pool but it looked large and clean. There's a fitness center, and the standard continental breakfast. I usually avoid them, but this one had clementines instead of plain oranges - a nice touch. The biggest downside of this location is that it is fairly remote; there's not much around (aside from Waffle House and Chick-fil-A), though a short drive takes you to more populated areas. I wasn't running this weekend due to rehabbing an injury, but if you're like me and usually like to go out for a run no matter where you're staying, be aware that there are no sidewalks in sight around here. The general area is a bit east of Columbus proper, so if you want to go into the city at all, you're in for a drive.Comfort Suites are probably my preferred label of the Choice Hotels family, and if you're in Columbus and need a good one near the airport, this is a great choice.Overall it was a good experience and decent value, with one major downside. I decided to splurge and get the room with a private jacuzzi in it, which was really nice. Service was nice, the free included breakfast was delicious with plenty of variety. Free internet.The only real problem I encountered was when I woke up with a bunch of bites that I'm fairly sure are bed bug bites. Not cool. They should take better care to avoid bed bugs! If it weren't for that I'd probably give it the full five stars.Stayed here on a business trip and we were all very impressed! For $99 a night we got a huge room, comfy bed, nice sized bathroom, a nice sitting area as well as a kitchenette with fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Not to mention a nice work area with desk and plenty of power outlets! The room was clean and kept cool. Plenty of lighting and a nice tv. Best of all, free *fast* wifi! Why spend $200 on a room elsewhere in the city (cough cough The Hilton) and not get free wifi?! If I had to give one con you can hear a plane taking off or landing every once in awhile but that didn't bother me very much. Anytime I do business in the Columbus area this is where I'm staying from now on!This is my favorite choice hotel in Columbus. Not only its close to the airport, the staff is friendly and the room is big and clean. the added bonus? FAST INTERNET!SUMMARYFront Desk:5Check out Process: 5Room Overall: 5Bathroom Overall:5Breakfast:5Internet:5The Run-Down:When you first walk in, the set up of the hotel is wonderful. Plenty of seats in the lounge to sit with a big screen tv. The computer and printer actually works well. The front desk is exceptional. I can be somewhat picky or needy at times but they are accommodating and super friendly. Check in is a fast process and when I go into my room, Im always suprised at how nice and clean it is. Its so clean that I dont mind walking around barefoot! Another little thing that I notice about the rooms is that there are outlets on every lamp and 3 extra plugs at the work desk. Its such a small detail I know but I appreciate it and I hate having to go behind drawers and desks to try to plug in my laptop and phone. The breakfast area is wonderful because even throughout the day, they have fresh coffee out. They also keep plates and utensils out which is great for when I bring take out to my room, I can easily head over to the breakfast area and grab what I need. Lastly, the internet runs about 10-15 Mbps download and 1.5 - 3 Mbps upload. Love it!I stayed here two nights last week while visiting family. I didn't get a chance to really explore the hotel or even stay in the room much, but I was quite comfortable. Check-in was easy (I'm really glad they had luggage carts available), the room was very clean with a nice assortment of extras like a fridge, microwave, plenty of plugs for electronic devices, and even a little sitting room area. Had we wanted to, we could have definitely had visitors in the room. It was quite nice. I also really was happily with the excellent air conditioner that was very easily controlled and kept the room at a nice temperature.I didn't eat breakfast, but my wife did. She didn't say anything about it, so it must have been OK. She did bring me some doughnuts, though.I will say, though, that there were a lot of geese outside of the hotel. That doesn't bother me, but one of them was quite aggressive and kind of lunged at my while I was carrying my daughter. I got in his/her face and yelled "come at me bro!" That caused the beast to back off. Don't mess with my kid, goose.Oh, and evidently a few people staying in the hotel had their Nintendo 2/3 DS systems on as well as I picked up quite a few folks on Street Pass.Plenty of parking (and was also allowed to leave my vehicle in the drive through for some time) Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.Room was clean and large with a separate area with a couch.Coffee maker (not in bathroom :-) and fridge.Large pool.Free coffee tea out at all times, and complimentary breakfast (decent - waffle maker was fun!)Close to food (off top of my head: Bob Evans, Tim Hortons, Chipotle, Tumbleweed)My husband and I stayed at Comfort Suites for 1 night while visiting our daughter who lives nearby. I chose this hotel based on proximity and Trip Advisor reviews. Our stay was wonderful. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean and spacious. It was nice to have a separate living room area, as well as a refrigerator and microwave in-room. Breakfast offerings were sufficient. There were eggs (hard-boiled & scrambled)and sausage, along with instant hot cereal, bagels, mini donuts, muffins, an assortment of fruit, yogurt and juice. There was also a DIY waffle station. The kitchen area and subsequent eating area were clean and tidy. There was also a business center in the lobby along with an adjacent seating area. Also the hotel offers free wi-fi. All in all this as a great stay. I would definitely stay here again.Knowing the Comfort Suites brand, I didn't have high expectations of this hotel.  It turned out to be a rather pleasant surprised.  Located close to the airport, getting their in our Mitsubishi rental car from Dollar was a rather simple affair with help from my trusty friend Siri.  The place was easy to find and looks relatively well kept.  Upon entry, the staff was very friendly and attentive.  Then again, most people from the midwest are.  I checked into Four Square while my boss checked in and got a little welcome gift offer.  I jokingly presented it the staff and they said they just ran out of it and would make some more and be sure to save me one.  I got a room on the 4th floor.  Since it's only 4 stories I guess you can call it a penthouse (j/k).  The room was nicely furnished with a nice sized bed, office area, separate sitting area and very nicely done bathroom with granite countertop.  Color me impressed!  My perception of Comfort Inn being similar than your Motel 6 was definitely wrong.  We were leaving for a meal and the staff actually remembered me and gave me the welcoming present.  The next morning there was free Continental breakfast with a Waffle station!  Also the WiFi is free and you don't even need a password.  That makes life so much easier for watching Hulu!  I give this place a thumbs up.  If it wasn't for the lumpy bed and the sad 3 machine gym, I would give it a five star.  Yikes a 5 Star Comfort Inn!!!Nice room, well kept and clean. Didn't spend a lot of time there but I had no complaints and these days that's the most you can hope to get out out of a hotel in this price range. The staff was exceptionally friendly. The breakfast was the standard "continental" fare, meaning barely edible.Nice place to stay at. Very spacious and updated. New appliances. Great breakfast!Didn't give 5 stars because floor squeaks and one of the computers in the business center wasn't working right and made me lose my work twice.Great, clean, comfy, no smelly heater, great service. I was happy to stay there!!!A nice looking building from exterior, and also well-kept on the inside. We stayed for an extended weekend with our infant son. Our room was large, with plenty of space to set up our pack n play. Nice kitchenette with sink and mini fridge... Needed with a baby for sure! Nice furniture including a hide-a-bed couch, desk w chair and a separate rolling table (handy!), comfy chair  (good for holding a napping child), large bed with down comforter and lots of pillows (though I always advise bringing pillows from home bc a good pillow is key to a good sleep!), nice closet, and an easy to use AC/heater unit. That said, my biggest annoyance about this hotel is the floors! And I'm not talking about the carpeting. The floors creak BAD!! And they are apparently paper thin too. We could hear EVERY freakin thing our upper level neighbor was doing... ALL NIGHT LONG! Yeah, hello... Hotels are floor sleeping!!! Go to bed, people!!!  Be warned now: If you tend to be a light sleep, you better ask for a room on the top floor. For this one reason alone, I'm giving a lower rating. No one should have to hear what the person above is doing all day or night long! (Why does anyone come to a hotel and not sleep at night?! Seems like a waste of $!) Well everything else is pretty top-notch. Don't expect anything delivered to your door though. You need something? Get down to the front desk. They'll gladly help, but there's no delivery service for anything... Except Dominos pizza, which costs extra, of course. The front desk lady (we saw the same one all weekend) is super nice. Continental breakfast is good, with a Belgium waffle maker. Mmmm! Parking is decent (particularly before 7pm). Oh and it's a great location with plenty of food options down the road!! So, overall a fabulous hotel... But best on the top floor if you plan to sleep at all.

This is exactly what I was looking for. I used hotwire to book the reservation so I didn't get to do a thorough check of the hotel prior but this place exceeded my expectations. I regularly stay in hotels for work and this place went above and beyond accommodating everything we needed. The from desk clerk was a younger lady (Laney) and she did a great job of multitasking and making sure everyone was taken care of. Great place. I will be back on my next visit to Columbus.Terrible management. We stay at Marriotts often. Usually no problem--in fact, we're usually very happy. Here? Too long a boring story-- suffice it to say: room not prepared; room not serviced the next day, despite a 2nd request; lies; smirks; and promises from a General Manager that went unfulfilled. Add to it a really dumb customer service function by Marriott-- you call, they say there's a wait, would you prefer a call back? I leave a message--and get a return call 4 days later. Not really great service any way you look at it. Maybe it's time to shift to Hilton.(Just noticed that another reviewer had a similar experience with the room last year--so it seems it must be management/training. Makes me think I'm not as crazy as I feared, as well. Most of my reviews on Yelp are very positive-- these guys really tourqued me off).Ok for conferences. Food is ok but better than some of the chain places near by. The Starbucks has odd hours and difficult to catch them open.I have been really impressed with the front desk staff.  Everyone is efficient, friendly, and has gone above and beyond to take care of us.   I will definitely stay here when I'm in town again.My husband and I got married last night and the wonderful staff took such good care of us! They bumped our room from a regular room to a suite at no extra charge! We will definitely be coming back to this location!This is a great hotel.  Service is top notch, rooms are updated and super clean.  Excellent Gym with lots of options and space.  Bar and restaurant have excellent service and all my favorites.  Possibly my favorite Marriott in the chain.The staff were friendly and efficient.  The hotel decors and the room were a bit dated but kept very clean.   I have the access to the lounge and it was small but had all the things that I need in the morning and before dinner.   I would definitely come back to this hotel should I come back to Columbus again.I've had the pleasure of staying here for the past year, and I wholeheartedly recommend this place both to business travelers as well as those who travel less frequently.  Let me start off by saying that I'm not one of those travelers who demand/require a lot of pomp and circumstance.  If I stay at the same hotel on a weekly basis, I try to know everyone in the hotel on a first name basis.  From the very first night, this hotel was top notch in every aspect.   The chefs, Larry especially, know their stuff.  I've had almost every item on the menu.  Never once did I have something that was prepared perfectly.  Michael, Allison, and Maria were amazing at the bar.   Clare and the entire front desk were always there to greet me with a smiling face every week.  Amy up in Concierge was always a welcome face each evening.  I think it goes without saying that my stay there was excellent.  I would not hesitate to suggest this place to anyone.  The price is good, the amenities are good, but the real selling point here is the staff.   Keep up the great work!Oh, Marriott in Dublin.  I am giving you a huge MEH.  I've experienced better.I am a 10 year fan of the Marriott Hotel chain.  I have had great experiences at most every hotel that I have visited.  This one is an exception.  Although the front desk clerk was nice and friendly, she also gave me a room at the very end of the hall way, next to a cleaning closet that was propped open more than half the time, making me a little fearful when going to my room.  Yes, I am sure for the most part, a hotel in Columbus is relatively safe.  But I still got the heebie-jeebies walking down the long hallway to my room.  And it was not like that hotel was full, there was probably a total of 5 cars in the parking lot on a Sunday afternoon. Why not give a female traveler a more appropriate room location?  Any other Marriott, and I would get my room upgraded.  My Gold status got me nuttin' here.Another couple minus stars for their gift shop.  When traveling, you are inevitably going to forget something.  And the gift shop should be stocked with necessities.  So, when I was in desperate need of Advil, I called to front desk to inquiry as to where I might be able to buy some.  I had developed a migraine, and although I have prescription medication, it does not work without Advil.  They told me that I could get Advil in the gift shop.  I made the trek downstairs, only to find the location of Advil bare.  Then I had to wait until they contacted the bell hop to see if some was in the back room.  No such luck.  So, it was up to me to take my pounding head back upstairs to get my car keys and sunglasses and go out and about the town seeking a local Walmart.  Not good.  Then two days later, I encountered a man in the gift shop desperately looking for Advil.  You can see their sense of urgency in keeping needed items in stock.This leads to yet another negative experience.  Since I has recovering in my room mid morning, I had posted my DTD sign on the door.  Housekeeping passed me over, thank you.  They were kind enough to leave a note to call the front desk at a time when I was ready to have my room cleaned.  Which I did.  However, I came back to my room after 6 pm, hours later,  to find that they did not get the message to housekeeping, my room was untouched.There are positives about this place.  I can think of one right now.  The morning person at the concierge lounge was awesome.  She was very friendly and helpful.  And she even remembered me next day and was thoughtful in some of her comments.  World class service from her.  Minus points for me, I do not remember her name.  But there is nothing nicer than being away from home, traveling all alone and having a friendly face.All in all, so meh, the next time I find myself in this area, I will be steering clear of this hotel.First time at this marriott.  My room is exceptional.  Everything looks brand-new.   It is a very large room with a king size bed.  The bathroom is well stocked and very clean.   Check in was very quick and both employees were exceptional.   They even walked me to the elevator.   I highly recommend this Marriott.  Ask for room 543 if you want the one I had.Love this Marriott! We try to stay here every time we come to Columbus. Room and public space is very clean!This is a great place to stay. The beds are soft and the service is great. I am a major Marriott fan. I typically stay here when I am in Dublin. Its close to the office and I have a lot of choices when it comes to dinner.Stay here if you want to pay a premium for the bare minimum. Go elsewhere if you want to feel like your paying for more than just clean sheets and a lobby with a cathedral ceiling and clean floors. Until now, I never stayed at a Marriott where I had to pay for internet access for each individual computer. I wish this hotel would have advertised this "feature." I'm not a baby boomer, so constant internet access is needed for work and life. The options are to either commute to the lobby so everyone can see how cool I am with a G.I. Dell running Windows pOS (I've been hating on PCs since '87) while working on personal stuff with my iPad and iPhone, or I can dish out $20 for three separate connections per day. Thank god I left AT&T for Verizon, so I can tether my phone (but only using LTE). I digress. This Marriott is run like Ryan Air: you have to pay for every convenience.We stayed here during a week long vacation to North Carolina and really enjoyed our night here. Dublin was not anything to write home about, but we prefer Marriott brand hotels and this particular one was clean and the staff was super friendly. My husband said the gym was very clean and the hours were a perk. The bathroom was small, but well maintained as was the rest of the room. We had breakfast in the restaurant in the morning which was absolutely horrible (I took one star off for the breakfast because it was simply that bad!), but having water and coffee in the hall outside the lobby during the day was an unexpected kindness.We just recommended our parents stay here on their trip home from North Carolina!i visited this Marriott while going to Dublin Irish Fest.  It is nestled in to an office park dominated by Nationwide leased buildings near Tuttle Crossings.The hotel was busy due to the event and other events happening in the Northwest portion of the city.     The staff was super friendly and the rooms were nice / modern.The only knock I have on this place was the restaurant / bar was severly lacking.   I remember over 10 years ago where they had more of a selection.    They offers beers and a very limited menu (I don't think they had any appetizers).The front lobby staff is very friendly and helpful.The bed, while equipped with Marriott's signature Revive collection, only revived me from being able to sleep comfortably. Incredibly lumpy, I had to constantly adjust my position. It certainly was not characteristic of other Marriott Revive beds I've slept in.The bathroom is a bit on the small side, but with ample counter space, and the water pressure out of the shower is good.The gym is located on the first floor and is open 24 hours. There are five treadmills and three stair climbers equipped with individual TVs. Apparently the Marriott also has an agreement with nearby Metro Fitness if you present a valid room key and ID. As for disclaimers, I have not tried that club, and the reviews are definitely not favorable.The Concierge Lounge is accessible via room key on the 7th floor and offers traditional beverages, food, and snacks for Marriott status holders. It is open between the hours of 6:30 am - noon (breakfast until 9:30 am) and 5 pm - 10 pm (hors d'oeuvres until ?) on weekdays.great food at the bar. nice facility. would stay hear again soon.Nice hotel and I have stay there a number of times.  But I still wonder why they don't have Comedy Central.  When it costs nothing to have 700 channels at home, why are there still missing staples in the room.  There are 6 ESPNs, Velocity, HD Net but no Comedy Central.  That makes no sense.Great hotel.  Good rates, wonderful helpful staff.  Clean and comfortable rooms.  I would definitely stay here again.

Did I catch this hotel on a good day? These reviews are brutal!I typically stay at Marriott properties now (I used to be a Hilton member but switching jobs had me switching hotel preferences), and I personally chose this one for leisure because of it's proximity to Nationwide Arena and N High. The location is nearly perfect; just a half block walk away to the hockey game I was attending.When we arrived, we were told that valet and self parking were the same price. We decided to valet because we're lazy. We checked in at around 6:30PM, and Lizzie (I believe/hope that's her name), checked us in promptly. It should be noted that it was her first day, and although she had worked at other hotels, she was already very rehearsed in the layout of the hotel and the surrounding area.I see multiple complaints about the difficulty of the stairs between the lobby and the elevator. I totally understand how that could be an issue, but it wasn't a big deal for us personally. We headed to room 323 and we were more than happy with what was there. Two comfy beds & a clean room.We didn't stay in our room too often as we were only there for one night. We went up specifically to watch a game and check out the bars and restaurants in the area. However, this hotel did exactly what we needed it to do: provide a comfy stay while we watched our Penguins rough up the Blue Jackets.So first thing I noticed is that you have to climb stairs to get to the elevator.... Really?!? In a hotel with lots of suitcases you want every guest to carry their luggage up stairs? Room was ok except for red splatter on my closet door that I'm hoping wasn't blood, some dark hair on my towels, and water damage on the artwork in the bathroom. Calling down to the front desk to ask for my car to be brought around I was placed on hold for 10min before I hung up and walked downstairs to which I was greeted by a front desk staff attending to no one. The morning I checked out I came down to the valet reading the paper, he didn't even look up from his paper when he handed me my keys. No thanks, I didn't need help carrying my suitcase down the stairs...or putting it into my car. I wouldn't stay here again.Passing though Columbus, so I decided to reserve a room near the brewpub I intended to visit. The weather was bitterly cold, so I wasn't going to walk far. The Courtyard seemed like the ticket. Not so much.Check-in is friendly and quick. Good valet service but they need a larger pull-in lane. My vehicle's rear end was sticking out in traffic while I waited for another car to clear. Probably not much to be done about that in a city. The next morning, my vehicle was ready in minutes after I called the front desk (their valet text service wasn't working).Room was fine. No complaints there. No noises, HVAC worked as it should.The big issue is the WiFi crapped out, which is super annoying when you want to plan the day's schedule in the morning. And when I went down to use one of the 'business' computers, the first one I jumped on was locked up. So I had to find another one. I was cranky by that point.Why is there no TV channel guide? The hotel booklet said to check the guide channel on the TV itself but didn't even provide the channel number for that. And you know how slow the channels change on hotel TVs (and why is that, I've always wondered?). Once I did find it - I think it was Ch 94 or something, not the first one when you turn on the TV - many channels that were listed weren't actually received.No free coffee that I could see other than the horrid stuff in the room. I think I'm spoiled by Hampton. They always have free coffee no matter the time of day.There's no security at all. I walked in from the street and used the elevator without even seeing an employee. The front desk was momentarily unattended. The elevator didn't have a room card reader. Yeah, I know this is how it is in many places I stay, such as suburban Hamptons, but it is not good for a downtown hotel and not good for the price I paid. I'd like to know that the only people on my floor are guests and employees.Bathroom was not clean - disgusting in fact, but I'll spare you the vomit-inducing details.  Called desk, manager visited, housekeeping came and re-cleaned.  Bathroom still not clean.  I asked if he had inspected after re-cleaning and he said "yes".  Only took me 1 second to find more grunge and hair all over floor.Manager came back, housekeeping came back to try again.  Better, but still not what I'd call clean.  Three strikes and you're out.  Follow up from management seemed more oriented toward apologizing than fixing the problem.  Apparently, they have no standards for cleanliness.  I checked out after one night and won't be back.No PARKING!! Only $20 valet, what? If you are there for work, don't trust their text system,the valet parking is mostly 20 year old kids and they hardly ever got my car on time.anyways, I was there for business. Rooms are big and clean, very quiet.There is a restaurant below but casual and not too many options.Staff is friendly and is located in a central part of Down Town .  Small gym, but not that bad.Plenty of restaurants open late at night.Not up to Marriott standards. Room is musty/smoky smelling and a/c is struggling to keep the room cool. Check in was pleasant and quick. I will not be returning.3 Stars- They are improving, but there are still a few things they need to workoutThis hotel has recently under gone a major renovation and they are still in the process of finishing some of the minor touches, i.e. one of the elevators. The Downtown Columbus Courtyard is now inline with the current Courtyard standards, including the Bistro/Starbucks combo, which can be a love/hate thing.Pro's:+Location- It is conveniently located within blocks of the Arena District and is located within a ~7 minute walk of restaurants. +Shower- This may not be a big deal to some, but the shower head was hung high , and I didn't have to duck to take a shower+Rooms- The rooms were recently redone. I love the number of power outlets that the room had. From the desk to the lamps, they incorporated additional connections in. Also, the bedding was brand new as well as the other furniture and the tv.+Work space Areas- There was a sitting area with a TV by the elevators near the lobby floor and another sitting area down near the Bistro where groups of people could hangout and talk. They also had a row of computers to use if needed down off the Bistro area.+Wifi- It was free+Staff- They were friendly and they handled a noise complaint in a timely manor. Cons:-Noise- Avoid staying in a non-interior room. You will hear the street noise. Also, there is noise that comes through the doors from the hallways.-Wifi- Yes it's free, so if there are a lot of people on, don't expect the best connection rates.-Shower- For whatever reason the water didn't stay a consistent temperature throughout use. There is nothing like a cold shower in the morning to wake you up.-Parking- The only option is to valet your car. The lot is right next to the hotel and you will be charged $19/day. Fair warning, if any thing happens to your car, the hotel/parking lot is not liable. I would suggest finding a garage to park your car or use another hotel's garaged parking.-Layout- Like other downtown hotels in older buildings that I have stayed in, the layouts for the check-in counters are a bit odd. The lobby is on the ground floor, but you must decent half a flight of stairs to get to the elevators. This is fine for the average person, but others may find this challenging. They do have an elevator for guests to take to bypass this, but keep in mind, it will take them more time to exit/enter the hotel.-TV's- This is not just a Marriott problem, but one that I have been noticing across all brands of hotels due to their cable providers, digital channels take longer to appear on screen than analog. We are talking upwards of a 10 second delay and it is annoying.Probably read about the fact that their is no parking.I had a run-in with the cafe staff - someone didn't get the "Marriott" training.  The hotel is super-handy if your working in the Nationwide complex.  Food is about 5 block walk away - so is the coffee.  I didn't bother eating here.There is one entrance that I know about, relatively small entrance.  Seems that there is always a congregation of employees hanging out at the parking valet desk outside.  The public sidewalk is actually quite narrow at same point, so they are always in your face.My alley view of the rear of the YMCA wasn't too bad since I didn't want to look outside the window anyway.They have the strangest sink faucets I'd ever seen.  Couldn't figure out how to make it work.  But here a tip, pretend that strange vertical metal thing is a joystick and you'll do fine.If you are a casual traveler or on vacation you will like this hotel. If you are a business traveler like myself (40+ weeks a year) keep reading, then go find a new hotel!*not handicap friendlyCons:-elevators and first floor rooms are 8 steps up from the lobby. Supper inconvenient with luggage and impossible for wheelchairs-when I arrived I knew it was valet only for $19 a day, what I didn't expect to find for that much as a cluster. This hotel is on a busy downtown street and there are 3 spots for valet. The valets attendants (lack there of) had me park in the street due to lack of space. Keep in mind this is an active busy downtown ST. See picture of someone's car, after he was told please leave your car in the street, it will be safe. As other readers mention it takes 15+ mins to get your car.- when I got my room it was on the first floor, ask to change and got a higher room with dirty sheets( although layout was spacious). Decided to take the 1st floor room. Super tiny room. Opened my blinds to find someone staring at me from the indoor  hot tub. No sunshine for me!- for breakfast asked if their egg sandwiches had milk or butter in them, no one had a clue, coffee was good though. And the girl gave me attitude for approaching to order when her cafe lights were off at 640a ( suppose to open at 630a)- I regularly leave a do not disturb sign up and opt out of daily room cleans, but no door sign. Ask for one at front desk and girl said she has no clue where they are and housekeeping doesn't work at 6p. Came back from dinner to a taped handwritten note on my door.- can hear everything through walls and door.-everyone at the front desk acts as if you are bothering them.- TVs on gym bike didn't workPros-clean updated gym. Up to 50 lb free weights- comfy bed-free wifi-location -standard Marriott feel.I will not be returning! The Hampton Inn down the street is the nicest I have stayed at in a Hilton chain. Only booked at this courtyard for Marriott promo and no rooms at any of the Hilton's.The recent renovations are lipstick on a pig. It's pretty clear that it's just cosmetic facade on a very poorly designed and dated building. Some of my experience is undoubtedly biased by the fact that they put me in a horrible first-floor room which was about the size of a medium security prison cell, with a view to match, despite charging my company a rather high rate.The parking is too much for a mandatory valet situation.The layout is terrible-nothing they can do about a bad building with renovations-and so the bar/restaurant has all the charm of a basement dorm cafeteria. Despite the new furnishings, that's what it feels like. Call it the "first level" all you want, if there are no windows it's a basement.This place is the first hotel I've ever checked out of early due to low quality. I'm surprised Marriot is willing to have their good name tarnished by this hotel.Ugh, I got athletes foot without ever stepping foot near the pool or gym. :( We stayed in the handicap room for two nights. I would expect them to wash the showers between guests.The staff were friendly, and they gave us an extra cot for a 3rd person.The two options for parking were street parking or Valet for $19. No complimentary breakfast.Another great stay.  We were upgraded to a suite for my wife's birthday.  Easy walk to the restaurant.  Helpful staff.Excellent hotel.  Very friendly staff, from the valet to the cleaning staff. I stayed in 229 and loved the raised separate area for my kids. Pool was freezing because the heater was just replaced, but still fun. Great location (close to COSI) and Starbucks on premise. We'll be back.This is where I stayed for the Columbus Marathon.I am so glad that I picked this location.  I knew in preparing for the trip that I would not want to have to walk far before or after the race to get to my hotel.  It is conveniently located in the downtown area, close enough to get to the marathon expo, start and finish lines.  For location for a marathon stay I give 5 stars.When we we're visiting this location was undergoing some extreme renovations.  Not only in the lobby but rooms on the second floor were under construction.  Now I understand that this may be necessary for any hotel during some point in time but it may be considerate to let your patrons know that this will be going on during your stay.  Luckily for us we weren't located by any of the rooms undergoing heavy/loud construction and I was able to get a good nights sleep for my race.  I feel like if I am paying top dollar for a room I shouldn't have to walk around caution tape, dusty floors and inhale drying paint.  Perhaps there should be some type of discount or at least let guests know of this before hand.  I could see how this could inconvenience people with allergies or even rooms that were disturbed by the construction noise.  Construction 2 stars.The staff was considerate and helped me out when I had finished the marathon but couldn't find my family.  My phone had died during the three and a half hour run so I was out of luck.  My only choice was to limp back to the hotel.  I barely made it but they gladly got me another room key, as I didn't run 26.2 miles with it in my pocket, I collapsed as soon as I got to my room.  Service 5 stars.Another moot point, I'm not sure if it was because of the construction but the shower in our room took a really long time to produce hot water.  Hotels usually don't have this problem so this was kind of a bummer.  Shower 1 star.I think this hotel is pretty nice and they have some cool stairs built in from being a shoe factory in the early hay days.  Friendly staff and very clean.  Has An ATM inside and valet parking only.  Very close (Walking distance) to the convention center.Wow, probably the worst Marriott property I've ever experienced. The only reason its two stars instead of one is the majority of the staff are really nice and doing the best they can with a fairly shabby hotel. When I checked in there was an angry mob in the lobby. Apparently there was a concert in town and many had hoped to get into their rooms at check-in time to get ready. It was almost 5:00pm and many had been waiting for two hours. The young lady working behind the desk was buried. It seemed like housekeeping was way behind or something. She was doing the very best she could and despite one upset guest after another getting in her face she remained polite and professional. The small lounge was offering happy hour prices to try to calm people down and the bar tender was handing out bags of popcorn to the waiting guests. This situation was a management or system failure that put these young staffers in this position and they were doing the best they could. Not being in a hurry I kicked it in the lounge and threw back a Makers Mark on the rocks, maybe two.Once I got into my room I had to double check that I was in a Courtyard Marriott not a Days Inn circa 1994. Worn furniture, work out carpet,  mystery stains in the bathroom and a small refrigerator that was dirty inside and out and was only "cool", not cold. It was like walking onto the set of Hotel Impossible in the "before" phase. I was waiting for Anthony to pop out of the closet and tell me this was just a test.No such luck. Here you go:Dirty bathroom. Not last-guest-dirty, but a decade of wear & tear dirty.The air conditioner is the loudest I've ever encountered indoors. The carpet is peeling up and is completely worn out.Mystery stain on the shower curtain. Bubbling and peeling wallpaper.The fridge - worst ever. Doesn't belong in a 1963 VW van much less a Courtyard. The door is out of adjustment and I had to push it closed with my foot. The bar opened at 5:20p one night. The sign says hours are 5:00p - 11:00p.No HD at all on the HD LCD television. Lame.Slow internet connection!  The PCs in the lobby "business area" are Gateways! In room WiFi: 0.36 Mbps download and 0.18 Mbps upload with a 47 Ms ping, BAD.However, every single person that works here is very very nice. They are courteous and professional. The valet crew sprints to get your car for you, the hostess in the breakfast area are super friendly and keep your coffee filled. I'm a Marriott Gold member, pretty loyal to the brand, But until I see that this place has been given a complete remodel I will not stay here on my Columbus trips.Where do I start???  No parking....??? How can you be a Marriott without parking....so you have to valet (which is costly per day) or you can park in a garage down the street that charges you to come in and out....what a rip off.The girl who checked me in (I want to say her name was Kaitlin), she was pleasant & checked me in swiftly. My room was clean.  It was actually a little nicer than I expected.  I was pleased with my digs....I couldn't get the TV to work w/ my iPad...which was annoying...no Netflix for me.I wanted to wash clothes...Dan was at the front desk texting & I could have sworn he was high....I was talking to him & he seemed tuned out.  I needed soap for the laundry & he took forever to get it...I was super annoyedOverall, my visit was okay...but I'm used to having the luxury of parking my own car...that would be my biggest gripe...Of the Courtyard Marriotts where I've stayed, this is definitely my least favorite. Good luck if you're carrying heavy pieces of wheeled luggage. You enter the lobby and have to go up about 10 stairs just to reach the elevators. I really don't know how you would get to the elevator if you're in a wheelchair. For what it's worth, there were also two small stairs in our room, which we found odd.Housekeeping is a disaster. We had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door, and the housekeeper banged on the door at 11AM until we opened it. And yes, we were still sleeping. We told her to come back later, and instead, she left a signed note stating the reason why we didn't have service was because we refused to have service. At noon, right before we were ready to leave, I called the front desk and requested the room be serviced. "No problem!" an employee assured. When we left, the maid was down the hall, and I said, "Hi, we're ready now for service. Can you please take care of room #____?" She gave me such a blank stare that I then just walked on. My friend said, "Good luck - it took me 20 minutes to explain I needed a trash bag and had to motion trash on the floor." Given that we live in the USA and English is the most common language in this country, I really think maids need to be able to understand and speak English. Later when we arrived back in our room past midnight, the room hadn't been serviced at all - total fail.The air conditioner in the room didn't work as well as it should have. We turned the AC to the second to the last knobs for both fan speed and cool temperature (no numeric temperature available). In the middle of the night, I had to get up and put the knobs on the highest fan speed and coldest temperature available because it was so hot. Even with the coldest temperature, the room really wasn't that cold.There were two good things about this hotel. We had booked under a room block, and the hotel provided a gift bag of small goodies (candy and bottled water), which was nice. The other thing is that they didn't charge me for two days of $19 daily parking (just one day), so that was a pleasant surprise. Nevertheless, I probably wouldn't stay here again. I'd probably pick a hotel closer into downtown.I had two recent stays here for work. I chose this property for it's downtown location and the fact that it was the only Marriott property with rooms available at my corporate rate. Overall the hotel was very clean. Both of my rooms were clean as well. The staff was very friendly and (for the most part) helpful. Unfortunately all of the furniture and fixtures are dated and worn. The sheer curtains had holes in them in both rooms I was in. The power outlets on the desk lamps in both rooms didn't reliably retain any power cable that was plugged into them. While the valet parking was the best option (with the option to come and go as often as you like) the service itself was spotty. Sometimes they were outside. Sometimes they were inside. One time upon arrival I waited well over 5 mins for someone to even acknowledge me. Had the buffet breakfast not been included in my room rate, I probably would have skipped it. At best it was your average hotel breakfast buffet. Two mornings I had to ask them to bring out yogurt for the buffet and one of those times the waitress just brought me directly a single yogurt cup without even asking me what flavor I might prefer rather than replenishing the buffet. While reviewing my expenses for my first stay, I found that they had mistakenly charged me for breakfast one of the days even though breakfast was included in my rate. Upon check in for my second stay I brought this to the attention of the desk clerk. First, she tried to convince me that I had charged something to my room. I advised her that I knew I hadn't. She told me she would have to find the receipt and investigate the charge, but she ensured that there would be either an explanation or a refund by checkout the next morning. When I went to check out it was obvious she had done nothing about it as the clerk at checkout (a different person) was completely unaware. The checkout clerk immediately acknowledged that I had been mistakenly charged and issue a refund on the spot. They have posterboard displays throughtout the lobby showing the details of the planned upcoming renovation. Although it looks like it's going to be very nice I would highly recommend avoiding this property until after they have completed their renovation.THE GOOD: Our stay here was pretty much perfect! The location was close to everything so that was awesome. We were upgraded to a King-sized room located on the fifth floor - great start to a vacation! The room was clean, not at all old and decrepit (like mentioned in other reviews) and comfortable all around. The hotel is pretty old but they seem to be in the process of upgrading so it really doesn't seem that bad. Good price and great service throughout our stay too! THE BAD: Their hot tub was out of service which was very disappointing as that was one of the reasons I picked this hotel. OVERALL: Definitely worth a second visit!
review_content_20: AVOID.I stay at a Courtyard Marriott several times a month.  This location isn't one of the worst Courtyards, it's one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at.  There are several other downtown hotels in Collumbus - I would stay at any other place before I would go back here.  It is simply not up to the standards we expect of a Courtyard Marriott.My complaints.  First, this hotel is not wheelchair friendly.  No, I don't use one and I'm quite capable of taking stairs two at a time.  But I do have family members who aren't as fortunate and I notice when you have to climb six or seven stairs just to get from the lobby to the elevators.  And if you have any luggage, you will have to lug it up those stairs.Second, there are two elevators and one was out of service during our stay. We had to wait more than 15 minutes just to get on to a totally packed elevator (which was NOT fun - it stopped on every single floor) to take us to our room on the fifth floor.Third, in the morning, we discovered that the water in the shower did not work.  No, this wasn't just no hot water... it was no water AT ALL.  We called the front desk to complain and the clerk acted like it had never happened before.  Ultimately, the manager told us that several guests had complained about the very same thing that morning.  There is no excuse for this.Fourth, we called to have our car brought up from valet parking about 10 minutes before we left our room when we checked out.  Despite providing that notice, the car was not there when we wanted to leave.  In fact, the valet guys hadn't even received the order from the front desk to bring our car up!  We had to wait about 15 more minutes for the car.  That's a nice touch for paying $19.To their credit, the manager "comped" our room that evening and admitted that the service we received during our stay was unacceptable.  While I appreciated her accommodation, I would have preferred to have paid and received the usual excellent Courtyard Marriott service and style during my stay.In summary, this property is not to the standards you expect from a Courtyard Marriott. There are other choices within a block or two of this property.  Use them.Nice rooms, modern architecture. The valet service is convenient even though it's extra. It's better than having to go park somewhere and paying for it when they will do it for 21 dollars a day. Our room was nice and clean. The staff is hospitable. We walked right down the street to nationwide arena for the bluejackets game. It's a great location. We will definitely return.This hotel is in a great spot downtown. You can walk just about anywhere from here without killing your feet. The staff is polite and friendly. Parking is kind of annoying. I had to drive around the building twice to see where valet parking was. They have a very small sign, which is hard to see if you aren't familiar with the area. There is a lot of construction going on right now, which made some of the hotel extras unavailable (pool/hot tub etc.).The room seemed nice enough, although it could have used more cleaning. There was visible dust around the perimeter.I really have no complaints about my overnight stay in this hotel. I read the other reviews before posting this one and all I can say is that I am glad my stay seems to have been more pleasant that most. The location is pretty decent. It is in downtown Columbus and there really isn't too much around in the area. We were in Columbus for a concert and would be there overnight so that wasn't too much of a big deal. The hotel is in walking distance from many bars, restaurants, and venues for concerts and sports. The room itself was pretty roomy and cozy. The bed was very comfortable and there was a desk and a chair in the room. The room itself was very pleasant and I was okay being in the room before the concert I attended and afterward as well. The one thing that was odd about the room itself was that the sink for the bathroom was right next to the door. It was outside of the bathroom with the toilet and shower. But I wouldn't say that it made the room horrible to be in. It was just odd. The staff was very friendly and we were even able to check in a couple of hours early. Our room was ready and I couldn't have been happier. If i ever return to Columbus for an event, I won't hesitate to stay here.Why two stars? So you have a stroller with a sleeping baby... how do you get from lobby to the elevator? What if you have a twisted ankle and need to do the same? Well... you will have to figure out how to get up those damn stairs. Really really really stupid layout of the hotel! We are not talking some motel here. This is one of the Marriott properties!Rooms really need some refreshing too. We had a suite and kitchen cabinets were really dingy. At least the staff is really nice.When I see some of the photos of the hotel taken just 6 months ago I'm surprised at how different it is now. Everything, as far as I can tell, has been updated & looks very modern. Kind of a mid-century look in a way. Overall no complaints other than shower not being hot. Sort went in & out, as if there was some kind of conservation device installed.Clean and comfy, and a GREAT location near the arena district.  Staff was friendly and polite and helpful.  Only two nits I can pick:  (1) the beds, although super comfy, were very low to the ground.  Others in the bar were asking/complaining about the same issue and (2) the AC/Heater in our room was very noisy.I am writing this review to counter the other less favorable reviews and felt the . I am not sure if this is due to recent improvements or if this hotel has always been worthy of high reviews but I am very happy with my experience. The included free wifi has average speeds comparable to other Marriott's. The non-complimentary valet parking is an issue, however there is plenty of alternative parking and street parking if you are stretching your money. The rooms are clean, unique, updated (flat screens, a/c units) and adorned with wall outlets. My experience was very enjoyable.Let me start by saying this review is specifically oriented to the "suites." We booked 2 suite style rooms the weekend I got married and were extremely disappointed. The only additional space was a kitchen area. There was no extra living space and the bathroom was TINY. Also, my bridesmaids and I had our dresses hanging in the closet, not very heavy at all, and the closet rod completely pulled out of the wall. I will not stay here again unless there are no other downtown hotel rooms available.Can't say that this is the best hotel in the world, as it isn't. What I can say is it is a place to stay for the night. What is remarkable about this hotel is that is exceeds at being nothing special. For instance. It has internet, but the connection is spotty and I would often only be able to do things when I was ready to hurl my computer accross the room. Maybe I should have reached that idea sooner and my work email would have loaded a little faster. There were a few free things laid out in the bathroom when you arrived, a few things extra, but I really want to say a few. There was conditioner but no shampoo, there was a facial soap but no hand soap. There were suppose to be towels in the bathroom but there were just wash clothes and handtowels. I am a big kid and the hand towel was hummors but not terribly useful. The location is very downtown, but nothing is really in downtown Columbus. You need to walk over to the short north area (it is north but there are only average sized people there) or near all the art school people. Also the conference areas where really small. Which was great because we were a small group. I want to say something good about this place, but the bell hop, either misspoke or I got a little bit scammed as he handed me a card for a cab to the airport telling me it was 15 bucks. But when I presented the card and the 15 bucks I was told it was a different price. All in all, this is a place to say for the night when you have had such a good life you need to be grounded a bit, you have had such a good trip you need to switch it up a bit. Maybe you want to see if your girl is the one for your, you can bring her here and see how she acts. See if she makes the best of it or she complains the whole time. This would be the best place in the world for that. Also, they had water, but only from 2 pm to 10am. For four hours during the day, they didn't have any water. Imagine being a germ-a-phone stuck in the bathroom with no water...There are only a few musts for a hotel for me. One of the top is free flowing hot water. Unfortunately the water in my room never exceeded room temperature :( and after 10 minutes went cold. Maybe it was my room, 116, but it was wretched.The AC unit was awesome, however! The blinds let in way too much light :( so i awoke at 530am!The mgr was apologetic and did offer me something from the shop for my trouble, and for that they got an extra star.I guess I have high expectations of Marriott Court Yards. For some reason I was a little disappointed with this hotel. The service was okay and the room was clean (it passed my bed bug inspection) but something was missing. I think it was missing the pretty Marriott feeling. The hotel had dingy carpet in the lobby and in the halls, old lighting fixtures in public spaces, and very limited amenities. Honestly the hotel just lacked the fresh clean glow. Every Marriott I have been to have had that Marriott magic. Not this one. If you are staying here for the brand name, you will feel like me--- disappointed. But I will go over some of the positives- We requested a fridge for no charge, the room was clean each day we stayed, the hotel was perfectly located (it is within walking distance to Arena District and Short North), there was parking available (although very expensive). My advice to you- Stay here if you are getting good deal (or if you have "points saved up"), if not maybe try exploring other options. This is not the worst hotel in Columbus but I doubt its even close to the best.The service provided by Shawntae, Jeanine, Seilda, Samuel and Ryan was great.  However, my bathroom in my room could use a huge amount of Tilex it was filthy and I found hairs in the shower that did not belong to me.   The doors are not secure enough for my taste.  It definitely requires some rennovation.One word: unacceptable.   Tired hotel.  Terrible beds and outdated bathrooms.   Has the feel of an old Motel 6.  Not at all what I expect from Marriott.If I didn't know better, I would be convinced that Marriott had hand-picked and gathered all their best staff from the entire Great Lakes region and put them into this Courtyard. Seriously, they're that good!We held a work event here and, WOW! This was the first time (and one of the only) in my career that I felt compelled to write a personal thank you letter to a facility for their stupendous service. Even our clients repeatedly commented on the excellent caliber of the staff.Need something? German's your man (anything -- he can make it happen!). Rather eat your breakfast outside the dining room? Nancy will box it up for you. Parking your car? The valet guys will smile and chat with you like they've known you forever. Need a band-aid? Yep, someone will drop whatever it is they're doing to make sure that's taken care of too. The only ONLY negative to this wonderful hotel is the building itself. A historic building, I understand, makes remodeling complicated. So perhaps once the renovations have been completed here I'll be able to give them the 5th star. But until then, the slow elevators and "eh" sleeping rooms where you can hear *everything* around you leave it at 4.This is a summary of the events that occurred while staying at the Columbus Marriott on West Spring Street: Water was turned off within 15 minutes after checking in. No warning. Glad I was not in the shower at the time. Called to have refrigerator put in room. Three hours after I make the call and return to the room, the refrigerator is sitting there unplugged. After I plug in the device it does not work. Replaced with brand new one. Before going down stairs for breakfast, which was now complimentary, I requested that my car be brought up within 10 minutes. Upon my completing my meal it was determined that it was not called for yet. On another occasion after the car was brought out and waiting outside, the valet was not there. After a moment he appeared with the keys. The desk lamp has faulty outlets to charge a laptop or cellphone. I inform the front desk just to inform them and NOT to replace it until my departure on Saturday. I return from dinner to find that it has been replaced. And by the way the lights flicker!You cannot make this up. Sounds like the movie Planes, Trains and Automobiles.This stay at that Columbus Marriott has been the worst stay of any Marriott over the past seven months. I would have checked out tonight (my second night) to make this a more powerful statement but it is just too much trouble and I am looking forward to see what can happen over the next few days.The last straw: 0n 2/23/2012 the hot water coming out of the sink was at best ?warm?. After calling the front desk to inquire if there was a problem, I was informed that this has been an on-going problem. Done. It appears that the ?owner? does not want make an investment in his establishment to retain customers. The front desk manager called back shortly to inform me that 3000 points were going to be added to my account, even after I had informed I would probably be checking out in our first conversation. The gesture on his part was nice but he knew that it was not going to keep in from leaving the hotel.I hope this information will be used to improve the quality of lodging offered by the Marriott on West Spring Street.Update: 2/29/2012; those 3000 points have yet to show up in my Rewards account (holding at 305,000) No word yet from the GM AFTER LEAVING MESSAGE EARLIER TODAY. No word yet from regional office. No more business for Courtyard Columbus. Now where is that Hilton directory?Update: 3/2/2012 - Spoke to the GM at the hotel who fully understood my frustration and reason for leaving. I was informed that he was going to add an additional 7000 points (for a total of 10000) to my account as well as having just had the boiler replaced resulting in plenty of hot water. This being done, I look forward to a return to the downtown Courtyard in the future.Holy crap, Marriott, WTF?Room is musty and damp, internet connection is beyond worthless and I can't get any work done, and the heater/AC unit in the room seemed to be set either to stank hot or freezing cold.  Courtyards are usually great, but not this one - won't be staying here again.I've stayed here once for 3 nights, and I would say "average" is the best word to describe this place. The rooms are really small, compared to other regular rooms in other hotels. There is a small gym down the basement that can probably accommodate 5 people max. This place is only great if you're attending a convention at the nearby convention center, which is about 3/4 miles away.I come to this hotel 2 to 3 times every year to see the Columbus Blue Jackets play at Nationwide Arena.  It is a great hotel that I have never had one issue with.  The staff is always very attentive and helpful.  There is a parking garage just one block west at the corner of Ludlow and Spring that I always use as it is a $6 daily rate.  Even if I go to a Blue Jackets game and don't stay there I usually use this lot.  Parking around the arena of course is high around game time.  Room are nicely put together and updated quite nicely with newer beds and LCD TVs.  I always hit the in house bar before or after the game for a beer or cocktail.  The prices are reasonable, but it is a hotel bar so they are a bit inflated.  There is an outdoor pool but I never get to use it because it is always winter when I am there.  Get to Columbus and hit a Blue Jackets game, the Arena District for a drink (Barley's Brewery is close) and the stumble back for some shut eye.I am a loyal Marriott guest, but this CY comes up short.  The rooms have  air/ heat units built into the wall which was both noisy and you could hear the traffic on the street. The beds were also in need of an upgrade.  On a positive note, the staff was great - friendly, helpful, and courteous.

review_content: Couldn't have been more satisfied with my stays at the Renaissance in Columbus- Friendly Staff - Quick Valet- Location is right in downtown- Rooms were quietSometimes I would get a room with two queen sized beds instead of the 1 King requested, so that was kind of disappointing but not a deal breaker. Would definitely stay againI stay at this hotel 3 times a year for business trips and the outcome is always the same. While at first it feels comfortable, decor modern there are few things that make this place very uncomfortable after a few nights stays.1) it sounds like water is running all night. Not sure if it's because of the elevators or what but the noise is constant.2)the showers have a half door that make it impossible for you to turn on the water without getting your entire arm wet.3)housekeeping never does a good job of cleaning in the morning (fresh towels, replacing things ect) my bed was barely made this trip. I also did not have a single trash can in my room until I requested.I'm still giving the Renaissance 3 stars because of the staff- restaurant-bar- and front desk. Just wish they could get it right the first time!As a loyalist to Marriott, I take issue with this hotel being branded as a Renaissance. It is still has way to many signs of the old branding of the days when Ramada owned the brand, from the sign on the hotel, to some of the questionable design of the bathroom, and decor.This is not how I think of the "luxurious hotel with upscale amenities". First off, the room was dirty. Yes, I know that housekeeping doesn't have that much time to turn over a room, but massive encrusted stands on the bathroom door, sink, table side bed, and other common areas is wrong. It looks like they tried to remodel the rooms at some point, but they really just added the standard quick designs enchantments, i.e lamps, bedspreads, headboards, etc. The beds, queens, are shorter than what I would expect and the bed is more typical to a cheaper brand because it was a pretty standard mattress that was on the harder side.The bathroom was a throw back with half a glass for the shower and no actual door. The room I stayed in ended up having a door that would fold in half and was cramped. The price charged for this property is not worth the quality of the hotel.This was a nice hotel with SOME luxury hotel options. Beds were great but still has quite a bit of old style, low budget hotel. You have to pay for internet at $269! HowI have to say that the staff was super nice and exceptionalVery nice hotel but the internet isn't free, we paid 300$ for a room and don't get free internet. The parking is valet so if you don't wanna pay for that you will have to find somewhere on the street to park.
