The rooms are really nice though, beds are super comfortable.I haven't written a 4 star review in awhile, and it's definitely not going to be now. For 270 bucks this place is a joke. Cons: valet parking only 25 bucks each night. the room was dirty. It had a cup of beer still in the mini fridge. The walls are paper thin, and we weren't even by the elevator but this is not a place you want to stay if noise bothers you. The grout in the shower was stained like it hasn't been cleaned. There was crud built up around the perimeter of the bathroom floor was built up with crud. The toilets are attached to the wall and are comically low, like I felt that I was back in India. The decor was kind of Art Deco mixed with early 1990's. Pros: comfortable mattress and our room had a view overlooking nationwide stadium. Pleasant staff overall. 9 dollar uber ride to short north. And bar open until midnight serving snacks.One of the staff at the small restaurant they have there was snide and rude and implied racist tones and prejudice values. I don't know how business is done in Phoenix and I'm sure that doesn't reflect the whole of Phoenix however this man was clearly in charge of things and if a hotel, any in fact employs such a character you can be sure that I, nor any one will want to spend money there. I am sick of this attitude people thrown out at others. What kind of person works in an area that serves others and as someone who fights for the equality of others, I am disappointed in this company that is part of an esteemed company. Is this the sort of values placed in this hotel?I stayed at the Renaissance Columbus Downtown Hotel for a couple of days when I was in town for business as it was close to the client that I had to meet and we had a corporate rate for the rooms.As its name suggests the Renaissance Columbus Downtown Hotel is located bang in the middle of downtown and has a plethora of dining options within a two block radius. It's about 10 miles form the airport and a taxi can get you here for about $25. I had a rental car so had to fork out another $25/day for valet as that's the only parking option available here. If you are only going to be in the downtown area I would recommend that you simply take a cab to the hotel and walk rather than taking a rental vehicle.I had booked a room with a king bed but as they were out I was given a room with two queen beds for the first night. The room was good but you can see that it is dated. In-fact the entire hotel looks dated and can surely do with a complete make over specially considering that the average nightly rate is $250 + $25 for valet + $15 for internet + $20 for breakfast + tax. For this amount I would expect a much better property. Fortunately I had a corporate rate so paid significantly less than they rack rates at-least for the first night. Unfortunately my return flight was cancelled and I had to return here for another night when they extracted their pound of flesh as discounted rates were not available during weekends. They provide Aveda products in the bathroom which I'm not a very big fan of. I was hoping they would have Thann like other Marriott's but that was not to be. Another annoying thing was that the water pressure in the shower was weak. Apart from this all other amenities were standard stuff that you would find in any other hotel so nothing special to report here (steam iron + board, coffee maker, cooler, alarm clock, safe). Check-in was as smooth as it gets and there is a taxi stand just outside the hotel's lobby so getting around is also a breeze.The Renaissance Columbus downtown hotel served me well given for my requirements and I would use them again if I get rooms at the discounted rates.My husband and I are moving to Columbus, Ohio and stayed at the Renaissance for a night while we met with a realtor.  I've stayed at probably over 100 hotels in the last 3-4 years... and I can truly say that the service at this Renaissance is on par with high end 5 star hotels.  Pros:* The Gold member lounge is one of the best. Not only did it have an incredible view and pretty good food, Kevin, the manager, MADE our experience!  When he found out we were moving to the area, he gave us his personal cell phone and encouraged us to call if we had questions.  He was awesome!* Rooftop pool. Enough said!* Room was spacious and offered every amenity you would expect from a Marriott* Front desk service was exceptional as well.  They made check-in and check-out a breeze* The lobby area has some beautiful intimate seating.  Cons: * I hate paying for parking.  It annoys me that hotels tack on extra room charges (internet, parking, etc) after you reserved your rate.  * The hotel is located in downtown Columbus.  It's pretty central and easy to get to-- although there isn't a lot within walking distance.Bottom line:  This hotel is PERFECT for a weekend getaway OR a business trip.  You will not be disappointed.Staff great and lobby very nice (and atmosphere much nicer here than at the Hyatt).Rooms are just OK. Water pressure not great, and room cold and hard to heat (in fact, the entire floor was very cold). Pool outdoors and so only available in the summer. Didn't love this hotel but I'd pick here instead of the Convention Center Hyatt (about a 10 minute walk from here to the convention center).Very good restaurants nearby (G. Micheal's Bistro, Wolf's Ridge Brewing) and so if you don't need to leave the downtown area no need to rent a car (walk or take a taxi).+ friendly and helpful staff+ clean hotel+ the rooms are very quiet - the only drawback is the tv channel selection. It's not as good as the Hilton's in the area.Comfy bed, decent bathroom and satisfactory service. If that's all you are after for a hotel, then this place has you covered. Please note that they will rape you on WiFi costs. So ridiculous that it's something close to 15 dollars for 1 day of terribly slow internet. It was a joke. Also the forced valet parking was annoying as well. You don't get much for your money for the New Years Eve bash here either, though I think the party organisers are to blame for this and not the Renaissance itself.My stay at the Renaissance was good, uneventful, and smooth.  I checked in Wed, July 23-25.  There were 2 large conventions going on, which I partook in one.  The other conventions participants were rude (not all of them, but maybe half of them), which didn't help my stay there.  Besides that, the employees were always very helpful, friendly and smiling.  I requested a room on the floor of the pool (4th floor) because I was hoping to use it, but the water was too cold for my liking.  They did have a hot tub.  Valet parking only ($25)Small Refrigerator in rooms :)Tiny odd shaped bathroomsThe best part of my stay was the employees!!!As a Platinum member for multiple years, I have had the chance to stay in hundreds of Marriott properties. One property type I try and stay away from are Courtyards, for one reason - they often have doors that slam and are incredibly annoying to other rooms nearby.  This is not something I would expect from a quality property like the Renaissance!  I am not sure how costly or complex adding a door stopper would be, but the constant slamming of doors around our room last night drove us crazy!!Separately, the organization of staff at the restaurant is comical.  There was a long line at the front and NO host.  All the separate people in line were basically joking how ridiculous it was until someone actually went and grabbed someone after no greeting from anyone for nearly 10 minutes.  I am sure the hotel knows how many rooms are filled and therefore can translate that into the likely crowd at the restaurant. The interior of the rooms are fine...nothing special, though I do find it funny that the plumbing for the toilet is reminiscent of a factory, not a nice hotel...This is a nice hotel with a few quirks.  I stayed here for a week, and overall I was pretty happy.The room decor is pretty, although the room was slightly cramped.  They gave me two beds when I was travelling alone, but I didn't really care to ask for a different room.  There are lots of convenient outlets near the desk and night stand.  The in-room toiletries are a step up from the standard shampoo, conditioner, and bar soap; they also give you toothpaste, lotion, mouthwash, a shower cap, cotton balls, cotton swabs, and an emery board.  The bathroom door, however, is this weird folding thing that sort of gets in the way, but the area is also too cramped for a full size door, so I'm not really sure what else to do about that.  There is also a hair dryer, coffee maker, and refrigerator in the room.In-room internet costs about $13 a day, which has unfortunately become standard practice in a lot of hotels.  Be warned that if you use an RSS reader or similar program that tries to download information from a lot of websites at once, their ISP will block you and you will have to call to get unblocked, even though this is a completely legitimate activity.  The outsourced tech support people were both very rude and unhelpful in explaining this to me; I had to figure it out myself after I got blocked twice.  However, the Renaissance staff comped the internet charges for the rest of my stay because of the problems I was having with it, which is above and beyond what I expected them to do.There was a huge window in my room that is poorly insulated.  I stayed in the winter during a snowstorm, and I quickly realized that my plan of sitting by the window with a cup of tea and watching the snow wasn't going to happen because of the cold air coming in around the window.  I wound up having to leave the blackout curtains closed at all hours and crank up the thermostat to try to offset the poor insulation, and I couldn't sit in the armchair--it was next to the cold window, and the room was too small to move it anywhere else.  Especially for a place that claims to be environmentally conscious, this is really inefficient, not to mention made my experience a little less pleasant.  Proper insulation goes a long way toward conserving energy.Transportation was pretty easy.  Taxis hang out on standby outside this hotel, so it was very easy to get to the airport.  There are also several bus stops nearby.  There are a few restaurants in easy walking distance, but not much in the way of shopping.  There are also a couple of theaters nearby, which I wish I'd had time to check out.  One major drawback of the location is that many of the local restaurants close at 5pm, so getting dinner can be a little difficult.There's a little business center with a couple of computers, a printer, and a copier.  You can print your boarding passes for free, but otherwise you have to pay to use the computers.  The printer was running low on ink when I was there, and the business center wasn't stocked with lots of things that I would consider basics--I had to go to the front desk to borrow a stapler.The fitness room is well equipped, with treadmills, stationary bikes, and elliptical machines.  There was a bowl of fruit provided for a post workout snack.  The pool is outdoors, so unfortunately it was closed when I was there.The hotel restaurant was mediocre, but I covered it in a separate review.  I didn't pay full price for a room here, so I can't comment on the value for the money.It appears much more elegant than it is. It's all about the details! The location rocks, and the amenities were all pretty cool, rooftop pool terrace was nice, the teak furniture was amazing. Gym was something I would expect (without the sauna) at a $80-100/night hotel. Was here for a convention/business meeting with catering provided, none of the meals were impressive, and you had to go find staff to replenish the serving pans. Rooms were nice enough, the bathroom was a bit cramped, and the towels were scratchy as hell - like sandpaper. I had a good night's sleep on the king bed, and I did appreciate the view of downtown Columbus.The advantage to this location is close proximity to the Ohio State House, a genuinely gracious and helpful staff and a quick $7 cab ride to German Village district. Following usual Marriott guidelines, the hotel is quite clean and your standard room is simply adequate. Upon our March arrival with local outside temps in the 40's we found the room to be a bit warm but the air management system controls responded to our programming and cooled off to our satisfaction. The standard bathroom is small but well designed for the one person that will be using it at a time. Do note the interesting shower stall. In lieu of a shower curtain there is an attractive glass half wall divider that forces you to reach into the stall from the back to turn on the shower. Expect a five second blast of ice cold water until the instant hot water kicks in (TIP: cover the shower head with a wash cloth for the initial rush of water.) The hotel concierge has the entire downtown area information dialed in and was most helpful with the loan of an umbrella to a traveling companion caught short in an unexpected rainstorm. There is a restaurant on premesis (not recommended, see review elsewhere for Latitude 41).If ratings were split I would rate the hotel at 3.5, above average. The rating would be raised to 4.0 if Marriott would (a.) provide better cable TV programming (you'll only get local network affiliates, five channels of ESPN, Sponge Bob and fortunately CNBC and Bloomberg Business channels); (b.) if the hotel didn't up-charge additional amenities like use of the Business Center computers (Instead I had the desk clerk print out my airline boarding passes, gratis) or (c.) the room charge for high speed internet (my Android smart phone avoids Windows OS and decoded the server just fine, at no charge). Room taxes between the local city and state will add about $25 to your daily rate. This is the first Marriott property that I have liked. A few policy changes and this could be one of the top tier hotels in downtown Columbus.Visited Columbus for work -- in the midst of a "Polar Vortex" stretch.  There was just no getting warm in the hotel.  However with the negative double digit temps....I wasn't really expecting to be warm.  Historic hotel located in the heart of downtown.  I, unfortunately, did not explore Columbus that much -- as the cold kept me indoors.  I am grateful there was a nice restaurant with meals options at reasonable prices that I could enter through the lobby.  Pros:1.  Aveda toiletries.  Nicely done. 2.  Great shower -- just the right water pressure.3.  Friendly staff -- who didn't let the cold get them down.  Even the men working to greet you outdoors.4.  Internet cost was comped when I was not able to connect to it without having to call the help desk.  Cons:1.  No pillow options for those that sleep on their belly.  I am a sucker for the historic hotel details.   If I have to be in Columbus again, I'd be happy to stay here.I was up in Columbus for a soccer tournament and my club booked us at this hotel. We looked at pictures of the rooms and other parts of the hotel, and we were satisfied. But when we finally got there we noticed there were pros and cons of the hotel.Pros:-Beautiful Fitness Center-Comfy beds-Nice lounge and bar-Quick and easy check-in/outCons:-The bathrooms are very small-The valet is a little slow not extremely thoughI've always liked Renaissance Hotels and this one was no exception. My late check-in was easy and there was even a big bowl of bananas at the counter, which was nice. My room on the 21st floor was very clean and had everything I needed. The area near the toilet/shower/bathroom door was a little tight but aside from that, no complaints about the room itself. Well, unless you count the thin walls. I wasn't bothered at all in the night - the time I found the loudest was before noon the next day when housekeeping was opening and closing (which sounded more like slamming) doors in the hallway.  I ordered a pot of coffee one morning which was on the pricey side but room service always is - you pay for convenience!I heard that there is a nice pool on the fourth floor but I never got to check it out for myself - maybe next time. I am hopeful for another trip to Columbus in my future and this is exactly where I would stay!
review_content_20: I love the Renaissance. While the rooms can be small, depending on the type, the beds are comfortable and the customer service is top notch.  At night its the perfect place to unwind. I stay here often and the bartenders, security and staff have become family. All they have to do is make the bathrooms bigger and this would be a 5 star review.I could not be happier w/my stay at the Renaissance in Downtown Columbus. The staff really know how to treat their guests. From the time I pulled up to the front door to the time I left, this place was class all the way. The room itself was really nice w/big, comfortable beds and most of the amenities you could want. The restaurant & bar inside both were hits (the restaurant specifically had a breakfast buffet I gorged on), and it's close to everything you could need in Downtown. 10/10 would stay again.My recent stay at this hotel was organized literally at the last minute. I've usually stayed at one of several Marriott-owned hotels, however I decided to be a bit of a cheapskate on my 4-day trip to Columbus. Big mistake. The hotel I originally made reservations at came with a certain bed bug infestation as well as plumbing issues. I had literally 10 minutes to jump online and arrange to stay at an alternative hotel (at my own expense of course. I'm waiting for AmEx to credit my account for that nasty place). So I came to the Renaissance Hotel in the middle of the night looking for a breath of fresh air...and that's exactly what I got. The front desk staff were absolutely amazing and the in-house restaurant was delicious. I've learned a very important lesson this week: You pay for what you get!! Don't be fooled by cheaper rates elsewhere.The hotel is dated and the amenities are terrible. Service is not what you come to expect at a Marriott property. The lobby bar lacks ambience and the wine list is awful.  Avoid this property!Was at this tell for a recent conference, and was pleasantly delighted. Their staff was incredibly friendly from the valet and bell staff, to the front desk staff, to house keeping. The lobby was open and welcoming, and the room was positively lovely, very open and with beautiful linen. Honestly, my only complaints are how the nice hotels piecemeal every thing (no free internet in rooms, no free computers in the lobby, no free breakfast, etc), and their restaurant. Their restaurant took absolutely forever; 90 minutes to eat a sandwich at lunch, and both nights, were "reservations only" which is a problem for a conference hotel with few restaurants accessibly near by (for someone with a disability), and only pizza places to deliver. Hotel gets 5 stars, restaurant 2.5, so I'll even out at 4 stars.I stay at a lot of hotels and I prefer Marriott properties (elite). Very rarely am I blown away by good service but it happened tonight. Service at the front desk was fantastic!  Will stay again for sure.This was one of the visits I wished my flight would cancel so I could stay longer. Not a grand lobby, but very comfortable and modern with old photos of past Ohio Presidents.Loved the room decor, smart and sharp, very comforting.Nice modern bathroom with a large sink and nice sized shower. The folding door was funky. What I disliked most about the bathroom was that one must completely get inside the shower to turn it on, thus, I was blasted by cold water. There is no shower curtain, just a 2/3 wall of glass and the shower controls are at the far end. Did NOT like!Also not a fan of the public rest room-style commode, with the loud flush. I was alone in my room, but was thinking, had I had a guest with me, there is no quiet middle of the night flushing going on in this room! HELLO, I'VE FLUSHED THE TOILET, WAKE UP NOW!My room had hair everywhere! The woman who stayed before me must now be bald! Long, black, wavy hair in the bathroom, on the floor near the closet, on the commode, in the shower, and a nest near the entry door. It was like someone's head exploded! The housekeeper must need glasses.Very nice staff. I didn't get to the work out area, but my room looked down on the pool from the 17th floor and it looked nice. I did notice street noise late at night inside my room, however, I do sleep with a white noise app, so I slept very well.There was only one outlet...located on the wall behind the night stand. For those who need a CPAP, it's not the most convenient. And if you need more than one, bring an extension cord.With a location 2 blocks from the Statehouse in the middle of downtown, it was very convenient. I'd love to return!A step above most Columbus hotels- comfortable bed, updated decor, nice lobby bar area, but odd shaped bathrooms?Beautiful hotel with very crisp rooms.  Not a huge fan of the location unless you need to be on this side of downtown (would prefer to be on the northern end of downtown).  Great service.I stayed here a couple of times over the summer for work. Out of every Renaissance I have ever stayed at, this is my least favorite. They need to update their rooms. They are aging badly. The bathrooms are like closets and had to request to be moved more than once because there was mold in the grout. You do have to pay for internet and parking but can get some serious deals through Priceline name  your own price.Nice rooms, expensive parking, but not bad compared to downtown hotels in other cities, that's for sure. They accidentally gave me two queens when I had requested a king bed. The front desk got me another room without delay. The rooftop pool is nice, great place for a fancy party.The Renaissance houses Latitude 41, but there's several other dining choices nearby on Gay St. Try the Tip Top dinner and drinks, and Cafe Brioso for coffee in the morning.I wanted so badly to give this place 5 stars. Unfortunately, there were some major issues.Pros:-Great amenities. The pool and hot tub deck are beautiful. -My guest agent at the front desk was extremely welcoming and was working as fast as she could with wedding guests arriving to check in all at once. (Thank you, Ashton! You'd get 5 stars yourself!)-Aveda products in the bathroom. SCORE!-Valet service was fast and friendly. $25 to park ($17 for us as wedding guests), but that's standard for downtown hotel valet.Cons:-Latitude 41 is great, but pricey. So is the bar. We spent $40 on 8 miller lite's. Really?-My first room had puke on the lamp. Gross. How do you miss that?! (I will say I was immediately moved and given a 1,000 Marriott Rewards Bonus, so at least they remedied it).-There was a difficult guest at the front desk when I was trying to get my room changed from the puke room to a puke-free room. One of the front desk agents flipped out on her, screaming "This is a 5-star hotel! You need to leave a credit card for incidentals!", among other things. I don't care how annoying a guest is, the response back and the attitude the agent had was horrific.-For some odd reason, my hallway's rooms were not as nice nor updated as the rest of the hotel. My parents had a beautiful room and a lovely bathroom on the 15th floor... my 4th floor room (the non-vomit one) was clean but just not up to par with other rooms.-My shower... it was more like a drizzle. No pressure.-My room was across the hall from the storage closet where they pull chairs for outdoor weddings. Fine. But please don't start pulling them out at 7am and SLAMMING them on a Sunday morning, not to mention talking loudly with your buddies on wedding set-up with you. Too early, too loud, no sleep.-The wedding we were there for... decorated beautifully. But it had problems. One of the bartenders was rude and snatched a beer out of my dad's hand and told him to "wait 2 minutes". We had to wait several times as bartenders disappeared (my assumption is they were getting more liquor or beer, but shouldn't there be a runner for them, maybe?). Overall, the catering staff was not very polite or welcoming.Not a great experience, Renaissance.Wish I could give a half star! This place is so lame you drop all this money on a room and stuff and they have a sick pool so you want to come back to the hotel and just chill in the jacuzzi but the pool is only open until 11pm on a Friday! Such a let down.So I'm a Wolverine in Buckeye town and my gut tells me I shouldn't like it here... but I do!  I've only been at this hotel for a few hours so far, but I'm impressed... Friendly staff? check!Spacious, clean room? check!Bathroom amenities? check!Comfy bed? check!And from what I've read in previous reviews, there is a kick ass workout room too!  There's also something on the room service menu called "Buckeye Pancakes," described as Valrhona chocolate, peanut butter, and maple syrup.  I'll be staying away from those as it's too early in the year (read: new years resolutions and baby weight to lose), but they do sound delicious!I think I found my home away from home when I come to Columbus!Good place. Conveniently located. Good bar and in house restaurant. Will stay again.I am a Marriott loyalist, usually stay at the Residence Inn which is just down the street (it's in an old bank building which is cool, especially breakfast which is served from the old vault), but Renaissance is better.  Club level serves delicious offerings for breakfast or evening; the rooms are very comfortable, especially the beds.  But the Lobby steals the show, especially if you are a road warrior like me and would like to feel at home when you are on the road.  Bar and restaurant (Latitude) fit the bill.Pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Would choose to stay here again if back in the area.Upscale hotel, but the walls are paper thin.  You can hear people talking in their rooms from the hall so I should have seen it coming.  At 2:15 a.m. we heard a bang of the door and loud talking for 1/2 hour after that...and that sucks, you would expect more from such a nice hotel. Other than that they have Aveda products for soap, shampoo and conditioner, which is nice.  And they have a bowl of fresh banana's when you check in.  But for me, noise is everything, I would recommend staying elsewhere downtown.  That sucks because this hotel is in a great spot, right near the river to run, great restaurants.That one star is for the breakfast buffet staff and Valet. Friendly & sweet, even if they do move slow...Everyone starts with 5 stars.-1 star for my room. First glance, very nice then there was no ice bucket, no bathtub only shower, the water temps varied from scalding hot to luke warm, but no place in between.-1 star for thin walls and loud housekeeping.-1 star for tipping house keeping and all they did was change my towells and make my bed. Not empy my trash, not clean the shower(but maybe they just didnt want to play in that painfully hot water)-1 Big Stinky star for the elevators and lobby stinking like viniger. They passed the buck off to the kitchen, but that whole 1st floor stink, stank, stunk! there was no attempt to compinsate any guest who complained. Free meal, late checkout? something? NOPE just "yeah it sure does stink" and a look like oh well we got your money..Not t mention the high wifi fees and parking fees. And nont bother paying for your incidentals upon check out. These money hungrey thugs will find someway to charge your debit card. Needless to say ill Never Ever stay at this travisty of a 4 star again.This hotel doesnt deserve to be a 4 star. Holiday Inn statusGreat staff.  Clean place, but very dated accommodations.  Can't swing a cat in the bath.
review_content_40: The hotel staff were exceptional. Kudos to all of them! The accommodations were functional but not remarkable. I found the bathroom to be very small with an odd bi-fold door that was very cumbersome. There was a very spacious living area in the room, but the work area (where I spend more time) was ... for lack of a better word, "klunky". The chair rolled backwards into the bed, the drawers on the desk, when open, required me to stand to the side or else I ran into the bed. The whole room arrangement was ill-designed. It may, however, have just been my particular room - at the end of the hallway. The bed and pillows were ok - I found the bed to be slightly uncomfortable. Next time in Columbus, I will try somewhere else.There's nothing really wrong with this hotel (my room staff were exceptionally friendly and sincere), but they price it like they're in New York, and when you step outside, you're only in Columbus. A number of people who were going to attend our convention didn't come because they couldn't justify the airfare plus the room rates. It was three times what we paid for much nicer rooms in Las Vegas, a town with as much or more to offer. If you've ever had occasion to use the facilities in one of the rooms, you'll appreciate the slogan "The Renaissance: Where the prices are high and the toilets are low."This is a nice hotel to stay in when traveling on business. The people were very nice. The room was very nice. Nothing extra special. But nothing wrong either. I would stay here again.Attended a conference here this past weekend, and was impressed by the hotel and its staff. The public rooms are attractive and comfortable. Our king-bed guest room was clean, comfortable and fairly large. The meals catered by the hotel were excellent, with very attentive service. And the two group cocktail services were also without fault.There was a charge in the room for wi-fi (don't remember the amount, but ridiculous to have to pay at all), and also a hefty daily parking fee ($25 per day). Hence the four stars. But the overall experience impressed me, and I would consider staying here if in Columbus again.So I paid for the hotel for 12 nights via the internet--it was close to work--so it was a win-win situation for me. Per their website, they are a 4 out of 5 star hotel. I was impressed with the check-in, the workers were waiting outside to load items on the baggage carrier to inside the hotel. There were about 3 to 4 people ahead of me to check in at the front desk. The total check-in process took about 10 to 15 minutes: (from getting out the car and being checked in). Their lobby is very modern, and near the elevators you have the restaurant inside the hotel called Latitude 41 (see their reviews on Yelp.com). Since I was spending a load of cash already, I chose not to buy from their restaurant. You can order up to midnight to get room service. I was under the assumption that they'd have a small kitchenette with at least a microwave--however I was kind of disappointed--no kitchenette nor microwave to speak of. You do get a one cup coffee maker, an ice bucket, packets of tea, a small refrigerator, creamer (non-refrigerator kind), sugar, artificial sweetener (Splenda, Sweet-n-Low, Equal), paper coffee cups, coffee lids, and a small personal safe. The ice bucket was oddly placed on the top shelf in the closet next to the iron so I put it on my desk. I choose to eat at Subway to not spend so much on food. You can find them on Broad St (diagonally from Chase Bank), East Town Street, Grant Ave (across from the Public Library), or the one on State and High Street. You have other options to eat at Lexi's, Custom Chef, and Mitchell's Steak House. There's a Starbuck's, too, but since they give you coffee in your room you shouldn't need to go there. You can venture out to McDonald's or Donato's Pizza. Their staff can recommend other options to eat, too. I saw on their website they charge for internet and phone (boo), $12.95 per day (from 12 noon to 12 midnight). I recommend bringing your wireless card and magic jack to avoid these fees if you really need internet and phone. I believe they charge around $12/day for parking, but I didn't pay anything for that due to no car. You will get a ton of pillows (6), and a comfy bed! They had a small, brown seat and a comfy red chair with a big ottoman. I had a king bed, so I could see two people being in the room. The room comes with cable TV, also with jack to hook up other devices (DVD/blue-ray, game system). They don't have DVD/Blu-Ray player. That could be a negative if you want to watch DVDs/Blu-Rays--be sure to bring along a player for them. The bathroom includes a unique/strange door--it folds in two, and a glass partition in the shower (there's no sliding glass door or shower curtain). It served my needs, but I know some people would want a regular door and a sliding shower door/shower curtain. I found that you can hear people in other rooms (I've found that common with other hotels), however this one was more so. For example, I could hear people talking, opening up their dresser drawers--so that could be a good or bad thing for you.The check out process took me less than 2 minutes. The workers were very friendly always asking me for assistance.Stayed for new years eve. Surprised by the garage fee and the Internet fee which were not disclosed to me before I booked. Plus the Internet was ponderously slow. The bed was uncomfortable and the room was not what I booked. Staff was super courteous but I shall not use this hotel again.Room Tip: Check the heat before you unpack. Mine rattled like an 80 year old all night!!!I came here with someone who was attending a conference at the hotel, so we had a really good rate that also included parking. Said person is also a Marriott Gold member so I was the beneficiary of free Internet, and we were also upgraded to a corner junior suite.Upon arriving to our room, I was really impressed. There was a separate living area and bedroom area with a door that you could close in between the two. There was also a huge desk/work area, which was a plus for me as I was planning on doing work while my travel companion was at meetings. I was expecting the bathroom to be small as I had read the reviews before we got here. They were not over exaggerating. They are tiny and awkward. When people wrote about the folding door, I was picturing something like a bi-fold closet door. This is not the case. It really just looks like they took a regular door and cut it in half and put hinges on it. As someone also said, the shower (there is no bathtub) has a glass partition that goes 2/3 of the way across the shower. So you can't really turn the water on without getting in the shower and, if you're not quick enough, getting blasted with cold water.As I settled in, there were several things that just make me think they didn't really think about the design of the room...the bathroom door being one of them. It was like they bought the doors and then realized that the bathroom is so small that you can't open the door all the way...so, hey, let's just cut it in half and put hinges on it and fold it up. All of these things were a little annoying, but wouldn't stop me from staying here because in the scheme of things, they really are little. First off, I loved the huge work area, but it made it so you couldn't really get to the window to open the curtains. I like to have sunlight in my room, but it made it a pain to try to get around the desk to open the curtains. Also, the desk was so close to the cabinet that the refrigerator was in that you couldn't really get into the refrigerator all that well. The TVs (one in the living area and one in the bedroom) were in these built-in cabinets that the TVs JUST fit in. They were kind of in the corner of the room, so it would have been nice to swivel them toward the couch or bed, but it was such a tight fit that it wasn't possible to move them. The safe in the bedroom was in the bottom of the built-in in cabinet and there was no other shelf in there. It would have been nice if that wasn't a total waste of space and was able to be used to put some clothes in the bedroom (no closet or drawers in the bedroom except two nightstand drawers). When I get to a hotel in a city that I really don't know, I always like to look through the books they have in the room about the city. So I looked through that and was excited to learn that there was shopping nearby at the Columbus City Center. I got on-line to see what stores were there and learned that it had been demolished in 2010! I looked at the copyright on the book, and it was from 2007; five years old!! Anyway, like I said these things were slightly annoying but nothing major.I like to have a beer or two before I go to sleep, and I was nicely surprised to learn that you could buy them from the little store by the front desk for $3.25 (for Bud Light). But even better, there is a little cafe across the street (Mata Cafe, 100 East Gay Street), where I got a six pack for $6.99. They also had coffee drinks, snacks, and hot food items that looked appetizing.During the day, I could hear our neighbors conversations in their room just as if I were in there. So far it hasn't been a problem at night. I think most of the sound comes through the connecting door. Luckily that is in the living room area. The living room is in between the bedroom and their room, so we have a little bit of a barrier, and if necessary, we could close the door between the living room and bedroom and probably wouldn't have a problem.All that being said, I still think this is a really great hotel. Just a few little things that could have been done better.I stay in a lot of hotels for work. It's like my job could be staying in a hotel... I wonder if Marriott is hiring. My experiences at the Renaissance define what good, comfortable, clean, and friendly hotel experiences should be.Everyone from the director of experiences to the housekeeping staff is smiling and will greet you on the property. After a few weeks, most people I came in contact with knew me by name. Of the 15 or so weeks I stayed at the hotel, I never had a single problem (except for one morning where the hot water wasn't working... that night, I got back to find a letter stating that it was a hardware problem and they would either comp 50% of the room night (which makes no difference to me as a corporate traveler) or give me a ton of Marriott points... guess which I took). The rooms were always spotlessly clean, smelled fresh (this is ridiculously important... so many hotel rooms do not smell good, are stale, or have remnants of smoke). The beds were always comfortable. The valets were always quick to retrieve my car. One of the things I appreciated the most was the *incredible* gym. It was probably the best hotel gym I've ever used, and it contained seven or eight treadmills, free weights, several machines, weight benches, ellipticals, and bikes. Plus, the gym looks out at the pool... a little motivation to work out, right? The location of this hotel is also great. You're within walking distance to the short north (especially on a beautiful night) and some of the hidden gems of downtown (Dirty Frank's, Little Palace, Barrio, etc.). The concierge at the hotel, Kevin, is an absolute delight. If you're staying at the hotel for any length of time, be sure to introduce yourself. He knows everyone in the city... everyone... and will have a recommendation for dinner to meet whatever mood you're in.I wasn't the biggest fan of the bar... maybe it just wasn't my scene. I can tell you, though, that their Bloody Mary's are made from scratch and are absolutely phenomenal. Either way, the Columbus Renaissance is a finely oiled machine delivering brand excellence for Marriott. If I could have this hotel in every town I worked in, I would happily stay in it, time after time.Stayed at this hotel last week for a conference. Somebody mentioned that it's not near much to do as far as activities. That's probably right, it appears to be geared toward people who are there for conferences or business. And after back to back workshops all day most folk either just want to crash in their rooms or go down to the lounge area and chat with friends before crashing in their room to get ready for the 8am session the next morning. It's an absolutely beautiful hotel though with rooms very tastefully done. HUGE work desk/area which I loved with wonderful shelving to put my books and conference literature and other work I had brought with me. The bathroom is indeed small and if I were traveling with someone, the bathroom nor the room would work for me---even if it were a spouse --nope! But for solo business travel it was perfect. The staff is wonderful, polite and accommodating (Restaurant staff is slow, but that's another review.) Now they do have valet parking which is a rip-off and internet is $12.95/day which includes long distance calls in the U.S. That is definitely crazy, but remember, folk, this hotel caters to business folk mostly and once you turn in your bill for reimbursement it generally doesn't matter---the company pays for it. However, working for the church, the Trustees would look at me crazy if I ordered $13/day Wi-Fi (and I believe Jesus would too!) I bypass those costs and use Boingo which gives me $9.95/month Wi-Fi just about wherever i go (including most Marriott Hotels like this one.) I'm glad somebody else mentioned the strange 1/2 glass partition for the shower. I actually thought that was strange as well but again, I travel solo and have no fear of anyone walking in on me. I asked for a late check out for 1:30 and they accommodated me for 2pm.Emphasis: If there is such a thing as "cost-effective, luxury business" this might be it. Remember....HUGE, beautiful work area for working and spreading out your stuff in front of an expansive window with a city view; Outlets around desk area, next to bed and around the room for your gadgets. Super comfortable king bed for sleeping after working. Yes, it's a modest size room (who's in the room? you're in conference all day); very small, but tastefully done bathroom. Big comfy chair with ottoman and a bench area with cushions. Huge framed mirror in room that will allow you look at your outfit from one angle and align the mirrored closet doors for another angle. I don't remember seeing a gift shop on the premises -- another indicator that they are not catering to folk on vacation. However, housekeeping does have those essentials that you might forget.I would definitely return to this hotel.I was scheduled to attend a conference in Columbus for a whole week and decided to head over on Sunday and check out the city a bit early. I did the whole Priceline "Name your own price" thing and got a night at The Columbus for $80/nt plus tax.We arrived, valet'd the car and headed in. The first thing I noticed is that this hotel is gorgeously decorated. Everything is very modern and sleek. They have a large lounge area that is separated from the lobby and actually feels like a place where one could relax in (which is exactly what we did later with a glass of wine).The rooms are clean, renovated, but a bit small. Same with the bathrooms.I probably would be much happier with The Columbus if after sleeping for a few hours, I came to the swift realization that they have walls like paper. I could hear someone distinctly talking in the room next to me from like 1:30 to 2:30 and then was roused from sleep again by noises next door that were a bit more 'intimate' than talking. Hey, at least they got to enjoy their room.If I never would have had to realize their walls have no sound proofing, I probably would give the place four stars. For eighty bucks a night, it's still a steal. There is just no way I would spend upwards of $150 a night there, though.PS - Almost forgot: you have to pay for internet in your room. That blows.This is my favorite hotel in Columbus. I've stayed quite a few times and loved it so much that we used it for our wedding. The front desk staff are always very helpful and friendly. I really enjoy the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms. I've never had a single compliant. When we reserved a block of rooms for our wedding, we were offered the largest suite at a VERY discounted rate and it was perfect for getting ready. They had rose petals, champaigne, and dessert waiting for us after we returned from the wedding. I would recommend this place to anyone! Great location as well!Location is good. Rooms are nothing to write home about. Fairly cramped, but clean and well appointed. I would be depressed if I had to stay in all night. Fortunatley, there are a lot of good restaurants and bars within easy walking distance (and the restaurant and bar in the lobby are fine!). Parking fee is excessive. And, as always, the fee for internet connectivity is positively obnoxious (I mean, it's free at the cheap hotels, WTH?). If you need to be downtown, this place will do!The Columbus sets a standard for service that we hold all other Renaissance properties to meet. We were very regular guests in 2007 - 2008 before travels took us elsewhere and were pleased to find (upon our return for NYE) that the quality & service levels continued to excel. The restaurant produces wonderful dishes (get the mussels via room service) and the lobby bar has wonderful spaces to allow privacy or great people watching.The smallest bathroom known to man and we had a suite,weirdest small fold apart door to boot. Couldn't really tell the housekeeper had even visited much less serviced our room. Interestingly they have no suites with king beds. Yes,it's pretty cheap but there has to be a better choice in Columbus.We couldn't have asked for anything more! Our wedding guests stayed here 1-2 nights and everyone at the hotel (our event coordinator, the restaurant staff, front desk staff, valet, etc.) were wonderful! They made everything stress-free, which is exactly what the bride (me) needed while planning and executing our wedding! I am so happy with everything and I would definitely recommend this hotel. I also love how close it is to the Arena District and Short North. It provided nearby entertainment for our guests while they were in town. Thank you, Renaissance!Used this hotel for our wedding guests and ourselves. Very nice rooms with great views of Columbus. The Valet people were super nice, and the staff put up with a lot of crazy requests from me and my bridal party as we made bouquets and stuff. The restaurant there is nice, and of course expensive, but we knew that would happen. Really pretty lobby too.The Renaissance Downtown Columbus is conveniently located near many restaurants with in short walking distance. The rooms are very nicely appointed, comfortable with all the conveniences expected. I found the staff very friendly and helpful.I really like staying at this hotel when I come to visit our aging parents when we come to Columbus. I really like that the staff is so attentive and friendly. We always check in late and the woman (Sarah I think is her name) who has now helped us twice at the front desk is so friendly and helpful. Even though it's near 11PM when we check in she is always cheerful and makes us feel so good after a long flight from San Francisco and trip from the airport. She gives us great recommendations for places to eat and check out in Columbus.At the hotel they have an efficient work area with printing which we needed for some reason when we stayed the last time. The rooms were perfect and the beds are super comfortable. They have a great bar in the Lobby that was recommended by Sarah at the front desk and it is open late and the bartenders were very fun to talk to and their food and beer was just great!Nice property. Room was clean, modern. Staff was friendly and efficient.Pool on the roof was awesome , food was great, across street from capital building, confortable
review_content_60: Stayed here with a AAA rate of $99 a night -- a great value at that price -- friendly staff, nice rooms and a comfy bed. The parking situation seemed a little problematic -- all valet parking and it gets backed up (though the hotel didn't even seem too busy). All things considered (especially the price) it was a very nice experience.Not a business traveller hotel. Rooms are nice but hit or miss. My room had no desk lamp, no plugs at the desk. Had to plug my Phone and laptop in the bathroom.  Come on! Definitely not a great value for 197/night. Internet is 13/ day. Restaurant really sucks, really.I was not sure about staying downtown, but I really enjoyed The Columbus hotel.  It is completely renovated with modern updated lobby.  The rooms are beautifully furnished.  I had a King Size bed with down comfortable and a lot of pillows.  Very comfortable.  There was a modern desk overlooking the city, a settee couch and another couch chair.  They fit a lot into a small space, but it seemed to work.  It was nice that they had a refridgerator and coffee maker in the room The bathroom had a funny door that folded in half but nice updated shower area and bowl sink.  Very nice decor.  One evening, we did go to the pool which is on the 4rth floor.  There were a lot of people out and the water was cool.  The jacuzzi was packed, but it was nice to be outdoors in the middle of the city.  The lounge chairs were very relaxing.  The website says parking is $26, which I could see paying in NYC, but this is Columbus?  There is a parking lot about a block away if you want to save on parking.I travel alot and this hotel is a meh. It's in a difficult location - there's very little to do in downtown Columbus right now within walking distance. Everything closes early and is closed on Sunday. In-room dining menu is provided by an on-site restaurant called Latitude 41. Unfortunately for me there isn't alot of traditional, comfort-type food on the menu. Lots of items with truffle aolis, if you get what I'm saying. That's fine if you're staying for a weekend, but feels very limited if you're there for awhile like I am (2 weeks). There's also no indoor pool/whirlpool, which makes no sense to me as it's COLD in Ohio. The gym is nice, though. The rooms are basic and have the small bathrooms have a shower only. The rooms and lobby are very modern and nice and provide a fridge but NO MICROWAVE, which I really could've used.  If you don't need to be downtown, stay at the Hampton Inn in the Short North. GREAT value for your money, pool, hot tub indoors, coin laundry (YAY!) and tons of things to do and see. Right next to the amazing North Market.This is the worst hotel ever in terms of security!!!!! At 3:30am when I am half asleep I wake up to a security guard opening my door to a random crazy drunk person into my room because the man claimed to be in my party?! What kind of hotel lets strangers into your room without photo id???! This is absolutely outrageous and I dont reccommend this place to anyone. Dont leave your belongings in the room because they will get stolen when they just let.strangers into your room!! this is crazy!So I have been staying at this hotel weekly since the end of August.  It's an extremely nice hotel and the staff is very accomodating!  If you're looking for a great place to say that's affordable for business travel, this is the place!!  Give it a try, I bet you'll love it!  Oh yeah, pass on the restaurant, it's not the greatest.  Mitchell's is right across the street & it's much better!!Travel to Columbus frequently and enjoy staying at The Columbus.  Good vibe, friendly staff and centrally located.  This is part of the Marriott family of hotels and just underwent a super renovation.I just got back from a 3-day weekend here for a wedding. Surely, it's one of the nicest hotels in Columbus. Apparently they just underwent a multi-million dollar renovation, and the rooms as well as the lobby and common areas were very modern, clean and beautiful ... but not over the top. The hotel staff were very accommodating for the guests and the wedding events. We were a rowdy group at times, and they still served us drinks with a smile. Great outdoor pool deck on the 4th floor, nice gym, expansive lobby bar/lounge. I have no complaints except that housekeeping missed our room on one of the days ... probably because I slept in too late though. We had a special rate for wedding guests at $109 per night -- a great deal.The best thing about this hotel is their rooftop pool and hot tub. Even if you don't swim, it feels good to just relax in the lounge chairs on the rooftop. The fitness center overlooks the pool. The rooms are nice and modern. The bed is sooo comfortable. No couch though. The TV is not flatscreen and has a lousy reception. There is a $11 fee per day for the internet in the room but its free in the public areas. There is no bath tub and the space seems kinda small.  Dinner service from Latitude 51 is excellent. The staff needs grooming though. The bartender was outrightly rude when asked for the menu and they weren't even paying any attention to us. Maybe because they had some corporate party going on which took up all their time. I had to cancel my reservation once while checking in because they changed the rates on me. They made no effort to retain a customer. The bell captain, amazingly, appears only when you are checking out (probably looking for tips) but never when you're checking in and could really use the help. I've never used their valet service but they seem nice and friendly.The Columbus Hotel is a great, high end, business hotel in Columbus' Arena District. It's easy to get to from 71 N (Cleveland) and 670 (Airport, Dayton) in both directions, as it's about a mile off of both freeways on the same street as the exit. I was there for a four day conference. The meeting rooms are very nice. The ballrooms are very spacious and great for whatever purpose you need. The lobby is modern and clean. The rooms were very comfortable, as they were spacious and clean. My biggest complaint was the bathrooms, which at first glance seem industrial. The shower has no door and only a partial glass wall shielding you off from the rest of the bathroom, which leaves you with no privacy if someone walks in, and it also feels awkward to me showering with a big open gap in the glass. The views were good from the 11th floor facing south towards the rest of Downtown. The hotel has 21 floors. Overall, if you need a hotel in Columbus, seriously consider the Columbus, as you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton Columbus Ohio Airport
review_content: Clean.  Comfortable.  Great location.  The room was very nice.  Large comfortable bed.  Large bathroom.  I stayed for two nights (conference in the area), mainly using the room simply to have a good night's sleep and to shower/dress in the morning.  I secured a good price.  The location was ideal.  It's fairly new.  It was clean and safe.  I can't really comment on the restaurant/bar area since I didn't venture into that area. I didn't even partake in the free coffee in the morning.  The common areas seemed nice. Decor and design unique and welcoming. The parking lot was convenient and spacious.  Only complaint: wireless internet was fairly slow.  I would stay here again if the price was right; on the other hand, there are many similar hotels in the Columbus area that are just as nice.Four Points is a nice place to stay... Clean rooms for sure. What's lacking are In-Room amenities i.e there were no refrigerators (don't bring those left overs back from that awesome dinner you had) no microwaves (to reheat those left overs) no safe (to lock the stuff up you don't want to take). Finally the biggest complaint was WIFI simply put it was Horrible and Unreliable. If your in Columbus on business and need wifi look else where. It was slow and dropped out repeatedly. This was a big miss on the part of this SPG Hotel stay. I'm sure our large company won't be using this hotel for anything again unless the above mentioned things are corrected.So many things wrong with this property.1. Internet is SO S   L   O    W  - unacceptable for any streaming, video conference, YouTube, etc. In flight wi-fi comparable speeds2. paper thin walls - can hear everything - the elevator dings, the very very very chatty guests and their kids right near me. Woken up many times last night.3. Coffee/tea maker - sitting on a shelf in a cabinet - you can't fill it with water without taking the entire thing out of the cabinet. Bad placement.4. Blackout blinds in my room didn't roll up so in permanent darkness. Called to have someone fix it - he came right away. Worked great that night - rolled up, rolled down. Came back from work the next day, broken again. Replace the cheap ass blinds. If basic use by a guest or housekeeping breaks it, replace it.5. Iron and ironing board - the board is  tweaked and not opening correctly. Iron has hard water deposits already.This place is a pass.This is a good hotel for both the money and the location.  Rooms and lobby/bar area are ultra mod and very cool- great bathroom and pretty comfortable beds.  However, even though you might sleep well on the bed, you won't once you are woken up by the constant noise you hear through their paper thin walls.  Making it even worse is that it is an airport hotel, so there are many people slamming doors and making a racket in the hallway at 5 am to catch their 7 am flight.Front desk staff was friendly enough, and the shuttle driver was very friendly, offering to help me scrape off my car when he saw that I was using a map to get the snow off of my car.  This is a great choice for a quick overnight stay to catch a flight- even with the noise issue the place is clean and convenient.This was a nice, clean hotel.  We stayed there for one night on our way to Chicago. Room was a good size. Staff were very friendly.  There is a salt water pool that is a good size and ranges from 3' to 5'. Would stay here again if in the area.We are Sheraton people--Starwood members. Whenever possible we stay at Sheraton properties. This Four Points was not good. Nothing awful happened to us, and it was clean, but for the money the Embassy Suites at this location (airport) is much better. Our room was small--Manhattan small--and the typically great Sheraton beds were not up to par. The sheets felt scratchy. No fridge, no perks for Starwood members. Breakfast was good--though it was free at the Embassy (where the event we were in town for was being held). This is a small hotel compared to the ones across the street. My kid liked the choloclote chip pancakes--other than that it was a ho-hum experience.All dishes were good, but I'd have to say the Quesadillas were the best. Burger needed a little help and the Jambalaya as well. Service was great! Hotel was great!I spent Friday night here after a hellish travel day from Texas that landed me back in CMH around 11:30 pm. Here are my thoughts a few days out:1. The place is very fresh and updated. Pretty modern place. I was a big fan of the bed - very comfy - so comfy I actually slept for 8 hours straight without waking up (doesn't happen often). The check in girl was very friendly and she literally just gave me the key right away. I got this hotel on a priceline express deal for $64 bucks 6 hours prior to my stay - not so bad.2. The coffee maker is a nice touch, but it leaks like hell. The coffee was pretty good. They don't have a lot of mixers/condiments for the coffee though, so use sparingly. Loved the burlap sack the coffee came in. Also, I was a fan of the free bottle of water next to the door.3) The bathroom has a really nice clean look, shampoo/conditioner/body wash dispensers in the actual shower (which is huge). That was pretty cool. There are also 3-4 hooks in there to hang your clothes on. While the bathroom had the appearance of being clean it was DIRTY. DIRTY bird dirty. Well, at least the floor. I put down the mat, took my shower and when I got out and stepped on the mat, it was black all over from dirt. There were also many long black hairs in the bathroom, near the sink and toilet... Those definitely weren't mine, as I am ginger.4) I really enjoyed the coffee in the lobby in the am... It was a nice pick-me-up before a two hours drive. Why don't all hotels do this?Overall, I would stay here again.... I would just request a much cleaner bathroom (didn't really notice it was dirty until the am).AHHHH!  After two weeks in a crappy hotel in Fairborn, OH, I get to stay here.  Great lobby area, beautiful rooms, wonderful beds and just a fantastic, soothing environment overall.  I unfortunately brought a lot of perishables and realized that the room didn't have either a microwave or fridge.  So sad.  Hint for the WIFI:Username sheratonPassword serviceFirst, the good. The room was comfortable and well kept. The bed was very comfortable and the heat was easy to regulate and not horribly noisy. Unfortunately, my shower had a clog and it took me 3 times reporting it to get it fixed. The food was not the best either. I had dinner and breakfast there and the only thing I slightly enjoyed was the oatmeal and their beer selection, for which the staff his no idea about. Front desk staff was great and very helpful and the fitness center was pretty good.Nice choice for a room by airport, for sure.  One major drawback: their walls are paper thin and you hear every single door slamming up and down the hallway as if it's your own door.  Stayed here twice and same experience.  Clean and comfy, especially the beds.  1 mile from airport.  Would not want to hang here for 3 nights but that's not its purpose.  Lobby with fireplace, very cool ambiance, and it's squeaky clean.  Recommend highly; modern decor and pretty friendly staff.I've stayed here only one night due to a scheduling issue with work and our normal hotel being booked up. Truthfully, I didn't even notice that this hotel was there. I pass the area every so often and I guess never really paid attention to my surroundings. I had a very pleasant experience here though. The shuttle took a little while picking me up from the airport, but not excessively long. The driver was really cool and personable.Once I got to the hotel, I was greeted courteously at the front desk and they had my room and key ready to go. Very nice lobby area with a decent looking restaurant/lounge area. Around the corner to the back, is the gym and pool. Look closely because it's tucked away back there. I didn't make use of the pool, but I did use the gym. Very large workout room with new equipment in great condition. They have two HDTV's up on the walls too. I watched Deuce Bigalow while running my laps on the treadmill, LOL!The room was great! Well lit, clean, and trendy. You can tell from the pics I took. I apologize for getting a little too trigger happy with my camera. I absolutely loved the bathroom. The light bordered mirror is awesome and makes your eyes do that music videon thingie where you can see shaped light reflections in your eyes. I pray I'm not the only weirdo to take note of this. I love showers with glass doors, but have yet to see someone solve the "splashing water in between the door pane" problem. Just put a towel on the ground, you'll be alright!The last benefit to this place... Jimmy Johns right next door!Highly recommend this hotel not just for a stay near the airport but also for a stay around Columbus. Can't beat the price for this level of accommodation. Close to the highways, quick access to the airport, Easton, and even downtown. The lobby, bar and rooms are nicely decorated and the staff are friendly and helpful. Free wi-if, heated salt water pool and great parking. I know where I'll stay if I ever need to come back.This is bar none the best hotel in Columbus for the price. And regardless of price, it is one of the best hotels in Columbus.You'll find everything you want here from an excellent staff with quick and friendly service to all the amenities- a pool, gym, a bar, and VERY nice rooms. I've stayed here once for five nights and will be staying again next month. The rooms are spacious, air conditioned, super clean, and have a very modern design. They essentially have "relax" written all over them. I also appreciated how nice the bathroom was for just $100-something a night. The lobby is also quite elegant and inviting. Even though the rooms are only in the $100 range, the whole place easily looks like it would cost $300 per night.It's also in a safe area with plenty of free parking. Less than 2 minutes to the freeway and you're on your way to downtown/ OSU, which you'll be at within 10 minutes. Yet you're not too close to the airport that you hear all the planes.Stay here and you won't regret it.Arrived at the hotel  at noon. Check in is at 3 PM however, at other hotels we've arrived earlier and was able to get our room. This day we had to come back 1/5 hours later. When we returned the room was ready. When the clerk signed into the system he did not put in for the 2 nights as we had booked and I had to go back down to have this corrected. The room was large, bright and very clean. The bed is alright for one night but after the second night I felt it in my back. They either need a thick mattress pad (because the one that was on there is more of a mattress cover) or a new mattress.  I felt there was not enough room to hang clothes. They did not have a regular closet but had a combination coffee/tea server, iron and ironing board and clothing wardrobe. No refrigerator or safe for valuables. There was a long table for a computer and chair along with some cubbies (yes, just like kindergarten) for clothes, socks etc. I did not like this set up at all. However, even being close to the airport the airplane noise was not bad. The gathering room was not set up for seating the number of people who wanted to relax there. I would recommend this hotel but not for an extended stay.I was not sure what to expect from this hotel.  Surprisingly, it was a hidden jewel.  Duran made sure I was comfortable.  I was able to check in right away.  The check out process was smooth as well.Conveniently located ~10 minutes from the airport, it's a perfect place to rest your head during a business trip.  I did just that for four nights on a business trip - worked 17 hour days so I didn't utilize anything but my room in the hotel.  Nothing else seemed to be nearby (except a Jimmy John's across the parking lot).Very IKEA-esque with modern decor and clean linesGreat soft beds with lots of plump pillowsBathroom is nice but you get wet when you turn on the shower!  (Poor design!)Thin towels were cheap, motel qualityYou can hear the planes taking off/landing overhead, but not enough to be bothersomeTwo free bottled waters/dayFree airport shuttleAll in all, a good value near the Columbus airport... (although maybe the prices in general are cheap like this in Columbus?)Omg. The best food ever. If you don't try this place you'll miss out. The food is absolutely fabulousGood location. Good price.My first thought walking into this hotel was, How are we able to afford this? Every inch of this hotel is amazing.This hotel is designed right down to the soap dishes. Everything has matching colors and designs, and it's lovely. The thought and effort in the design was unmatched by anywhere I've stayed. Our room was beautifully equipped and the bedding was fabulous, soft and warm. The set up of the desk for an office was genius and perfect for working from your room.The bathroom was beautiful, with an oversized glass shower, and lovely tile on the floor. The shower head? Amazing. The pool was small, but quaint and again, the entire place was decorated in such an excellent manner.I drank at the bar until midnight, and it was a nice time.
review_content_20: Overall, yes it's a 3 star hotel but for 3 star hotels......it's 5 stars.  I stay here on a regular basis and by far is my favorite place to stay when doing biz traveling in columbus.I wasn't here to stay at the hotel as an overnight, but rather came as a part of the Columbus Young Professionals who were having a meeting here. I was a bit worried about finding it (I'm directionally challenged) because my GPS couldn't find the address, but luckily Google Maps was on it and brought me right here.  Be on the lookout though or you might miss it..its hiding pretty well!From the standpoint of a meeting space, the hotel is really nice.  It is a fairly new place and therefore is well equipped for meetings.  One of the staff members there took us me on a short tour looking at the various meeting rooms, workout and pool facilities and this would definitely be someplace that I would consider having a meeting.  What makes it nice for those coming in from out of town is that they offer a free shuttle to and from the airport AND to and from Easton.  For someone who may not have a car, and coupled with the fact that there isn't much going on near the airport, that could be a big sanity saver!I wasn't thrilled about this place. Let's first state the obvious - it's miles away from anything else. There was nothing objectively "wrong" about the hotel, but so many things that felt wrong. As a frequent traveler, your hotel could really make a huge difference in your day. It could make you feel welcome and comfortable - closer to home - OR, it could make you feel like you're stuck in transit. This hotel is the latter. The place...smelled funny. It smelled like cleaning liquid. It was extremely clean but felt impersonal, empty. I mean, the floor squeaked it was so clean. I don't like it when the floor squeaks. The staff was nice, but not that friendly. They didn't make jokes, didn't make conversation. I didn't feel welcome; I felt like an overnight boarder. The decor was not bad, but every Four Points has cool decor - some much cooler. Plus there was that ridiculously uncomfortable hot/cold thing going on. The room was freezing. If I turned off the AC, it went from freezing to extremely hot. Overall, I've come to expect more from Starwood. Try the downtown Westin instead.we flew into Columbus to visit family so we had a slightly unique booking.  Our brother was paying for the room but we were paying for any food or other charges.  At checkout they charged the entire bill to my credit card and could not understand why that was wrong since the room had already been paid for.  Once I got that straightened out I thought everything was taken care of until I checked my credit card bill a few days later.  They billed me for my dinner on the night I stayed there and then again one week later.  I have now called 3 times and no one at the front desk is able to help me and the one person who apparently can help won't return my calls.  If you plan to just use one credit card this hotel will probably be okay for you, the service at the restaurant was good and the room was nice but they don't appear to hire anyone who understands customer service in their management pool.  With several hotels within walking distance of this hotel I would not stay here again just to avoid any hassles.Got stuck at airport due to lengthy weather delays late at night. Decided to stay over and take early flight out. Picked this hotel because I saw all the stars. I think over rated. Staff gets five stars. But the entire experience only three. My room had no phone. The shower leaked water to a well stained wood floor and the towels were exfoliatingly rough. Lobby was nicely done. Wifi is free and speed good. Bed was comfortable. Shuttle service to hotel was prompt. Van was clean. Not the closest to the airport. If ever here again under same circumstances would probably give another property a try. I dont think the rate was even that great. Did the job but not a standout.This location is clean.  It is updated.  It looks like something from an Ikea Catalog.  The only bad thing about it is the hours at the cafe.  They are only open for lunch and dinner so if you want something good to eat you have to drive through the ghetto to get it.  The showers are the only other thing I would rate bad.  The bathroom is beautiful (all glass shower which resembled the WonkaVator) but you have to jump into the shower to turn it on.  This means having a lovely stream of cold water run down your body for 2 minutes until the hot water decides to come out.  The staff here is beyond nice.  I had a problem with my room one night and they moved me without hesitating.I had to downgrade my star rating because there was a billing mistake and I had to email them 5 times in order to have it corrected. The last email confirmed that it would be corrected, but I still don't see it. This last interaction with them tarnishes my thoughts about this otherwise great hotel.I stayed here when I was flying back and forth from my hometown to seek out places for residence and for school.  I think for what you pay, this is a very clean and nice hotel.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating and a plus that it's right off the highway and near the airport.  If I had to stay at a hotel here in Columbus, I'd stay here again (please note that this is from a newbie standpoint who doesn't really know her way around Columbus.. even to this very day).Conveniently located near the Port of Columbus Airport, this Four Points is very clean and well maintained.  The staff was very helpful and shuttled us back and forth from the airport to the hotel quickly and efficiently.   If I'm ever in the Columbus area again, I will be sure to stay here.i haven't taken a shower since i left OH two days ago ... hmmm, too much? it's just that my shower was THAT amazing, i still feel so clean!*i went on my first business trip this week with my new company and we actually landed on this place because, after some quick research, we noticed they had a schwanky gym (we had some co-workers training for a marathon) ... and the other place we typically stay at HAS no gym. sooo, clearly a win-win. plus one to aim's new place of employment ... they REALLY get me. besties for life. four points is a fairly new joint in columbus - it's obvi with their bright shiny lights that could be seen from the main road; their UBER DUPER CLEAN rooms where i coulda eaten my dinner off the floor from** and keen attention to being green. however, their schwanky gym's two treadmills, elliptical machine and recumbent bike were a FAR cry from "state of the art" ... but they had TVs which is a major step-up from other hotels i've encountered. now, seriously, is it REALLY that weird that i asked my (female) boss if we'd be sharing a room together?*** since we're so cool i had this thought that we could stay up late talking about boys and painting each others' toenails.**** again, too much?* - right now, i use that term quite loosely. ** - not that i tried. *hangs head in shame**** - no, that wasn't meant to be dirrrty. **** - yes, i've traveled on business before.Do not eat at this hotel! Yes, the decor is nice, slick in the Starwood way, but the hotel is staffed by 18 year olds that do not know what they are doing. I am a Starwood Gold and this is a property that I would avoid. The food is beyond awful and with so many other hotels near the airport in Columbus I do not know why you would choose this one. I will never stay here again.Clean, comfortable bed. Restaurant staff friendly, atmosphere modern and comfortable. We used a meeting room and it was well maintained, equipment worked well and was in good shape, staff was helpful and the general manager stopped in to make sure all was well. A very good experience.... Plus free WiFi... Not common in that area.

hotel_name: Doubletree Suites by Hilton Hotel Columbus Downtown
review_content: I've stayed at this property several times now and never found it to be anything but great. The service is always excellent, the staff is friendly and is very customer focused. Of course it doesn't hurt at all that this property is only suites. The food is good, the fact they've got a nice restaurant, full Starbucks menu and room service make it so you don't have to leave if you don't want to. They've also got a great all inclusive gym.Certainly not what I expected. Time for a makeover at this hotel.  Room was large with a great view but also poorly lit with mostly  drab color everywhere. Windows were filthy. Furnishings were also a bit dated. Wifi was a challenging connection so finding things of local interest was especially tough as no guide to anything in the hotel or nearby could be found. Thank heavens for the Gideons. At least they did their job.  Hampton at least has an in-room guide that always tells me about the free breakfast, where I can get a pizza and other items of local interest. Our stay came with a free continental breakfast. We arrived at the restaurant reception desk and were NEVER seated. We had to find staff and we were told we could just sit anywhere. After we realized that the continental breakfast was little more than toast we opted for the up charge buffet only to find NO PLATES. We solved this by sticking our heads into the kitchen and taking some off of a cart. We filled our plates and had a seat. Halfway through our meal we were finally asked if we would like some coffee.  Coffee was good. The fact that we were so poorly treated at 10:00 AM on a Sunday is unacceptable. Like many downtown hotels this property is not cheap. Maybe it should be.The rooms here are very large, if you get a conrer, the rooms are enormous.The rooms are quite nice.Thre are issues outside of the wonderful rooms.  As described in my previous review.Bumping up the rating for the huge nicely appointed rooms.I was pleasantly surprised by the Double Tree . Considering the low yelp ratings I reserved rooms with low expectations. However, my room was clean, plush, spacious, quiet, and comfortable. I spent 4 days here on business and would definitely return. My only gripes were with the elevator system and lack of continental breakfast. Also, the workout facility is really top notch. Puts places like planet fitness to shame.Rooms are spacious. Staff is friendly. Wifi works well. The area around the hotel is pretty and it seems like a very safe neighborhood. I liked the warm cookie I got when I checked in. Note: no radio or device to plug in your Ipod was in the room. Breakfast service in their cafe was painfully slow and expensive.Had to place a $50 per night hold on our credit card for a 4 night stay for incidentals???? I have stayed at this hotel a few years ago and this new policy change did not go over well with any of us. Also had to hold the entire price of the room on our card even though she wouldn't let us just pay cash at check in. Our room that is supposed to occupy 6 can only have 5 people on the check in and we only received 3 towels. I had ordered a few requests for our room on their website and none of those things happened. Staff was nice but not at all understanding of our situation. We are here for a conference and I know they cater to that but seem unprepared.Hotel itself is very nice, nicely decorated and our room is pretty large, but I would probably not stay here again.Check-in was E-Z, no issue, except they fixed our A/C within 10 mins after we reported. When we checked, I paid $22.00 for parking and the parking garage only charge $17.00 for overnight! Be aware!!!!I had a horrible experience staying at a doubletree several months ago and was given a certificate for one night to give them another try. My experience was worse than the last time! Doubletree apparently has really gone down hill...I will never stay at another Doubletree again. This particular location is a good walk to downtown where north market and the restaurants are so just be aware when making reservations.
