We arrived and the parking situation is not that great, you share a public parking garage and it costs $22 per night with no valet. It's hard to get your luggage to and from the car due to the location of parking. You have to go up to the lobby and then another elevator to the main floors. I could live with that ..the issue was the cleanliness and the service. The king room was a very nice size but very dated and our room was not clean. Stains on the walls, bathroom was not clean , shower still had hair in it! The bar in the restaurant is fine, if you are lucky enough to get the good bartender otherwise you have someone that doesn't know the first thing about making a drink. Which leads me to the free breakfast from the restaurant. I was not expecting 5 star dining but again cleanliness and service horrible! The breakfast buffet was laid out with over cooked sausage and bacon, stale bread and bagels, eggs were never brought out. We sat down, lay  our napkins out and were appalled to have hair all over our napkins! As if that wasn't enough that evening our neighbors decided to have a party until 6 AM . We awoke to very loud yelling and laughing, etc. about 3 AM. We called down to the front desk continuously but no one ever did anything about it. These walls must be paper thin because it was as if they were in the same room with us! Sorry, will not be staying here again. I love Hilton properties but I am done with this one!This hotel is not what it used to be when stayed last in 2009.    Not what we expect from Hilton.   The good:  location.   Spacious rooms,  very comfortable beds.    The not so good.    The room was not very clean.    The glasses on the bar had what appeared to be dried alka seltzer in the bottom of the glass.   Lights in the bathroom were burnt out.    Toilet seat broken.   Towel hook fell off the wall.   Bath tub won't drain.  The couch very hard and uncomfortable.   We used the pillows from the bedroom.   Our Amex was charged $ 100 dollars after we checked in,  we only found this out by our email alert on that account.   We called the desk and it was explained it was anticipated charges on the room.   The must be physic.   Did not like that what so ever.   Okay only four more nights and we are out of here and won't be back.   Takes too much effort on our part to stay here.In reality, I would probably give this hotel 3.5 stars for various reasons. It is recently renovated and has a clean welcoming feel; but there some flaws that could be fixed. Pros-Large room size, especially corner rooms -quiet and tranquil -Wonderful full fitness center (racquet ball, spa, sauna, steam room, locker rooms, clean quality athletic equipment)-Friendly service-Central location in the cityCons-Expensive restaurant, food not worth the price-House keeping isn't could be more through (dusty furniture, no sheets for fold out couch)-Central heating/cooling isn't very reliable--as of March 2015--air that comes in makes rooms feel warm and stuffy. Staff states that the air conditioning doesn't come on until AprilOver all, it is a decent hotel centrally located downtown with great access to Short North, OSU, CCAD, German Village, and more.It's not worth it.  I spent $220 for a Deluxe Suite (per night). Probably the 2nd most expensive room that they have. 1. parking is expensive and confusing. 2. stale cold cookies upon entrance. They also claim there are no nuts, but there's definitely nuts mixed into the cookies. 3. I reserved directly with the hotel and told them 3 people were staying. Nothing was set up for 3 people. Water, cups, towels, etc...4. bathroom fan didn't work5. refrigerator didn't work.6. heater hardly worked. Woke up 2 days in a row shivering. (During winter storm Linus).7. No free internet.8. rude, unhelpful staff. 9. Place is old and needs to be redone/refurbished. This is the exact conversation I had with the front desk:me: "Hi, just an FYI room 916 has a few issues. The refrigerator, bathroom fan, and heater don't work."Man at desk looks at me funny. "have you informed maintenance about this?"How am I supposed to inform maintenance? I'm the guest.So I gotta give praise where praise is due. Jim and his team have completely turned around my impression of this Hotel. We arrived and immediately were taken to our room which had a great view of the river, city and the Fireworks. The room was amazing and once we got settled, a bottle of champagne and desserts came to our room for our anniversary. Jim took care of our room, parking and more importantly  memories of our 17 year anniversary. What a great surprise tonight has been. Jim thank you and your team for your Hospitality.TonyGreat hotel, clean, nice rooms, nice view of river...no compaints with the hotel itself and I would stay again, but...it's one individual: "front desk boy"We called 45 minutes early for check-in, he said room wasnt ready...ok fine, rules are rules at this point, I'm taking it.  But not once did he say, "while you're waiting there's a Jimmy Johns next door, we have coffee over here at the table, we have water and pop for purchase over in that cooler, etc."...nothing.   The whole time he was rude and almost like a bitchy gay guy.  He's short so you'll know who he is.We ended up leaving and exploring the City after that phone call and forgot the idea of checking in, showering after a 4 hour road trip, and getting settled-in.  So we checked in really late and there was a different guy who was so nice.  Checking in took less than 2 minutes...for real.My MAJOR problem is we were charged THREE (3) times for our stay and it took so long for it to clear from our credit card.  The same "front desk boy/bitchy gay guy" also checked us out so we know he screwed up.  And, yes, he was bitchy then.  Real Mr. Personality.  I called a couple days later and they said it'll take awhile to clear, and that lady was really nice. UGH!Get rid of that guy, please.I'm a longtime Hilton HHonors gold member, and this location is not up to par with others. It's not run down yet, but definitely shabby or well-worn. Water stains on the ceiling tiles in the hall, frayed carpet, the usual signs that either maintenance is not being kept up or a capital upgrade is needed. I requested extra pillows through the app three days before u checked in, but either the app doesn't work or this hotel ignores those requests. I found only one bath towel in the entire room so I called the front desk for more. 30 minutes later I still had nothing, so I called again. They acknowledged the original request and said they would tell housekeeping again (I'm not holding my breath). Usually I would just grab one off a housekeeping cart, but when I poked my head into the hallway at 9:30 AM, there was no one in sight. As a person who spends 40-50 nights per year in a hotel, I know that is very odd. No housekeeping making the usual rounds first thing in the morning?The only good thing I can say is that the suites are incredibly large, at least on the reserved HHonors floors.The rooms were large and nice, and I was able to get mine very cold which I like. The breakfast for elite members was awful. No eggs no hot foods. Not even a pitcher of cold water for people who don't drink juice or coffee. I'll find myself a better breakfast next time I won't be staying here.On my second day, I waited for 30 rings before the lobby answered. When I told them I was checking out they said ok briskly and hung up. Very short and rude. I went down for my lame breakfast at 6:22 and both the full and VIP breakfasts were CLOSED (they open at 6a). I mentioned this at the lobby. They said, oh we can open it for you. I said its 22 min late. Don't open it for me. Open it for all your guests. I am leaving now.My husband and I were on a business trip & stayed here many times on our visits to Columbus. Their staff service is always great no matter how busy they are they still do their best to accomodate. It is always very clean which is a MUST for me. The lobby is on the 2nd floor separate from the main doors... really weird lay out. The parking is a little weird too. There aren't too many restaurants walking distance, esp ones that are open late. This review is for my most recent visit. This last visit I am giving them 4 stars but it usu. would be 5.When we checked-in my husband (he's a social butterfly) hit it off with one of the receptionists which scored us extra cookies. Great way to turn my tired traveling frown upside down! We later nicknamed her "Cookie". When we got up to our asssigned room we couldn't open the door. Seems as if it was locked? We went back down and quickly got reassigned. The week we visited there were multiple conventions and parades going on so they were super busy and I think the staff handled it as best they could. You could tell they were a bit overwhelmed because my calls to the front desk would go unanswered and when we did request for towels, etc. it took awhile to get them but no biggie. Seems they were short staffed. We booked our reservations through expedia and was already paid for. We checked out and had no charges to our room. When we returned home there was a charge on our credit card for our whole stay at Doubletree! Man, how do you mess that up? Unfortunately, that is a big mistake that didn't sit too well with me. If I am to be a returning customer I need to be able to trust the staff to take care of things like this no matter how busy they get. We have been calling between Expedia and the hotel and both firms have been transferring us all over the place. We finally got it resolved today. Keep in mind, even though we had difficulties all staff members we talked to were very courteous. And even though they remained courteous while frazzled, it seems they were short staffed. The staff we encountered did the best they could with what they were given and we really appreciate that. Having a leadership development background, it may be likely their staff is struggling in areas due to management issues but who knows!My laptop was stolen from the room and the staff did NOTHING to help. They aren't even apologetic. If you stay here do it only out of necessity and keep EVERYTHING in your safe!!My husband and I had a romantic city getaway at this clean, cool, and quiet hotel during the Rib and Jazz festival. I used 12,000 Hilton Honors points and $50 to reserve the room, and because I booked online I was well aware of the $22 daily parking fee, which included in and out privileges. Our room was a king 2-room riverview suite encompassing about 625 square feet, which I believe is their standard room. The living room had a sofabed, chair with ottomon, bistro table and chairs, large desk and chair, tv, and wet bar with sink, mini fridge, and microwave. The bedroom was separated with double French doors and had another chair with ottoman. There were plenty of dresser drawers in both rooms. We found the size of the room and the view to be luxurious, and the furnishings and decor were new and modern. We do tend to book Hilton family hotels, and we will definitely be staying at this Doubletree in the future.Let me tell you about my terrifying experience at this hotel. I usually come to Columbus twice a month and stay at the Hilton Hotel on North High street but that hotel was booked at the moment. So I decided to stayed at the Double Tree hotel from July 14th to the 18th. The building itself was bit outdated but has been kept clean. When I checked into the hotel on July 14th around 6pm, I got the vibe the front desk staff are not as friendly as the other hotels I've been to in the area. When I checked into the hotel, I realized the toilet in my room didn't flush well. I had to hold the handle down for about 10 seconds to flush the toilet well. It still worked and I'm very OCD about maintenance or housekeeping in my room so I decided not to make a big deal. Here is when it gets worst. It was July 16th, around 10pm. I was taking a shower with the music on. While I was still in the shower, I heard someone's voice. I thought it was next door, but I heard the same guy's voice again. I knew nobody would be in the room because I had the "do not disturb" sign on my door knob. I turned the water off and yelled "hello??!!". And the guy yelled "maintenance!". At that moment my heart sank to the floor because I was so scared. Imagine being a petite female in the shower and hearing a random guy's voice in your own hotel room. I yelled back at him to ask him to please leave my room but I did not stop hearing his voice. He was obviously trying to tell me something but I did not care anything but my safety at that time. (I don't understand why he didn't immediately leave my room when he realized he invaded my privacy) When I didn't hear his voice anymore, I heard the phone ring. It was the front desk to let me know that the maintenance was in my room because the water leaked to the floor below me. I was so shocked at that time I was shivering and shaking. I went downstairs to speak to the front desk. They apologized and explained that the maintenance knocked on my door once they received a water leakage complaint from the floor below me. When I didn't answer my door, the maintenance decided to open the door. I asked for the manager because I was still shocked and furious at this situation. They said the manager was not here at the moment. Which doesn't make sense to me because I thought there were night shift managers on site 24/7. Anyways, to conclude my long review. I will list everything that went wrong at my stay. 1. Privacy invasion.2. Maintenance guy - poor judgement of the situation. He should have left the room immediately once he realized someone was in the room.3. Front desk - Instead of calling me after the maintenance barged into my room, they should have called me ahead of time to confirm if I was in the room.4. Manager off duty - Does this exist? No night shift manager? If it does, the manager should have contacted me once he/she was on duty the next day to check up on their customer.  Obviously they don't care how their customer's stay was.I made sure to tell my story to everybody I knew in Columbus, OH to ensure they don't experience similar situation. My colleagues travel a lot for work and I made sure to tell them this is not the hotel they will be safe in. If you're looking into staying here, please think again.I like this Hotel a lot.  The rooms are huge and suite-like.  There's a kitchenette in every room, coffee pot, and huge couch. The bedroom has a comfortable king size bed and a great view of Columbus.  The lobby is several floors up and that's a bit of a pain in the neck but that's because there's a big Parking garage under the hotel. There's free complementary drinks and snacks in the lobby and the workers are very friendly. If you're planning on attending events at the veterans memorial this is the closest hotel you can stay at
review_content_20: My cumulative experience here, over the course of three different stays, probably warrants four stars, but three is fair. On my last stay, I arrived to an empty registration desk at around 6 p.m. It honestly felt like I was on that "Hotel Impossible" show as a secret shopper who found poor service. The front desk woman arrived after a good 5-10 minutes, wearing a jacket and saying she'll get right with us. She seemed annoyed that she couldn't relax after what I assume was a smoke break. She checked us in quickly but stiffed us on the cookies, which was par for her surly course.The rooms are incredibly large, but it took my husband literally kicking in the door to see that. The electronic key was working, but the latch was sticking. That fits with the decor, which is dated. Yeesh... this is sounding like a one-star review, which it shouldn't, because the rooms are giant, clean and updated in the important ways. That is to say, modern TVs and comfy clean beds. Older bathrooms but with good showers. Lastly, and importantly, it's cheap and a great location if you're doing any business in downtown Columbus. I just wish they'd make some updates to the rooms and maybe some updates to the staff.The worst dbltree i've ever stayed at.  Stuff falling from bathroom vent on a daily basis.  Rooms are really dated.Hotel and garage parking is laid out sort of weird. Hotel is very convenient to my work, that's all it has going on for it.  If there were another hilton brand nearby i would be all over it.$22/day parking! The weekend cleaning of our room was inadequate/incomplete. We had water flowing out of the vent above the shower head onto the floor and when I called the front desk they said we will make a note of it! Understaffed front desk could not help me print a boarding pass. Not a place I would ever choose to visit again.Just skip it.  Keep driving.  Find a hotel in another city if you have to.I was in a smoking room that smelled absolutely rank.  When I entered the hotel room, I put on socks because I didn't want to go barefoot--and I was so glad that I did!  The bottoms of the socks were filthy after only an hour of walking around the room--and I wasn't pacing the room or anything.  Perhaps most revolting, the bedskirt looked like there was blood on it.  The furniture was old and everything looked like it was from the 80s.  The room was very expensive (208 for the night) and, though the room was large, it skeeved me out.Downstairs, the hotel was very understaffed.  There was only one person working the front desk at any given time and only one person working at the bar.  Service at breakfast was also slow and the food was mediocre.Sorry folks. The management of this Hilton-based hotel is inexplicably inconsiderate, uncaring, and only out for himself. I was treated very rudely when an emergency arose and I tried to appeal to Joseph Jones, the manager, but he refused to respond to me.  I had to escalate the matter to Hilton Corp.  I have been a long-time Hilton Honors member and have decided to decline to stay at Hilton after this incident.  Staff  get orders from management...and all are rude.  Buyer beware.First time at the Doubletree Suites in downtown Columbus. We got one of the newly renovated suites so my review is much better than most of the others I read, who apparently got older suites.Amazing suite with lots of space to "run around naked" if you want to. No, we did keep our clothes on... or DID we?Was presented a warm chocolate chip cookie for each of us at check-in. OK, realtors use this trick at open houses and I'll fall for it every time! Free wi-fi and all the usual free shampoos,conditioners and body gels.I'm an environmental advocate who works hard to recycle as much as I can to save the environment. The Doubletree has small garbage cans throughout the suite that are divided in recyclable and non-recyclable items. Never saw that before!I would have given the Doubletree a five star rating if my shoes didn't stick to the floor in the lobby bar and the three bartenders each covered a specific part of the bar. They seemed lost - wandering from customer-to-customer and not noticing that we had been standing there to order a drink for almost 10 minutes before we finally spoke up to get their attention.Horrible! Small beds, couldn't get the heat to work properly, nowhere nearby to go for dinner. Will not be back.Unsafe.  Garage is haven for thieves. Food is taco bellish. Old hotel.  Parking outrageous. $30. Not very good for priceRooms are nice. Nice TVs, nice gym, and lots of space.Why two stars you wonder? Parking is expensive, no free internet and no free breakfast and worst of all the rooms are disgusting.My room had trash on the floors, chewed gum on the counter and clipped toe nails on bathroom counter... Completely unsanitary and smelled horrible.Management was nice to change me to a different room. The new room was clean but the bathroom still smelled odd. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone as for $150+ a night you can find something way better! (Something clean anyway) the more I write the more I think they deserve less than two stars....don't stay here.The staff is very friendly and the rooms are decent, buy unusable Internet performance in this day and age is unforgivable.  Smoke signals would be faster.I checked in late the night of 6/23. Midnightish. I was tired after getting in after a long flight. Went up to my room and it was hotter than hot. I called downstairs to mention it. The person on the other end "sighed" and said "we're are working on it, should be fixed soon".Being that it was late, I trusted this would get fixed, particularly because the sigh was telling;  this was an issue and this will be fixed. It didn't. I woke up multiple times in the night, sweating waterfalls. Ever woken up in a hot room in a wet bed? Not a comfortable feeling. The next morning rolls around, probably 3 hours of sleep, none of it "good" sleep. I'm not upset at this point, just frustrated. So as I leave for work, I ask about the A/C. They tell me it will be fixed during the day. Cool, one night's hellish experience is over. Move on.I come back in the afternoon. 95 degree day, just walked from Nationwide Arena. Hot as all hell. Can't wait to get up to my room to feel the AC on my face. Open the door to my room........ hot. I call downstairs why trying to rip my clothes off to cool down. Ever tried that? Ripping off sticky clothes? It feels gross. They say "we're still working on it, we have a 3rd party here fixing it." Whatever. I put my clothes back on and go to dinner.Come back from dinner, guess what's not fixed? I call down again "it won't be fixed until tomorrow morning". Goodness gracious. At this point I don't even think they care. They are getting my money and they are happy. What they need to do is set people up in other hotels and pay their way. Or at least rent me a car I can sleep in in the parking garage. At least I'll have AC.Worst of all, the maids know the situation, and they refuse to leave bottled waters in the room after the first night. So here I am sticking my head under the sink trying to cool off.I stay in a bunch of Hilton family hotels, and can recommend if you're in Columbus to stay in the Hampton of the Hilton (proper).It was as if I was at a separate hotel from the other review that were negative. I have to assume that perhaps some folks have been out into rooms that have not been remodeled yet. Mine was huge, new carpet, new counters, Two giant flat screen televisions and a river view. It is a Shame because I was so nervous about the quality and it was awesome!Yes, parking is inconvenient, but you are in the heart of downtown! What would you expect? Valet would be a nice touch, but not something to complain about. If you are concerned, ask for room 310. You won't be disappointed.This is a two-star hotel masquerading as something nicer.I'm saying that as a road-warrior who spends 50-ish nights in hotels yearly.During a 2 night stay, nothing was quite right;  the entire hotel WiFi & back-end computer systems went out for 3 hours one night - housekeeping simply did not service the room at all one day, the front desk people were somewhat surly - the 'guest help' line was never answered (just rang and rang), and overaly, it was just a very meh experience.The one plus;  the rooms are large, I'll say that.Next time I'll pick any number of other options in town over this hotel.I've stayed at the Doubletree Suites in downtown Columbus over 20 times in 2011 and 2012, and so it's been my home away from home. I've stuck with it, because the hotel meets all of my criteria: a Hilton chain with a large room, a full gym, and complimentary hot breakfast.Pros:Each room is a true suite, where the living area is connected to the sleeping area and bathroom by a French door. Each area also has two TV's. The rooms here are easily the largest I have ever stayed in.The hotel is connected to the Capital Club, which features a full-size gym. The gym is old and pretty modest compared to a 24 Hour Fitness, but is very complete compared to other hotel gyms.One side of the hotel faces the Scioto River, and offers a lovely view of downtown Columbus. If that matters to you, then make sure you get a Riverview Suite.Lastly, I've also stayed in one of the three bi-level rooms once here, which had a staircase, a bar area, dining room table, and an extra half-bath downstairs. It was quite comfortable.Cons:The hotel is old, in general, and the rooms are outdated. Aside from a LED TV, each room would look better suited for the 1980's.Most of the rooms have dirty carpets, and so house slippers are a requirement for a comfortable stay.The wifi service has a mind of its own, and can come and go as it pleases.The service is pretty basic here, the restaurant, called the Caucus Room, serves average food at best, and the breakfast gets old quickly.Conclusion:At the end of the day, if you're a Hilton HHonors member, then the Doubletree is a decent option. There is a brand new Hilton a few blocks north that just opened, but as of this writing, I have yet to stay there.This is a business hotel at best. Very minimal service, no fluff type hotel. I don't mind, since it was just one of those business trips; the rooms are quite spacious (though maybe could use a little renovation (the fridge and the microwave look a little worse for wear). I had a double suite, so there is tons of room (living room space, bar area, office area, bedroom, closet/vanity mirror area, and bathroom). They do have two TVs in the doubles which is surprising (both flat screen TVs too... probably the newest things in the room).Housekeeping didn't replace the toiletry items when they made up the room... but they were more than happy to bring an extra set of stuff for me to use. It's some variant of the Crabtree and Evelyn citrus and honey stuff which I like a lot surprisingly (I've never seen these at a Hilton). The shower was a bit on the old side and took a little finagling to make it work properly, but nothing terrible.The beds are comfortable as usual (Hilton generally does a good job here) and it is relatively conveniently located in downtown Columbus (across the street from the Supreme Court). The restaurant (the Caucus Room) isn't particularly great, but it does the job for the morning (you can see my review for that too). The gym has set hours... didn't get to check it out this time around, but you need to get a pass at the front desk.I'd probably end up coming back, but only because I have to... they do give crazy good cookies at check in though! (They are terrible for you though... so watch out :D)I have been going to HH honers hotel for a few years. This by far the worst hands down. From arrival to departure it was awful, employee Adrianne, Leniss, and even Joe the front end manager, their customer service is lacking. They have policies that aren't shared with the chain, and they can't even give wake up calls. The problem lies when you have seeming competent people not doing their job and having zero respect for the words HOSPITALITY!! I paid $140 a night for no internet and disrespect of management!! Spend your hard earned money somewhere ELSE!!Terrible.  Avoid at all costs.  Not much has changed since Frank C. reviewed this place last May.  Frank C, your review was spot on!  My room was very dirty.  The bathroom was especially gross and the bedding was drab at best, but I just about lost it when I discovered stripper glitter all over the place.  Sure, all kinds of things happen in a hotels and I'm not passing judgment, but I expect the cleaning crew to make it so I don't have to ponder the types of business conducted in the room I've just inhabited.  Lame.On my day of departure, I let the front desk know I was going to be checking out just at check out time, noon.  At exactly 12:02, some over zealous wannabe tough guy in a Doubletree uniform pounded on my door.  When I opened it, he immediately told me to get out.  He claimed I was trespassing and that they were gong to alert the authorities.  I'm no customer service expert, but as a Hilton Diamond member (their highest ranking) and as someone who is all of 2 minutes past checkout, I don't see the long term benefit of accusing me of criminal activity.  The front desk staff was proudly indifferent to my complaints about this interaction.  Some other issues:1.  The parking is lame as is the path to the lobby (down a urine-soaked hall way in the parking lot, up an old, dirty elevator).  The door knob literally came off in my hand on one of my expeditions from the garage to the lobby.2.  The food served in the restaurant is inedible.  Stale fruit, flavor-free mystery meat and other such delicacies served with dirty forks and knives.The ONLY good things about this hotel...in order1.  Hilton points2.  Ummm.  That's it.So I  thought I was really going to like the place when I checked in. the room was a bit dated but not bad. The Gym is very nice.  Then the nightmare happened. No water for my first day and I was woken up by drilling two days at 8 AM.  When I informed the front desk of these problems they said I could take a shower in the gym and that there "is no drilling"!!!!!!!  I held the phone up to the room so they could hear the noise and then they said.." oh,  we will check into that" NOTHING was done.  WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER.  I travel a lot for work  and this was the most indifferent I have ever seen a staff.  No attempt to make it right.  No effort at points or any sort of compensation for the money I wasted trying to get a good nights sleep and to be able to shower in my room. The staff said if I had a complaint to contact corporate then corporate said I had to contact guest assistance then they sent me back to the hotel. IT has been nothing but a run around and I wish I had never stayed there... Oh and to make it worse... my wife got food poison from breakfast on the last day of our stay. Do not stay here. they don't care about you at all.I guess I'm probably more of a fan because we stayed here free on a won gift certificate, but still this hotel deserves a bit more credit than what has been given so far.It's just an older property, and has the same feel of older properties in other major cities. I had no problems going in or out of parking (also free with my stay), I work downtown so I generally knew where the garage was already. It's location is good for many things in the downtown area within walking distance. The room was neat and tidy, and came with some free cookies on checkin. Aside from that, like I said, a bit dated, but not out of shape. Overall a very pleasant stay for us.We stayed here for work and got a great rate!!! As a Diamond Hilton member I am accustomed to being treated well...I like the Double Tree chain as they are infusing millions into bringing things up to current standard through-out the chain...and I am a cookie monster. Love their cookies!Location--4 starsRoom size--5 starsBeds--5 starsBreakfast--2 starsParking--2 starsI rented a meeting room for our group for two days at $300/day...that was bad enough until I got wacked a 22% SERVICE FEE TOO. All I asked for was water service and I have to ante up $66 for that? nope!! They graciously wiped it off my billso I was a happy camper!Everything was clean and neat...some of the breakfast staff were really attentive (Carol) and the others were really bad...teeter-totter.The parking is not owned by the hotel so there is no "comp" for Diamond members...the entrance is not intuitive to the hotel entrance and a bit pricey for Columbus.One observation I had was that this hotel is centrally located to all the government offices and corporate offices in the downtown area but yet it doesn't have the appropriate higher-end feel that it should have. Its just a tad off the mark...I would stay here again until the new Hilton opens later this year!
review_content_40: Dirty and gross. Housekeeping made one of two beds, didn't vacuum. Sister-in-law's room had mildew, reeked. Stains and rips galore. Pretty sure it should be called SingleTree.Either I'm reviewing a completely different hotel than the others are who have posted reviews, or this place has had a major remodel since the last reviews. I only stayed there overnight -- I was coming in late and leaving relatively early, so I searched mainly on price -- looked for an inexpensive Hilton property downtown Columbus. I booked at the government rate, which was $80 -- an exceptional value for what I got.The location was great. I was on the 10th floor and had a great view of the Ohio Supreme Court building and of the river. It is within walking distance of many downtown amenities -- COSI, the Columbus Art Museum, and the Greater Columbus Convention Center were the three that I was most interested in. Check-in was extremely efficient, and the front desk staff were helpful. Parking was quite easy as well -- the entrance to the parking garage is on the side of the hotel, which seems to flummox some of the other reviewers here -- but the signage is clear and the garage easy to navigate.  All of the spaces allocated to the hotel are close to the elevator.  And the $20 per night parking fee, while not cheap, is reasonable for an urban downtown hotel.  The breakfast buffet was somehow free to me (I think it was because of HHHonors membership).  It was not exceptional, but decent and clean. I don't think I would have paid full price for it, but for the price of the tip it was great. The room (suite) was huge and very nice.  All of the furniture was newish.  The rooms were immaculately clean.  Nice bed and bathroom. The technology was good -- large flat-screen TV and free WiFi. I'm really not sure what else anyone would want out of a hotel.Don't waste your time or money here.  Go one block up to the Marriott Residence Inn.I had been looking forward to staying downtown for weeks. We had never stayed at a Hilton brand hotel before and entered with high expectations. In the end we left very disappointed that they were not met.I would like to thank Patricia for her warm welcome at check-in. We arrived rather late and were ready to get some rest. The large suite and view of the river were initially impressive, but unfortunately, the nauseating smell of marijuana detracted from any hope of a pleasant stay. I regret not returning to the desk immediately to speak up and hope that this isn't indicative of every room or location.Besides the smell, downsides included the non-working light over the vanity, ineffective climate control, and the milky, clouded water that each tap produced.  A ball of hair was left on the edge of the tub from a previous visitor and the only bath towel had a huge stain on it.The woman at the desk in the morning couldn't even be bothered to respond to the issues that we brought to her attention . Our first stay at a Hilton brand hotel was also most definitely our last. Overall: don't waste your money. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that can offer a much better experience for the price.Ok, where do I begin??... I in fact WORK for Hilton and this was probably my most ridiculous hotel stay to date! My boyfriend and I came up here for a friends wedding so we were here for almost a week... First thing that happened is their parking garage is not marked very well so we pulled around to ask if it was the right one and the parking attendant was less than friendly about it. The rooms were 100 degrees basically even though the thermostat was ALL the way down after wed been told by the front desk that they had been fixed weeks ago. Here was the main issue: construction. As an employee I realize renovations happen, but this was ridiculous. Woke up EVERY MORNING to drilling and hammering after being jet lagged. Bf goes down to front desk and the idiot moves us one floor up on the same side.. Long story short we end up moving rooms 3 times and chick at the front desk is super rude to my boyfriend. She said at some point (about the construction) about me "well she's in the business, she should understand!" Um yeah, I understand to an extent but this hotel is huge and you can move us farther away from the noise than ONE floor... The list goes on but don't expect to be comped for anything or upgraded in rooms... They just don't care unlike the property I work at. You think as a fellow employee they maybe would have at least wanted to make a good impression. I would not stay at this location again. The only reason I give two stars is for the nice renovated rooms and cleanliness.I checked into this hotel for a weekend stay in Columbus, Ohio for a convention and stayed only one night. So this review is limited.Pros:I love the decor of the hotel. The lobby is decorated with dark wood and nice tile.The rooms are very large. I was staying in suite with one king bed. The room had two flat-screen TVs and a great view of the river. The bed was decent but the sheets were a little stiff. The room had a large bathroom and overall was a nice surprise.COOKIES!!! GLORIOUS COOKIES!!! They have free cookies, all you can eat, and they are seriously the best cookies I have ever had. I ordered 8 the night I stayed.Cons: I had to wait 30mins for my room to be ready, after the 4pm check in time. The hotel was really busy, so I should't complain to much, there were two weddings and two conventions going on at the same time.This hotel nickels and dimes you like crazy. $20 per day for parking (with in and out privileges). No free breakfast, which is a killer for me, it is one of the reason I love staying at hotels, free breakfasts are the best.Overall the stay at this DoubleTree was not bad. I have stayed at better hotels and I have stayed at worst. I would come back if there was nothing else available in Columbus.Pros:* spacious rooms(we were in a suite and that can easily be shared by 5 people as the king bed is large enough to fit 2 comfortably and 3 if you're on a budget, and the sofa-bed definitely fits 2ppl)* very friendly staff members from the folks cleaning/re-stocking the rooms to the front desk to the bar and kitchen staff* very well situated if you're in town for work Mon-Fri - (there's a CVS & Subway barely a block away)* good lord, the cookies (we didn't get any as we checked in, only when we requested them)* we were in town for a friend's wedding & they held a brunch at the hotel in a conference room/wing of the hotel which looked and felt very glamorous and beautiful, but the actual brunch was ultimately just so-so & overlapped a lot with the regular b'fast menu)* it seemed super easy to get get a cab called via front desk almost instantly* i don't watch TV for families that do - the suites have 2 of 'em - so no fighting!Cons:- breakfast is not included (this is the first time i've experienced this) but luckily enough there's a bunch of cafes again, around the corner barely 2 blocks away- the food was good, but nothing i'd write home about- there was a game this past weekend & the hotel was slammed and there was only one elevator working between 9 floors (got maintenance anyone?!)- the sheets+towels were indeed stiff (i noticed someone else said this in their review, but to be honest wouldn't you rather have stiff clean sheets than softy dirty ones?!)- if you place/remove the appropriate sign on your doorknob they will come change sheets & re-stock your bathroom supplies - but only if it's the right sign!- notice i said nobody actually cleaned the room (we had spilled chips on the floor & crumbs were still there from the night before, which leads me to question how often carpets ever get cleaned, which just creeps me out so i take it back *shudder)Ultimately would I go back? - sure, but i'd do my best to find something with a little more personality, free b'fast, softer sheets & working elevators, if not, the doubletree it is.I can't attest to price & parking woes as I didn't pay for the room, which i guess means i don't technically have any right to complain......so i'm just Yelping out loud instead.DO NOT STAY HERE, THEY'RE UNDER CONSTRUCTION!  Terrible construction noise coming from, what seemed to be, directly above my head.  Then absolutely nothing done on the part of the hotel to try and make up for this inconvenience.  Everything was deferred to corporate, who would in turn defer it back to the hotel.  And in the end they provided no recompense at all, not even extra rewards points.  It was a cluster.  To top it all off, they accused my friend of lying about a credit card which was definitely stolen from her room while she was at work.  I travel with a large group of people, which I understand can be a challenge for hotels to deal with, but I've never seen it handled so poorly as it was at this Doubletree.  NEVER staying here--or perhaps at any other Doubletree--again.The Doubletree Columbus gets three stars for the spacious rooms but would otherwise garner only two. The parking is on the lower floors of the property and they charge $20 with in and out privileges. That said, you have to take an elevator 6 floors up to the lobby and change to the hotel elevator for rooms. The clerks were pleasant enough but not terribly professional. Oddly, the smoking rooms are on the lower floors. Hello? Doesn't the smell travel UP through the ventilation system? We had one river view room but the river was blocked by a building. The other rooms were, mmmm , ugly courtyard views. Our rooms were HUGE. There was a living room with a couch, comfey chair and footstool and a refrigerator/bar area. The bedroom was quite spacious but the bathroom was a bit small. There was a nice marble counter just outside the bathroom but no stool to sit on to make it useful. The room had a coffeemaker. We stayed over on a Saturday night for a hockey game and the hotel is convenient to Nationwide Stadium - only a 5 block walk. We did not explore downtown but it was pretty quiet on a weekend. Columbus seems like a nice little city and I'll be back when I have more time. The breakfast was standard Doubletree fare at the buffet. There is no sign mentioning made-to-order omelets but after inquiring, we found they do have them. The omelets are much better than the buffet food. If you get the buffet included with your room, take it but if you are paying $13.95 plus tax and tip, head out to the deli up the street. For the January sale price of $89, the Doubletree worked well for our group. If we had to pay much more, I'd explore other options.Not the greatest but not bad for business stay. Food at the bar mediocre but enable should be consumed only if you have no other options. Although, service at the bar was really good and friendly.WOW! what a shit hole! I will never stay here again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I don't even know where to start. Well, I will start by saying I had nothing to do with picking this hotel. We had a group of 100 staying at this hotel from Buffalo, NY, so this is where I was told the reservations were. For starters, finding the parking ramp sucks. Even though it is on the side of the building, there is two garages that go under this building. And why the hell is there no valet?? Also, when you enter the hotel from the street, you have to take a elevator up to the lobby. the elevator is from 1956. When you get to the hotel lobby and the floors, this is where you ll notice this is a shit hole. It looks like somebody took a bunch of furniture and carpeting and wallpaper from grandmas house. Also, this place is so dirty from the lobby to the elevators to the rooms. The rooms are Big, there was a living room with a couch old and very uncomfortable , chair and footstool and a refrigerator's area. The bedroom was quite spacious but the bathroom was a bit small and extremely dirty. There was a counter just outside the bathroom but no stool to sit on to make it useful. The room had a coffeemaker. We stayed over on a Saturday night for a hockey game and the hotel is convenient to Nationwide Arena- only a 5 block walk. That's the only thing it has going. Last but not least, this will disgust you so don't read on if you have a soft stomach....... Lift up the mattress, like The whole bed frame and mattress. underneath was so filthy and i mean filthy. Crumbs, dead bugs, dust, dirt anything you can imagine. Also, i took the sheets off the bed and the mattress and a huge piss stain...disgustingHUGE rooms.  Seriously 600 square feet is a huge suite.  Our two rooms were clean and well maintained but the parking is pricey and so is the restaurant.  If you stay here make sure you get something for breakfast before you're in for the night.OHHHH and I totally forgot....$9.95 for internet access.....when you can get it free at McDonald's now???  Ridiculous!!Great hotel.  Easy fast checkin, clean rooms, good TVs, good wifi, good bar with decent food.  5 stars.  The only place I will stay in Colmbus.Rooms are spacious since they're suites, but man this whole hotel needs a complete overhaul.  Everything looks so old in this place.  The carpet looks so outdated and gross looking.  If you've read my other posts on hotels you'll remember that complex I have about walking barefoot on the carpet.  nuh uh..Not gonna do it.  I was in Columbus for almost a year and I've stayed at this hotel for months only because I'm a Hilton status holder.  If it wasn't for that I'd choose another hotel in the downtown Columbus area.  So I'm moving onto the bathroom.  In some of the rooms I stayed at some of the shower stalls had ring around the tub or something.  I'm thinking dude what the hell took a shower in this tub today.  I was grossed out and and went back downstairs to ask for another room.  Since i've got high status with Hilton I got one of those preferred status rooms, and you'd think those rooms would be well maintained better, but I guess they're all like that or possibly worse.  I mean the staff  is super friendly, but the place isn't well maintained.  Don't even get me started with the restaurant.  They offer a free buffet for me and I head down one more and it's your usual American fair as I'm walking down the buffet line scanning the items and reading them out in my head, "ok we got scrambled eggssausagebaconbreakfast potatoesyogurt, milkbut when I got to the fruit medley...fruit with a swarm of fruit flies flying around them...I'm thinking where did all these flies come from and how gross is this.  these guys were partying it up on the fruit medley.   If you can relate I walked right into this grouping of fruit flies and realized it too late before you take a couple in your mouth just like when you're walking outside and when your'e not paying attention you walk right into one of those little swarm of gnats and catch your mouth open.  That wasn't my idea of breakfast.  I was grossed out and left the buffet.  From that day I only ordered directly from the kitchen.  I never touched the buffet after that.  The kitchen staff are real nice people so I'm just conflicted why they had the buffet in that condition.  I mean granted it wasn't like that everyday, but I'm looking for consistency.  Unless you have status at Hilton I'd just try going somewhere else.

review_content: Room - 915PROS: The WiFi in the room was fast and free for up to 5 devices. The room was quiet facing facing I-670. The beds, bedding and pillows were amazingly plush and comfortable. The 2 queen bed room was spacious. The spaciousness of the room was especially noticeable between the two beds - there seemed to be more room there than is typical which was great. The beds were modern with a wood headboard going all the way up the wall and half over the bed on the ceiling. On this ceiling part were two reading lights one for each side of the bed. There were 2 outlets and 1 USB port for each bed and the same by the desk. The Illy coffee in the room is great and the machine is easy to use - Keurig style. The curtains were sufficient to black out all light at night. I also loved the shower head - a big rain spout with great water pressure. The walk in shower was spacious too. CONS: The only bad thing about the room was the sliding bathroom barn style door which would not stay closed unless you got it in a particular spot. Since the door faces the side of one of the beds instead of the entry way this was particularly problematic. SpaPROS: The masseur, Robert, was great. I loved how he incorporated hot towels in the massage and helped me with various neck stretches. A 60 minute massage was $111 and a 30-minute was $58. His technique was great and he can definitely deliver pressure.  To start of the massage he asked me about any trouble areas and then gave me a couple of oils to smell, and told me their benefits, so I could make a selection as to what he would use. I also liked that after the massage you get 30 minutes in the spa suite if you booked an hour treatment and 15 minutes with a 30 minute treatment. There isn't too much to do in the suite alone, but there is a pretty awesome shower that throws water at you from above and all sides - about 9 different angles. CONS: Maybe it was just forgotten, but some music would be nice in the suite. Also I would like heavier black out curtains. The room ends with windows on two sides so the light from High Street flooded into the suite through the drapes. Either black out shades and mood lighting is needed or eye masks need to be handed out when lying face up. The 9 jet, 8'X11' shower could also use another drain - the 3" circle drain got a little overwhelmed to say the least. NOTE: Even if you are a hotel guest, go first to the front desk to sign-in for your massage. Someone will then escort you up to suite 401/2 for your massage. Robert told me I was supposed to be escorted out after my massage, but when I finished with my 30 minute relaxation no one was around so I just left. OverallPROS: Overall the hotel experience was great and I would return here in a heartbeat. It really feels like a boutique hotel, but of course with the rewards/status perks of a chain. The front desk staff was friendly and always greeted us as we walked past it to the 2 elevators. Upon check in they provided good recognition of elite benefits/status and when passing the desk after my massage a front desk employee recognized me and asked how it was. The doorman always had the door open and was always friendly. Upon arrival he offered luggage assistance. The hotel location cannot be beat. You can walk right out the door of the hotel onto High Street in the Short North to shops and OpenTable's highest rated restaurants. This hotel is the perfect home base for a weekend getaway. CONS: Valet was very slow. It took them a long time to retrieve cars. The valet staff were very friendly and considerate people, but the length of time it took made it take awhile to get your car when you wanted to leave, and also made getting close to the hotel to a point where you could drop your car off take some time. The road in front of the hotel was often backed up with cars the valets had not yet taken away. Another oddity I noticed occurred when I was watching another guest print his flight boarding pass. This had to be done on one of the two front desk computers. So the guest had to come behind the registration desk and use one of the computers therefore cutting the efficiency of the desk's check-in/out ability temporarily in half.The hotel restaurant is The Guide House. See my positive review of breakfast at this restaurant.Gorgeous, bougie hotel in downtown Columbus. I stay here when I'm in town for business (aka I would never pay to stay here with my own money.... lordy). In the heart of the Short North (the Soho of Columbus, they say), this place is conveniently located right next to the Convention Center and awesome bars and restaurants. Everyone is nice and polite, will get you whatever you need, et al - typical bougie hotel.A few notes from a non-bougie, practical person like me... - The decor is so modern, it's almost suffocating and stuffy. The furniture is so square and the drawers and armoire open very weird, wide angles and hard-to-grab handles.- The outlets along the bedside table are behind the bed and up high, making them... kinda inaccessible. - The shower is amazing with a great huge shower head, but getting in and out has its own design flaws, and so does the handle to turn the water on (gotta stand and reach in very awkwardly while trying to adjust for temperature and not burn your goods?). - The towels are surprisingly harsh and the robe doesn't have loops to put the tie in??? So you're basically standing in your room, adjusting your robe and then it drops and you're buck naked (Go Buckeyes!). Weird feeling.- The pillows look luxurious, but turn to dust when a single hair lays on it.- Haven't eaten at the downstairs restaurant yet (The Guild House), but even the menu and the prices look uppity. Hello, we're in OHIO, why is a ribeye steak $35?? Come on now.All in all, although this is a beautiful hotel, a lot of the amenities and accessories make it somewhat inaccessible. Still, I shall patronize this place with the most glorious amenity of all - my corporate card.A lot of reviews say this is just an Aloft trying to be something upscale. I would agree but for the price, we paid 220 plus taxes, You are really just paying for location which is great with everything in walking distance of short north. This was $20 more than the Hilton downtown and was more or less similarly priced for the standard room.  Parking/ valet is $ 30 a night. It's the same price if you just left your car in their garage overnight. Again this is due to the location. It would be a nice perk if parking with no valet was free with your accommodation. For example if you were just going to leave your car in the garage and walk/or just give one free validated parking ticket!Everyone  from staff/guest services were great. The entrance has a cool, funky vibe that also has a  funky strange smell , something listed on many reviews that we read. But the decor is chic,almost to a point where it's forced. The room is modern, they kind of beat you over the head to make sure you know this, and was fairly spacious. The view is eh but its Columbus what are you going to do!  The room is loaded with mini-bar price traps so if you have kids make sure to put that stuff away! (Review up date: we got charged $11 from the mini bar after our stay and we did not touch a thing....beware its a trap)There is an Illy coffee machine with really cute cups, but kind of just a keurig. The bed was clean,as was the room, and very comfortable. The room has pretty nifty decor it screams Ikea but I loved it. The bathroom was fairly baller. I'm happy they watched any episode of HGTV and threw in a walk-in shower with some subway tile. The bathroom door is a large warehouse sliding one, again their designer is on that HGTV.  The upgraded rooms also have a beautiful bathroom, but why in the buns would you pay for that when the water barely gets to warm. This was the sad face. I was all ready for my walk-in subway tiled HGTV flip that house hot shower and that shit barely got to steamy. I was inconsolable. I thought maybe this was just during a heavy use time so I tried it again hours later.....and nope.  This is disappointing. I can get a hot shower at a red roof inn plus or literally any hotel. No I am being difficult because this is an  upscale Aloft. If I was at the Rodeway Inn I would be presently surprised. Overall this is a 3 star stay. Everything was okay. My price point for this would probably be $150-$200 for a standard room. The rooms are nice/clean, service was good, and location is great.  If you want to splurge and get that baller room just be ready for a lot of "Okay" with nice decor.I have stayed at this hotel twice when travel for business in Columbus, and I have no complements, service is great, rooms are spacious & trendy.  Good Work Le Meridien.Stop in at Soul Bar at The Joseph & see Jason & Kristen!  Jason's cocktails are AMAZING!!Absolute great location. The hotel is upscale and modern with great finishes. The staff is absolutely amazing from the Valet to Front Desk. Everyone is very helpful and friendly.This is a cute hotel in a great location. The hotel was clean and modern. I loved all of the artwork throughout the hotel. My only complaint is that the room is not very sound proof and the valet takes a very long time to retrieve your car.We went to Columbus for a wedding and stayed in the Le Meridien because the shuttle to the reception was going from the hotel. When we checked in there was a large group that were going to the wedding checking in, but ours was the only room that wasn't ready yet for some reason. We waited approximately 20 minutes and were given our keys. We were happy to find that we were given a room overlooking North High Street, which probably is one of the better views at the hotel. From then on, our experience at the hotel improved.The room was clean and had nice toiletries. Unfortunately, housekeeping knocked on our door right before we were going to leave and, although we said we'd be gone in 10 minutes, they never went back to service our room. We also had an issue where the door locked us out with the latch at one point and the service crew had to assist us to get back in. The front desk staff said that happens all the time, so luckily it was a quick fix and we got right back in.We went to the bar both nights. The first night it was empty other than us and the second night it was packed with wedding guests. I don't think that they were prepared for that many people showing up, as there was only one bartender both nights and some people from our group left the second night because it was taking too long to get drinks.We went to the gym twice and both times we were the only ones in it. It had several treadmills and exercise bikes,benches, some yoga mats and weights. There were some snacks available (oranges and apples) and a water dispenser. Overall, the hotel was clean and well located. We would stay there again.I had the chance to visit The Joseph several times over the weekend, since my parents were in from out of town, and I told them they had to book a room there. The interior is so clean and modern, and there's some very cool artwork hanging up all over. I was actually expecting there to be more art pieces, but I'm actually glad it wasn't made out to be it's own art gallery. Check out the water bottle chandelier on the stairs going from the first to the second floor. Really neat. My parents were on the 4th floor, and the view from their room faced South and was one of the best views of the Columbus skyline I'd seen. At night time, it looked especially amazing. The rooms have some modern artwork as well, but I'm not as big into this as my mom, and I was more into admiring the huge flat screen TV. We spent a couple cocktail hours at the Soul bar down in the lobby. I loved that it was right in the lobby too, so that you could drink and watch people come into the hotel. You felt immersed in everything whether you were drinking at the bar or arriving for the first time. It was very lively. The Guild House is right next door, but you can also order some dishes at the hotel bar. Next time I'm there, I'll have to take a picture of the menu. My mom loved the house cocktails they made. I did have a Ginger one though that I wasn't a huge fan of.Everyone was working there was incredibly friendly, and the bellhops and valets were about as helpful as you'd expect at a hotel of this caliber. It's definitely not a cheap place to stay, but if you have some friends from out of town looking to spend some time in Columbus, and you want to impress, I'd definitely recommend them booking a room here.All I can speak for is the Soul bar and the  art gallery here, but they are both fantastic! As I walked past a slew of tiny overcrowded bars in the Short North, The Joseph was a spacious and beautiful respite from the chaos. There was plenty of open seating in the lobby which was available for drink service from the Soul bar. I ordered a cocktail for $10 and got a $6 craft beer for my boyfriend. The service was friendly, the atmosphere is top notch, and it was surprisingly not nearly as crowded or expensive as I expected. After ordering drinks, we were told we were allowed to wander around upstairs with our drinks and check out the gallery for free. This made for quite a lovely and affordable date night in a drop dead beautiful location.I'm solely reviewing the Soul bar and not the hotel. The atmosphere is really cool and hip. There are seats by the bar and two communal tables with additional seats. Lots of great cocktails to chose from. The back door is connected to The guild house.I come to Columbus a few times a year for work and typically don't love the hotel options...until now. This was my first time staying here and I have to say I was very impressed! Beautiful decor, friendly/attentive staff and a great bar menu. The icing on the cake was the card I was handed from the front desk welcoming me to the property. The attention to detail was noted and most definitely appreciated. I have a new home away from home in Columbus and can't wait to stay here again!!Very clean and modern.  Furniture and bedding all very comfortable. No exhaust fan and terrible acoustics in the bathroom, plus the door is sliding and metal.  So if your roomie has to go number two you might hear more than you'd like. On arrival we were given a room that wasn't yet cleaned.  Went back to front desk and it took way too long to give us another room. Cleaning staff walked in on our room twice without knocking.  Not cool. If you want to hang out in the Short North, this is your place.Way overpriced for the quality of room and services. Room is a Hampton Inn, nothing special, just overpriced. Paid twice as much for room service then most 4 star hotels...got half the quality. The only thing decent is location. The bartenders were nice and so were the check in personnel.This  lovely hotel only opened in January 2015 and not only has gorgeous and spacious rooms but also exceptional service and extra friendly staff.Huge and comfortable beds and very modern bathroom; complimentary illy coffee maker in the room. Will book again!I've spent about 120 nights in Starwood hotels now, and this is my favorite of them all.Pros:1. Location.  The hotel is on the only street worth visiting in Columbus.  All night life and most good food is within walking distance of here.2. The room. Tasteful modern furniture in the suites.  There's an Eames chair + ottoman in my room!!  Expansive floor to ceiling glass for half the room overlooking high street...beautiful!3. The shower and tub.  Both are great, and the wall in the shower room is a giant window that overlooks high street, so high street gets a show unless you choose to lower the shade.4. The wifi.  30 megabits per second.  The best of any hotel I've been in.5. The TV.  Not that garbage hotel cable you find everywhere.  It's a normal HDTV with a normal lineup (all the sports channels and HBO, not terrible Showtime or Cinemax).  The channels change quickly, just as with a normal TV.  This is what it's supposed to be like...why don't all hotels do this?!?6. The noise.  It's quiet.  Not the quietest place I've been, but you're on high street, so it's great all things considered.7. Food. Guild House is connected to this place, and it's one of the best restaurants in town.8. Drink. The bar downstairs makes really good cocktails.Cons:1. A little pricey, but you have to expect that.  This is probably the nicest place in town.  Parking is ridiculously expensive ($30/night in Columbus!!), so I suggest Uber if at all possible.  It's about $12 to/from the airport and way faster than if you were to rent a car.  This is the only hotel I ever choose when I come to Columbus.Probably the best property in Columbus, certainly downtown. They did a great job. Every member of the staff was genuine and went out of their way to help us. We stayed in the Executive Suite and had a great view of the fireworks at Red, White & Boom. SW views are the best. The room was large and spacious and very modern. We travelled with a 2 y/o and a 2 month old. The crib was already in our room when we arrived. They also provided a list of nanny services. The location is perfect too. Surrounded by really good Cameron Mitchell Restaurants. Walking distance to Goodale Park and the Arena District. Get a sandwich from Press Grill. 2 huge complaints: the valet situation is an absolute disaster and detrimental to the experience. Don't rent a car if you don't need to. If you do, use a parking garage 2 blocks down. Coffee in the lobby is not free. Literally every $200+ a night hotel I've stayed in offers complimentary coffee.We arrived 1/2 and hour after our 3pm check in time. We were told that the room had not been cleaned yet. The guy at the desk was very nice and it was not his fault, but the wait was annoying.  The room had an AWESOME VIEW of the city! We were on the 9th floor. The room was nice, The bed is comfortable and the shower is nice as well. Overall the place is good, not sure 350 a night good though. Doesn't have the 5 star feel you'll get at other hotels, but Its new. Valet is a pain. Costs 30 a day and expect to wait 30 minutes for them to fetch your car.Awesome amenities. Great location and beautiful interior. Much better than the hiltons at Easton shopping center.First impression is that they have very attentive staff. Opening the door for you all the time, and when it rains they hold an umbrella over you while waiting for a ride. On to the front desk! The morning staff were great! Sociable, happy, and more importantly very well informed about local recommendations.  One of the managers also struck up a  delightful conversation about local recommendations. The foyer is well done decorated with marble floors, elegant furniture, and art work.  The room is very modernly decorated.  The bed and pillows were 5 star all the way. The shower was perfect with a valve that controls full range of pressure.  Room view was nice for thunder storms and aerial view of high street. The price, slightly over priced. However, they earn it with everything previously mentioned and location. Some of the best brunch, breakfast, and dinner places are all a couple blocks away.
review_content_20: Loved this hotel after my first stay.  Unfortunately during my repeat visit, the hotel used a heavy epoxy to seal the showers on one of the floors.  Hotel is not inhabitable however they didn't shut it down, notify guests, or provide alternative accommodations.  Rather a fully booked hotel of guests stayed and got il!!! Very poor management.  When we checked out, they said they've been sealing the showers one floor at a time for the past several weeks.  Why would they not do the right thing and close the hotel for several days to repair this issue without toxic fumes causing guests to become ill!I am an SPG Gold Member and this was my second stay in this hotel. My first trip this summer was a 2 night work trip.  I was so impressed by the location, staff, food, decor, cleanliness and overall vibe that I booked another 2 night stay for my family (including 4 young children) during my Christmas visit with my family.  I was a little concerned since this hotel is rather hip and new and wasn't sure that my kids would not be the best fit here.  I have to say that once again the staff was top notch and made our stay nothing short of fantastic!  The kids were greeted each time in and out of the hotel, often times by name by the bellman and the front desk staff.  We had connecting rooms, one room with 2 queens and the other with a king.  The accommodations couldn't have been more ideal.  We ordered room service and food quality and presentation was incredible.  The guild house, like most other Cameron Mitchell restaurants, did not disappoint!  Thank you to Thomas, the food and beverage manager, George and all the other front desk team and the bellman staff for another memorable experience, we will certainly be back!I travel weekly for business and I am a big fan of Westin hotels. Helpful staff - but all I kept thinking was it is an over-priced ALoft where they wash the comforter covers.  $30 a day for parking is ridiculous - even by DC standards. Switched to three different rooms - strong chemical smell in all of them that left me with a headache.  Overall - disappointed.

review_content: I stayed at the Hilton in Downtown Columbus for 4 days 3 nights for a conference by my employer. The Lower Level is where the meeting area was held and it was quite accommodating for various sessions / sizes of rooms. The staff brought cold water to each table each session which was very nice.Breakfast supplied for the conference attendees was not stunning. while it was good, it was nothing more than run of the mill pastries and yogurt.I posted a separate review of the Gallerie Bar & Bistro located inside the hotel which I did not have a good experience with.The Room: I thought the room I stayed in was fantastic. I was on floor 6 room 21. The only real gripe i had with the room was the shower door. There is about a quarter inch gap on each side of the door like in a public restroom stall. So water goes through and onto the floor.The hotel is within walking distance of many great restaurants which I was happy to try also.I would definitely stay here again.Sweetie had eaten at the restaurant here before, and it popped to the top of the list as we searched for a staycation/anniversary/babymoon splurge hotel.  Yelp helped- thanks everyone, your reviews are always useful!We parked ourselves, but it is probably worth using the valet ($24, instead of $20.)  It was a hike, and there are no handy elevators in the garage.The lobby is beautiful, check-in was superfast, and the service in general was great start to finish.  Our room was on the 7th floor, with a view of downtown.  The room was a little small, but plenty for us.  The decor was modern and comfortable.  The bed was firm (perfect for us,) with cushy pillows and comforter.  The bathroom was very sleek, and warm despite a tile floor.  Location is perfect- close to (and connected to) the convention center; right around the corner from the North Market; and a short walk to downtown or the Short North.  Plenty of great restaurants and shops nearby.  I would highly recommend it to anyone coming into town for business or otherwise needing to be downtown.Some negatives:  our room, on the south end, was far from the elevators.  Seriously, another bank would have been nice.  Plus, there were train tracks directly beneath our window.  Not super loud or frequent, but the trains were occasionally intrusive.  There was lots of noise from the hall.  And the shower took forever to get hot.  Still, it was a great experience.  Price was very reasonable for the quality.  I would recommend it (though hey, I live here, so I might not have much reason to stay here again...)I've stayed here twice, both times the experience was fine. If you can get a room below $150 it's in a very convenient spot. Ok pillows, a little flat. Mattress also OK... I would not want to stay more than three nights on it though, my back was aching for home by the time I left. Typical for a hotel like Holiday Inn but your expect a notch up in comfort here.My issues are mostly around the HVAC and staff.My room was freezing when I arrived, although the thermostat said 65-ish. I cranked it up to the max of 75 and I swear the system was blowing cool air. I am a cold climate person and enjoy cooler temperatures but even this was a bit much. The second day I return to my room and find housekeeping had shut it off completely. Cold again.The bathroom was ok. Flawed shower design which caused some leakage on the ground and either low pressure or a low-flow shower head made me wish for a little extra force in the mornings.The restaurant in the hotel was very forgettable for breakfast. Nothing I'd eat again. I will recommend the Italian restaurant on the corner from the Hilton, Martini, which has better cocktails and incomparable food.All in all an ok hotel experience. I think I got a funky room and some zealous housekeeping staff. Next time I may try the Hyatt across the street.Solid in every respect.First of all, it has a fabulous location. It's literally across the street from the Convention Center and in case of rain or snow, you can use the skywalk off the hotel's second floor. You are a five minute walk to the wonderful North Market, and within a ten minute radius there must be 25 restaurants and saloons. The area is safe with a lot of people out on the street, but I did see a few vagrants and panhandlers out there.The hotel is absolutely gorgeous- everything from the lobby, to the center atrium to the sweet Gallerie Bar and Bistro on the second floor accessed via a majestic spiral staircase. On the first floor, there is artwork all over the walls on the way to the conference rooms.My room on the tenth floor was spacious. Comfy bed, great work station, fast wifi, and a big bathroom with a glass shower and plenty of water pressure and temperature.The room had a few cool features, like a big hand painted mural on the ceiling, a nice radio alarm clock with an iPod jack, a Cuisinart coffee maker that makes two cups at the same time, and nicely marked light switches for the desk area, window area, and headboards. There is a full length seating area by the windows and the seats have built in storage areas to give you a few extra dresser drawers.  Lots of nice touches everywhere.  I attended a private reception in the Robert King Suite (a first floor conference room) it went very well with a cool bartender and great catered food.I'd definitely stay here again.After we landed and got our rental car we made our way to find our hotel. Using my phone as navigation it led me to the hotel but could not find where to pull in to valet the vehicle. Drove around the hotel twice where there was a lot of people walking around like there was a big event going on. Finally found where you pull into to park the car. The valet guys were nice and helped get our luggage out from the trunk. As we walk in I was amazed how nice the lobby was for it all looked brand new. I quickly noticed all the artwork hanging on the walls and the articulate furniture. I had already checked in online but still had to wait at the counter. We were given a room upgrade and made our way to the 12th floor.The 12th floor is the top floor and executive level meaning you have access to a private lounge that serves free breakfast and light hot food items in the evening. Free drinks are available and only alcoholic drinks are paid for. The food lounge items were excellent and got addicted to the bacon every morning. There is a large TV, sitting areas and desktop computers to use like printing out airline boarding passes. The person working there is very nice and friendly.Our room was a mini suite where one had a sitting area and the other a king bed. Two bathrooms but only one had a shower. There was no tub in this room. Two 50 in. TVs, mini fridge and lots of places to sit and relax. The couch was a pull out. We had an excellent view of Nationwide Arena and could see the fireworks at the Huntington Park (baseball stadium) next to it. The room has excellent lighting and comforts like the bath items. It was also very quiet at night. Our room was cleaned well and had no problems with the room. The bed was comfortable and slept well at night.On the second floor there is a nice bar and restaurant with more art on the walls along with more computer stations and seating areas. This floor also houses the nice workout facility and indoor pool and spa. I gave it a try where the pool water was chilly and spa was hot. Towels are provided to dry off. There is also a nice gift shop to sell items you may have forgotten or to snack on. They do sell the Buckeye candies in there. Along with the gift shop there is also a Coffee Bean also in the lobby level. There is a sign saying there is a bee hive on the roof to provide fresh honey. Below the lobby is a convention hall space for parties.A main highlight is the location where you can walk to the convention center, sports complexes, and numerous bars and restaurants around it.At the end we had a very enjoyable time staying here and will do it again when we return to Columbus.This hotel looks likes like a scene out of a James Bond movie. It's STUNNING. The architecture is mind blowing. The atrium runs right up through the middle of the hotel with beautiful views of the entire hotel. The staircases are literally works of art. Speaking of art...the hotel is full of it!I've stayed in my fair share of hotels and this is easily in the top 5 as far as most beautiful. And y'all know I'm a modern girl. I like clean lines, fancy food, and a good stiff drink. Here are some reasons why I think this hotel rocks. PROS:- Pool- Fitness Center- Full service bar- Full service restaurant THAT IS ACTUALLY LOCAL! - Comfy beds- The most comfortable pillows of all time (I seriously almost bought one at check-out)- Probably the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at. Everything was spotless- TV has cable and descriptions on each channel. You'd be surprised how many hotels do not have this. - Great location. It's actually connected to the convention center! - Beautiful art work- Visually stunning to just walk around and look at. - Great customer service. - IT'S CHEAP! (somehow)CONS: - You can literally hear everything. And this is the ONLY con, but it is a big one and the only reason for the -1 star. Families and kids running rampant through the halls. The cell phone on the side table in the room next to you. The TV's. Once I turned my TV and I worked an event until 2am I pretty much passed out, but I can't imagine how annoying this would be if you weren't exhausted and staying here.Overall the most beautiful hotel in Columbus in my opinion and wayyyy underpriced for what you get. Also won the #1 hotel in the USA last year in the Hilton family of hotels. (At least that's what the bartender told me) Would definitely return! *Shout out to Mark at the bar for making me a killer Bloody Mary and for generally just loving his job. I adored his smile and the way he took interest in my stay. Love that.So overall it was an enjoyable stay. Well located between restaurants and downtown arena it was a good choice for us. However, for the money I dropped for a one night stay I expect a little more for the staff. They were professional but not friendly by any means. Granted we were here on a very busy Saturday night, but little things like how the front desk staff didn't take an interest in us, how I tried to explain that I tried to download the digital room key but it came up with an error and the woman behind the desk snapped that I had to be there at the desk to get the digital room key. Oh OK. My bad. The whole idea behind the fancy room key is that you don't have to wait in line to check in. We ordered room service and the woman was very nice but the food was o.k. at best. The whole reason we had to order room service was because when we tried to go to the bistro in their basement they told us the kitchen was closed....at 10pm...on a Saturday. Not, "were on a limited menu, or sorry the kitchen is closed but our room service still has plenty of options", just " oh sorry the kitchen is closed". The room was clean and safe and lovely, the decor is gorgeous and the downtown location is great, and that's all you're paying for so expect nothing extra.This is the most amazing hotel experience I have had yet in my life, who knew I would find it in my favorite city Columbus Ohio?
