I will absolutely come here again.  Highlights:--staff:  here for a work offsite so using conference facilities.  Extremely responsive staff across the board.  Really friendly front desk.  Very professional restaurant crew.  --ambiance: common areas are clean and very cool.  Neat open second floor restaurant and bar area.  Hotel rooms are updated and uniquely decorated.  Small but well used space.  View of parking lot in my room but you can't have everything:)--food:  OH THE FOOD!!!   I am so incredibly impressed with the food I have had here.  Everything has been amazing from restaurants and from conference facilities.  I don't know how this wasn't first.  I haven't eaten this well over a 24-hour period, potentially my entire life!Doesn't look like much on the outside and the ridiculous parking price ($24 a day I think) makes me sad.  Also some hotel rooms have inward view of lobby and I am sad for anyone in those rooms.Overall HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place for your next trip to Columbus, conference, wedding, party, Etc.Just stayed here for 3 nights. Very nice hotel. Clean. Quiet. & close to good restaurants. Rooms are kinda small, & pillows were awful! (I hate down pillows) but if you like that kind of thing, then you're good. Mark at the bar is fantastic. & if you are there you have to try the bourbon infused with peaches & pecans. Sounds weird but it's seriously so good! & I don't drink bourbon! I would for sure stay here again. The food at the restaurant sounded gross so I never ate there. Martini modern Italian next door is a must & also the north market next door is a must!This hotel is in a great location, and is seriously beautiful on the inside. I didn't even mind that the only window in my room faced the atrium and not outside. The second floor atrium is really cool - full of lots of comfortable places to sit and relax, as well as the beautiful Gallerie Bar and Bistro. There is also an indoor swimming pool on that level.Everyone I encountered at the Hilton was extremely friendly, especially the employees at the in-house Coffee Bean stand. The only thing I found confounding is the questionable housekeeping of the room I was staying in. You'll have to take my word for it when I say that I'm not one to complain about hotel room cleanliness. For example, upon walking in to the room for the first time, it smelled bad...really bad. I figured the previous guest may have thrown away a poopy diaper or something, and the smell lingered. Well, three full days later, the smell remained, and it took my by surprise every time I entered the room. That might just be a plumbing issue.The housekeeping was okay, but again: not to the standards you might expect from a Hilton. For instance, every time I got back to my room, the toilet seat was left up. One time, the toilet seat was left up AND the blow dryer was still plugged in, and had fallen into the sink. Neither is a big deal - but I have a weird tendency to not flip the bathroom light on sometimes, if there is enough light coming in through the hallway (peeing with the door open is an inexplicable luxury of living alone). So.... I didn't fall into the toilet, nor did I electrocute myself. But it was weird. The complimentary water bottles in the room were nice, but were never replenished. Here's the thing: I cannot stand entitled, smug people who complain about weird minutiae, and I NEVER want to be like that. None of these issues were worth bringing to anyone's attention while I was there, and I'm not even sure why I'm even bringing it up now. I don't know. Finally, I did not order room service, but I thought about it. It was the first business hotel I've stayed in that had reasonable prices for room service. All in all, I would definitely stay again... hopefully in a non-poopy room.The reason I'm a fan is because of it's location!  They are right where you want to be for anything in the area and c'mon! Right next door to the North Market?  We stayed there recently for a convention in the convention center and it was nice to just walk across High Street in the walkway and not have to deal with the rain and cold that was happening at the time.The hotel itself is beautiful and great for events like weddings etc.  The front desk staff were a bit dry to me but eh, it happens.  Now where they lost a star with me was our room.  They never mentioned when booking about the room differences.  All the rooms are supposed to be the same based upon what kind of room but they neglected to mention the atrium view rooms.Here I am thinking we will get a room with a view of High Street or the city or something but noooooooooooo!  We got a room that faced the atrium which meant that with the curtains open we could see everyone in the hotel and vice versa!  No view of the outside!  Unless you like that kind of thing I would make sure when booking the room to not take these.  I should've asked to change the room but felt I could live with it.  Really didn't like it but had emptied out my suitcase and shot over to the convention and wasn't in the mood to repack and move until check out.The room felt a little small to me although the bathroom itself was a nice size with a huge shower and a sink that was partially stopped up and they were a bit spartan with the supplies in there.  There is also a small fridge in the room which is great for that late night slice you might bring back ;)  Self parking in the garage is $20 while valet is $24.  The thing with that is valet parking is right behind the hotel while self parking means you will have to drive further into the garage and further away from the hotel.  I would return to the hotel providing I did NOT get one of those atrium rooms - ick!My go to hotel when I visit Columbus. It's the newest hotel in the area. I like you are in such a central location and can walk to some top notch restaurants.The rooms are nice and the suites are even nicer! The beds are comfortable and the linens are quality. I love the art on the ceiling... Just a nice touch. The bathrooms are a nice size. Good shower, plenty of vanity space, and nice towels. Many amenities such as a restaurant which serves a nice breakfast. The executive lounge, hotel bar, fitness center, business center, and a coffee shop. The service has alway been solid... valet, check in, and house keeping all have been excellent. I would recommend this hotel!FOOD: I've gone to the Hilton for a few events. The most recent was an art auction. The food selection included grilled cheese sandwiches with tomato bisque, caramelized bacon, sirloin sliders, and more. Everything was delicious! There was also a salad topped with grilled chicken and a sweet dressing. One of the best salads I have ever had.I was here for a conference.  Location was excellent.I liked hanging out at the bar area, above the ground floor.  The room was what I expected.  There was free Wi-Fi, although that may have been through the conference I was attending.If I was back in town, I would stay here.This hotel was designed to be a jewel in the middle of downtown, and it shows.The lobby is a beautiful, open space that takes advantage of natural lighting to highlight the marble, glass, and granite construction whenever possible, and naturally leads you back towards the reception desk. Rooms are nicely arranged and even the relatively small one we used was laid out to give you as much space as possible. Staff were friendly, helpful, and positive, and the coffee bar featured tasty (if basic) sandwiches at breakfast, plus an amazing pumpkin latte that actually had pumpkin blended into it!The only slight downsides are that parking is, unsurprisingly, very expensive ($20 for self parking / night, $30 if you use the valet), and that while the rooms have wide windows that give a great vantage point, 1/2 of the hotel basically just gets a view of the convention center instead of a look out at the city. Still, that really can't  be helped given the location.I have to admit - we stayed here for a little weekend getaway because I had a bunch of Hilton points saved up. Normally this would probably be out of my price range - but if you have the money, the points, or the expense account to make it a viable option? This is where you want to stay in Downtown Columbus.Well, I'd have to write a several-chapter memoir to give a complete review of this Hilton as the venue for my wedding. I will be as concise as possible. First, If you would've told me that I would get married at a HOTEL CHAIN when I got engaged, I would've slapped your face. I decided fairly last minute (in August of 2013) to have my wedding that New Year's Eve, provided we found a venue I didn't hate. Which, of course, would be a challenge with such late notice. This Hilton is the reason the NYE date even worked, and so many other positive things have flowed from the decision to get married earlier than originally planned. This Hilton feels NOTHING like a chain, Hilton or otherwise. It feels like an artistic metropolitan boutique hotel. There's lots of local flavor in the art, and the architecture and interior design is unique and current without being overly trendy or overdone. I wouldn't say this metro-contemporary aesthetic is really "my" personal vibe. I think it's beautiful and I appreciate it, but it's not exactly a reflection of "me." With that said, all that went out the window when I considered the fact that my wedding would be on NEW YEAR'S EVE, in Columbus WINTER. It felt glam and polished, and I didn't have to leave the hotel all day, and neither did my guests. I even stayed the night BEFORE the wedding here, and had my hair and makeup peeps come to me in our drop-dead-gorgeous-amazing-huge suite. I'm going to switch to lists to save some space. Amazing things:- BLAIRE, the event coordinator. She made this experience exciting and easy. Can't say enough about her. She was bubbly and knowledgeable and helpful and ... on and on. 10 out of 5 stars for Blaire. (Example: having cake -and other goodies like some snacks and champagne- sent up to our room after the wedding.) A billion other things, but that's an example of her above-and-beyond touches.- The suite we had the night before and day-of. Beautiful and accommodated the 50 or so people who moved through there that day.- Taste tests before the wedding! We were able to try and customize all of our food with the chef. We came on a separate day to try our signature drinks. Like a mini-celebration each time.- Location. All these appointments were easy because of the convenient location from work. And it was awesome to be downtown on NYE, duh. We said we wanted it to be like Columbus was a "guest at the wedding" -- and it totally felt that way!- Their standard chairs are actually cute. I didn't have to rent chairs or major table linens. For those of you that have planned a wedding, you know how huge this is.- Didn't have to rent "conversation" furniture either. We were able to pull ottomans and armchairs from other areas of the hotel for our use.- Service was spot-on. Gracious, seamless, professional, helpful. - Having our after-party on the glass bridge over High Street. What a memory!Some things that could've been a bit better, but are definitely eclipsed by all the amazing things above:- Some trouble getting our contract right, which caused a little stress. The writing didn't reflect our oral agreement on some of the charges, and the lawyer in me was freaking out over it. We eventually got it right, but it took a lot of prodding on my part.- A little nickel-and-diming going on, but that's old news in the event/wedding world. I would've like the option to get some things charged by VOLUME and not by GUEST. Example: we wanted fun toppings and additions to a coffee bar (since the wedding ended at 1 am, and the charges per guest were outrageous. We eventually worked some of this out. - The bar by the bridge was supposed to be open during our after-party, but the rowdy NYE crowd (not from our wedding) caused it to close early. Some of my guests were able to talk the bartenders into giving us a case of beer though, ha!- The ballrooms are in the basement. But! They're pretty, customizeable, and even though they're below the lobby, some have big windows. It seems weird at first, but we created our own little universe and it was a non-issue. Thanks, Hilton! A year later and we're still getting compliments on our wedding and fabulous venue.A good choice if your visiting Columbus! Staff is very friendly and helpful, hotel is very clean with a beautiful entrance! I loved the rooms, beds and shower (although it took my knucklehead self 20 minutes to figure out how to override the energy efficient lights, duh!). Very short walk to good restaurants, bars and a fun market place behind it. A great choice for anyone traveling for a convention as the hotel has a direct access skywalk to it. My only complaints are how expensive the convenience shop and restaurants inside the hotel are, plus paying $9.95 for wifi... C'mon it's 2014, not cool Hilton!One of the nicest Hilton's we've ever stayed at. Beautifully renovated and modern chic. The only small complaint was the musty smell of the rooms which comes from the air conditioner. It disappears after the AC runs for a while. Other than that great place!+ friendly staff+ clean rooms+ great tv channel selection + gorgeous hotel+ relaxing atmosphere I stay in hotels weekly and choose this one over all others in downtown Columbus.For the cost, this is a difficult place to stay.  For one, you have to pay extra for parking, whether it's valet or the ten minute hike to the garage that's not but ten feet away.  The other, for such a fancy place, the thermostats only go down to 68 or up to 75.  HUH???  All the doors open out into the atrium inside, and we could hear a bunch of jocks screaming at some party down there all the way from the tenth floor.  The curtains are translucent and some of them face the inside.  ... and only one set of towels?  The shower... felt like being peed on.  Where's the water pressure?  Yeah, the place is fancy, but they get too many of the little things wrong.
review_content_20: Great location... About a 7 minute walk to the LC Pavilion, which is great. Thought the $20/day parking was a little steep, I suppose business travelers don't care about expenses as much for these type of costs, being across from the convention center, their business is driven by the turnover traffic from there. The room was great, big shower, nicely appointed tile and wall coverings. Big flat screen, very comfy king bed. Wifi and Ethernet ports built in to big desk area and fridge under cabinet. Breakfast at the bistro was horrible. Two people breakfast for almost $50 included 1 egg and two slices of toast with a yogurt parfait. Then a Belgian waffle plus two cups of coffee. Coffee tasted like it had been sitting on a burner for way too long. The service was sloppy, waited for syrup while my waffle cooled down. Went to get it myself. Wife had no spoon for parfait, went to get that myself. Quality of food was... Ehh. Could have gone to a Best Western and got the buffet with the same level of food quality. The nice table settings and silverware can only demand so much of a premium. Bistro was very empty, but now, not surprised. Front desk was very helpful. Directed me to events I needed to find and made great suggestions for food and entertainment in area. I would stay again when in Columbus. Wouldn't go to bar or breakfast again, and would park across the street for $6 instead next time.If you want a quiet place to rest or work this IS NOT IT. Loud unattended barking dogs are allowed even in the evenings and at night and morning. They or it barked for hours. Loud sounds in the room from machinery not in the room but somewhere is the hotel. Hard to park if you can find it. Valet parking was $26 a night so you end up spending $300 a night. Bring your earplugs.Very modern and clean hotel in a great location. It's a lot like Columbus itself - nice but a bit sterile and soulless. I'm not a big fan of the central atrium style and the standard rooms are small compared to other hotels I've patronized in Columbus, but overall it's a solid choice.The location is great if you're looking for something close to the convention center. There's a bridge on the 2nd floor that connects.The staff is friendly and welcoming - everyone from the front desk, gift shop to room service.It's nice, has a bar and a restaurant. There's only one restaurant on site, coffee bean (although they don't have the full range of coffee bean menu - just coffee bean roasted beans). This hotel is swanky so if that's your thing then you're in for a treat :)I love this place! I don't even know where to begin... It's so swanky! The hotel is beautiful, the staff is amazing, the location is perfect, the views are stunning, there is art every where (am I'm not even an art lover). When ever I'm here, I feel so...'classy'...BUT...what really makes this hotel awesome is that the "executive rooms" have 2 bathrooms! 2 bathrooms!!!! 1 for me and 1 for him!....no sharing!!!!I love this place!Was in town for our business conference at this location. I was very impressed with the hotel. The meeting facilities were very good, and the food was actually decent for hotel banquet food. The staff was very nice and my room was also very current and nice. Downtown Columbus is a nice area and there are many restaurant choices within walking distance.I had stayed at a Doubletree by Hilton the night before in Austin that was a bust...so I was happy to find such a delightful hotel. I was greeted very nicely when I came in. Given a bag with two bottles of water and a bag of fancy popcorn. My room wasn't large - actually a bit tight but it was very functional which is most important to me. Great location and lots of electrical outlets. The bathroom in particular (loved the shower and tile) and the rest of the room had a nice modern feel to it.We held an event there the next day and I just loved the decor (pictures) around the hotel. I also had a chance to meet with the events people and they took such good care of getting me and provided an absolutely delicious lunch (I was a presenter and had meetings afterwards and no time for lunch). I wish I could remember the Events women's name but she was great! Took care of us in the Edith Hopkins room (with Gartner). I should also mention that the comforter was SO cozy. Absolutely wonderful! Check out was also attended by a lovely staff member as well as the gentlemen who took care of my luggage (Nathan in particular).I really enjoyed this hotel.I can't speak for the drinks. We decided to stop in after a birthday party at Barley's so others could get a night cap.Definitely a different, sleek modern look. White/light grey marble. I don't like the giant carpet squares on the main floor, where the seating area and front desk are. It's got big light purple and bright neon green splotches on it - it looks like someone puked on the carpet. I hardly ever am in the Arena District, thus I don't frequent the establishments in that area. I probably won't ever come to the Hilton again - even the restaurant is not realistic - $25-30 per plate is not even worth a second glance at the menu :( The high-end clientele feel of the joint made me feel somewhat uncomfortable, as my personal likings do not quite fit this hot spot.Beautifully and tastefully decorated "modern" Hilton hotel just south of the fantastic Short North district in Columbus. Clean, well priced, and love the location. A brisk walk gets you back to the heart of downtown or up to a plethora of fantastic offerings in the Short North. As with most Hilton hotels you have to deal with the lack of free WIFI which I still find mildly irritating, however this is probably the only negative I can bestow on this fine hotel. Staff was helpful and the valet is very proper and prompt. Will certainly be staying here again.Maybe because it's all new & shiny but this Hilton is my new favorite hotel. The design of the hotel is very unique with some of the rooms facing inwards and overlooking a huge atrium. I was worried about getting a "inner" room but the huge glass roof let in plenty of natural light and I liked the different view of the restaurant and surrounding rooms. You can tell Hilton looked at other chains like Kimpton and Element and really upped their game with this new property.Our suite was well decorated and our bed was super comfy. And there are electrical outlets EVERYWHERE! Finally a hotel understand how important outlets are! And they also have wifi boosters throughout the hotel to ensure you always have a strong wireless signal. BRAVO! Shower was very nice and the fitness center has some of the newest Precor equipment. Staff was incredibly nice and took care of everything we needed. The only negative is that the connection to the parking garage is bit wonky. You have to go down to get to the hotel and then up to the lobby once you get in the hotel. Plus our room keys were never able to open the parking garage gates. Not a big deal but just annoying.We absolutely loved our four night stay and this will be our hotel of choice when we back in Columbus!I came to the Hilton for a conference and my stay was wonderful. The rooms are classy, the food they served for conference was good quality, and the staff were all helpful and up-beat. I would stay here again. I didn't get a chance to go out in the city too much so I don't know how good the location is, but there are some great bars and nice restaurants near by.I feel like I'm only writing negative reviews lately :(.I've stayed here twice. The first time was with a friend who was in town right after the hotel opened a couple of years ago. Beautiful hotel, had a great time.I just checked in tonight (at a rate of $190/night) and parked (at a rate of $20/day). Made it up to the room to find that their WiFi is ALSO $10/night.I guess I just don't understand why. It's exploitative and not really good business sense to nickel-and-dime customers for every small service you provide. All it accomplished in this case was annoying me enough to write this Yelp review fifteen minutes after walking in the door. Of course, that's tethering from my iPhone because I'm not going to pay $10/night for what other reviews indicate is slow WiFi, and that's not even mentioning the extra fee for "premium" Internet access (are you fucking kidding me?).Blah blah I'm crotchety and cranky, but whatever. Just roll it into the cost of the room so your customers don't have to watch their bill go up with every minor convenience that you've decided to bill as a service.We paid for a block of rooms, and stayed with guests on our wedding night. Now the night we stayed was fine. The rooms are nice. The reason I am giving this place two stars is because their customer service is horrible!! We paid this place in full a week in advance, then they demanded more money from us when two of our guest accidentally booked outside the room block. She also wanted the. Check we turned in a week earlier. I said we paid, and she said "our financial dept couldn't find it" We cleared that up, but then the lady refunded us $398 (which was 50% of what we gave them)The check bounced over our honeymoon because the hotel waited 3 weeks to cash it. When we met with her she said it would be deposited on that Sunday. So it bounced because some automatic payments went through, and now their demanding the full amount again!!! Do not stay here!!They have no idea what they are doing with you money!!!They gave half our money back to us, and the amount they want now.... The math doesn't add up.I'm only going it two stars because the view was nice and the bed was comfy!!!Stopped at this gem on a business road trip. Check-in was speedy and efficient. The rooms were spacious and clean. I especially loved, loved, loved the bathroom! Oh and the view from my room was amazing. I could see into the middle of the hotel where the dining area is located. The staff is amazing. They accommodated my traveling partner and I with loading and unloading A LOT of boxes. Parking is not free, but it is secure. If you are a HH member the Wi-Fi is free of course. I truly enjoyed my stay.Absolutely perfect home base for a weekend in Columbus. The front desk staff has been helpful with everything from restaurant recommendations to the best place to walk our dog. The Ohio burger was recommended by Mark in the bar and is a must try. We will be back with or without our little dog.I got a chance to check out the new Hilton Columbus Downtown at the 25 year anniversary of local non-profit Homeport. Checking the hotel's website, it looks as though maybe it hasn't opened to the public yet, but it certainly looked completed to me. I saw no signs of construction in most places, right up to the rooms, all floors of which were accessible by elevator. One portion of the restaurant was blocked off, but if that was construction related, they were definitely putting on finishing touches. (Update - the Dispatch says it's open for business: dispatch.com/content/sto...)The banquet rooms were all definitely complete, and I take it the kitchen was too, as there were lots of delicious Hors d'oeuvre coming out all night, the most amazing of which was the coconut shrimp. I could not get enough of these! The staff was excellent: friendly, fast, courteous, and helpful. Most of the design and architecture was impressive, but the lobby, atrium, and stairs to the restaurant were the highlights for me. The bar/restaurant upstairs was a bit slow moving; enough so that I only had one drink. Once the dining area off the bar is open, this establishment will be capable of seating quite a lot of customers. I am sure it will do well. I still take issue with Columbus residents' tax money going to a corporation as large as the Hilton as an incentive to get them to build downtown, but politics aside, it was an impressive new construction.My first night of four is complete and I would agree with other reviews that this new, modern hotel is beautiful. Everyone from the doorman to the bellhops has been pleasant and helpful. The rooms are well designed, plenty of light and clean. So far it has been a pleasurable stay. For breakfast the servers are friendly, but the service is slow--really slow--like plan an hour unless you give them a little nudge. The location downtown is very convenient to restaurants and of course the convention center. Traffic can be a little crazy if there are events going on downtown. The hotel has parking that is popular for events- $10.00 -a good deal. I would definitely recommend to my friends to stay here.Love the Hilton properties. This one just opened up a few days ago and it's still somewhat under the new construction so you need to be patient with some of the "in between" stages as it just opened up. Staff? AWESOME. Drinks at the bar? ROCKING. Parking? PLENTY and you have an option of 24/overnight via valet or 18/self park. I was also here two weeks ago for a business meeting and the catered Mexican food was amazing. Healthy options and very tasteful. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The bathroom as self monitoring lighting which is huge for me. I can't stand screaming bright lights without any options for self dimmering as it's the biggest pet peeve I have regarding hotel rooms. These are cool in that you can lighten up or lower down to your preference. Conveniently located across from the Convention Center (my old stomping ground where I worked for 5 years), this property really continues to add and build up downtown Columbus. My best friend left her phone charger by accident. All it took was one phone call and they are mailing it to her. Fabulous property. Fabulous experience. Loved it. Would totally stay again.Beautiful hotel! I love the art everywhere and the variety of furniture styles (I know that might sound stupid but I have a huge furniture fetish. They have a green chair by the check in desk that I've been trying to figure out how to steal....) The rooms and everything else where sparkling clean. Every single staff member we talked to, from valet to front desk to housekeeping) were extremely friendly, and that's pretty rare. The room was pristine and very comfortable. And we loved that the room came with a mini fridge. My one issue was we could not figure out the bathroom lights! I'm a high school math teacher and my husband has a Ph. D and after three days we still were getting stuck with the lights going out on us in the bathroom. Maybe we'll figure them out next time we stay. :)This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. Wonderful service. Beautiful rooms. Great location to Short North with lots of restaurants, bars, shops, etc in walking distance. Nice pool and gym. Lovely atmosphere and decor. Great bar on the 2nd floor, but its not very popular. If you are looking for a fun happening bar, go to Bar Louie across the street. The only downfalls:- the wifi SUCKS! I couldn't do any work on my laptop because the internet was so slow. also the wifi is expensive.- i wish the bar was open a little later every night - breakfast stops at 11am (with the time difference, we were waking up at 11am (8am PT), so we had to rush and get our order in every morning), and there's no late night room service options. Also, the room service food is overpriced (same as every hotel). A regular can of sprite costs $5! However, they have a Pete's Coffee downstairs, so you can go there for breakfast instead of spending a lot on room service.Even with these few small issues, I plan on staying here every time I visit Columbus. I highly recommend it.
review_content_40: This hotel is 2 years old and still feels new. The food was amazing. The caliber I would expect at a 5 star hotel or independent restaurant. I ate in the hotel every meal because of it and skipped my annual excursion to The Pearl down the street which is exceptional. The staff was professional and attentive in EVERY department. Room service was particularly outstanding.The staff should be proud to work there. Guests are lucky to stay. I travel a lot and it is so nice to have your whole experience....just perfect.Clean and nice hotel. Comfortable bed and neat design. Buffet at $18 not worth it. Visit Nancy's at California and High Street. Nice but small gym. Fire alarm went of at 0300 hours due to a water leak that shorted a ight but i can fault them. Great location next to hockey area and good eats.I recently worked in Columbus for a short stay. When I arrived my work travel coordinator had assured me after a red eye that my room would be ready at a nearby associated hotel-it was not. At 6:30am, Heather took 4 of us in and got us rooms at the Hilton Downtown. We were given great service and complementary room credits as well as pleasant help finding restaurants, shopping, and a convenient Coffee Bean downstairs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Columbus, Ohio. We were so well taken care of.The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Very nice big bathroom with huge shower. Great location across from Convention Center. It has a restaurant and a bar. Highly recommend it.This hotel brings swanky to Columbus. Located downtown in the Short North arts district this Hilton does not disappoint. You can't miss this hotel as driving past it would require you to miss the beautiful lit up, color changing, glass bridge the hotel has connecting to the convention center. The exterior of the building is also visually appealing to the eye as it is also all glass and very contemporary in style. After the valets park your car, your enter the lobby which is a very chic all black and white with wood accents. There is a big grand staircase that leads upstairs into the restaurant and bar area. That night I checked into a suite and I was not disappointed. There were two bathrooms fit for a goddess, decked out in beautiful granite and other stone tiles. The bed was beyond plush and comfy, and on the ceiling was a beautiful work of art about the size of the bed. The room overlooked downtown and a few of the local bars and bistros as well as Hyde Park. The lounge are was also very classy and there was a nice little wet bar as well. Since I didn't stay here very long I didn't have a chance to use the one site gym or the pool, but I did get a chance to see them and they were very up to par! Highly recommend staying here if your planning a special night downtown and want to party in style! P.S staff were friendly and helpful too!While the amenities in the rooms were great, the bed was comfy, the bathroom was clean and modern, the WiFi at the Hilton was absolutely atrocious. I was there for a 3 day work conference, and all of the sessions require the use of Hilton's WiFi for one reason or another. We spent more time on fixing "technically difficulties" than learning from the courses. It was quite annoying. The best example was when I attended a 4 hour hands-on computer course that requires the WiFi network to be working seamlessly the entire time, and of course it wasn't. The signal was spotty at best. At its worst, the entire class was completely stalled when none of us could connect. A four hour class turned into a five hour class, and we didn't even cover all of the information we wanted to go over. It makes the host of the conference look really bad because they are known for their very well maintained data center and are almost obsessive about making sure the users are always connected.The WiFi in the rooms were horrible too. I stayed in a room on the 8th floor (out of 14) that had the view of the courtyard and can clearly see the sky through the glass ceiling, and I could barely get a signal. Since the windows don't open, the closest I could get to the sky was right up against the window. I don't care about looking ridiculous, because I'm sure many other people were doing the exact same thing. I'm sorry, but if you're going to advertise the hotel as a place that work conferences should come to, you really need to beef up your WiFi network, because it was simply unacceptable. I hope this message gets passed along to other Hiltons so I don't have to keep giving 1 star on my reviews.One of the nicest hotels in the Columbus area. The rooms are clean, modern and designed beautifully. Bottom line: GREAT LOCATION!The hotel is within walking distance of the bar scene (Brothers, Gaswerks, Cantina, etc.) Walk back to your room, even in 6-inch heels! ^_^ And if you're craving a late night snack, there are a few restaurants nearby as well.Minus one star? You have to pay for Internet.If you find yourself in Columbus for a couple of overnights, you can't get any better than this. The location is perfect, just a short walk to the Short North and the trendiness it invites. Great restaurants and watering holes are nearby so leave the car in the attached parking garage and give your Nikes a workout. There is also a walkway that connects you to the Convention Center right across the street.The rooms are new and modern with some good views of the city and locally produced artwork on the walls. Room service is quick and tasty. The hotel bar is really a nice change of pace for your usual Hilton bar, it seems less like a businessman's hangout and more like a place were you can meet real people. Plus, the bartender poured a really decent Old Fashioned!I stay at Hilton properties all over the country, this one is in the top tier. Great staff, super quick check in if you are a Diamond.Hotel in general is great to stay at. A few things kind of bother me though when it comes to staying at a nice hotel. No free wifi, no soda/pop machines available, no late night food options (after midnight), no cups to drink water... had to order Papa Johns in order to get some food and drinks. I'm surprised they don't charge extra for direct TV here.Yes, this place is new. Yes, there are tons of shiny things in this hotel: furniture looks new, large screen TV, new fitness equipment, super neat looking pool... let's just say it's nice to be in a newish hotel. If it wasn't for this... I would never consider looking back and choosing this hotel again on my next business trip... though it probably is the most upgraded Hilton in Columbus, Ohio. I wanted to give this place 3 stars, but it really deserves 2.5 stars... because it is not "A-OK".. unfortunately Yelp doesn't have half stars... so 2 it is.The issues I have with this hotel:1. The internet. Holy crap. They make people pay for this internet? speedtest.net/result/244.... Check that out. Worst. Internet. Service. I have EVER seen in a Hilton. You can't use it. Can barely load webpages... give up all hope now of ever watching a video. This was what the internet was like all 4 nights I was here. My boss called down to the front desk to complain and they basically said that it is what it is. Ridiculous. Can't remote desktop to my work computer... this is supposed to be a business oriented hotel (it's across the street from the Convention Center). This by itself is game over.2. The room temperature control. For my boss, he couldn't make it cold enough. For mine. Much too cold. The thermostat doesn't go below 68 and doesn't go above 75... which is not a big deal usually. I get the environmental consciousness thing... the problem is... 75... is not 75... it only kicks in early in the morning and after... maybe 1 am.3. Minor gripe for service. Front desk was great and friendly (though it is weird that they make you carry your own water bottles up to the room now... is this standard Hilton practice now?). Everyone else? Yeahhhhhh... the staff at the restaurant... hit or miss... ate here a lot (all my breakfast meals and a couple dinners). I'll be writing a review about this later... just... eh. Really hard to get their attention for anything... *sigh*. There were good ones though.4. Minor gripe, maid service. Wow. Talk about inconsistent. I'm not usually picky. I don't ask for much... but this is relatively poor for what is supposed to be a top class hotel. The first night, they cleared everything. They tossed the soap, the shampoo, conditioner... I hate being wasteful... I try and use the little toiletries as sparingly as possible because it is kind of a shame to have to toss them every time I'm on travel. The second day was ok (something irked me but it was minor)... the third day they left everything... but i finished using it all... the soaps were fine to leave, but there was no shampoo or conditioner left. I had to call the front desk to get more (luckily they were pretty quick about it). They also folded the towels and left them on the love seat? Never seen that before. The last day they didn't replace the tea/cups :/Interesting design (rooms overlooking the atrium is kind of a weird design choice... I'd much rather look outside), nice that everything is brand spanking new... but this hotel has a long way to go if they're going to be top notch.Good hotel overall. Rooms are small. Feels like a W Hotel. Real trendy. Brand new; pristine.Nice infinity pool.Only complaint is that housekeepers were slamming doors all morning up and down the hallway and I was trying to sleep in.I stay at a lot of hotels. I travel a lot for work and have become very picky where I stay. I checked in for a few days just before their grand opening and it was a blast. The best part: EVERYTHING IS NEW. Their work out facility is top notch, they have a pool, secure indoor parking, great everything. Decent lounge with a nice area to relax and do work.Location is prime too, love the short north. Good night life and always something to do after work. Very easy to get a cab too if you need it. They also have a restaurant in house which looks very nice, but didn't eat there yet. With so many great dinner options OUTSIDE the hotel, it's a no brainer for me to take advantage of that. Come stay here. I guarantee that you'll love it.After speaking with Christian at length, he informed me that he had been present that weekend on duty at the hotel. Of course, the question this brings one to offer is why after 9 phone calls/ complaints over 18 hours, he didn't feel it was necessary to contact us personally to resolve the situation? I have declined his offer for a free stay/ dinner at this establishment due to the fact that I would rather not expose myself to the potential for this type of customer service. As this is primarily a convention hotel, perhaps some corporate training from those at the Hilton Austin Convention Center and Hilton Baltimore Convention Center may be in order. Multiple stays at both in the last 18 months were both inviting and professional.We spent 3 nights here during the Summer Fencing Nationals this year. Beautiful hotel! Warmly welcomed by attentive staff. Beautiful room with a not-such-great view but I'm not here for the view. The room is immaculate. Wonderfully comfy beds, cuddly pillows. Towels are large and wonderful. The bathroom is large spacious with a lot of room to put toiletries, but alas, no extra towel hooks. My favorite was a wonderful tabletop mirror to use for makeup. Only had breakfast which was very good although a bit slow & greasy. Had to wait too long for milk for my coffee.Not so happy with the valet service. They had a fender bender with our rental while they were bringing it to us and at first tried to get our insurance involved. They flat out blamed the other driver but that seemed a bit suspect to me as they had many powwows out of earshot. Then I found evidence of a picnic in the car-ketchup packet, sticky console & crumbs but no evidence they they went for a joy ride thankfully.I would absolutely come back here-loved the hotel & felt VERY welcomed and at home but I'm still a bit shaky when they drive off with the car.This is a gorgeous hotel! The design and decor are beautiful and it is well worth the rate per night. It is also convenient if you have meetings or gatherings in the downstairs areas. Just a great place.Awful experience overall. I hate leaving negative reviews but this one deserves it. This hotel seems to lodge mostly high school and middle school students on a field trip. You can expect simple elevator wait times to be between 25 or 30 minutes. (Due to the teenagers switching floors every 10 minutes) the hotel seems poorly staffed and the nickel and dime effect is very apparent. The business center computers require a credit card to even access the computer or print a birding pass, as do many features of this hotel. This hotel has been one of my top ten worst acclimation as a business traveler. Think twice about this hotel if you appreciate peace , quiet, and a professional setting.Eh, its OK, its a Hilton. Very friendly staff, but clueless , truly clueless about any of the local questions I asked. I was shocked. WiFi is HORRIBLE. Good location, both directly behind and to the north of the hotel there is a lot of options. I guess this is a good as it gets for Columbus, but for goodness sake, where is the training on local knowledge PS I really got pissed when I saw a cab driver giving a bellman $2 so I could get in his cab. I find it highly unethical.New modern hotel. Stopped in later in the evening without a reservation, because the hotel we had booked down the road was horrible. The Hilton was able to accommodate us and exceeded our expectations. Room was clean and spacious; staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful. Would definitely stay again.I just tried to find out how much it would cost to stay at this hotel from Nov 18 -23, waited on hold forever, was transferred to a centralized booking group, where I could barely understand the man answering my questions: online, I found a AAA rate and wanted to see if a better rate was available. After waiting way too long, while he checked with someone, to see if that rate was available (no, I wanted to see if there was a better rate available to me), I hung up. I have a really bad impression of Hilton hotels from this experience, and I used to love Hilton, had a frequent stay membership...not anymore.Beautiful hotel, pleasant and helpful staff, and rooms and all common areas so well kept. It was a pleasure to stay here. Very convenient to restaurants and of course the convention center. Would definitely stay here again.
review_content_60: Great location. Convenient for walking to food clubs and shops. Great amenities and wonderful customer service.I came here for a conference and found the hotel absolutely beautiful.  I mean, really impressively beautiful.  The spaces for the conference were nice, though I will say the food we had was not overly impressive.  But back to my stay-the room was lovely with an enormous shower.  The room was smaller than most, but that was not a problem for me as I had everything I need.  The bed was insanely comfortable as were the pillows.  I often have a hard time sleeping in hotels, I did not here.  Overall, the service was pleasant, the hotel impressive, and the location good.  It was definitely fairly pricey, even at our group rate.  That rate also did not include breakfast or wifi, which is somewhat expected for a downtown hotel, but would have been nice.  Overall, I would stay here again, and recommend it for anyone staying in Columbus (unless you're looking for a super cheap room)My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day and it was an amazing experience. When I checked in I tipped the front desk and they upgraded me to a suite. He asked offhandedly if we were celebrating valentine's day and I responded 'yes". I went in and it was HUGE. We had 2 bathrooms! I left to pick up my boyfriend and when we went into our room the staff had put out flower petals from the front door leading into the bedroom and left a card. I know they probably do that with everyone, but it was really sweet and cute.Later we went and got dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was SO DELICIOUS (totally recommend). We went up to the front desk to thank them/ see if we could have  a check out time later than 12. She was like"oh sure, what time? 1:00? 1:30?". She acted like it was no big deal at all. So we got to stay til 1:30 instead of 12!The staff is friendly and thoughtful, the hotel is REALLY cool. The structure on the inside is really great, the location is nice, and the decor was impressive and modern. They had a TON of chairs that I wanted to try and we both like that they incorporated a lot of local art inside. AND the tunnel that leads to the convention center is really cool on the inside (I still have mixed feelings about it from the street).If you want a really nice modern hotel to stay in, I definitely recommend the Hilton.I stayed at the Hilton Columbus downtown for one night (yesterday). Although my time there was short,  I was please. It is a new hotel, and it showed. Beautiful design, and super clean. Walking distance to several dining establishments and helpful, friendly staff. The rooms were a tad small, and I did not like the atrium view. Next time I will ask for a room with an exterior view. All and all, a good experience.1st stay and it was great. New, clean and the staff was great...I stayed here on 12/23/14.  The hotel is beautiful and the staff is friendly but I do have a few major complaints.  First off when I first arrived there was nobody present at the valet station.   I waited over ten minutes for someone to show up then decided I would park myself because I was in a hurry. Once I found a spot in the parking garage I quickly realized I would be carrying all my bags down several flights of stairs. I spoke to the front desk about the problem and she did have the valet move my car but this was after I carried all my bags down flights of stairs. The second issue I had was, while our room was very nice, it had a smell which I can only describe as body odor.  I was out on the town most of the night so I just let it slide since I would only be there for a few hours of sleep anyway. I love staying at Hilton hotels but this one was just not up to standards, especially for a hotel this new.A brand-new Hilton. I love the look in the common areas as well as in the guest rooms. The bar area was lively without being too loud (and the drinks were great!). I like the area; you can walk to the Nationwide Arena and the convention center, as well as several top-notch restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Columbus.You will not find a better hotel in Columbus.  I travel more than most people and can attest that this is a superior hotel.I've stayed at this Hilton a few times now and have been impressed each time. As most of the previous reviewers have noted, the hotel is new and has a sleek, modern feel. Every time I have checked in the staff at the front desk has been nice, courteous and always willing to assist with any questions I might have. I do agree with some of the previous reviewers in that the WiFi is pretty bad and the rooms are fairly small, but I never spent much time in the room or on the WiFi so they didn't really bother me or ruin my experience. The rooms are clean, showers and bathrooms are large, and beds are super comfy (one of the best qualities of the hotel in my opinion). I like the fact that the hotel is in downtown and there are a lot of restaurants and bars close by to walk to (Covention Center & Arena District). I've also had a few drinks at the hotel bar, which were moderately priced and fairly stiff. Overall, I've always had a good experience at the Hilton Columbus Downtown and would recommend it to anybody staying in the Downtown Columbus Area. I will be staying there again sometime in the near future.Just returned from as nights stay in this new Hilton. Can't say enough good things about it. Very helpful and professional staff new everything. Professional valet service with autos parked at the hotel. Yes, Professional valet service, doesn't sound like a lot to ask for but last years stay at that sh!thole Hyatt across the street cost me 3 weeks of my Acadia in the body shop with close to $6K worth of damage. Do yourself a favor and stay here next time your in the Columbus area. You will be impressed.I stayed at this hotel over a weekend because it was hosting a conference for my fraternity. Everything about it was wonderful. It was clear that everything was new, and I appreciated the modern feel of the decor. The staff was always very kind and courteous. The hotel was also responsible for catering the conference and they had excellent food. I myself am a vegan, so I did not eat the buffet-style foods they had. Instead, I talked with the staff to ask about dietary restrictions and they were more than happy to accommodate by providing impromptu meals for me at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. These meals were delicious, so I would only expect the planned food to be even better (my friends said good things about the bar as well).The rooms were very roomy and comfortably fit 4 men to sleep through the night, and we had 10 of us hanging out in one room without any trouble and still room for more. There isn't much else to say, besides the fact that I had a wonderful experience at this hotel and will  return if my adventures bring me back to Columbus.The bar was miserable. The food selection was not very accommodating to people with dietary restrictions. Getting a menu was like pulling teeth. We had to walk to where the server was hiding out to get service multiple times. To top off the experience, as I was pouring a glass of wine the server snatched the bottle so that he could give the rest to a person in my party (very close to spilling on me). Never will we have an event there again. Not worth the walk or the trouble.BRIDES BEWARE!! I am getting married in May and called January 3rd to make a room block for my wedding guest. The event people told me you can not book it farther then 4 months from the event. She said that is there policy for weddings, she took all my information and the dates I would need rooms for and said she would contact me closer to the 4 month mark. This was pretty annoying because I had to wait on ordering my wedding invitations,  to find out if we were going to use The Hilton. Also any bride will tell booking a hotel 4 months out from the wedding is cutting it pretty close and it really added to my stress level. I waited anyways, because the hotel looked so nice. I called it exactly 4 months to the day and talked to the same girl, she was very nice, but she still did not have any information for me.  She said she would called later that day or tomorrow. Well tomorrow goes by and I call her in the afternoon and she says her boss has been in meetings and she is waiting for a price from her, she says she will call tomorrow. I finally get a call the next day, to find out that they do not have anything available! That they are already too full and can not offer me a block!! I asked her how that could be when I was told you can not book until 4 months too the day. She said all of the convention center business is a priority and there is already stuff booked for them. If this is true, why could she have told me this almost three weeks ago when I first called.  I understand the booking policy, but I would of appreciated it more if they had just said I'm sorry we don't have the availability, you should look for a different hotel. So here I am not less the 4 months to the wedding, till no Hotel booked and I haven't printed my wedding invitation either because I was waiting on them. All I'm saying is this is not the place to do a wedding block, unless you really want to stress yourself out close to your wedding day.

review_content: Absolutely Perfect Service Makes for a Great Stay!We stayed here along with approx 30 other family members for a family event nearby.  The first impression was how excellent the service was that we received from the staff.  It started with the valet parking attendant, and continued with the front desk staff, the maids, the servers in the restaurant, even the bartender in their sports bar!  Everyone was very polite and very good at their jobs.  It makes such a difference, and lead to a really wonderful stay.  I would absolutely go back here when the chance arises.  The room was very modern and clean.Their "dining room" restaurant is way overpriced for the service you get. Had a horrible valentines day dinner here. Salads came out at the exact same time as our meals. No apologies were issued. Menu can be very limited for special occasions. (I.e. Only 1-2 choices only)I can get a Way better experience for $50 a person at other places.Not a great day for our lunch fourtop.   Most everything was out of synch.   We waited to be seated.   We waited to be greeted at the table.   And we waited for our food. It didn't seem to be particularly busy on a Monday at 130. Once we got the food all was well.   My guess,  a bad day at a place that is usually very serviceable.Happy Thanksgiving everyone! Speaking of thanksgiving did you all know that the Hilton does a wonderful buffet for this special day that we give thanks? It is just phenomenal.I was with a private party and if anyone saw my check in it was roughly 50 to 60 ish people in the family. We started off at the Sports Bar where everyone had a cocktail hour and got to mingle/take photos/etc. It was there I learned that Bloody Mary's are not my drink because man was that drink overly spicy. I had to trade it in for a dirty Shirley Temple and that was so much better! After the cocktail hour, we proceeded to the main room where our big party sat down to give thanks. Then we went out to the buffet area where they had your choice of carved beef, carved turkey, pigs in a blanket (their version of ham with bacon on top). There was a salad bad, a seafood bar, a dessert bar. So many options, I definitely had to pace myself!The turkey was so moist you could taste the juices. The steamed vegetables, mashed potatoes, sweet potato au gratin were all wonderful. My husband even said the brussel sprouts tasted better here than at the Hilton Polaris. They were fully cooked to perfection, while still having the full flavor.We then got tempted by the dessert table. They had cupcakes, pecan pie, strawberry shortcake, gluten free chocolate cake with whipped topping. Out of them all I really liked the strawberry shortcake. I didn't eat them all, but what I heard was that the strawberry shortcake tasted better out of them all due to the berries soaking into the shortcake. In between eating, our private party got to meet the chef who was in charge of the entire buffet at the Hilton today. I would have to say he did a phenomenal job, because his food was way better than the Hilton in Polaris. Having the right chef in charge of all the food makes a world of a difference in how the food will turn out for a huge event for one day. I know this from experience.I would highly recommend to anyone who is looking at places to eat for Thanksgiving to definitely make a reservation here. It's definitely worth the money.Years ago I had stayed at this hotel for a convention so I was looking forward to coming back since I did not get the opportunity to explore Easton Towne Center during that visit.This hotel is currently under renovations but it has a lot going for it. First of all is it has a self parking garage (if you are willing to walk a bit) to protect your car from the elements. They do offer valet parking but with this feature you really don't need it. Also the hotel has entered the technical age. Being a member of Hilton honors I was able to "choose" my room from my phone. The Hilton honors app would let me know when my room was ready for check in. When I arrived I was prepared to give them my credit card and inquired if an upgrade I had requested was available. I was told there wasn't one and that the concierge level was undergoing renovations until the middle of next year. They told me that my phone would work as a digital "key" since I had Bluetooth and if I experienced any problems to let them know.As I heading to get my car I ran into two maintenance personnel who gave me advice as to where to park and how they could make my stay more enjoyable. All I really needed were a few towels. So when I moved my car and entered the room I found a card from those same people offering me a free buffet breakfast! I was literally blown away! Also this digital key really does work! My room is renovated and consists of a glass shower stall (no tub) in the bathroom but there was plenty of room. There's an in room safe and small refrigerator with a card that told me that the two bottles of water inside were mine to use.As a Hilton honors member I got free WiFi in the room. I was happy too that I got a room facing away from the Towne Center since I wanted a good night's sleep. When I got up I went to the buffet. It is your typical breakfast buffet with both cold and hot breakfast foods and made to order omelets. They even had a multigrain oatmeal which I loved. This buffet normally runs for about $26.00 so with the cold weather I was glad I didn't have to go out and find a discount place just to get an affordable breakfast.When I went to check out I was told they would e-mail me the bill. Remember how dreadful it is finding it slid under your door the day you leave?  The main thing is to make sure you stop at the front desk in order to check out because if you are using this process, then there is no way they can tell you have left the hotel. I asked for a printed copy of my statement for record purposes only just to play it safe.It was worth staying onsite and being able to enjoy the evening activities that Easton Towne Center has to offer.Decent stay. Close and convenient to the airport. Staff was friendly at check-in. Room was nice, however housekeeping missed a few things. Old coffee filter from previous guest still in coffee pot. Yuck! Room service was fast but I would not recommend the chicken soup. It had more grease than broth. Double Yuck!!"F" on housekeeping2 days in a row they left their own black kinky hairs in and around the tub Numerous complaints ....... WIFI ..... Absent Lied to about no one else has internet access problems ... Told us it was only usWhen I went to look for maid  where her cart was she was gone but the room was open and belongings of guest in plain sight to steal .. Then noticed numerous other Rooms she left wide open  while she was ? Well. Where was she ??? Not protecting anyone's belongingsBartender totally ignored me  whole catering to 1 male guest / sexistA shout out to Alicia at front fest for wrapping out Christmas gifts and to Matt for finding carrot cake for us these. 2 were the only bright spotsThe good: Awesome location.The bad: See also, "The Ugly".The ugly: All of it. I couldn't believe the experience I had at this hotel...a Hilton no-less! I travel about once a month for business, and can honestly say I haven't had a worse experience at a hotel. Now I must admit - MY bad was not saying anything, but by the time I had a break from the conference to do so, I felt it wasn't worth it. -The room-Immediately upon walking in, I thought my room hadn't been properly cleaned. There was lint and part of a clothes tag on the ground, the pillows were disheveled, washclothes were folded sloppily, and the shampoo bottle was half empty. I also never got comfortable: I had the air turned down to 56 degrees (!!!) and it was still balmy. My co-workers had the same heat/discomfort experience. Much to my dismay, on the second day (after the room had been "cleaned") all of the same problems were present - stuff still on the floor, sloppy folding and disheveled pillows, and another half empty shampoo bottle. I couldn't believe it. -The service-Front Desk Staff - I didn't have much interaction with the staff, but what I did have made me feel half informed. Upon arrival, I asked the front desk staff about a taxi back to the airport. I was told that there was a shuttle - free of service - so I was happy to use this instead. Upon check-out, I walked downstairs at 7:15am only to be told that the shuttle left in every half hour increments - not what I had been told previously. I didn't have 15 minutes to spare (and if I had, I would used it to sleep some more!), so I begrudgingly paid for a cab.Bartender - After the first day at the conference, there was a Happy Hour. I always attempt to get a "drink" that only resembles alcohol, so I asked for a virgin bloody mary (very quietly). The bartender all but yelled back at me "virgin?!" and then proceeded to pour tomato juice in a glass and hand it to me. I said, "...Do you have anything to add to it? A lime, lemon, olives...?" I got a horrible glare, and one small excuse for a lemon plopped in my drink. I don't know at what bar plain tomato juice passes for a "bloody mary" but remind me never to visit it.Server - In addition to drinks, appetizers were being passed. I always ask - if the server doesn't tell me - what the option is. At one point, a server carrying a plate of what looked like small baguettes with a soft white cheese dip walked over, and stood in front of us. "What is this?" I asked...to which the server replied..."Cheese." "Cheese?" I questioned...surely there was more to that...nope. She stared at me while I hesitantly tried the unappetizing "cheese" thing.Room Service - Lastly, I have to mention this conundrum. We had a very early dinner, so I was starving come 9:30pm. I perused the menu, but none of the greasy options appealed to me. I found the easiest breakfast item I could - a fruit and yogurt parfait. Granola, yogurt, fruit - DONE. I dialed the button on my phone three times, but it kept hanging up on me. So I called the front desk...got transferred...and five minutes later, was told that the Chef changes, and "the night Chef doesn't know the recipe". Recipe?! I get it, this is the least of my concerns, as I was ordering off the wrong menu - but give me a break...this shouldn't be hard.To spend $440 for two nights (a discounted rate, mind you!) for this location is disgusting. The lack of service, attention to their patrons and the rooms, is unacceptable.A long time Buckeye, previous Columbus resident, and fan of Easton Town Center ever since it's construction, I've consistently been disappointed in the Hilton there. We've stayed there several times since it's construction and just recently (July 2015) to visit Columbus for a wedding.The good: Close to Easton Town Center, one of the premier places in Columbus for shopping, food, and drinks. Excellent parking and close to the airport for travelers. Relatively clean and spacious lobby. Nice workout facility and pool.The bad: The internet access and speeds are horrific, usually trying to upsell customers to "premium internet", which if purchased does not guarantee any increase in speed or availability' WiFi was consistently dropping on both routers. The redesigned bathrooms are broken, the shower doors don't seal on the bottom, resulting in a flood every time you shower it's as if they constructed the showers backward. Atrociously dated and slow TV/Cable package.I suppose in the end most of the blame rides on Hilton in general as a chain and their contracts with vendors; their antiquated internet access, entertainment, and bottom-dollar renovations will definitely lead us to trying out nearby competitors in the future. Bottom line, get with the times Hilton, you're falling behind.I stayed for a week at this hotel for business and had no complaints. From front desk to the housekeeping staff everyone was friendly, accommodating and provided top notch service. The room was large and I did not feel cramped as I have in other hotels. My only suggestion is that the quick service coffee area that is serving Starbucks coffee adjust their prices to come in line with the chain operated Starbucks which is a minute walk away. I was a little shocked when the employee told me how much I owed for a cup of coffee when I would have walked to the Town Center Starbucks.Stay away from the bar! Just charged $48 for 2 drinks!!! Complained to management - got us a response "those are our prices".Insane. I feel bad for out-of-towners visiting Columbus & having that little surprise. Not cool Hilton - not cool.I have only been here for conferences but its a very nice hotel and they always handle it very well.Its a very beautiful building and very clean. The food that has been provided by the hotel has always been great. The staff is always friendly and helpful and seem to be on top of any problems that may arise.I also appreciate the free, easy parking thats right in front. I've never stayed here or tried their restaurant (just their catering) so I am not commenting on either of those. If you were to stay here, you would be right next to Easton mall which is awesome with plenty of dining options for all taste buds and budgets.UGH.My husband and I were here for an event not too long ago.  Yes, we paid for it.  And the food was awful.  It's a nice location, being close to the mall and all, but I will never ever eat here again.  Even if it's free.That being said, my husband thought the food was good.  Which was weird.  He never likes that kind of food.  We were served salads first - mine was covered in nuts, and I have a nut allergy.  Which they were informed of.  Maybe the message didn't get to where it needed to go.  But no biggie - I flagged down a server and asked them if they had anything available that was nut free.  He was very kind about it and brought back a plate with a tasty looking salad on it.  I was two-thirds through the salad when there was a BIG HUGE PINE NUT sitting there on my plate.  Staring at me.  I stopped eating the salad.So then the entree course came around - and a rather nutty looking breaded chicken came around.  We asked - yes, it contained nuts.  So they whisked it away and brought me back two very dry pieces of chicken breast...My husband said his nutty chicken was very tasty.  And moist.After weeks of useless phone calls and emails re the hotel GM's public comment about the desire to "make it right", the Hilton management concluded that their staff did nothing wrong and that I did, in fact, cancel my own reservation and Simply Don't Remember Doing So.  Certainly, there are less irritating and inconvenient reasons to order a new credit card.Four of us went to the Hilton specifically to have a three course meal special they offer.  There were three choices for the main course, two weren't available.  The waiter said "people won't eat them and the chef won't serve them."  We were offered a substitute of beef ribs for the pork ribs which was very good with mashed potatoes.  I it came with salad and all of our salads were not fresh.  It came with desert "cobbler" non of us were happy with it.   It was cooked fruit in a dish that's it.  My brother had a beir and cheese soup I tasted it and wasn't good, he was very sick later that day.  I vas very disappointed in what I expect from Hilton and paying over $30 for a meal.  No wonder their was only one other party besides us at 6:00pm.My new favorite!!!!! I will never stay anywhere else. The property and facilities are amazing! Close to shopping and restaurants, although the onsite sports bar is reasonably priced the staff is friendly and helpful.I sent my family there to Christmas shop using my rewards points. Even though I had already checked them in, they were forced to wait until  6 pm to get in their rooms. This caused the cancellation of activities they had planned that evening. The hotel staff was rude and when I contacted them with my concerns (hoping no one else would have to go through that) they would not return email or phone calls. Shame on you! All you had to do was talk to me. I'm a long time Hilton user, but I will not use this establishment again.Great seafood for the cost..sushi was great, but needed servers to clean up more frequently. Had to remind themWe had dinner at the Hilton Friday night, which has their seafood buffet and sushi bar. We have eaten there several times, but this time was bad. If I could give them negative stars I would. Raw Oysters were warm so I had one and stopped. Their crab legs had been in the pan for so long they were dry, almost the same texture as the shell. So I thought we would try something else, there was something like a seafood stew, but it was just basically tomato juice, there was some kind of chicken curry and salmon, but couldn't get past the dried out chicken and salmon covered in sauce. Yuck. There was suppose to be rice pilaf, but it was just plain white rice. Desserts had been picked through and didn't look very appetizing. Sushi was OK, but you need to make sure you don't eat if it's warm. We didn't feel very well that night. Sunday we decided to try the brunch they do have a nice omelet station, sausage and bacon were good but after seeing the same chicken curry and same  seafood stew. I stopped eating and we left. I would think for the price they charge, they should be able to afford to put fresh items on the buffet. Will not be going back. The hotel is nice but don't eat at the restaurant.Literally just the breakfast buffet with my husband. The food was  not hot or warm at all. I was so disappointed  that we spent $60.00 for garbage! We live here I Columbus and I heard great things and wanted to give it try. The biggest waste ever!
review_content_20: I come here once or twice a month for the Prime Rib Seafood Buffet. You won't find anything better for $30! My first plate is always loaded with sashimi. Not only is their sashimi very very fresh, each cut is thick, unlike other "sushi buffet" places. By the time I've eaten two places of their sashimi, I'm pretty sure I've already eaten over $30 worth of food.  Next, I will go get a couple slices of their prime rib, and other dishes.  They also have pots of other food, like seared salmon, gumbo, and others for you to choose from. On the other side there are crab legs and clams, which are all super fresh. There is also an option for you to choose your own veggies and meat and have someone cook it all for you.  I got this once, but it was way too much food, I didn't have any room left for anything else.In the middle of it all is a dessert bar. Their desserts are delicious! The chocolate is always thick and creamy. The perfect ending to an awesome dining experience.I love this Hotel.  This has to be one of the nicer hotels I have stayed in the Ohio area.  I've stayed here probably a total of 15 times in the last 7 years. Each time, my stays were for business, but that didn't stop me from enjoying what this hotel has to offer. The staff here is great. From the bellman to their front desk, they're efficient and customer oriented.  This hotel has it all...bars, restaurants, spacious/luxury rooms, and huge conference rooms.  This hotel is is fairly big, but it doesn't take forever to get from one end to the other.  The love the convenience of elevators on each side of the hotel.  Never fails when I stay at a hotel. Usually my room is miles from the elevators, which I hate. Here, your no farther than halfway to an elevator. I also love their spacious lobby where you can relax and talk shop with your business partners. Regarding their rooms, it really depends on which rooms you reserve. My previous stays were all in spacious and luxurious rooms. My most recent stay was in one of their smaller rooms. The room is still nice, just not as nice as my other stays. One thing I really appreciate about their rooms is the amount of outlets so close to the bed.  Totally comes in handy when you have an iPad, iPhone, and laptop to keep charged.  Now for their amenities. I include Easton Town Center as one of them.  This hotel sports a nice indoor pool and decent fitness room with free weights. For a fairly large hotel, it's still a bit cozy. I'm not saying that this hotel is huge and grand. It's obvious that this hotel is good for conferences and business.  When I'm in Columbus for business and have a choice of my hotel stay, I'd choose this Hilton every time. TIP: -Wifi signal is weak and I think they charge unless you're an Hilton's Honors member.  My suggestion, bring your own wireless card if you have one. I'm a member but again, weak signal and had to use my wireless card.-The hotel offers a free shuttle to and from the airport every half hour.PS: People out here rave about their restaurant. I haven't had the opportunity for dinner, but breakfast here is good.What an amazing evening we had thanks to the staff at the Hilton. I joined my mother for her event for the columbus board of realtors as she was being honored with an award. Assuming there would be somewhat of a food choice on the menu I panicked when I saw it was just filet. (I'm a vegetarian) the staff quickly accommodated me and the chef gracefully prepared me a dish. Sheila was the BEST part of our evening. She was one of the banquet servers and was hilariously funny and very efficient at clearing our table, providing wine/coffee, and general entertainment. Our table had so many laughs with her it was great. Overall I was extremely impressed with the quality of the event as I know much preparation goes into these things. Thank you all for making it such a memorable evening.I just returned from a stay at the Hilton in Easton OH. The outside is beautiful, I thought it was a courthouse or government building.  The lobby is classy but had comfortable chairs.  The desk staff was very friendly and I was off to my room in a few minutes.  My room 335, had just been renovated, I love the new electronic lock where you just have to hold the key card up to it. A plus when you have luggage or packages.The room is a very nice size with a King bed, couch, chair, desk and vanity in the entrance area.  The bathroom was very modern with a huge walk in shower.Everything was spotless, the bed was super comfortable.  I also got free wireless, and Continental breakfast.   The WiFi was pretty slow, there were times it didn't work at all, but I'm not someone who needs to be online all the time.The continental breakfast was the only low point in an otherwise perfect experience.  There wasn't much to choose from, the bran muffin I tried had some sort of candied cherries in and had a weird taste.  I didn't even attempt to try the bagels because I live in NJ and I know they won't measure up. I would stay there again, hopefully I can see more of the beautiful shopping center right there.Ambiance: 4 - It's extremely beautiful inside. Very elegant with well-placed furniture; it really looks expensive. It's extremely well lit at night. The only problem is that the inner room's facilities are just okay! Actually, the toilet in my room flooded the entire bathroom with just two flushes, and we had to ask to have our room changed. Service: 4 - The service was excellent. They really care about their customers! When our toilet flooded, they were able to move us to a better room with a better view. Even when we reached our room, they met us there and decided to give us free internet charges, free movie passes for on-demand on the TV, and even wanted to comp our breakfast. (Which we politely refused the latter, because we didn't want to take too much.) Food: 3 - The food that they served us as a group, let's just say our last day when they served wraps was probably the best food of our weekend. I believe when serving big groups food, you should really work on improving the quality of the served food and the kind of food served. Even for breakfast, it would have been nice to have something like croissants rather than bagels--creating a more sophisticated breakfast is key!check-in: Quick, painless, easy. It took all of 50 seconds. Love it!Room: I got a king bed suite. The sitting area was nice with sofa, chair, and breakffast table.  There was a bathroom in the hallway with a shower, and a bathroom in the master with his/her sinks and tub-shower (extremely spacious- i'd say about the size of a NYC studio!).   There was a desk in the bedroom with a chair & ottoman. It was a very cozy but spacious area that made my 2-night stay in enemy territory (I'm a wolverine!) enjoyable.Lounge: The executive lounge on the 7th floor is also spacious and welcoming. Breakfast in the morning was simple- omlette, hard-boiled eggs, juices, cereals, pastries, toast, and coffee. Evening reception was also delightful, but alcohol was charged to the room. Parking: free surface parking.Misc: The hotel is right next to a shopping mall, within walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants around that you can walk to, including the Cheesecake Factory and P.F. Chang's.Great stay and great staff!  Pool was excellent.  Super friendly check in (and fast--there was a line but more people jumped in to help right away).  Very clean.  Starbucks in the hotel is nice add on and the seating in the lobby was nice w live music.  We didn't eat in the hotel but it looked great!My family decided to host my sister's graduation dinner here last week. There were only two tables occupied in the dining room. It took us well over an hour to receive our food, most of which was cold and tasteless. The wait staff was horribly slow as well for only having two tables, and three waitress present. The room however was beautiful and quiet, but almost too quiet...there was no dinner music at all.Great hotel, beautiful and spacious rooms. Came down for a conference and the front desk staff was very helpful and polite. Even staff walking around said hello. Room was clean and newly renovated.
