The location is perfect for walking to gym, restaurants and shopping.  Can't wait to come back !!!Probably one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in Ohio. The location is great and the services offered are top notch. My biggest problem and the reason for a one star docking, is the lack of free WiFi, except for the lobby. I mean, come on, you get free WiFi at Best Westerns and the like. Similar to Jason's issues, you can get free WiFi if you are in their Hilton Honors program and have enough points or whatever, but i think this is silly and a big problem.The room I had was great. I did call ahead and made sure that a small refrigerator was in my room, I recommend you do the same. There seemed to be pillows of different firmness levels and I appreciated that. The TV was large although on some HD channels the signal suffered from some snow artifacts or signal loss. #firstworldproblems Everyday I received a paper under my door. I wish I could have opted out of that as I find it such a waste of paper and a source of guilt as I would like to read it, but didn't have the time. ha ha.  Ok, the gym situation. Decent and good enough for the majority of people. There are tons of treadmills. The free weights only go up to 50lbs. The cable machine is set apart in a room that includes a TV and hand sanitizer. The pool is connected to the gym and while I didn't take a dip in it, looked nice and clean. I wish I could have tried out the hot tub, my aching body would have loved it. In closing, if your work is paying the bill, stay here, if you are paying, you might want to check out more reasonably priced options.The Hilton Columbus at Easton went above and beyond to make my husband's birthday special. :) Back in December, I was looking for a fun place to take my husband for a special night out, since my family planned their annual Christmas gathering in Columbus on his birthday weekend (D'oh!). Since he loves the movie theatre at Easton, I thought staying On-property  would be a fun and convenient way to treat him. When I made the reservation, I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday and asked if they could do "something special" for him. When we arrived, the staff was welcoming and courteous, and when our room was not quite ready, they held our luggage and called a shuttle to drive us to the Theatre so we wouldn't have to walk in the rain. We returned to our hotel room to check in, and we were given our room assignment, which they had upgraded to a better view, and we given vouchers for breakfast in the hotel dining room the next morning! When we got up to the room, there was a beautiful balloon boquette that said "Happy Birthday!" on it. Thanks, Hilton Columbus at Easton (and Ashley at the front desk), for making me look like the best wife ever! ;)Remind me why a room is over $200 bucks here? The rooms look like your typical Holiday Inn.  The TV's cable doesn't work and had to wait an hour after check-in time because they didn't have any room ready. Hm. The lobby is pretty, but I'm not staying in the lobby. On a good note, I like the lit makeup mirror. It lit up. Other than that, might as well save a 100 bucks and stay at the Holiday Inn.Disclosure: I am a Hilton Honors Gold level customer. I also design and build web sites.Without question this hotel has the very worst WiFi "system" I have ever encountered at a Hilton or anywhere else. I have found the entire brand uniformly bad but none quite this bad.Having been burned before, I carefully quizzed the desk clerk about the log in process. I was given totally wrong information to include the password.Several phone calls ensued with very nice people who were rightfully embarrassed but equally unhelpful. It soon became apparent that the staff is even more annoyed than I about the "system". It wastes their time and energy having to deal with irate customers all the while insuring a drop in employee morale by making them look like idiots for a situation completely out of their control.Finally two  people, again nice people, showed up at my door and were able to log me on...using their own password... and suggested leaving well enough alone and not logging out. Should you you wish to use your iPhone or iPad in the lobby however, guess what, you must log in again to a different "system".To say that the Hilton brand relies on AT&T for WiFi is an outrage is an understatement of the highest order. If you require WiFi stay somewhere else, anywhere else, but a Hilton brand.I had the Friday night buffet. The experience was not bad, but I expected more for the price.Buffett was so so.  Service was so-er so-er.  Prob won't be back.Had a great time getting awAy from home even just for one night. Had wonderful food & drinks very nice !!! Thanks to one if the chefs !!Good wedding venue..I stayed here for my step-brother's wedding, and we had the wedding reception/dinner here as well.The hotel portion was decent, and what you'd expect for a Hilton.  Heated mirrors are a nice touch in the bathrooms, though the height of the heating element was such that the de-fogged portion was too high to be of use to me (I'm 5'7").  Being adjacent to the Easton was nice, as it let me walk places (I was car-less).The wedding was small, family affair, with less than two-dozen total, and the bride and groom elected for a fancy dinner, rather than a reception.  Dinner was in the hotel, and the meal was impressive.  The went for a grand tour-de-force, with 12 courses.  Notes are as follows (and images are uploaded as well):1) Fresh tomato mozzarella with balsamic glaze - nice presentation with a sliced tomato alternative with fresh mozzarella slices.  Balsamic glaze drizzled over the plate, with fresh basil and pesto as a garnish2) Stuffed artichoke hearts - menu had a typo of "Articoke", but again, good presentation, and a nice amuse style artichoke heart3) Cheese and vine fruit - ridiculously large portion of cheeses and red and green grapes4) Portobello mushroom soup - rich, and a bit salty5) Grilled salad - never had anything like this before; it was a wedge of Rommaine that had been grilled, with some prosciutto and cheese, and a balsamic dressing6) Lemon Lime Sorbet - a nice palette cleanse before leading into the entrees7) Rosemary chicken with smashed potatoes, broccoli, and glazed carrots - the smashed potato balls were the highlight8) New York Strip with baby portobello mushrooms, asparagus, and Parisienne potatoes - strip was tender, and the sauce and mushrooms were fantastic9) fresh berries with lemon and cane sugar - this came with an edible flower, which was the first time I'd had one of these in person10) Creme brulee - massive; basically a small, tapered cocktail glass filled with creme brulee11) Chocolate lava cake - this was super rich and decadent12) Chocolate truffles - the group called it quits at this point, and we had this to go; I never got around to eating it . . . Overall, rad presentation, but  the food didn't seem to match the appearance.  I get that two dozen is a large party, but the food definitely tasted like banquet/buffet style food - high-end banquet/buffet, but still a bit rubbery on the chicken, a bit overdone on the beef, and generous use of sauces and salt to make up for shortcomings in prep.The courses were surprisingly large for a 12 course meal, and the timing was just off.  The wait staff seemed on it, but the food just came out with large delays between courses - the whole meal above took almost four hours, which was fine as we were celebrating the union of families, and everyone was hanging out and having a good time, but as far as dining goes, definitely room for improvement.We had brunch at the hotel the following morning as well, which was good as well.So, overall, the Hilton is what you'd expect - high-end hotel, but still mainstream.  Nothing that knocked my socks off, but everything from the room to the fitness center, to the meals was executed competently, and leaving no room for complaint.Easily one of the best suburban hotels in the country.If you're going to have a business meeting in the Columbus area, this is the place to do it. There are several restaurants within walking distance (probably 100-200 yards away) that would be suitable.Let me address some of the concerns I saw in the other reviews.The price: The Hilton is geared for business travelers and charges prices . If you're looking for a better price with some sacrifice in not having to coordinate driving dozens of people around, the Hilton Garden Inn is about half the price and 2 blocks away.There is WiFi in the rooms and throughout the hotel. It's free if you're Gold or Diamond HHonors. It's fast, too. I was able to use FaceTime without any issues.Bed was great, shower was hot and the iron worked. There's free parking and the parking lot is laid out very well so that you're never far away. There's really no need to use the valet here.The short version is, if you're in the upper tiers of HHonors because you travel frequently, this hotel is for you and you'll appreciate it. If you're a casual traveler, you're probably going to find it expensive and you'll probably be happier with the Hilton Garden Inn.After seeing all of the good reviews for the Friday night Seafood and Prime Rib buffet, we decided to try it. If it was possible to give negative stars for a rating, I would. We made a reservation, as suggested. The dining area was very busy. I started with a cup of clam chowder, eight pieces of peel and eat shrimp, and one oyster on the half shell (it was the last one available and I had seen several on plates around the dining room and passing by). The soup had okay flavor but the clams were a little chewy. The shrimp was fine and cleaned properly -- it's hard to mess up peel and eat shrimp! My boyfriend had returned to the table with more oysters, freshly stocked and had eaten them right away. When I ate mine, I immediately realized they had not been kept cold enough. The oyster was warm. We moved on and tried the crab legs, which were barely warm and they were water-logged. We stopped after a couple of those. I could see the sushi table from where I was sitting and could see there was no way to keep the sushi cold. After the oyster incident, I knew I wasn't risking sushi. The risotto looked sticky and unappealing and there were no au gratin potatoes refilled while we were there (not long). The real treat came later when we were both sick from consuming the ill-prepared food. There is no way I could eat $36 worth of the horrible excuse for food that was served. I gladly pay that price at authentic seafood restaurants, such as the Pearl, Bonefish Grill, or Hyde Park. I expected way more from this Hilton establishment. Terribly disappointing to say the least.
review_content_40: Seafood buffet was mostly delicious!! There weren't a wide variety of selections, but whatever they had was tasty from the fresh fruits to oysters on the half shells! All the fruits I had tasted so sweet! There was a salad bar, one type of soup-clam chowder, and a pasta station with a chef ready to make you a plate of pasta with your choice of mussels, shrimps, clams, scallops, and vegetables. I chose a mix of sauces for my pasta and it came out well flavored and zesty! There was also prime-rib, but it was a little dry. We were there when they had just opened for dinner so we got slices from the end, and not the pink center of that chunk of prime rib. We were there for the seafood so we can overlook this mishap!We also had fresh sashimi and sushi there. There was a chef at the sushi station preparing and cutting the fish so you know it is fresh!!! The salmon sashimi literally melted in my mouth!! I went back to the sushi station for thirds!They offered other dishes of cooked salmon, flounder, stripe bass, chicken paella, potatoes, asparagus, and yam. I tasted all of them. I was more than impressed!Last, but not least, our gang wrapped up a satisfying dinner with dessert!! They must have had over ten different choices. We tried the tiramisu, chocolate cake, carrot cake, and some type of sticky nutty pie!! Let me tell you, they were all to die for!! Overall, the best experience with a seafood buffet in C-bus!! The service was friendly and prompt- our water glasses were never empty! Bottom line, I would come back to this place, and recommend it for you seafood lovers!The price is $31.95 per person for the seafood buffet, which is every friday from 5 pm- 10pm?? I believe.Friday seafood buffet is one of the best deals in Columbus if you like seafood--raw oysters, chilled snow crab legs, chilled shrimp with tasty housemade cocktail sauce and fresh-prepared sashimi and sushi!  The pasta station allows you to create your own sauce, I recommend mixing half Alfredo and half marinara sauce.  From the sushi bar the seared tuna and salmon sashimi are great.  There is also cooked fish with capers, cucumber, egg, and tomato garnish.  The dessert bar is great, having all sorts of cakes including cheesecake and carrot cake.  My favorite dessert was the tiramisu. Would definitely come back again!The Friday night buffet at the Easton Hilton has been in the talk threads lately. All seafood loving Yelpers should check this buffet out as soon as possible. We made a reservation and they showed us to our table as soon as we arrived. The dining room is not very big, so the buffet line was never super crowded. There were a lot of great choices the night we visited. Sushi, sashimi, smoked salmon, crab legs, oysters, peel and eat shrimp, and lots of hot entrees including prime rib, pork loin, grouper, and jambalaya. There was a delicious sweet potato gratin that I could not stop eating. There's also a nice salad bar, a big spread of fruit, and a selection of rolls. Everything was fresh and delicious. The only part of the meal that didn't wow me was dessert. Everything was cakes and pies. Delicious for sure, but it would have been cool if there were some cookies or brownies or chocolate covered strawberries. I guess I was looking for more colorful, smaller bites. Service was great. I encourage you to check this buffet out as soon as you can. We had a fantastic meal and we will be back!I am a frequent business traveller and a frequent patron of Hilton hotels and, unfortunately, I was not a fan of this hotel.  They charge an arm and a leg for a room here and it definitely didn't live up to what I'd expect.  I arrived late due to hours of flight delays and had to run through the airport for the last shuttle.  I called the hotel to tell them I was going to be there right at 10:45pm when the last shuttle was scheduled to leave the airport but they were still about to pull away when I ran up at 10:45 on the dot.  Why not hold the shuttle for one minute people?Upon arrival, rooms on the concierge floor were sold out.  That's fine, I'm used to that.  I was put into a room with double beds instead on the 4th floor.  Here's the kicker...The room had no heat.  Seriously?  Now it's after 11pm and I need to get up at 5am.  I have zero energy to switch rooms, deal with maintenance, etc.  I instead opted to sleep with the blankets over my head.  It wasn't fun.  The fitness center is decent (two rooms...one for cardio equipment, one for weights) and the pool is quite nice.  I had trouble with the audio on the tv on my treadmill but no big deal...At least I arrived early enough to not have to wait for one.  The concierge level breakfast is standard.  Good coffee, some fresh fruit, lots of seating in the lounge.  The business center is convenient and free but no WiFi in the rooms.  It's about time to equip this place with wireless.  If you don't have status there, you pay for the very, very slow hard-wire internet which is your only option unless you sit in the lobby.  I informed the front desk of my heat troubles upon check-out.  They said they'd have someone go up and look at it.  I expected some sort of reparation (toss me some Hilton Honors points like Marriott does when something like this happens) but no dice.  I did submit an online feedback form and got a call from someone at the hotel but haven't had a chance to call them back yet.  It's nice that they replied to my feedback but again, it's unfortunate that I had to go that far.I stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night as it was close enough to cab to my work holiday party. You have to check in at a podium before you enter to make sure you were really a guest. You have the option to valet,but we self parked in the adjacent garage. Warning. It is a hike to the lobby from this garage. Especially when you are trying to play super heroes and carry everything at once! Room was nice, but I feel like they could have included a small fridge and free wifi for the cost of the room. I have paid less in downtown Chicago. The trash cans were minuscule as well. This would be fine if you could recycle, but I didn't see any receptacles to do so. Also, the signal kept going in and out on the tv. Annoying more to my husband than to me. It is in a nice location, but I probably won't stay there again.My company of 7 partners (along with their significant others) decided to hold our Christmas party at Easton including hotel rooms at the Hilton. While I had never stayed there before, I had always understood the Hilton was the "flagship" hotel (whatever that means) for the Easton area. In hindsight, while we will continue to do our Christmas get-aways every year, we will definitely NOT be at the Hilton.It started with the valet parking and went down hill from there. It's snowing in Columbus, but they chose to park our car outside by the entrance rather than the normal valet parking garage. Gee, thanks. And before we checked in, we found out the hotel screwed up our rooms and gave us full size beds rather than the reserved (confirmed) king sized beds. So we asked at the desk but no Kings were available. But of course those of our party who checked in later managed to get King sized beds. Would have been nice if they could have told us we could have Kings if we waited. But that would require someone at the desk actually caring about their customers, which I assure you, they didn't. We found the desk service to be cold and perfunctory.So off to our room we go, and they have given us an ADA room. Oh, now I'm just loving this place. Perhaps they could have mentioned that at the desk and asked us if that was alright. Sadly, no. So between the curbless shower that soaks the bathroom, and the closet that doesn't function, I'm pretty disgusted given the money we paid for our rooms.So we head down to the lobby bar where we find the only bartender in Columbus with little or no personality. In fairness, he wasn't rude, just cold. Not the way you normally expect to be treated in the bar. Fortunately, we spent the rest of the night at local restaurants, so all went well.But the next morning (and yes, this is the honest truth), we awoke to the sound of a jackhammer operating inside the hotel. Apparently, some bathroom maintenance had been scheduled for 8:00 Sunday morning. At this point in time, we just laughed and got the hell out of there.While I am sure most people's experience isn't as dreadful as ours, we certainly won't be returning. And the icing on the cake was the apathetic attitude we got from the hotel staff. It is my intent to show them the same attitude.We come to Columbus several times each year for a quick weekend vacation, and we almost always stay at the Hilton at Easton. Why, you ask? The gorgeous property, for starters. If I didn't know better, I'd never guess this hotel was in Columbus, OH, let alone the midwest, just by looking at it. The styling is both elegant and contemporary. Next, the attentive staff. In the 20+ times we've stayed in this hotel, I don't think we've ever come across an employee who wasn't up to Hilton's high service standard. Seriously, everyone from the valet attendants at the main entrance to the clerks at the front desk are nothing less than helpful and friendly. In many cases, they've gone above and beyond to ensure that our stay was enjoyable. Also, the location simply cannot be beat. With Easton Town Center just a quick walk across the parking lot, you'll be entertained for an entire long weekend. Valet parking is available for $10 per day, and they keep most of the valeted cars in a well-lit area directly in front of the hotel's entrance. Overall, the Hilton at Easton is a great choice if you're looking for a relaxing stay in Columbus.This place is not good but if you want to be in Easton it is the best. By any real city big hotel standards, this place wont even place, so be sure to adjust your expectations. The staff are generally uninspired so don't expect to feel special at all at any time. I don't really need that, but when the same guy checks you in 6 sundays in a row at 9:45PM, you expect a "welcome back".  The guest rooms are truly designed to make you feel like you are sleeping in your grandmother's guest room: old beds, worn carpets, striped curtains, dark wood with gold-ish fixtures. The real treat with this place is that the wireless internet is terrible (so don't expect to catch up on a new show) and if you wake up at the wrong time you will NOT have hot water. To me there are three things that any hotel has to do: not have bed begs, have hot water, and have good internet. The fail at two (dont worry -- you probably wont get beg bugs though the carpet is very old). Cant wait for the next 20 nights I have to spend here for work... enjoy.One of the most disappointing business hotels I've stayed in and definitely not up to Hilton's standard. The hotel is fairly new but the condition of my room was poor. At 7 am there was no hot water in the shower. To make things worse, the tepid water didn't drain fast enough and by the end of my quick and frigid shower, I was standing in ankle deep water.Wi-Fi in my room was very weak.  If I was standing near the door to the room, I had plenty of signal.  If I was sitting at the desk, I had absolutely 0 signal.  My room by the way was not at some distant end of the hotel.  I was about as close to the middle as a room could be.  Fourth floor, six or so rooms toward the middle of the floor from the elevator.In the room, one of the electrical outlets on the desk didn't work, one of the wall mounted fixtures in the bathroom was hanging out of the wall, and the fluorescent bulb over the toilet was unbelievably dim.The only good thing I can say about this Hilton is that it is conveniently located to the mall at Easton (not sure the official name) and there are several acceptable restaurants within a very short walk.The next time I'm in this area I'll stay at the Courtyard by Marriott which is also at the mall at Easton.One of my favorite hotels to stay at. Great service and the like. One complaint....internet should be free...especially for Hilton Honors Guests. Im paying enough to be here....no more nickel and diming.This has to be one of the finest hotels not only in Columbus, but in all of Ohio. It is beautiful! As soon as you walk into the foyer, your wallet starts shaking! You know right away that you're going to drop some coin in this place - even if you don't stay overnight.The rooms are georgeous. The restaurant is spectacular. The decor is breathtaking. What more do you need in a hotel (except affordable pricing) :-) It's a great place for weddings and business events as well.The best part about this Hilton Hotel (to me) is the lounge on Saturday nights. The live music is absolutely fabulous. Typically, you will hear one of the finest Jazz bands around. Get there early, because this is a real hot spot.Wonderful experience.  The room was a comfortable size, the bed was very enjoyable.  A big plus were the pillows, exactly what we would have wished for.  The towels were awesome, for a moment there I had to fight myself against asking if they were available for purchase.  Check-in was a breeze, very friendly too.  We didn't make a lot of requests, but every one was quickly and cheerfully attended to.  We enjoyed brunch Saturday morning.  The brunch items were a little cool, but not too bad.  Terrific selection and great job keeping things fresh.  Loved the make-up mirror in the guest room.  It was a wonderful surprise that current movies were available on the pay per view.  After a long day of being out and about we loved curling up with our dessert carryout and watching a movie that was playing too late in the theater across the street.  We will definitely do our best to go back again...and again.From the moment you pull into the parking lot, it is clear this is a fancy, expensive hotel. This is absolutely a 5 star place to stay if you do not care at all about how you spend your money. I'm not one of those people. It keeps three stars for a clean, well-designed room, a very comfortable bed, a very nice pool and work-out facility and a pretty good location. Some don't like the fact that this hotel is sandwiched between a mall and the Easton shopping center, but I think many travelers would appreciate the convenience of a variety of shopping outlets and eateries, all within walking distance. The food delivered from room service was also very well-prepared. I would give 3.5 stars if I could. It loses one star for charging $10/day for internet. I'm not saying I will NEVER give 5 stars to a hotel that charges daily for internet, but it would take a LOT for me to do so. I'm taking away another star for a lack luster personal experience I had. To try to keep a boring story short, I was told by the front desk staff that I could find a deck of playing cards in the hotel gift shop. I was NOT told that the gift shop was currently closed. So I came down, saw the gift shop was closed, and turned around to head back to my room. One of the bellboys asked if I needed anything and when I explained that I had just come down to get cards not realizing the shop was closed, he helpfully said, "No problem! I can get someone to get in there and get them for you." Wow, I thought, that's really great service! Not so much. It turns out he just got a manager (which took awhile) to get into the shop, and charge the hotel's 7.25% sales tax on their already exorbitantly priced cards in addition to a 7.25% "after hours" tax for going into the store less than an hour after it closed. Furthermore, the manager couldn't be bothered to find out how much the playing cards actually cost. And of course, they could only charge it to my room.Very fresh sushi and amazing taste. Seafood buffet is the one you don't want miss for your Friday dinner. The only problem that bothers me may be the cost.Had my wedding reception (brunch) and stayed for a couple of nights in a suite. My wife had the room the night before our wedding and I stayed at Best Western off 71. Wow I loved the suite. It was amazing and fun to be in a great location. A lot of people go, "Wow expensive for a shopping mall..." But come on -- Easton is not just a shopping mall. It is an awesome location, but parking can be an issue.Internet is $10, but if you can afford to stay at the Hilton you can afford the $10 -- and I know it's a nuissance, but still.Can't wait to go back and spend a few more days in a suite.The Hilton is the nicest hotel offered in the area but I found a hair in my bathroom when I first got to the room and when I picked up the phone to call housekeeping, there was another hair under the ear piece.  The wifi is not free, bad instant coffee in the room - don't waste your time and the room service is expensive but overall, good stay.Very nice hotel. We stayed here for a wedding. The reception was in one of the ballrooms. Even though there were other weddings going on....it wasn't bothersome. The room we stayed in was nice but the decor was kinda ugly. It was comfortable though.Pretty average Hilton. If you're shopping at the Easton Mall it's perfect. It's older. The rooms are fairly small. The bed wasn't too great. It's was super crowded when we were there which made check-in seem like it took a lifetime. I'd only stay here if you plan on shopping, eating, and drinking in Easton.This was my second trip and although it's billed as a "Prime Rib Buffet" the real star of the show is the sashimi.  I had two plates of it and debated skipping everything else and just eating more of it.  But I didn't.  I had a small piece of prime rib and some vegetables, and some pasta from the pasta bar and a pretty big piece of strawberry cake.  Whew!  The same price, $29.95.  This is an amazing price when you think about it.One of Columbus' top hotels. This place is great. Five stars from me!  Beautiful lobby. Small bar, but plenty of cushiony areas to sit and enjoy a drink. Beautiful restaurant. Rooms are very nice. Top-notch hotel. Stay here if on the east side of Columbus!
review_content_60: Very nice property.  A bit expensive for staying at a shopping mall.A bit pricey but overall a nice hotel. In a fantastic location, close to shopping and restaurants. The rooms are a bit small I feel but the staff is super accommodating and friendly.Very nice convenient to shopping and food. I enjoyed my stay for business. Suprising that they do not have wireless in the room but do have a fairly quick wired. We ate the restaurant in the hotel which was very nice. The concierage floor was well stocked for breakfast but no oatmeal. Come on I need a healthy start. I rate it a 3, not because it was bad just because it was ok for a Hilton of this size.Very nice, impressive hotel with great facilities. Stayed here a week ago for business travel and was quite happy with my stay. Like all Hiltons, it's perfectly standardized so everything is convenient and familiar.Nice location out adjacent to the shrine to chain-based gratuitous consumption that is Easton, if you're into that stuff. I was there on a sunday night and so it was calm, but I can't imagine what a zoo that place gets to be on most nights.Glad I was there on business....yikes, that's a lot of money for the suburban midwest!!!Great hotel in a wonderful location. Walk to movies, restaurants, shopping, or whatever you want. Full service, wonderful hotel. Definitely stay here on your visit to Columbus.

review_content: Stayed here for two full weeks for work in January 2015, had my trusty yellow lab with me, and we both enjoyed our stay very much.  This place may be a little older, but it's affordable and it may be on the end of an access road but it's far enough from foot traffic, and the general public that there's no "omg crime!" feeling to it. I guess I'm a connossieur of shady alleys and vacant lots as it were...The room was very clean when I arrived.  It had a kitchenette with a dishwasher, full size stove and oven, a microwave, coffee maker, and a full size fridge. Even had plates, glasses, and silverware!  Bed was comfy, diagonally sprawled dog notwithstanding. Free breakfast wasn't terrible, coffee, cereal and fresh fruit worked for me.  Management were super friendly, and very helpful.  After reading the other reviews on here I feel like I stayed at a different hotel than the rest of you...Awful. The staff are fine, but this should really qualify as a motel. In fact, I've stayed at better motels. Non-smoking room but downstairs they smoke so you're screwed anyways. Breakfast is barely edible - go elsewhere for your breakfast, really. Although rooms are spacious, they look so ancient and the bathrooms so worn out that it takes a lot to pretend you're paying money for this. So why did I even book here? It was the cheapest last-minute booking I could get that claimed to be near the airport. Yes, CLAIMED, because it's not close. Think 15-20 min ride. Oh and the shuttle is an independent contractor so you have to book 24hrs in advance. The only reason this even gets a star (other than that Yelp doesn't let you put 0 stars) is there is a mall nearby you can escape to, and the sheets and towels are clean. I had a great time in Columbus, this definitely made the experience less than.Really crappy place in my opinion - avoid staying here.Firstly they advertise free shuttle to and from the airport but you've gotta book that 24 hours in advance, which you discover once you phone them. Then they tell you it's a $20 taxi ride. Actually it's a $35 taxi ride from the airport. Then I get there and the first room is literally wet inside - they'd just had a rain storm come through and the roof leaked in multiple places leaving literally a desk soaked in water and the carpeted bathroom soaked to the bone.The staff were friendly enough and changed my room. But the second one the AC wasn't working properly and emitted a nasty bug spray/mold kind of smell that made me literally cough and gag and felt like it was burning my eyes. They had no other rooms. Who knows what I breathed all night, but at midnight I was out of options to go elsewhere. I saw a couple of other people leave, telling the clerk that the hotel wasn't fit to stay in, so it wasn't just me.If I was doing this again I'd stay closer to the  airport in a better hotel - while it'll have a higher room rate, you'll save on taxis and you'll sleep without worrying about your health. This is not the smart place to stay - the bad reviews you read on here are absolutely accurate. The people who say they like it - there is no way it's this hotel, or maybe there are 1 or 2 rooms out of the many that they just got lucky with. If there was a zero star option I'd do it.Whew if I could give zero stars I would! The male staff was great, the room was okay besides the couple of giant spiders and the fact that my door barely shut!!! The main issue was the fact that there are several people who LIVE here and the minute you show up its like you showed up to the wrong neighborhood! People glare at you constantly and they are outside loud as can be all hours of the night in the parking lot like a block party and the front desk seems to deal with it because they live there! Also the wifi was "not working" for the whole four days I was there! Avoid this place like a plague! The whole area around this place is not good at all either! Not female or kid friendly at all!!!This hotel is one that should permanently stay off your radar.  The hotel is old with very few upgrades and did I say old?  It has a grimy feel to it...the wall paper in the bathroom is coming off due to age and water damage, the appliances are outdated, the furniture is old and needs replacing, the TV is way too small for the room and you physically can't view it from the bed because it won't turn that far, the room as a whole was fairly clean in appearance but with everything else it didn't feel clean.  Check-in was extremely painful and slow.  The hotel doesn't even have a credit card reader...the attendant who appeared to be the owner had to type my credit card in (seriously...are you kidding me).  This place is a total waste of money if you are looking for any creature comforts.  However if you like a sub par establishment that has fairly large rooms in a crappy location then look no further because you've hit the jackpot.  In all seriousness save yourself some time and stay at the Hampton across the street.  I'm surprised that Wyndham would even link their name to a run down place like this.  I personally will never stay in a Hawthorne again!!!  This was a blind pick for a one night stay and thank God for that because if my stay were any long I would switch hotels.  I truly hope this feedback helps if you are thinking about staying here.  Take this humble advice and don't!!!!Would not stay here again. Shuttle only operates 6a-11p. Both my flights were outside of these hours. There were no sheets for the pull out bed. The couch was dirty. The pool was not usable. Need I say more? NO. Pass this oneIf I had to choose just one word to describe this hotel, I would say "dirty".Upon walking in our room last night, the smell hit us as we opened the door. I don't know how to describe the smell but unpleasant and musty will give you a good idea. Then I was actually pleasantly surprised, as the hotel was set up like many Residence Inn properties are. But that was just upon first look, it was actually an old Residence Inn that they had let fall apart and not taken care of.In the bathroom, the toilet seat was stained yellow in some spots. As I sat there the ceiling dripped on my head! I looked down to see a puddle at my feet. It was a rainy night but we were on the first floor! The ceiling was also breaking off and dropping as it continued to get wetter and wetter.I peaked in the tub to see a dirty tub floor and a piece of toilet paper dried to the side of the tub. No clue how it got there, or more importantly why it was not cleaned off.There was a HUGE cobweb over our bed on a picture frame. I killed two spiders, a handful of ants and had to just let the flies and gnats fly around all night. I can understand bugs get in but there was evidence that they had been there and the hotel made no effort to seal the holes which they came through or clean up the webs and other areas they had made. The housekeeping clearly does the bare minimum. There was a piece of food in the utensil drawn (could have easily been picked up when cleaning), food pieces underneath the sink area and my favorite, a curly hair on the drinking glass by the sink.This place is dirty and not well taken care of. The only good thing, which also happens to be one of the most important things is that the sheets looked clean and the bed was comfortable. This is why I gave them 2 stars instead of 1, if the sheets were dirty- forget it.I would not have stayed more than one night and at that, I would not have chosen to stay here in the first place, except all of the hotels in the area were completely booked on a Tuesday night! This was my first and last Hawthorn experience.Not pleased. That was how it started.The check in was slow, but I really wasn't too bothered by that. We stayed here because we got a really cheap deal and wanted to stay somewhere on the way to where we were going to do our 5k the next morning. However, after that it got really weird. We made our way back to our room towards the back of the hotel complex. Upon getting to our room we noticed the window was cracked and we could hear the TV was loudly on. We knocked. No one answered. I double checked the room number on the paper work and key the front desk gave us and it matched. I then figured maybe the maids had just left the TV on. I opened the door... and there was a man laying on the couch watching TV. He looked surprised when we opened the door, but he didn't get up right a way. "Sorry!" I exclaimed and started to walk back out and away. Then he got up, turned off the TV, gave me a confused look and scurried out the door softly mumbling "Oops! I'm sorry." I stood at the door confused with my husband... not feeling very keen on the situation.I called the front desk, and they said "Oh! What did he look like....(long pause)... That must have been one of our property maintenance workers. It should be fine. I'm sorry.""Do I need to do something, Is the room not ready?" I replied."No, it should be fine. Don't worry about it, your room is ready for you."Uhhh call me picky, but that isn't ready. I know they may have been unaware he was in there, but I was just not down with this whole experience. Additionally there was a spot in our room where there was obviously water damaged by the bathroom and the floor was soft with the carpet damp. It was not the cleanest room I have ever stayed in. The check out was also painstakingly slow. This hotel is close to the freeway, but not entirely convenient to other things. There are some grocery stores and restaurants in the area... but its not great. The breakfast in the morning was okay.. but it was upstairs in a small room and it was very crowded. I have had much better hotel experiences from other hotels in this same price range. I will not be coming back to this hotel. Just. No thanks. No coming back from that initial impression.Hawthorn Suites for the price, king size bed, full kitchen and  free breakfast is worth it.  I don't know if I would stay here for business for several days but, if you need a clean, roomy, comfortable king size bed this place will do.  We fly into Columbus from the west coast so we get in extremely late.  This place is not very close to the airport and the neighborhood is a little shady after dark if you keep driving down Hamilton Rd.It is right off the highway and now that we know where to go it's a 10 mins drive from the airport.  Anyhow, this place is clean, our room suite was spacious for 2 adults and 1 kid who slept on the pull sofa.  They did have linens for the pull out which was nice.  The free breakfast included all 3 of us and the breakfast staff were very accommodating and friendly.This is the place work put me in and for a guy that works 18-20hr days it ain't a bad setup although outdated and I had to buy cleaner and cleaned it myself to know it is clean it's not to bad BUT it's Easter Sunday breakfast ends at 9:30 and at 8:30 the lazy worker who probably wanted to go home early said I couldn't make pancakes thanks for ruining my Easter had to set my alarm to get there early and now I am starving and awakewouldn't suggest staying here, the rooms are dirty the couch all stained up, the bath tub was corroded and dirty, the front desk was useless, shady people hanging around outside,  and to top it off I'm pretty sure it's a hooker hotel,  6 hookers and their pimp at the breakfast...  Gross...I booked through Orbitz which thought it was close to the airport- NOT-  in small letters on the hotels website it says they have transportation to the airport- false advertising-  I paid $40 to the airport by taxi and $40 back to the hotel-  I missed my flight leaving Columbus because of having to wait for taxi to arrive-  rooms were dirty, there were exposed outlets without covers, sheets were thin and mended- overall one of the worst stays ever.If you want a DIRTY MOTEL, on a dead end access road, this is the place for you! When I heard I was booked at a Wyndam Hotel, I was originally happy. My happiness was put into question when I pulled up and got into my room. It's obvious the cleaning crew does not care one bit about this place. Or, maybe the owner will not put up the funds to actually clean and keep up this place. Tubs are stained, walls roughly patched and not painted, dirty handprints around all door openings, greasy head stains on couch, stains all over chair at my desk, spider webs, filth and dust on walls in cooking area. This place is just gross. I think some people may actually live in some of the units. Traffic in and out of some rooms all through the night. My colleague in another room had restless people up all night walking around in the room above him. Do yourself, your family or your employees a favor and stay somewhere else. Actual photos of my room to be posted soon.Rooms are large and the staff is very pleasant. This is where the good stuff stops. Only two burners on the stove work which fits since there are only two pots. The bathroom ceiling is falling in  the furniture is all stained and worn out. TV is small. Ants in the bathroom. Maid service doesn't come until 7pm. For long term stay it was terrible. I had already paid for a week but would not stay any longer. They wanted $84 dollars a night. Should have been around $34. It's run down in a crappy neighborhood.This place sucks! A group of 8 of us stayed at this place (which we were told the rooms were big enough to accommodate), and each of our keys didn't work when we got back to our room three times! They never cleaned, never supplied enough towels and we're always out of things. It's not a very nice place to begin with but the least they could do is run the place like a hotel. Don't stay here, you've been warned.You know that feeling when you step onto a subway platform in a large city and you're suddenly afraid for your life? The stench of urine is so strong, you're just sure somebody must be making stew out of it.  The homeless guy sitting on the ground looks as though he'd like to relieve you of your personal belongings. Small animals are in the trash cans, digging for their dinner, and the lights are flickering on and off like a b-roll horror film?Welcome to the Hawthorne Hotel by Wyndham in Columbus.When I read the reviews for this place, I must have missed the bit about it being in a dead end back alley, surrounded by abandoned businesses and condemned buildings.  The premise for this place is fantastic. The setup would be perfect for a family to visit here, and it was probably a great place 20 years ago.  Since then, holes have been punched in the walls, stains have been mysteriously left on every upholstered surface, and the bathrooms have been drenched in urine. (I bought my own cleaning supplies, trying to rid the bathroom of the smell, but it didn't even touch it.  I assume someone had terrible aim and got the ceiling or wallpaper behind the toilet.) When I complained about the stench, I was told, "Yeah, we've been having a problem with housekeeping."The outside trash cans were teeming with stray cats, the other guests were mostly fixing cars in the parking lot and letting off fireworks at 11pm.  Some lovely young lady, obviously well over the legal blood alcohol limit, and what should have been her own personal limit, really, came to visit our door at 1 in the morning, screaming for, "Yvonne! Get out here!  Where Yvonne?"I will say, the linens were clean and fresh and the refrigerator worked very well.Other than that, run! Run far, far away.Unless, of course, you have a wayward teen and you want to scare him straight.  If so, by all means, bring him here!Just make sure you have all your shots first.I ended up staying at Hawthorn Suites due to a cancelled flight and last minute need to book the absolutely cheapest hotel possible.Unfortunately, this place as the word "airport" in its name and Expedia listed it as such.  Take note, fellow desperate travelers, this place is NOWHERE near the airport.  It's a $35 cab ride away from the airport.  So much for saving money?Upon my arrival I meet a surly woman at the front desk, who is swearing rudely at someone on the other end of the telephone, explaining that whatever the issue was, it was not the hotel's fault.  After a few minutes of uncomfortable waiting in a humid, dirty front desk area that could only remind me of the Howard Johnson's I stayed at when my parents visited me while I was in college where someone was murdered the same night we stayed, the front desk agent greeted me by saying "Expedia people suck."  To this, I could only respond with tired sarcasm stating that I just booked on Expedia and was checking in.  By the way, I don't suck.I am given a key to a room and am provided with a vague, poorly drawn map that would help me find where my room was.  I get lost while going there and have to drag my bags through a few puddles and mushy grass.  I was in the back of this place at the end of a shady road and considering the amount of windows in this suite, I was utterly convinced that I would be murdered that night.Needless to say I was not murdered.  The room was a total dead zone for both phone and wifi, so connecting to the outside world was a bit tough.  If using an electronic device at Hawthorn is on your to-do list, cancel your reservation.The breakfast was atrocious.  It's a buffet brunch gone bad.  Please, can hotels/motels start offering real food?  Otherwise, just stop.The shuttle to the airport must be prebooked so do not forget to take care of that 24 hours before you leave.  It's another long ride back to the airport, so plan accordingly.  The driver was nice enough but started getting into a bit too much of her personal business while we chatted on the drive back.  It was awkward and I almost felt bad for the woman driving me.In short, unless you absolutely need to stay here to gain the convenience of a suite with a full kitchen and living room set up, skip this entirely.I'm in Columbus for business several times a year and this is always my go to hotel.  The standard suites are like studio apartments complete with full kitchens.  For a real treat, go for the penthouse suites (2 bed, 2 bath) which are even nicer.The complimentary breakfast is quite a step up from the traditional continental breakfast found at other hotels.This hotel offers quite a lot for a reasonable price and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Columbus.  It's conveniently located about 10 minutes east of Downtown right off I-70.This hotel is slopppy, smelly, dirty, and not close to the airport like I thought.  When I asked for something simple like towels, I was told they housekeeping staff had went home and I had to come get them from the front desk which required me to get re-dressed, go outside and walk to the front desk. If you can avoid this hotel, please do! Its not worth the money. If you just need a place to sleep and nothing else, then this is a place for you.I definitely agree with Nijole's assessment that this is not a 4 star hotel, but the service and rooms definitely make your stay worth it. I was a bit skeptical about the location / neighborhood and how affordable it was. My assumption was sketchy neighborhood + low cost = bring a sleeping bag. Yet, after checking into the Wyndham and settling into our room, there was no doubt that we made a wise decision. Our room was more like a spacious one-bedroom apartment than a hotel room. The comfort of the bed, the open floor plan, and the kitchen caused us to want to stay longer than the one night that we had booked. When we awoke and went to breakfast, my wife and I were floored by the choices - fresh fruit, yogurt, milk, juice, breads, bagels, waffle bar, and cereals. Typically, when we travel, we have to eat after we leave the hotel because there are very few options available to individuals with a gluten allergy. This was definitely NOT true here. On top of the aforementioned non-glutenous options were several bins that contained eggs, sausage and hash browns. We toasted some gluten-free bread to make breakfast sandwiches. Sandy, the woman setting up the breakfast, was very attentive, genuine and gracious. She went out of her way to check on us and ensured that we lacked nothing. Our stay here was full of friendly staff and good food. Good food, friendly staff, comfortable beds, and an affordable price.  We will definitely stay here again.
review_content_20: I had checked with the hotel beforehand about airport shuttle availability, because, you know, a lot of the times places that have "airport" in their name aren't that close to the airport, and are trying to save on the shuttle and don't run it at all times, or run on an infrequent schedule, or else the shuttle has to be reserved in advance and is booked out for the next morning by the time you arrive in the evening... the answer the hotel gave was "the shuttle runs until 12:30 am". I arrived at CMH at 1218 am and called the hotel immediately for the shuttle. Hotel called back at 1222 am and advised that shuttle was unavailable, cab had been ordered, estimated arrival 4 to 8 minutes. Fifteen minutes later, no cab. After multiple calls to hotel, hotel advised that Cab 839 was on the way. No Cab 839. At 1244 hotel advised taking first available Orange Cab, and said this was agreed upon with the Orange Cab company. I asked the first Orange cab in the airport line; its driver refused to convey, and stated he wouldn't get reimbursed by the hotel. I then asked the same driver to carry at the regular, non-negotiated passenger rate. The cabbie refused again. I called the hotel and informed that I would take the first available non-Orange cab, and asked the hotel to reimburse the ride. The hotel refuses to reimburse, and states again that Cab 839 is on its way.At 1258 hotel called and advised Cab 839 was at the airport ready to pick up, however there was no Cab 839 in sight. At 0102 am Cab 839 finally arrived (promised time was 1226 to 1230 am). I take a picture to document the arrival time. Cab driver then refuses to convey. I call the hotel and ask to cancel the room, and refund the rate (Expedia prepaid). The hotel refused.I then called Columbus police, it arrived, along with the cabbies' super. The police and the super instructed the driver of Cab 839 to convey. I finally arrived at the hotel at 0144 am.Now however terrible this Orange Cab may be, which is a separate matter, it wasn't me who opted to bring it into the picture. The hotel chose not to operate the shuttle, and it was also the hotel that chose to contract with this Orange Cab. It was also the hotel that refused to reimburse a regular taxi fare once difficulties surfaced with a contracted cab, and it was the hotel that refused to cancel the reservation after it became obvious that getting to the hotel would be an issue.Don't get me wrong, this is NOT a 4 star hotel, my experience there however was.This was our first "home" in Columbus and we stayed in one of their suites for a month.Everyone there, from the managers, the cleaning crew, the lady in charge of breakfast and the rest of the staff was very very friendly, accomidating and made us feel welcome and a nice introduction to what we were about to encounter in Columbus.The pool was clean and well kept, as well as the hot tub.They have a good variety at their breakfast which is included with the meal.My son enjoyed making his own waffles every morning and I had a hard time deciding between the fresh bagels, jogurts and cereal or going all out with potatos, eggs, sausage and fresh fruit, so I usually opted for a bit of everything which held us through till dinner.That is also free on wednesdays.Our suite was clean and had a living room, full kichen and plenty of storage for the whole month.We also got a great deal on the whole month stay.The only  thing I could complain about is the partys on the weekends, but one call at the front desk and that was taken care of as well.Great location (in a bit seedy area) at a good price, I would recommend staying here!

review_content: This past weekend we drove to Columbus from Cleveland.  As a Hyatt Gold Passport member,    I couldn't get into the Hyatt Convention Center downtown, so opted to try the Hyatt Place Worthington.  I was blown away by not only the cleanliness and layout of the room (as well as the shower pressure - what a great shower!!), but the staff made the visit.  From the time I called on the day of check in to see about an early check in and was told by Shawn that it would be absolutely no problem to check in as early as we liked to Josh, who was on duty at the front desk area, when we did check in.  Josh was so pleasant and helpful at check in and after.  I'm not much of a breakfast person, however we both enjoyed a buffet of eggs, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurts, sausage, and muffins/toast/bagels.  Really nice spread. This great experience at HP made this a really nice quick trip out of town for us and we will definitely be back.Hyatt Place always is a plus in my book.  This location may be surrounded by construction at this point, but that's not the fault of the hotel.  Rooms are clean and spacious and they have a large variety of dining options.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because of the super slow elevator and loud (but amazing) AC unit.The place was clean and efficient which you could argue is the most important thing in hotels. My stay was comfortable even if everything wasn't up-to-date. Some appliances were old. The coffee machine start and stop button didn't work so I had to plug the outlet in and out every time. The bedside lamp switch had a glitch and I had to try it a couple times before it turned on. Food was typical hotel food. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall nice stay and for the price will definitely consider this place.I made a last minute change, checking out of the nearby Doubletree 2 days early due to a horrible experience there.  Hyatt totally saved my business trip by showing me what true hospitality is all about!  Nice hotel. Room was spacious and clean.  Bed and pillows were comfortable.  Their 24 hour kitchen was a real surprise.  Didn't use that option but very cool that they offer food options 24 hours a day!  Breakfast was very good.  Not vast but a decent variety of hot and cold options and the food quality is very much upscale in execution.  (Not something somebody just unwrapped and nuked!)   The have a small bar for Starbucks or adult beverages which is nice if wanting to either get a coffee pick-me-up or a cocktail to relax and unwind at the end of the day.    Price was lower than other nearby hotels like the Sheraton, Doubletree, etc...   Every staff member I encountered was absolutely and genuinely helpful and friendly.   This is my new "go to" place when in the area!My wife and I made no formal arrangements during our trip to Ohio. Booked this room at 1am on our way to Columbus. Great rate, clean, spacious single king with a living room. The water pressure in the shower was AMAZING. So refreshing. Solid continental breakfast. Fast wifi. And added security at night as they lock the front door in order to screen who comes in (fear not they are paying attention and let you in quickly). The staff were friendly as well.This hotel was a less impressive than the website made it seem. First, as of October 2014 there is MAJOR construction before entering this complex. Getting to and from the hotel was a huge ordeal each time and nearly caused an anxiety attack. The room was spacious, there was a nice mini fridge. But the bathroom was so small, I could barely move and there wasn't a fan so it was hot! I also didn't like that the bathroom sink was right across from the beds, which disturbed my roommate in the middle of the night. The hot breakfast was good, I enjoyed the sandwiches and wide variety of foods but I do think they should get their dishwasher checked out because many of the dishes seemed to be a little dirty still.I thought this hotel was a little overpriced, but still a comfortable stay!Stayed here for 4 nights. Here's what I experienced:- Good location, not far from Polaris shopping and highways.- Friendly staff, especially at check-in.- Good morning breakfast.- Nice large screen TV but it's odd viewing it from an angle from either side of the room. Unfortunately a lot of the TV channels are not in HD so they have poor resolution.- Room was dated. Needs updating badly. Stains on the carpet. Nothing looks "fresh".- Housekeeping wasn't the greatest, they didn't always replace tissues, ignored my full melted ice bucket on the floor, etc.- The mattress pad was uncomfortable to sleep on, It was wrinkled/old and left indents on the skin of my back.- Room had 8 feather only pillows---why not 4 feather and 4 foam?- WiFi was slow.  Did not respond to requests quick enough.- Pool is outdoors, so it's only available during the summer.- Air conditioner beside bed runs all the time, so it's noisy in your room all the time, unless you shut it off completely. That makes it hard to sleep. I called the front desk twice about this and they were clueless. They didn't get back to me on any solution or alternative.- I'm a Hyatt Diamond member, there was no benefit other than a free beverage, which I never received.Patrick the GM needs to tell the owner/HQ to overhaul the property badly.Nice place to stay, clean, modern lay decorated, offers drinks and snacks in the evenings at the little bar in the lobby,staff is very hospitable. Beds are comfy. Lots of space to sprawl out.This is the first time I have stayed at a Hyatt and I must say they give exceptional service. I travel often, 6-12 times a year, and the I can say the staff went above and beyond. You usually get a different type of service from day vs evening shift but not here. The night shift was very courteous and helped me find my way around Columbus, gave me plenty of good tips, and overall very friendly.  Oh, Liz helped me last night. The evening staff met and exceeded the morning shift. Micky was wonderful tonight. Due to the crazy winter we are having I am having to leave a night early and Micky and her staff helped me check out quickly. More so, I was checking out very late, 6pm, which is 2hrs past normal checkout, and they were still able to help me not pay a full nights rate. Even though they would had been 100% in the right to charge me, they understood that with the adverse weather and having to drive 6 hours back to Chicago where the bad weather is coming from, they only made me pay half.  They really didn't have to. They can not rent the room tonight so they can not recoup their money. I appreciate all of there help and next year when the Arnold Classic is held again, I will be checking back in. Thanks Hyatt!Great service and the rooms are great. Room service food is decent- I would definitely come back.5 reasons for 5 stars: 1. Nice & clean rooms. Layout is nice nice with a living room & bedroom area. Only negative on the rooms are the TINY bathrooms & small closets. 2. WIFI included3. Hot breakfast. Eggs, french toast, sausage. Also had cereals, fruit, yogurts, pastries and lots of varieties of each. 4. A 24 hour menu & room service is you need a bite to eat and don't want to go anywhere. 5. Location is excellent. Right off the freeway. Plenty of restaurants near. Polaris is a 5 minute drive. I could give plenty more reasons: excellent staff, nice outdoor pool with plenty of seating, clean hotel and public spaces. Price!We stayed here this weekend and couldn't be happier with the quality of the room, the level of customer service and the general operation of this hotel.  We both travel often enough to decipher a good experience from bad, This by far was a good experience. On a side note, the free breakfast was even better than the competition and the elevators smelled clean and fresh!This will be my hotel of choice in Columbus. It's very competitively priced at about $120 per night (this was over the weekend of a OSU football game). It's a bit far from OSU campus, but if you have a car, it's not that big of a deal. I picked this location because it is within walking distance of a COTA shuttle to the Horseshoe on game days. Hyatt Place looks brand new - both the lobby and the room had a very modern, comfortable design. The room I stayed in had a 42" TV and a comfortable couch. Free wifi and everything worked as expected. Staff was friendly and parking was plentiful. Will definitely be staying here again next time I'm in Columbus.OMG. We live in Avon Lake and never has such great service and qualify of food. Must try!!Decent hotel w/ great customer service.  Bathrooms are really small.Nice hotel in a great location.  Right off of 270 and plenty of variety in nearby (walkable even) restaurants.  Staff is very friendly and you can get a good price on it sometimes. Breakfast if just cereal and juice, coffee and tea, and bread products.  After breakfast time if you want any coffee or tea you have to pay for it.  So what is amiss here?  The room itself!It is a very good size but they did not think it out well.  There is a great huge sofa to flop on as well as sleep if you want.  Nice desk with chair to use computer (free wi-fi but rather slow) and cool thing is there are connections where you can hook up your computer to that VERY nice big screen tv.  Has a wet bar with mini fridge and teeny coffee maker but no microwave.Then you get to the sleep area.  This is where we have the fails.  Bed itself is nice and comfy but there are no nightstands, you get a shelf.  And that closet????? What closet? You can barely put anything in there and forget any suitcases.  The sink is outside of the bathroom and that bathroom is claustrophobic! Open door, slide in sideways, have back to tub, then close door.  And the heat/AC is this big clunky behemoth that juts out into the room practically against the foot of the bed.It's not what I expected, but after adjusting to how to stow our things it was good for what we needed.Good location. Great room layout, free wifi, HDTV.My wife and I found his Hyatt Place to be in an ideal location in Columbus since we were visiting multiple areas around the city.  I gave this Hyatt Place five stars because of the amazing customer service we received throughout the whole stay.  In particular, an Hyatt employee brought us food even though she was leaving for the night.  Each day she impressed us by her sincerity in making sure all hotel guests were extremely happy.    If you are looking for a Hyatt Place in a great location with superior customer service then this Hyatt Place is the place.Oh, I almost forgot... You must try one of the chocolate chip cookies.I stayed here for three weeks while working out of Columbus, but I wouldn't recommend it.The location is decent, but not great. There are chain restaurants nearby, but the highway exit (exit 23) to get to the hotel often has bumper-to-bumper traffic at rush hour. If I left at 5pm, it would take me around 20m to travel about 4 miles.The main reason my stay was frustrating and the reason for this review...The room service wouldn't stop coming early in the morning (8:30 am). I explicitly called and requested that they come no earlier than 9:30 am, because that's when I'm usually out for work. They said it wouldn't happen again. A couple days later-- I'm woken up by a knock at 8:30 am! This has happened thrice since I called, and they never apologized.I was pleasantly surprised with the Hyatt Place on my last trip to Columbus.  The lobby is clean and up to date and the front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful.  They do have a 24-hour coffee bar, brewing up Starbucks finest, but take this warning: Starbuck Baristas the Hyatt employees are not.  My latte was a little on the rough side.  Also, stay away from these blueberry muffins...The rooms were better than I expected, especially since I consider Hyatts a very mid-level hotel chain.  My king bed room included a large sofa for lounging, a huge flatscreen and an extremely comfy bed.  Um, can I mention the bed again?  I never sleep well in hotels, but I was out like a light at 10pm each night.  Well, that could be due to my grueling meeting schedule during the day, but still...Hyatt Place serves up complimentary continental breakfast every morning, too.  Double bonus when you want to grab something light to eat before you start your day.
review_content_20: I belong to the Hyatt club and had a free night I had to use within a year.  I used it here and was so happy with this location.  We spent 3 nights, very reasonable @ $99 per night for the remaining 2 nights.  The location was perfect, rooms were so clean and large. Large flat screen tv.  Close to the Polaris mall and other shopping centers.  We staying on the 6th floor which is the top floor.  Could not hear street noise, doors slamming or any noise coming from the hallway.  What a Joy!  Great views from the room as I left the curtains open all night.  Amenities were replaced each day and everything was cleaned beyond expectations.  Staff is real friendly and the complimentary breakfast is more than you can ask for.  3 different types of heated food and various other breakfast food such as breads, cereal, yogurt.  3 types of juices and Starbuck's coffee.  Very clean and modern lobby.  The person who complained about not having HD tv - hello?  where do you get HD in a hotel room?Great hotel near A LOT of restaurants. The staff is friendly and remembers me every week. As a platinum member with Hyatt they give me a free drink coupon good for even alcohol!The room is a standard Hyatt Place room, nothing new- and thats what I like about it. You know what you are getting no matter what location you are in. The price was awesome too, with my corporate discount the room was only $104!If I'm going to Columbus and looking for an inexpensive hotel, this is my first choice.  It's not new, but it looks it... modern, clean and bright.  Rooms are nearly spotless, even the bathrooms (which appear to have been repainted white a hundred times - but at least they're clean).Love that the rooms have sofas and flat screens with easily accessible AV inputs.Only complaint is about the air conditioning units in the rooms - they are individual units by the window instead of central AC.  They are noisy and either blow freezing cold air or none at al.Free breakfast is nothing special, but fine for a quick bite to eat.  Cereal, coffee, juice, muffins, etc.Hyatt Place is rapidly becoming my hotel of choice.  Love the decor (each hotel is exactly the same, right down to the gingko leaf glass over the registration desk), very friendly and clueful staff, clean rooms, stylish furnishings, and they cater to geeks.  You can be almost 100% human-interaction-free if you'd like, with self-serve kiosks for checking in, checking out, ordering food, paying, etc. Free wifi, a "starbucks-lite" in the lobby serving coffee, sammiches, snacks that you'd actually want to eat, etc.Can't really go wrong, especially for around $115/night.  I'm fairly sure Hyatt Place is a newer brand of Hyatt, so most of these properties are newly built (or mega-renovated); maybe in a few years they'll be meh.  But for now, I'm happy!

review_content: SO happy we picked this hotel!This was one of the best hotel choices we've made in the last couple of years. We tend to not have much luck with our hotels when we go out of town. This one however, was a great choice. We were in town for a concert, and were hours late, driving from Akron in a blizzard. When we finally got to the hotel, the man checking us into our room informed us that the bar was an open bar for the night and we should help ourselves after we're situated in our rooms. Too bad we were dead tired from our commute, but we did grab some food and a couple drinks from the bar on our way out to the concert that night. Really great options for food and the bartender and waiters were very accommodating, very impressive.Our room was so spacious, and the beds were so comfortable. I loved the view of the city from our window at night. The bathroom was the perfect size for me (we have a small bathroom at home so I appreciate a good-sized bathroom anywhere). Everything was very clean and laid out for us and they even gave us complimentary robes!Fantastic stay.Room is huge, clean, new, efficient at a great price! If only the bar was stocked, bourbon please, sorry-out, olives for vodka-sorry-out, bartender is always missing & im the only one at the bar at 6pm, he definitely is not into this job, annoyed I'm ordering drinks & food.This is a fairly new location. It is located right beside the airport. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. The breakfast at embassy is always amazing, cooked to order pancakes, french toast and omelets.The reception hours in the evening are pretty nice as well. The drinks are unlimited and they have a few snacks to choose from. Whenever I can find a embassy hotel that is where I usually stay because they never disappoint.My husband and I were here for about 6 days last week and were very pleased by the amenities, service and cleanliness of the hotel. I would recommend this location to anyone.I went here for a national company seminar and meeting. Hotel was very clean, and staff was professional. Facilities nice and roomy.  Room service was quick, food was good.Thank you for making our stay a pleasure.Haven't even checked into my room yet. Having dinner in the 5star restaurant. Highly recommend. Service is great. While sitting here waiting for my room to be ready, the front desk clerk came in, handed me the room key, told me my luggage had been taken up and that I was all set. Love this service. More later. Here for 9 days.check in: Pleasant staff. I checked in at around 9 PM. There was only one person working so there was a few minutes' wait, but unremarkable.Room: The room was very clean.  Flat screen HDTVs in bedroom and in the living area. Microwave and refrigerator were very clean. Bathroom was very large with a nicely-tiled stand-up shower (no tub). Linens and towels were clean.  The room was very comfortable and I would definitely stay here again.Parking: free surface parking.Breakfast: The layout of the breakfast area has very poor flow. Many guests, myself included, were running into other seated guests as we were making our way through the cooked-to-order omlette line, coffee/juice station.  There are no servers and I couldn't find any water in the breakfast area, which I found to be frustrating. The quality of the food was unremarkable as well- they had the usual breakfast items: bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy, potatoes, waffles. I couldn't find anything too healthy in the buffet line. I would rate the quality of food to be about 3.5 of 5 stars.Wifi: If you're gold/diamond, you just "bill" wireless to your room and it'll come off of your bill. Otherwise, you're stuck paying for wi-fi, even in the lobby.Check-out: painless. No complaints!Great location, staff was very friendly, offers very clean rooms. Very nice, new hotel with a clean modern interior. Lots of items to choose from for Breakfast, plus made to order omlets YUM!Stayed for Ohio State Game Vs Michigan cost of cab from hotel was $20.00 for 2 people.Great hotel! Seems like new construction. Friendly staff, nice rooms with big flat screen tvs, excellent free breakfast, free wi-fi and newspapers.  Hotel , grounds and rooms all immaculate. Very close to the airport, but little noise from the planes.  The room is so big, I feel like I'm living in an apartment.Very nice hotel, good rates, hot cooked breakfast and finger food and drinks in the evening daily free. Very neat and clean and close to airport.I am in Columbus at least once a month on business.  This places offers very clean rooms and awesome service from the staff. The management reception is great too. It goes for about two and a half hours. During this time, unlimited house booze and draft beer. They also provide some light snacks.  Every morning there is also a nice breakfast offered with an omelet station.  This is also FREE!!!!!  Everyone loves free, right?I definitely recommend!The hotel itself is great. The staff is nice and professional. The rooms are very clean, large with lots of amenities (2 TVs, refrigerator, microwave). The management reception is great. Despite being next to an airport, the rooms are incredibly quiet. There is a nice breakfast, exercise facilities, pool, etc.The reason I gave it 3 stars, however, is that their internet access (wifi) is terrible. When I travel for business, internet access is essential for me. Their wireless is very flaky, forcing me to log off every 10 to 15 minutes. It's pretty frustrating and is pretty much a deal breaker for me.Stayed this holiday weekend with my family.  We have stayed at other Embassy Suites and other hotels in the Columbus area.  It has been challenging for the six of us.  This is an excellent hotel.  Clean, new.  Great service.  Nice indoor pool.  Breakfast is amazing, although the staff has difficulty keeping up with busy times.  The happy hour is great.  The restaurant is great for breakfast, but not visually appealing for dinner.  The food is good, however, either via room service or at the restaurant.  No free wi-fi is a pain.I was coming back to Columbus to see the family for Christmas and wanted a decent, newer hotel to spend the time. I'm a dedicated Hilton person and really wanted someplace nice close to Grove City where the family lives. After ruling out the dated Garden Inn and Hampton in Grove City and knowing the Doubletree downtown had seen better days, I decided to stay at the Embassy Suites-Airport and liked it. Hotel is newer and has a decent looking lobby.  Rooms are good however I found the bedroom a bit cramped. There was really no room to store two bags.  We kept those in the living room. Staff is good and friendly. Fitness area is standard newer Hilton with decent amount of Precor equipment.  However, Wifi sucked! I've experienced worse Wifi at the Conrad Chicago and theWit but those were downtown locations.  I don't really expect dropped signals and having to fight with the neighboring McDonald's AT&T wifi signal. Hotels need to realize that a good strong Wifi signal is a VERY important feature. And as more people have tablets, that little Cat5 cable connection in the room is not going to cut it. Also, I choose this hotel strictly on the fact that it was the newest Hilton brand property in the city. On my next trip to Columbus, if the new Hilton downtown is open, I will be staying there. This Embassy Suites is not a bad hotel at all. And it's great if you need to stay near the airport and it's a quick drive to Easton but I'm a "downtown" guy.  I want lots of stuff around me, besides a Turkey Hill and McDonalds. Also, if I wasn't a Hilton Diamond member, I would choose the new Sheraton Four Points across the street. It's a newer and cooler hotel than Embassy Suites.The "Gold Standard" for Embassy Suites.  New place, modern look with great open and large rooms with multiple flat panel TVs.  Staff was nice, the bed was super comfortable.  Conveniently located close to the airport (although deceivingly not right next to it with a location on "Airport Dr"), easy access to downtown and close to Easton.  I will stay here again if I come back to Columbus.Very nice, new hotel with a clean modern design...which I love. But, there's nothing to do or see near here. If you want to go to a bar you have to drive 15 min into town and risk driving after drinking, no bueno!...or go to North to Easton, which is a bunch of lame chain restaurants. It has a very nice, large gym with state of the art equipment and nice indoor pool/hot tub. (The pool deck tile is slick a snot when wet, be careful. I almost fell several times!)Rooms are very modern as well with separate bedroom and two large flat screen LG TVs.I've stayed at this hotel almost every other week over a period of four months. Got to know several of the staff at the front desk, restaurants, the shuttle drivers, and of course room service. The staff are very good. The place is a really good deal for the business traveller. Not your average budget hotel. Rooms are spacious, well furnished and well-kept. Just a few minutes from the airport and the Easton area. Breakfast is included and isn't that bad. However, this hotel has had some serious problems with the menu, in terms of quality and consistency of the dinner and lunch options. Depended on who was in the kitchen that day. You won't go wrong with the burgers (classic and veggie), the house salad with grilled chicken, and on most days with the grilled salmon with rice. Stay away from the mussels!! They were terrible. All else is mediocre.Wow, I'm pressed. Easily the nicest Embassy I've been too. Super nice staff and the rooms are VERY nice. Two huge flat-screen TVs, a huge stand-up shower and brand-new through-out. My new go-to hotel in Columbus.Horrendous. I am a pilot and spend over half of my life in hotels. For an Embassy, this place is terrible. If not on top floor, you will hear the toilet flushed as it is a high pressure system. The staff is stiff. Most have zero personalities and not friendly. The breakfast is a hassle. Every morning they either screw up a basic over medium, no bananas, no Earl Grey tea or something like that. The service line for coffee, drinks and toaster is crammed and can't get anything from there without bumping the diners  seated nearby. Management is apathetic.
