I have complained every other day during my 20 plus days total I stayed here. The rooms are nice and place is still new and clean.  Quiet rooms on the seventh floor, especially the back, odd numbered rooms.another great hotel I stayed at while travelingan Embassy Suites free breakfast is the best you will get at any hotel chain across the US I believe =)
review_content_20: Great, great hotel near the airport.  And because it's Columbus, you're not more than a 15 minute drive from just about anything.  Spacious new rooms, clean and tasteful decor.  All 2 room suites.  Rates are reasonable too.  Best hotel option near the airport.  Good fitness center and pool, very well kept property and comfortable hotel.

review_content: I was in Columbus a few weeks ago for a work event and our party of 9 stayed at this hotel. I can confidently say that I have never had an experience quite like the one I had there. First and foremost, the parking lot was full but it seemed like the hotel itself was pretty empty. The outside looked like it needed a good power wash, but it wasn't too bad at first glance. Our rooms?? Very different story. The only reason I'm giving two stars instead of one is because of the friendly staff. Everyone we interacted with was as helpful as they could be, given the circumstances and tried their best to accommodate our requests.  Now, back to the rooms - one half of our group had a beautiful room! Clean, looked relatively updated and overlooked the pool area. MY half of the group wasn't so lucky....our room was nothing short of terrifying. There were stains on the covers, the bathtub was dirty, handprints on the walls, our fridge looked like it fell off the back of a truck and rolled down a hill, there was something crusted to the phone... And that's not even the end of it.  When we mentioned our dissatisfaction to the front desk, the young lady working happily moved us to a different room on the other side of the hotel. Admittedly, that room was nicer, but BARELY. I'd say this hotel is ok for someone quickly passing through or maybe has an early flight to catch, but I'd looks elsewhere for anything long term :/OMG, all I can say is stay the hell away. Had to book room in Columbus for a convention. In efforts to save the organization some bucks and having to stay 5 nights, did some extensive research, reading reviews and pictures and was hopeful about picking this one.Started off ok. The front desk ladies upon check-in (saw 4) were chatty enough and helpful when I engaged them in conversation asking for restaurant recommendations and traffic to downtown.I asked for a quiet room so they put me in the last room on the 3rd floor. As soon as I stepped in and took my shoes off, had a bad feeling. The carpet seemed soggy and felt there could be mold (though I couldn't see). Knew the part of the place was undergoing construction so I specifically asked for a room away from that.I go to the bathroom and it seems apparent this room hadn't been used in a while. The sink counter was sticky and unclean. I cleaned the entire top before I dare lay out my toiletries on the counter, even with a towel underneath.I take a shower and despite the curtain being closed, the floor is kinda wet. At first, I thought it was me, having missed closing the shower curtain shut in some way. Then consecutive days, the longer I take a shower, the greater the pool of water on the floor. I see that they tried to spackle the tub area probably due to leakage but it seemed to leak up from the tiles and other places. So needless to say my foot towel was always soggy from trying to dry off all the wet spots.I could tell the tub and floors did not get cleaned thoroughly everyday cause there was still hair in the tub and powder spots on the floor.In the mornings I usually have the Do Not Disturb sign on the door and when I leave I take it off so the room can be serviced. I left late one morning and the room wasn't serviced. Figured I missed the cleaning lady's time so the next day, I told the front desk as I left, to ensure the room gets serviced.And then, I come back that day and there is hardly a quarter of a toilet paper left on the roll. Also, instead of leaving shampoo and conditioner, they only left shampoo. Usually they have a spare roll (there certainly is a spot for it). So alas, I ran out of toilet paper in the middle of the night. Not wanting to be bothered I survived using the facial tissue box which I left on the counter to bring attention to the fact that there was no toilet paper. I leave the next morning and come back in the evening. Was so tired I took off all my clothes and went to the bathroom and voila!, the empty toilet paper 'stick' is on the counter and the box of facial tissue just the way I left it. Seriously, hotel doesn't have toilet paper?!?! So I promptly call the front desk. Or at least I tried to. The buttons on the phone that notes housekeeping didn't work. I press the front desk button, didn't work. I dial '0' and it rings and rings and rings. Nobody picks up. So finally I used my phone to find the hotel telephone number and called them. I asked does the hotel phone work? The answer; it should. I said I haven't had toilet paper in 2 days. Before I could even ask them to send them up, she goes come down and get them. I said, what? Could you send them up? She says I can't leave the front desk. I was thinking WTF?? So I put all my clothes back on guessing what lousy management to have only one staff at the front desk. I go down and I see another worker right there on the phone, chewing gum. I said you gotta be kidding me. So with an incredulous look, I said, how could it be that I don't have toilet paper for 2 days? To which she promptly replied with her hands up, I ain't got nothing to do with that. If she doesn't who the F does?!?If a client calls to say the room is out of toilet paper, wouldn't the first thing out of a decently trained staff, or even just common sense say, I'm really sorry, we'll send some up right away??I want to give zero stars but since I can't, so be it. I was just too incredulous at not only how badly the place was kept (not kept); having pieces of plaster literally covering the hallway in front of my room to having a microwave that wasn't connected to electricity (had to move furniture and McGyver things to connect the short microwave plug and then the refrigerator to the extension outlet which was waay too short to get it too work, to having no privacy curtains so unless you wanted to provide a peep show, you couldn't open the curtains while you were in the room, to non-functional phones, to elevators that take literally a minute and a half for each floor (it's a 3 story building) which means it takes 3 minutes to go up 2 floors and on the way down it's slower and automatically stops on the second floor to  toilet paper and the staff's attitude and response, there could not be a worse combination of indifference, ineptitude and lousy management.Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay...This place was disgusting. There was an upside down cross drawn on the wall above the bed, a huge stain on the comforter, the phone was sticky and crusty, hole in the mattress, the bathtub was sticky, the elevator didn't work well, exercise equipment didn't work- only had 20 pound dumbells too.  Please stay away.An absolute dump to say the least.  The only thing that makes this hotel nice is the staff, which I have always found to be extremely great people.  I won't go into detail, as the other reviews are spot on, but I will say this...if you've ever seen the Simpson's episode that featured the Sleep Easy motel that had the neon sign with the bulbs out that read "Sleezy Motel" with the mayor coming out with a hooker...I think they were talking about this place.Really you get what you pay for.  I booked a room for ~$65-$70 during the Columbus Marathon.  Parking lot is worn out which should tell you something.  Lobby was decent and nice.  The layout of the hotel is odd.  There's a central portion where continental breakfast is served and leads to the pool.  We checked into our room, where you realize that a bulk of the rooms overlook the pool, so you have to pull the curtains if you're changing in the room.  Bathrooms were fine, room was ok, no signs of smoking in our room.  The continental 'breakfast' really wasn't much of anything at all which was a negative.  When we checked out after showering after the race, we thought all was good.  In the end, my credit card was charged that I used to book the room, not the credit card that we gave the front desk when we checked in.  How hard is it to say I want this credit card to be used to pay for a room?This place was a complete dump. Stains on the carpet, shower curtain was so nasty I took the bottom snap part off before I showered, the walls had crap all over them, the fridge shelves were missing and bottom was all stained not including it look like it was from 1960 and was rolled down the hill befor put in my room and the heater/air didn't really work and sounded like it was going to catch on fire as loud as it kicked in and off. The hallway was stained and had holes in the floor (be careful don't trip and fall, kinda deep). It smelled like cigarrets all over since they mixed smoking rooms with non. The breakfast was left out all the time it was nasty looking. The outside was not a place you wanted to be after dark or maybe not even at all. The run down trailer park across of the street with the little store had people standing out there all the time with cars driving up doing god knows what and driving off. STAY AWAY!!!! Oh I will say the gentleman that shuttles the bus to the airport was always smiling and saying good morning... But that's all they will get from me, it's a complete dump! I'll post pictures on Yelp and other places, because it won't allow me to do so here, but managed to post some under photos.OK... where do I start? This place is so bad that I'm writing this while still in the "hotel." Just need to vent before "hitting the hay."The photos on their website are not an accurate representation of the facility. The most impressive feature of this hotel is the lobby. It's downhill from there.I booked two rooms - one for my wife and I and one for my daughter, her husband and two year old. At first glance, our room looked and smelled OK. My daughter's room had a musty smell and mold growing where the walls meet the ceiling. The staff allowed us to move my daughter and her family into a room that was in much better shape.Our room had the clock radio and both night stand lamps unplugged. Once plugged-in - one of the lamp's bulbs were burned out.There were no facial tissues in the dispenser. Makes you wonder what kind of quality control checklist the housekeeping staff uses.The elevator made a loud clunking noise each time it started from the first floor. Didn't feel too safe about that one.The TV didn't show stations higher than channel 20. My wife was looking forward to watching HGTV (one of the channels higher than 20) - something she has missed since we dropped cable at home. When I called the front desk, they said the maintenance man would stop by to take care of it. When asked how long that might be - they said it would be after he returned from shuttling guests to/from the airport. So we have a maintenance man/shuttle driver that never showed up in the 2+ hours since we called the front desk.Had we known the maintenance man wouldn't show up, my wife would have joined us by the pool to enjoy our two year old grandson splashing in the water.So it's 10:30 at night and it's off to "dreamland" - or should I say, "Nightmare on Stelzer Road"?Worst choice! Got an asthma attack do to the dust in the room.plus the whole place smalls like chlorine from the pool! I checked right back out the same day because my boyfriend get sick from the smell and had to take him to the emergency room. We had to come back the next day to get our money back because the manger was not there on the day! asked for our money back and the manger was super rude. It has been two weeks and still have not got our money back. Would never recommend anyone to stay at this hotel/motel whatever it is.Very dirty, service was slow . Sitting in the lobby waiting for delivery ( don't walk outside) 4 people were getting their rooms switched . I accepted why I got, as I know nothing else could be better . MAZE INN,,, confusing where rooms areThis place should be immediately demolished. The staff has been trained in BAD customer service. C'mon. Didn't know places like this still existed.Outstanding front desk service from several different folks. Very nice spot for the price. If you're looking for the Hilton for $70 a night this isn't it. But the interior pool was quaint and the kids were really enjoying it when we walked through the lobby. Yes our room was a bit outdated but it was clean, efficient and smelled fresh. It looks like there might be some updating in progress. The lamps were new and the drapes modern. Did I mention how nice the staff was each time we interacted? Not sure why this place has some grumpy reviews. Seems like their expectations might be unrealistic for the price. Also the pool area view was adorable.If I could give this place 0 stars I would. It was dirty, smelled like urine, and we had to switch rooms because of the dust balls and cob webs in the corners and filthy bath tub. We barely spent any time in there before we realized we would definitely never sleep on the beds (that were missing comforters and sheets) so we called down to see if we could move rooms. The phone had a crusty brown smear on the mouthpiece and it turned out it wasn't even plugged into the wall. Once we switched rooms we thought we would be fine, but that was not the case. The room we switched to had a sagging mattress with an enormous stain in the comforter. The chair had what looked like a stab and cigarette burns all over it, covered in stains. People had drawn on the walls, the picture above the bed fell off the wall with one touch and the other picture across the room still had a yard sale tag on it. The bathroom flooded with one shower and the wall paper was peeling off in there. There was also an open soap packet in the shower like they hadn't even cleaned it from the previous user. "Continental breakfast" was cereal (no milk....what....?) and 3 kinds of cheap bread for toast. No juice or fruit. Coffee was watered down dirt water and Seriously, I could go on and on about how nasty this place was but I've given you a good idea. Pick ANYWHERE else before here. Don't be forced to sleep with one of your t-shirts as a pillowcase like we had to!!!!I'm giving this a one star because I have too... Let's start at the gate! The Lobby was uncomfhumid with no climate control. My room smelled like cigarette and the ac/heater smelled 100x worse! I requested a wake up call, Didn't get it ! the only thing good about this experience was checking out !I'm so pissed to even give one star!  I'm a flight attendant so I stay in hotels often and this one was of the worst nights stay ever. Our first room didn't have a air conditioning so we got a new room however which was worse. Dirty and old. The bedding is just 70s, which makes me hesitate to even sleep on it.I'm certain there was prostitution or some scary sex crap going on in our hall and next door. I had to wake up at 5am and I probably got 3hrs of sleep cuz of the noise. HORRIBLE. I will never stay at a Days Inn.Meh.  If you need to be close to the airport and not pay much for your room, the Days Inn is ok.  Just ok.  Room was fairly clean.  Plenty of parking.  Hot water.  The TV was old school, though, with a tube and a curved screen and all that.  I'm not much of a TV watcher so who cares, but it's worth mentioning, I think.Worst thing about my stay here was the "breakfast".  Whew.  I guess I'm spoiled by numerous stays with a rival hotel chain but I expect breakfast to be decent.  No eggs benedict or mimosas, ok, just not sucky.  This was uber-sucky.  A loaf of bread someone bought at the grocery on the way in that morning.  A gallon of milk and a gallon of OJ - forget about individual cartons or a dispenser with cups.  Single-serving cereals (which is fine, but I need more than 2 choices if I'm forced to settle with cereal).  And the coffee was so bad.  Oh man, was it bad.  I only had one cup - about 1/6 of my normal intake.Not good, Days Inn, not good at all.  I will not be back.So, here's my review for the Day's Inn Columbus Airport. I chose the hotel due to it's location from the airport (less than a 10 minute drive from the hotel room to the airport's drop-off/pick-up, and I mean literally - no traffic) and it's amenities.My stay this past weekend at this hotel was kid of a loss from the moment I recieved my e-mail confirmation. Although the website I viewed said they had a wonderful indoor pool, the e-mail warned me that it was out of service.Strike one.After driving there for six hours from Chicago, I wanted to rest a little before seeing my family. The woman behind the counter was very pleasant, and very helpful. That was the only positive part of the whole place.When I stepped into my room, I was kind of shocked at the depressing 1990's decor, the torn off trim on the wall, the filth behind and under the table between the two twin beds, and the lack of any kind of upgrading in service. (I was glad that I brought my flip-flops so I didn't have to walk barefoot on the sticky carpets.)All this for $59.00 a night!I figured I was only going to be in this room for only a few hours and the rate was cheap, I stuck it out.I wanted to order food from their in-house restaurant, but I was told it was CLOSED FOR REPAIRS too!Strike two.The analog tube TV was easy to navigate, and the room didn't smell like cigarettes (but other rooms near me SURE DID), and the beds were haphazardly made, but clean.Plenty of towels, the sink's cold and hot taps were set backwards (almost got burned - ouch), and the shower was good.They had a workout room, but I wasn't around enough to use it.I slept okay, and it was quiet. The airport is about two miles away just north of the hotel, but I heard nothing.I had to leave early in the morning, and the "continental breakfast" in the oddly shaped lobby consisted of single serve boxes of cereal, a banana, some apples, some bagels and a few coffee rolls, coffee and milk.I made it out of there and checked out quickly by merely presenting the card and saying I was leaving.All in all, it was a sub-par room with two twin beds and no real amenities, low to non-existent guest services, no pool, no restaurant, no bar, a very barebones breakfast but an easy checkout.I've read the other reviews for this place on Yelp, and I didn't see any hookers, but then again I wasn't looking for hookers. There is a gentelman's club up the road a few miles called the Centerfold Club and read their reviews, learning that sometimes the sleazy dancers end up there, but I don't go into that kind of crap, either.Anyway, this is my review. I'd say avoid it if you have real standards, but if you're looking for a room close to the airport with no frills and no real hassles, go here. It's okay, I guess. I'm not dead or don't have bedbug bites, so it's all good.one of the most revolting places I've ever stayed at. It smells.. rooms are just gross.very bad part of town.. the pool was pretty much infested. the store across the street run by a gang. definitely a must miss!!! EXCEPT... the front manager was an absolute doll!Would not recommend this place. Very rough neighborhood and very dirty hotel. Room had peeling wall paper and lose wires under the bed. We were on the 3rd floor and elevator made loud noise the whole way up very scary place, spend the extra $75 and stay downtown.So gross, there are stains all over the sheets and comforters. There were no towels in our room, saw actual hookers downstairs. There was a suspicious man in the hallway and we ended up keeping all of our stuff in the car which also felt unsafe here. Only nice thing about this place was the front desk girl who was helpful.This place certainly has the potential to be an enjoyable hotel.  After a little looking around, it is obvious that the budget for maintenance is either meager or nonexistant.  The front desk staff was pleasant enough.  Breakfast is scarse at best, with coffee andbagels available.  There appears to be a large number of rooms that are not being used.I hope whoever makes the decisions here has a plan to resurrect this business.
review_content_20: Do not stay at this place! It's a complete dump! Small, dirty rooms. Tv looked like it was from the 90's. Hooks where pictures should be on the wall, holes in the wall, mirror and pictures were crooked which means no takes care of this place. Just a broken down hole in the wall dump.Its cheap, near the airport, and they will pick you up from the airport. A life saver if you really just need to crash for the night and go about your business the next day. There are better hotels in the area, for sure, but it's cheap and easy here. Just depends on your situation. They have a nice large lobby with pastries and coffee for breakfast. There is a gym, which I've never used, but it seems pretty well kept. The hotel is decent enough. I've heard horror stories about dirty rooms, this and that, etc. I personally have never had any significant problems here. Once I had to change rooms because the heater was broken. Some rooms have fridges and microwaves. Just various little things here and there. One time, there was no hot water. So it's basically a hit or miss hotel. The WiFi is not that great, but it will get you on the internet to do minor things. Streaming video if you're a NetFlix user may be a stretch.

review_content: Not sure why other reviews are saying wifi didn't work, worked fine for me! The beds were SO comfortable. Rooms were spacious, nice and clean. Check out time is late, 12, but the breakfast should go later...ends too early. The one morning we did have breakfast, it was really good. The people at the front desk were kind of rude but I guess they were in training. No microwave in room. Otherwise, nice stay.I've stayed in many, many hotels in my day, but to my surprise, this was one of the nicest. I've stayed in $400/night rooms a few times and this exceeded my expectations. On a random night, my husband and I decided to Priceline a hotel in town just to not stay at home. We booked this place on a bid for like $53. The staff was super friendly, bed was comfy, room was really clean and still looked new. There was a couch and kitchenette which I always appreciate. Ample parking that is free. And there are a lot of food and shopping options within walking distance to the hotel. Because of our experience at this Hyatt Place, I'd be willing to stay at another in the future.A $150/night hotel should not have rooms where the heater generates a strong burning smell and sets off the fire alarm.Also, Internet connection is barely usable for basic browsing. The 4G hotspot on my phone is faster.So often people write bad reviews for questionable reasons.  This is not one of those occasions.  My family and I had driven over 3hrs to stay upon arrival we were told we had no room.  We had a reservation and they had over booked and choose us randomly to have our reservation cancelled.  I am a Hilton honors silver member and still was cancelled.  They seemed to care little as they checked In No less than 6 people after telling myself, wife and 11 years old daughter we had no where to stay.  All other hotels in Columbus we're sold out due to the Arnold Classic in which my daughter was scheduled to compete the next day.  The lack of regard for us as customers was disappointing to say the least.  I am thoroughly disappointed.   It shows a real lack in management at this facility.  They did finally find a room at a lesser establishment. It wasn't near the standard we were expecting.Clean hotel well priced for biz travel.  Breakfast included but mostly carbs. Small gym with 2-3 cardio machines.  Suite type rooms but BIG downside for me is due to layout cannot watch TV while working at desk.  4 stars ut I'll not stay again.Clean and convenient but if you need Internet service during your stay don't count on it at night. Second year in a row here that I've had glacially slow internet.Amazing customer service, especially from Manager Kevin who was able to assist us with a reservation mix up. The staff is professional, the rooms clean, the free breakfast is great, and the location really convenient for us when we visit relatives. We have used the heated pool on a prior visit and that was a welcomed break from the road. The hotel room size, floor layout and location are perfect for my us - including my son who loves to run around the hotel outside.Any place is nice on the company dime but the room is  spacious and clean with no lingering "funk smell".....That's a plus!!!Teeny tiny little nook of a bar but coworkers made it WAY more fun anyway....nice little breakfast buffet to enjoy but I couldn't....Still WAY to full from the previous evening!!!Great hotel! Room was clean and had separated sitting area with a sectional and tv. Can plug gaming systems into the televison as well. Breakfast was great.Here on company training so can't complain on price.  Room was clean and nice.  Wasn't too small. Would definitely stay here again. Breakfast in the morning was great.I hate to say anything bad about this place because it is a really nice hotel (room wise), but my family and I experienced some not so great customer service when we stayed here recently.We stayed here to attend the Dublin Irish Festival this weekend. My uncle was the first to reserve his room, after reading on the website that they have a shuttle that runs from 7:30am-10pm within a 5 mile radius. Not only does the website say that but he specifically called this location to ask with regard to the festival and was told that there would be a shuttle. We got there and got ready to leave and went to the front desk to get the shuttle and were told that there wasn't one. That it was only for 'companies' or business groups, which is not specified on the website and was not told to my uncle when he specifically asked about it. The front desk person tried to ask my uncle "who he'd spoken to" --- which, of course he wasn't able to tell her because he reserved the room way ahead of time. Maybe that's his fault for not writing it down but I checked the website AFTER we stayed there and it does not specify who is allowed to use the shuttle. I suspect that they were going to offer the shuttle, but for some reason at the last minute wrote a note at the front desk informing that it wasn't to be used for the purposes of getting guests to and from the festival. So we had to take a cab instead. Luckily they had vouchers available at the festival for some cab companies so our ride on the way home was free. I don't expect the front desk person to go against what the employees are instructed but she didn't even apologize for the misinformation and it basically made me feel like she was blaming it on us, which is not great customer service. I will be the first to take responsibility for a mistake, however the shuttle ride was the reason we booked at this location and would have looked elsewhere had we known it would not be available. I've stayed at the Hyatt Place before (this same one actually) and I do think it's very clean and comfy. I like the set up of the room really well and everything else was great....this situation just left a really bad taste in my mouth about it though and when there are many other nice places to stay I'm not sure I'll choose here again.Per normal, Hyatt Place in general gives an extremely high bang for your buck, and this one lives up to that standard. Friendly staff, comfortable spacious rooms, giant HD TV flat screen, modern and comfortable living room area inside the room... You just can't miss by staying here. If I could give it six stars I would... Book with confidence!Nice place. good breakfast, unfortunately not for the gluten-free challenged once.. rooms are clean and nice. Staff always friendly and smiling. You can get a Starbucks-Coffee there if you wish. Location is close to an interstate and there are a lot of restaurants around and a shopping mall very close by. like it. :-)My wife and I randomly received a free 1 night stay here through our credit card.  I don't really know why they chose us but it was nice nonetheless. The hotel is easy to find as it's visible from 270.  We arrived around 10 pm and we checked in with ease.  They gave us a free non-alcoholic drink at check-in. The room is very spacious with a 42" flat screen in the middle.  It pivots in either the direction of the bed or the couch.  The bed is quite comfortable and I absolutely loved the pillows.  The bathroom was quite small especially when the door is open.  I had problems with the shower as the water temperature changed drastically from cold to hot several times during my shower.  However, my wife didn't have that problem.  Sleeping wasn't too bad although the sounds from the highway are pretty loud.  I also seemed to constantly hear doors slamming at night and in the morning.  It seemed as though the walls weren't too thick.  Breakfast was decent with a good selection of fruits and breads.  I have never been impressed with most continental breakfasts and this wasn't much different, but it's free so I can't complain about that.  Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, but I gave it 4 stars because of the traffic noise and the loud noise outside our room.For this business traveler this place has one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on.  The room was spacious and the TV was gargantuan.  I would definitely stay here again.  It was priced around $100 a night.Although the hotel isn't located in downtown, Dublin provides many amenities. The hotel is very clean and my biggest complaint lies with the size of the bathroom. When you open the door, it literary takes up the entire bathroom. I can appreciate having a separate toilet and tub, but the size it just very small. The rest of the room on the other end, is very nice. You have plenty of room around the sink, as well as a small closet. The TV is rather large (42" I think) and is placed so some can relax on the couch and others can relax in bed. Plenty of walking room in the middle and a nice area for the office and a separate sink for drinks and a fridge. This hotel room is designed differently than most I have stayed in, electing to remove the often uneeded drawers and freeing up some space. If it wasn't for the bathroom, I would give it four stars. Free Wifi too, although there were some issues getting logged on by myself and another guest.The room is spacious and very nice. Breakfast was good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the pipes in the shower made a terrible ear piercing squeal for the duration of my shower. I'm not sure if this is normal for the hotel or not.This was a great find.  The staff is very friendly.  The room with a kingsized bed was a great value.  Hyatt Place has a good formula that is a bit nicer than the Holiday Inn express but not too expensive.As much as I like this hotel, I have to downgrade a star.  My coworkers and I had a late flight into Ohio and we didn't arrive to the hotel until 10:30pm or so.  Upon arrival, my boss was told they didn't even have a reservation under his name.  I was told they had my reservation, but they didn't have a room for me.  Um, what?  I was tired, grumpy, and hungry.  NOT a good time for this to happen.Apparently they overbooked and we were told to head to the Marriot down the street.  I was comped a room at the Marriott which was nice, but this experience definitely changes my view on Hyatt Place.This is a very nice hotel.  The staff was nice, The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable.  The television was very nice.  No problems with Internet.  Breakfast was great with a lot of healthy choices.  Loved the sectional sofa and bed was comfortable.  Nice area with a mall directly across from it and plenty of dining choices.
review_content_20: I'm glad my aunt picked this place out, it was great! And it was a chain hotel, so that's pretty unusual from what I usually see.The room was really a suite it was spacious with the bedroom area being partially divided from the living room/office area. It looks nicer in person than in the photos on the website. Free wi-fi! No gross polyester bedspreads.The living room area had a huge L-shaped couch and if I had time I'd kick it there a little. Gigantic flatscreen that you can plug your devices into. You can also pivot the tv between the living room area or bedroom area. The bed was SUPER comfy, I did not want to get up in the morning. The bed/sheets/blankets/pillows were high quality.The breakfast was...eh...but free. When I stayed there in June they were still working on a remodel of the place, so there was construction in the lobby. They did mess up when I first got my room and assigned the same room to someone else. I'd only been in the room 5 minutes and someone else's keycard unlocked the lock! They do have a physical lock you can throw that's not hooked up to the keycard that would keep anyone else out. I had it on, no one could actually get in. However, I'd guess it was a fluke since they were doing a ton of construction around the check-in. Thought I should throw that out there. I would stay again and not worry. Totally worth the money, I think the room was around $90 total and they had a discount rate on the weekends. Crazy right? But I think it's mostly a business hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree By Hilton Hotel Columbus - Worthington
review_content: Comfy beds. Large bathrooms. Good breakfast in the morning - not free but good. They have a phenomenal gym for patrons as well as -wait for it- a golf indoor range that is computerized.  One hour for TWENTY dollars.  Are you serious? All over that. There was no one waiting so the guy gave me a free extra half hour.  Decent restaurants nearby. Great place to stay in Columbus.This place doesn't have enough recent reviews to weed out some of these picky comments. I didn't come here for anything special except for a weekend trip to columbus. Not sure if my experience was completely different because we are Hilton honors silver members and was placed on the honors floor but my experience was great!! From the time we checked in Jasmine was a sweetheart, fast, efficient and really welcomed us to the hotel. The room was excellent! Decent size, bed was comfortable and everything was clean (trust me, we check). We had mini fridge and microwave which for me is always a must when your outta town. The bed and pillows were beyond comfortable (which is usually the case anyhow with the Hilton brand). I've been to lots of hotels and this one meets my expectation in all areas, definitely worth the price.(P.S this is conveniently located next to some of the top restaurants in columbus and a movie theatre (all in walking distance).Pretty hotel, nice folks running it, great big room, black mold in the ceiling.My wife and I were attending an event at the hotel last week and had some severe problems. First though, the good things.The folks who work at this hotel are universally friendly and helpful, maybe the nicest I have seen at the many hotel stays we have had the last few years. The room was, well, roomy, had a nice couch, a comfy bed and the usual mediocre hotel bathroom (I hate bathroom hotel sinks with a passion, all of them).The first night I thought I was coming down with a cold. Stuffed up and uncomfortable through the whole night. Oddly enough, it went away within an hour or so when I left my room. During the first couple of nights, a friend posted on her FB page about how her bathroom ceiling had collapsed, revealing a lot of black mold. I'm wondering now how much of that was my problem. So, beware if you have a severe allergy. This hotel could be dangerous for you. When we attend this event again, we will stay in a different hotel.Hotel is very worn out and tired looking. Elevators broke down, hotel staff are not friendly except for a few. I think they are tired of the surroundings themselves. Please update and repair things.Normal hotel. Good enough beds. View is lame but that might be the area. Over all a good enough hotel for a conference or a short overnight trip would stay again. Nothing extraordinary good or bad.The room we got has 2 double beds but we had requested a king. Ok, we'll des leith that, but our room was like " we really don't need this storage closet, let's make another room.  It is at the end of the hall next to stairs and that is fine but there is a tiny closet and bathroom, no towel bars and like 8" of bathroom counter top.  The carpet in the elevator is dirty and the luggage cart was filthy.  The room and rest of the hotel is reasonable clean.The road construction outside makes getting to and from the hotel take forever during busy times.Unfortunately, zero stars isn't an option...I've stayed here many, many times and the hotel keeps going downhill.  Last straw this week.  Horrible room, unclean and appeared to have many bloodstains on carpet in my room.  Upon complaining to the front desk, the employee only laughed at my situation and offered no solution or apology.  I checked out two days early and went up the street to the Hyatt, where I thoroughly enjoyed the rest of my week in Columbus.   The staff and condition/cleanliness of hotel continued to disappoint with this week's experience sealing the deal... I'll never spend another night here.Every year I attend a two-day conference for my job, and every year they choose this location.  Since I live in Columbus I can't speak to the hotel portion of this DoubleTree.  I'll limit this to the conference center and break out rooms.I tend not to comment much on service.  Service experiences, good or bad, don't mean much unless it is consistent over a number of visits.  Service is like officiating during a sporting event: if it's good, it's often invisible.  Having said that, service has more than invisible during the last four conferences I've had here.  Stuff just worked.  Food just got served.  It wasn't anything I had to concern myself with.  The rub, if there really is one here, is that the place is getting long in the tooth.  Nothing, from the parking lot to the lobby to the ballroom, has been freshened up for quite some time and everyday wear and tear is beginning to take a toll.  It's not a hotel I would choose if I wanted to impress some key note speaker from out of town.  The ballroom is underlit, and the P.A. system is weak at best.  Not sure if it's the speakers or the connections, but guests invariably say, "Okay, can you hear me now?" with alarming regularity.  HVAC in most of the common areas seems to be fine, but it varies widely in the breakout rooms.  DoubleTree could use a facelift, and facelifts cost big bucks, but it might be worth it if they want to complete with the myriad of other hotels in the professional services park it inhabits.Not bad, but not particularly good. This was categorized as a 4 star hotel when I booked it...and it's certainly not that. It's in a nice location and there are a lot of restaurants in the area. Traffic is awful, especially now since there is construction. I have no major gripes, but the quality of the hotel overall is 3 star in my opinion.I reserved a king room several weeks ago and tonight I was given a handicap accessible king room without a closet to hang my clothes. So I will have the wrinkled look tomorrow at my meeting. The room is old and uncomfortable and there are patches on the bathroom door and most walls, the carpet needs vacuumed and the bathroom counter is too small to place my amenities. I called the front desk and was told they are sold out sorry. I reserved this room weeks ago so there is no excuse. This is a horrible hotel, stay anywhere else!Martina at the front desk is so kind and professional, she's a breath of fresh air.I was here for a conference; however, I also stayed here at the hotel for four days.As a conference venue, this place is top-notch. The conference rooms are large and spacious, and the staff here was as helpful as possible. However, what surprised me the most was how amazing the DoubleTree catering service was. While most hotel catering services are lazy and focus more on being economic, their catering service was the nicest I have ever encountered -- and this includes private catering services at weddings. The staff was amazing and the food was even better.The hotel was upscale. The rooms were always clean and tidy. The pool was on the shallow side and the fitness center was small and modest. However, the one thing that really, really hurts this hotel in my rating was the air here. I've been to plenty of hotels during my life and I've never gotten sick off of the thick, unfiltered air like I have here. As soon as I would leave the hotel to go to the bar after training, I would be fine. I think they need to fix the AC here. Badly.Don't be spooked by the very dated exterior when you arrive at this hotel.  The inside is totally updated and the rooms are an excellent value for the price.  I'm not sure when renovations were completed, but both the lobby and my room appeared to be recently redone.  My first floor room included a spacious bathroom with granite (or faux granite, but in a hotel, who cares?) countertop, excellent lighting, and a very clean shower with excellent water pressure.  The sleeping area itself had comfortable beds with several pillows, conveniently located outlets, and a nice big flat screen on a rotating stand.Despite being located in a typical pedestrian-unfriendly, suburban highway exit area, there are several restaurants within safe walking distance.Hotel is ok, but theivery is rampant in the parking lot, so watch your car like a hawk. I stayed there  and a work truck got ripped off on Monday and another on Tuesday. Cops won't do shit except write a report and disappear back to guarding the donut shop.I was happy with my stay here. The beds were clean (plain white comforters and no weird dated designs meant to hide stains or anything here). The beds were the key thing I was worried about and I was glad to see they were inviting. The bathroom and room was otherwise clean and the decor was decent. The carpet and drapes might need an update soon, but I felt comfortable in the room. The bathroom shower was easy to operate, good water pressure and good hot water. The wifi was free with my stay and could get a little slow, but mostly worked fine. I ended up getting room service for lunch -- a crab cake sandwich with fries and a hot chocolate -- and it ended up costing me about $22. That was perhaps pricey but it was delivered quickly and was very good. They said to pur your tray outside your door when finished and it sat our there for like two days -- but I did have an end unit around a corner so maybe they just couldn't see it. I didn't end up using any housekeeping, instead opting to keep the "do not disturb" sign up for the duration of my stay. I did realize that hotels offering free breakfast are actually pretty good deals if you will eat breakfast everyday. DoubleTree does not offer free breakfast.If you want to go out for a meal, this hotel is in a small subdivision with several restaurants. A restaurant and bar called the Winking Lizard was almost literally across the street, and there was also a Chipotle and a movie theater nearby. No grocery stores in the immediately vicinity, but when I looked online there was a Kroger less than half a mile away. You would be able to at least walk to a couple restaurants from the hotel if you didn't have a car. So the location itself was pretty convenient too.The vending machines kind of sucked. The one on the second floor only accepted coins so I went to the front desk for change and then I realized the one on the first floor accepts $1 bills. But the vending machines only had water and soda. If you wanted any snacks or medicine or anything, you had to go to the front desk and buy it. My room key got deactivated somehow by accident, which was annoying. They said if you keep it near your phone it can deactivate. I have never heard of such thing. So it was inconvenient for me to have to go around to the front of the hotel and get my key re-activated after I went out to my car.Overall though, I'd say I did enjoy my stay. At $109 a night for two nights and $277 after taxes and my room service meal, I just wish it would've been just a bit cheaper.Nice and big..good location near 270 and 23...but dated.  My bathtub had mildew stains and I mentioned that to the front desk....they were not able to get them out.  Overall OK..I do not understand why this hotel has such low ratings, maybe it was bad before being updated? I have stayed here several times and never had an issue.The exterior can be deceiving, the interior is completely different: much more modern. The rooms are always clean, including the bathroom and the bed is comfortable. I have never used room service (nor in this hotel or any other for that matter) nor I have had the chance to use the pool or any other amenities.  It is conveniently located and fairly priced. There is a Starbucks, some restaurants and a cinema at walking distance, which considering the suburban location is a plus. Parking is free.I'm taking time to update that having attended here as a meeting planner, I am reducing my review. While the majority of the front of the house staff is ok, I had problems with most a few of the "upper level" people to the point that my event is considering alternate locations for next year.It's a shame, because it's generally a nice hotel, but when you overhear the front desk staff insulting your convention, there's hardly a reason to stay.Stayed for two nights.  Seems like a older hotel. Not at all what I expected from a hilton chain. Rooms were ok- nothing special- no ref-no DVD player. Bedspread had a stain when we arrived and room seemed slightly dirty - like hair on bathroom floor. Overall not worth the extra money ( single ply toilet paper is not worth more than 2 stars )I didn't actually stay at this hotel, I was only there for a conference, so I have no opinion about the accommodations.The conference facilities weren't terrible, but the were a few flaws.  The biggest issue was the heating/cooling.  The room we had our meals in, along with conference-wide programs (keynote, awards ceremony etc.) was probably about 60 degrees.  It was absolutely unbearable.  I was too busy thinking about how cold I was to actually pay attention.  During the keynote speaker, I had to leave the room because I was shivering.  A few of our smaller conference rooms were the same.  Then, on the other end of the spectrum, were the rooms that were about 80 degrees.  Not a single room's temperature was properly regulated.The food was very boring, but in my experience, this is typical at conference hotels.  The chicken was overcooked, the potatoes were cold, and the carrots were hard.On the positive side, hotel staff were very friendly and all of the facilities were bright and clean.
review_content_20: Hotel options in Columbus are pretty slim compared to some metropolitan areas.  We stayed at the Doubletree for a long weekend surrounding the 2009 USC vs. Ohio State game.  Being Trojan fans we were not received well no matter where we visited in the Buckeye state.  However the woman working the reception desk at the Doubletree was a Michigan fan and we were a pleasant break from the myopia she has to experience during football season.The Doubletree isn't a bad hotel but it leaves a lot to be desired.  It is clearly geared more for small conventions and business travel but it could still use a little more artistic flair and polish for this traveler. Technically there is a lounge, restaurant, gift shop and business center but none of them are really comforting or engaging.  For example, the gift shop is nothing more than a double door coat closet with some basic sundries that I can only assume you would pay for at the front desk.  There were six of us in our travel party yet the only place we could sit together as a group was in the bar or restaurant.  The rooms were typical Doubletree rooms.  Adequately appointed but nothing to make you forget the comforts of home.  They were clean and fairly well maintained which is all we really cared about on this trip.Would I stay here again?  Yes, but only if I needed some place cheap and easy to stay.  It wasn't a bad hotel, it just wasn't a good one.Kinda dated exterior. Wifi blows-could not get connected with three devices. Air stuffy. Chair in the room too low for the desk. Forget about working here.  Wish their cookies had a nut free option.

review_content: Stayed here over the weekend for a wedding. Because the wedding party had rented a lot of rooms, they were offering a discounted rate for a room. I'm not sure what they are usually are, but my room with a single King size bed came out to $110 per night. Parking for two nights was $20, I think. You can park in the garage just North and literally next to the building or you can valet. If you are staying overnight, park your car on the upper levels. The lower ones are used for others not staying overnight. The hotel is very clean. I was in multiple different rooms during my time here and did not see anything out of place or bad that stood out. The bed was comfortable and looked and felt clean. I had everything I needed in order to iron my suit and shirts. The bathroom was clean and the shower was nice. I didn't use the TV, so I can't comment on that. They had an older radio with an iPhone dock, but the dock is for iPhone 4S or before. I wasn't spending a ton of time in the hotel, so it wasn't a problem for me. I accidentally left my jacket at the hotel in the closet. I called and spoke to the housekeeping/lost and found group who located it and shipped it to me for a small fee. I appreciated their prompt and speedy shipping. I received it the next day. It's a solid hotel and it's right on campus. You could get cheaper, but you can't get a better proximity to Ohio State.This is a very convenient hotel to host meetings and conferences near The Ohio State University. I've stayed in the rooms as well as hosted visitors to the hotel and it is a very nice university hotels. It is also a great place to have meetings. They have several conference rooms that get booked well in advance, but they are great for workshops, project review meetings, or larger conferences. The also have an excellent selection of menu items for breakfast, lunch, and dinner to be served at such meetings at fair prices. I've rarely been disappointed by either the service or the quality of the rooms at the Blackwell. I highly recommend it.This hotel was pretty nice, but I don't feel like any thing "wowed" me during my stay.They have a shuttle service to and from the airport as well as a local shuttle service that takes you within a 3 mile radius. This was really nice and convenient because it meant that I did not have to rent a car. The service was mostly timely (give or take 5 min) and dependable, a definite plus. Everyone that worked there that I came across was obviously a student. As a student myself, I completely get it but I think it potentially affected the quality of service I received, which I will explain below. However, there are two things about this particular hotel that stood out in a negative light. First, when I pulled back my sheets, there was a makeup stain on them. Not okay.Another issue I had was I had to be at the medical center by 7a, along with two other people (we each had our own rooms). We asked one of the drivers if it would be possible, as their car service typically starts at 7a. He's mentioned that exceptions have been made in the past and to inquire to the front desk regarding it. When we asked the front desk about it, they stated they could not take us prior to 7a. Seems silly to me that they couldn't make an exception for a 5 minute drive for three paying customers. I couldn't help but wonder if the management at more investment in their job (aka it was a career vs just a job for a student), if that would have been permitted.The walls are really thin, to the point where I could hear the lock motor unlocking when a person in the hallway swiped their card to unlock it. I definitely woke up a few times due to noise - people weren't particularly loud, the walls were just thin. Overall, a clean room, nothing particular specular but nothing amazing either. I probably wouldn't stay here again if other hotels were comparable.We stayed here on a Friday night when we were in town for a show at the Newport. There was some sort of conference going on, so it took a minute to get checked in and then we had to push through a crowd of lingering humans to get to the elevators. Aside from that struggle, there wasn't much wrong with our stay. The room was fairly large and clean from what I could tell. The shower was a little weird and I felt a bit like I was in my grandma's bathtub, but other than that, it got the job done! Of note: there was a strange humming in the walls. I thought it was maybe someone using an electric razor or a vibrator, but it went on and on and on...and once I heard it, I couldn't distract my ears from it. Overall, a good place and I'm sure we'll be staying here again in the future.Clean, newer, great location. So why 1 star? Quite simply THE most uncomfortable bed Ive ever (tried) slept in. Mattress is firm like a slab of granite. The pillows are stuffed so think and full of concrete that my neck is twisted to the point that I hope I pass out from the pain just to get some shut eye. I went to school at OSU and honestly, my dorm mattress was easier to sleep on. Blackwell, get some decent beds. I am rarely envious of the homeless but I promise you that a piece of cardboard laid over gravel is at least 3x more comfortable. Oh, and please allow patrons to control a fan in their rooms on these thermostats.Very clean and comfortable room. I'm on the forth floor and have a beautiful view of the horseshoe stadium! There is free internet, and a nice bar and restaurant walking distance from all of OSU! This would be a great place for family visiting students or future students wanting to visit and see the the campus, so they are close to everything.It's the little things.I enjoyed staying at this location. Mostly because my event was located on campus and it didn't make sense to spend more money to be near the downtown area and still have to get to campus for my event. It can be at least $50-$60 less than downtown. Cabs came in under 5 minutes. While the decor wasn't the most contemporary or updated there were little things that made the stay worth it - potted REAL plant, chocolates on the bed after turn down and free wifi without some complicated login code. It isn't near Short North, in terms of walking but definitely within 10 min drive.The reason why it isn't 5 stars is because noise travels from the hallways pretty well. It's not fun to hear someone chatting it up on their cell.I was booked at the Blackwell Inn by my assistant (note to self - no bonus for her) for my weekend business trip to Columbus. Maybe I'm spoiled from traveling so much, but there are certain things I expect when I stay at a hotel that I didn't get from my stay at the Blackwell. It did seem as if the staff that had the most interaction with the patrons (doormen, front desk) were teenagers so maybe that's why the professionalism I'm accustomed to when staying at a hotel wasn't there. Who knows.Strike 1: when my colleagues and I arrived via taxi the doorman did not greet us and help us with our bags. He did however hit the handicap button so the doors would open for us. I guess we should be grateful for that act of kindness.Strike 2: check-in time is 3pm, I checked-in at 3:23pm, and was informed that my room was ready, but showing as dirty. I was asked if I wanted a different room or wanted to wait. Now, I don't know why I needed to be informed that my room was showing as dirty. All the young man who was checking me in had to do was say, "Sir, the room we had for you isn't available so I'll put you in a different room." Or he didn't have to say anything to me at all and could have just switched me to a new room. I would have never known. When I went pass the check-in desk about an hour later I heard the employee giving the same "dirty room" message to a couple checking-in and the look on the lady's face was priceless.Strike 3: When checking-in we were never informed of the services the hotel offered (i.e a free car service that you could book for drop-offs and pick-ups) or where the restaurant and gym were located. We spent about $30 on taxis before we found out we could have been requested the hotel car take us where we needed to go....I'm glad I can expense the taxi fees otherwise I would be one angry Yelper.While I focused on the negatives with my stay at the Blackwell Inn, I do want to recognize the positives i experienced.1) My king size room was indeed spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable.2) The breakfast at the hotel restaurant was delicious. The buffet had a good selection to choose from and even had a made to order omelette station.3) The staff working in the restaurant was on top of their game providing excellent service.The Blackwell is an exceedingly comfortable hotel, with spacious rooms (mine had a very long desk with two chairs, ample outlets for charging phones/computers/ipods; a king sized bed, and a nook with a fridge/coffee pot), and very comfortable beds. The folks working at the hotel - many of whom are very young, and I assume in some kind of hotel management/hospitality program - are incredibly willing to be helpful (though sometimes you have to ask specific questions like "When will my shuttle to the airport be here?" to get the answers you want). And the small touches they have here - Lindt truffles on your bed every evening - are nice. The only downsides - the rooms aren't the quietest - by 7am, I could hear folks walking up and down the hallway, and housekeeping knocking on doors, and that was about an hour earlier than I would have liked. And, the room service breakfast was mediocre (watery tasteless oatmeal, and the promise of a bread basket which was actually a tiny croissant and a big danish that looked straight out of a NJ diner circa 1985.) But these are small missteps - the Blackwell is a very comfortable place to stay.I am rating the Blackwell from a wedding venue standpoint. I used the Blackwell as a reception location as well as a hotel for my wedding guests to stay. When I started planning my wedding I really wanted a reception venue at a hotel because many of my hotel guests would be traveling from out of town. I really wanted a place where they could enjoy themselves without having to worry about driving to another hotel. The Blackwell was perfect for this reason and so many more. First of all when you book at the Blackwell the cost includes a wedding planner. Rachel was absolutely amazing ensuring everything I needed was perfect. From out first meeting to organizing the tasting, and meeting with us multiple times she was always professional, helpful, and a great guide in the process. When we ran out of a certain size room she found more, when my mom wanted to add a breakfast, it was done. She gave a head strung bride piece of mind. I didn't have to worry about a thing. Everything was coordinated,and organize creating a smooth, and fun wedding reception. Lets talk about the food. It was the best wedding food I have ever had. I cannot tell you how many of my guests told me the same thing. The options go way beyond the typical steak or chicken. There are so many options the in house chef offers that you will find something delicious to meet your wedding needs. The icing on the top of the cake was the presidential suite offer to the bride and groom on there wedding night. It was an probably will be the best hotel room I will ever stay in. Lets just say I think it was bigger than my house :) I would highly recommend the Blackwell to anyone planning a wedding, you don't even need to be a die hard Buckeyes fan.The Blackwell Inn and Conference Center is simply terrific. This moderately priced hotel is surprisingly modern. If you pay for the car valet service, you can text the valet and they'll shoot you a reply indicating when your car is out front. As a regular traveler, this is the first I've seen of this type of service. Naturally, this is The Ohio State University's hotel so it is full of OSU pride. However, the pride isn't obnoxious the way it could be elsewhere. Instead, desk and other staff turn that pride into striving to provide the best and friendliest service possible. Honestly, it's the sort of thing you wish for from all service-oriented establishments these days, yet hardly find in big name hotel chains... Additionally, the hotel room was spacious, modern and comfortable. The closet and desk space areas are better than average. Outstanding.Rooms are large, well appointed, clean and comfortable. Location is excellent on OSU campus, gym is good, restaurant and lounge are top-notch. They hosted our medical conference with smiles and great service. Don't believe the "low" reviews. This is no Four Seasons, but it's the best in Columbus, Ohio and would love to stay here again. The Hilton down the street was a nightmare.I have stayed here a few times while visiting an OSU student. The customer service never ceases to amaze me! The staff is friendly and courteous every time! I highly recommend this hotel!Awesome hotel. Why? Because EVERYBODY here is super nice. They anticipate your every need. From turning down your bed, to a forgotten toothbrush, to passes to the athletic center. The rooms are spacious and super clean. The price per night is fairly reasonable. Good place and folks!i stayed here over a weekend when i was traveling to Cbus for a 2nd interview with OSU. i agree with everyone else that the doorman/front door staff were not as attentive but they are teenagers. i called for my car well in advance but it was not there a few of the times. the room was clean, the breakfast buffet was really good and they even would give you a to go cup of coffee for the road. the dinner was good though the menu was limited, the staff were very attentive. rooms were clean and the gym was clean as wellI really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were spacious and the hotel was very clean. In addition, they had morning and evening service. And in the evening they left chocolates in the room (the expensive kind). The amenities in the room were also nice such as the coffee/tea/hot chocolate maker and the television had a massive number of channels. The internet connection in the room and in the meeting rooms were excellent. Finally, the gym was good for a hotel. Big size and a good mixture of aerobic and weight machines. I recommend this place highly.A quick note on my review: I was at the hotel for a meeting with a group that booked multiple rooms. So, I'm not sure on the cost of the room and whether the internet is always free. I'm also not sure if all rooms receive morning and evening service.You couldn't find a better place to stay if visiting The Ohio State campus. The room was beautiful - very large with every amenity you can imagine, including a scale. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is within walking distance of all sports venues and the campus.Had business on OSU campus and The Blackwell came highly recommended for it's convenient location. The lobby was much nicer than expected, albeit a little small. There were a lot of athletes staying in the hotel that night and when 15 or so of them are hanging in the lobby -- it makes for a tight squeeze. To the side is a bar that served really delicious food (especially when you take into consideration that it is a hotel).The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. Apparently there is turndown service and the attendant leaves chocolate and a weather report card though somehow my room was missed :-(Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by The Blackwell and will without a doubt stay here next time I am in town!I booked this place through hotels.com when I needed a place to stay close to the medical center. It fit all my criteria: free airport pickup, free transport within three miles, and easy on the budget. I was most impressed when I arrived to find it was waaaay more luxurious than I expected! Beautiful lobby, friendly staff at check in, and a gift shop with all the scarlet and grey stuff you could ever want-- seriously, I never stay in places like this. My room was clean, comfortable, and outfitted with more desk space than I knew what to do with, plus free Wi-Fi. It is very obvious that the Blackwell was designed with the business traveler in mind. An in-room Keurig and fridge completed the setup. The bed was super duper comfy and overlooked the university campus. Other happy occurrences:The turn down service where they left a Lindt truffle and a card with the next day's weather forecast on my bed. The super precious college students who happened to be my drivers and gave me more of a city tour than any official tour guide could, plus the skinny on where to go and what to do in the city. The fact that this hotel is IN THE MIDDLE of the OSU campus, so I got to wander the beautiful grounds when the weather was nice. The other fact that this hotel is a stones throw from the football stadium, so I wished I wouldn't been there a day earlier so I could've tailgated. I could not have asked for a more lovely lodging experience.I have stayed at The Blackwell once a year, 2 years in a row, each extended stays, and each time having btwn 5-10 rooms booked for our group. I coordinate this trip, so I hear all the complaints, or compliments. We are always very happy w our stay. The staff are wonderfully friendly, and like other reviewers have said, genuine. The staff seems genuinely happy to help - this is SO very refreshing! Questions, needs, requests are never a bother or inconvenience - they get its part of their job. Hooray! The rooms are great - from comfy beds to ample work space to awesome bathroom. I *always* have problems w the coffee maker though :( They always send up coffee via room service, but I'd just really prefer to make my own & not greet a stranger in pj's. We've eaten in the hotel restaurant twice, once breakfast, once lunch, each time we've been very pleased. From reading all the other reviews, I'm realizing The Blackwell has WAY more amenities than we were aware of, they can do a MUCH better job ensuring folks know of these, esp the extended stay folks. We''l definitely be taking more advantage of these next year! But all-in-all, this is a GREAT place to stay. We'll be back!
review_content_20: I've travelled a decent amount and this is my favorite hotel yet. Amazing service ( including nightly truffles) and the local shuttle service alone is worth 5 stars. Rooms are very nice and spacious, my to came with its own kuerig machine too!Very close to a ton of food options, an the driving staff will even take you to Starbucks down the street for your morning fix. I you have the opportunity to stay here, do it, you won't be disappointedGreat food - great hassles. I attend a catered dinner and awards night each year hosted at the Blackwell. It is a beautiful venue and offers accomodations for out of town visitors. Recently, a new chef took over and introduced special items for our organization. The food: Very good. They can cook a filet perfectly. There's a bit too much going on for a plating. I had a surf and turf - steak and sea bass (I only wish it Chilean, but alas it wasn't). There was well-seasoned sauted spinach beneath the sea bass, but the sea bass was covered in tasteless parsley and lacked salt or pepper. The filet was atop a balsalmic gravy (tasty, but unneccessary) and was cooked too perfectly to require much additional seasoning. In fact, the gravy was a distraction. There also was a delicious sweet potatoe mash, well-seasoned spaghetti squash, and squished tomatoes. This was too many "other" items that detracted from the dish.Servers and Service: Sadly, it goes downhill. Maybe this is a management problem, maybe not. Several tables never recieved their entrees! They just forgot to serve them dinner, but served them salads and desserts. What a mess! The coffee service is nice and the food was served at temperature. They did two rounds of wine service (I'd rather they just leave a bottle at the table). I look forward to another tastly treat again soon!I hate the Buckeyes, but The Blackwell was great!When I found out that this hotel was basically on the campus at Ohio State, I was ready to not enjoy my stay at all. It was a long few days of travel and finding out that The Blackwell was on the Ohio State campus, for some reason, put me in a foul mood. I was ready to find something wrong with the service or the facility. I'm usually a pretty positive and upbeat guy, but I just wasn't ready to enjoy staying here. All that being said, this place was fantastic. It was absurd how every need seemed to be anticipated, every face was genuinely smiling, and all of this in a very well appointed room at an excellent value. It was almost disturbing that these guys did so well...everyone really knocked it out of the park on this one! I'll continue to not like the Buckeye sports teams, but will go out of my way to stay at this hotel again. Great job to all of you at The Blackwell.I stayed here for a wedding I was in. My husband and I arrived at 3pm on the dot and there were no rooms ready. Kind of bummed since we had a ton of stuff to carry up, so we waited in the lobby for about 10 minutes. The room was nice enough, had a lot of desk type space and since we were sharing the room with another couple, that was nice. It had a fridge, that froze everything we put in it, and a speaker dock, that didn't work. There is a keurig to make coffee. No fan in the bathroom, which is not awesome when four people need to take showers and get ready. The bride was on the executive floor which was where we got ready and they have a little snack area set up with a cool coffee maker and pop/juice free for the taking. The housekeeping staff was great. We had the do not disturb on our door and when the one lady saw me going, she stopped and asked if we needed anything for the room. She definitely went out of her way. The paper is also hanging on the door each morning, it was the Columbus Dispatch. Valet parking for $17/night and you just text them when you need your car. It was ready every time I needed it.I absolutely enjoyed my stay at the Blackwell. I've stayed here a few times as I have a student at the University and it's very conveniently located on campus. The majority of the front desk help are University students, extremely polite, very helpful, and courteous from the minute you pull into the front entrance. The Hotel has a car you can use if need be, and there is also a hotel shuttle that will take you where you need to go within a few miles, with free transportation to and from the Airport. Who needs a car?? Anything you ask for, they seem to always have the right response, so helpful. You have a morning newspaper at your door every morning and your bed is turned down for you at night. Rooms are very clean and bathrooms well equipped. Great coffee, and tea in the room. The Hotel Restaurant has wonderful food. Although it is a little higher in price in comparison to a few of the others around the area, the amenities that are included make up the difference, and the service is so worth it. I highly recommend the Blackwell.One of my favorite hotels. I've been staying at the Blackwell roughly once a year from almost the time that they opened, more than a decade ago. The Blackwell was the very first hotel at which I stayed where there was (free) internet in the rooms, and I've been impressed with this place from the get-go. Very comfortable beds, a kitchy turn-down service in which chocolates are placed on the bed and the bedside radio is tuned to music that features the likes of Barry Manilow, the Spinners, etc. (these being two of the featured artists in songs that were playing when I entered my room last week). The shades are true blackout shades - the room can be pitch dark at high noon on June 21 - and everything is comfortable. My only negative comments about The Blackwell are that the exercise room is really quite lame, an indoor pool would be a great addition, and the breakfasts - while good - is not "fantastic" and really should be comped to the guests at the hotel.I stayed at the Blackwell for a wedding I attended that was held in the banquet hall. The hotel room was clean though it felt a little small. The staff was professional and friendly though, and the room was comfortable.The weddng itself was a little generic. The food was just ok, the bar set up was less than ideal and seating during the cocktail hour wasn't easy to find or comfortable. The Blackwell has a great location for all Buckeye related events, but they know this and charge accordingly. This is usually the very last place I consider when I'm coming to Columbus.right on campus. Easily a 4 star hotel that has excellent service. What surprised me was that it is apparently completely run by the school and the students at OSU. They have a valet service which you can use which is $15 a night or you can park at the parking structure right next door and that caps at $10 no matter how long you stay there. Again, it's right on OSU campus so I can't imagine you staying anywhere else except here if you're visiting someone at the school or the school itself.The Blackwell is an amazing hotel with absolutely stellar service. I attended a technical conference there and I couldn't have been happier. The food was tasty and it was well located within Columbus.The rooms were extremely comfortable and I had no complaints about anything. I did have an unfortunate experience with the front desk, where they didn't know too much about the running trails in the area. I was directed to run in the OSU campus, rather than taking the nice riverside trail feet from the hotel door. The trail was very nice, whereas the campus would not have been a very nice run.This hotel is all about excellence. I stayed here for three nights as I was visiting the school for an interview, and also because it was the hotel the school recommended me to stay at. I am truly impressed with everything about this hotel. The airport shuttle service was convenient (be sure to call in to reserve a spot), and the shuttle driver was an undergraduate student at OSU so I had the opportunity to hear about the school and the area from his perspective.Checking in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly in handling the matters. Since I had the room to myself, it was especially spacious and very clean. The business style desks were nice and the leather chairs complemented them pretty well. What surprised me most was when the hotel staff came by my room at night around 8:30 and offered me ice, chocolate, and a card with weather info for the next day. I was quite impressed by this and I could tell that the hotel accommodates their guests very well. For nights when you're not around, the staff tidies up your room again, which I also thought was very considerate of them (as if making the room during the day wasn't enough).The bathrooms throughout the hotel were very clean. They have hand towels for you to use if paper towels aren't enough for you. The business center was open 24 hours (as long as you have your key card on you), so if there are any Internet or printing matters that needs to be taken cared of you can get it done there.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Blackwell. I highly recommend it for those visiting the school or even if you're just visiting Columbus. I will definitely stay here again if I ever come by Columbus again.The Sunday buffet was good, great variety and good quality of food. The staff was TERRIBLE. At the buffet they were unsure of items (whipped cream or butter?) and were not very personable. The dining room staff did not clear plates and had to be flagged down multiple times for a drink refill with a 30% capacity dining room. Gratuity of 20% was added to our buffet bill for a group of eight.reasonably priced boutique-y hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff. Valet parking only-so add that to the cost. Skip the over-priced restaurantExcellent hotel--4.5 stars (rounding up)!! I stayed here before finally transferring to Ohio State. *The beds are so comfortable, and the pillows are fat with stuffing!* The service is generally great, from its airport shuttle to its concierge, and its wireless connection is excellent--as is the business computer lab, which is amply soundproofed despite its location near the reception hall (where I gather many a Buckeye wedding party is held for alumni couples).A special shout-out to the airport shuttle drivers, who I notice are usually OSU undergrads, and with whom I've held pleasant conversations.My only minor gripe would probably be the valet drivers/doorpersons, also undergrads. Sometimes they kind of just "hang out" there, talking about their party exploits or something of the like--or maybe that's just what I just keep running into when I encounter them? So maybe it's just me.Anyway, I honestly wish I could dorm here. :-DOoooooowah. Super fancy. I loved the his & hers desks across from the separate beds. It was totally convenient, and really spacious and well designed. There's like 7 HBO channels but we couldn't find anything good to watch. TV today, honestly. If I could find anything negative to say, it would be that the staff was almost....like, TOO helpful and accommodating. Like, they came to our room around 8:30pm with ice and chocolate. Those silly helpful guest services people! And they held the door open nearly every time I entered or left the front door. And the beds were sooooo comfy. I slept like an angel in a fluffy cloud.The family and I just returned from a weekend in Columbus. We stayed at The Blackwell for 2 nights, and enjoyed our visit immensely.The hotel is very warm and inviting; the rooms are large, clean, and well-appointed. We stayed on the third floor, which was really quiet - the only neighborly noise we heard was the odd toilet flush or shower turning on. There are a LOT of TV channels - way better variety than I've experienced elsewhere. The location is also phenomenal; we did visited a few different areas of Columbus, and were never more than a 10 minute drive from any of them.Tips for you:+ Join the hotel's loyalty program and make your reservations through that site (iPrefer.com) to score better rates and some freebies. On this visit, we booked for about $20 less than rack rate, received vouchers for breakfast in Bistro 2110 (which I'll review separately, so as not to mar the hotel's rating), and were comped wireless Internet access.+ If you will have a car at the hotel - consider parking on your own at the Lane Avenue garage right next door to the hotel ($7/day during the week; $3/day on the weekends). The hotel charges $15/day for valet, and they're parking your car in that same garage.
